formulation: Ghana is the first country to approve a new vaccine for Malaria, the Mosquirix– RTS,S, made at Oxford University. The first time a major new vaccine is first approved in Africa.
answer: Ghana became the first country in the world to approve the RTS,S malaria vaccine for widespread use in children.

formulation: National state of emergency declared in Ethiopia in wake of anti-government protests.
answer: Ethiopian Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn resigned amid escalating protests and political unrest.

formulation: India surpasses Russia to become the world's third-worst affected country, daily COVID-19 cases exceeding 20,000 and total cases over 700,000.
answer: India's COVID-19 cases surpassed two million, eclipsing Russia and becoming the third-highest globally.

formulation: Mount Nyiragongo erupts in the Democratic Republic of Congo, sending rivers of lava towards the nearby city of Goma, prompting evacuations.
answer: Mount Nyiragongo erupted, sending lava flowing toward Goma and prompting mass evacuations.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: By this date, multiple U.S. senators whom have attended presidential events have tested positive for COVID-19.
answer: Several U.S. senators, including Mike Lee, Thom Tillis, and Ron Johnson, tested positive for COVID-19 after attending the Rose Garden event celebrating Amy Coney Barrett's Supreme Court nomination.

formulation: United Arab Emirates leader and ruler of Abu Dhabi Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan names his eldest son Khaled bin Mohamed crown prince of Abu Dhabi.
answer: On March 29, 2023, Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan appointed his eldest son, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, as Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi.

formulation: United Arab Emirates is the fifth entity to successfully orbit a probe around Mars, as probe Hope begins to study the planet's atmosphere.
answer: The United Arab Emirates' Hope probe successfully entered orbit around Mars and began collecting data on the Martian atmosphere.

formulation: Cannabis legalization takes effect in Minnesota; Minnesota becomes the 23rd state and 27th U.S. jurisdiction overall to legalize cannabis for recreational use.
answer: On August 1, 2023, Minnesota officially legalized recreational cannabis use, joining 22 other states.

formulation: Largest-ever demonstration in Belarus as 100,000 people gather in Minsk to protest against controversial election results and regime of Alexander Lukashenko.
answer: A massive demonstration of approximately 100,000 Belarusians protested in Minsk against Lukashenko’s contested election victory and subsequent actions.

formulation: Last part of the world's largest floating restaurant, the Jumbo Kingdom seafood restaurant, leaves Hong Kong after 46 years (sinks four days later near the Paracel islands Islands).
answer: Jumbo Floating Restaurant, a Hong Kong icon for over 46 years, capsized and sank after being towed from Aberdeen Harbour amid financial difficulties and damage sustained during a typhoon.

formulation: Archaeologists announce the discovery of one of the oldest churches in the world from the 4th century BC, during excavations in Artaxata, Armenia.
answer: Archaeologists unearthed a complex of early religious structures including a potential temple, ritual spaces, and residential areas dating back to the 4th century BC in Armenia.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack: – The January 6 House Committee issues its first subpoenas, which mandate that four advisors and associates to former President Donald Trump turn over records and testimony. The targets of the subpoenas are former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows, former White House Deputy Chief of Staff for Communications Dan Scavino, former Defense Department official Kashyap Patel and former Trump adviser Steve Bannon.
answer: The January 6 House Committee voted to subpoena six of former President Trump's advisors, including Steve Bannon, Mark Meadows, and Dan Scavino, compelling them to testify and provide documents related to the Capitol attack.

formulation: New Zealand Parliament membership becomes majority female for 1st time.
answer: New Zealand's Parliament became the first in the world with a majority of women members after the 2023 general election, achieving a 57% female representation.

formulation: U.S. Representative Liz Cheney loses her Wyoming seat to Trump-backed candidate Harriet Hageman.
answer: Liz Cheney suffered a decisive defeat in Wyoming's Republican primary, losing her seat to a Trump-backed challenger, Harriet Hageman.

formulation: Nigerian Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala becomes the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization.
answer: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala was appointed Director-General of the World Trade Organization, marking a historic moment as the first woman and first African to lead the organization.

formulation: US 30-year fixed mortgage rate rises above 7% for the first time in 21 years.
answer: The 30-year fixed mortgage rate surpassed 7% on August 17, 2023, reaching its highest level in over 20 years.

formulation: A baby, a teenager, and four others are killed in a mass shooting at a home in Goshen, California, by alleged cartel members.
answer: A mass shooting in Goshen, California on January 16, 2023, left six people dead, including a baby and a teenager, and is believed to be connected to cartel activity.

formulation: The Justice Department and the Drug Enforcement Administration announce the arrest of more than 600 alleged members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.
answer: Operation Alpha Storm targeted the transnational criminal organization Jalisco Nueva Generación (CJNG) with over 600 arrests across 17 states.

formulation: Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo declared "largely contained" by World Health Organization, first outbreak to use new Merck vaccine.
answer: The Democratic Republic of Congo began using an experimental Ebola vaccine to try to contain a new outbreak in Bikoro.

formulation: Nationwide COVID-19 cases surpass 16 million and a new one-day record of 3,309 deaths are reported.
answer: The United States surpassed 300,000 COVID-19 deaths and 16 million total cases.

formulation: US Federal jury says Donald Trump must pay $83 million in damages to E. Jean Carroll after he denied raping her.
answer: A federal jury found Donald Trump liable for sexual abuse and defamation against E. Jean Carroll, awarding her an additional $83.3 million in damages.

formulation: Singapore flagged cargo ship strikes Francis Scott Key Bridge over the Patapsco River in Baltimore, Maryland, causing the 1.6 mile long, 47 year-old structure to completely collapse.
answer: The cargo ship Dali struck a support pillar of the Francis Scott Key Bridge, causing it to collapse into the Patapsco River.

formulation: Airstrike on Sudanese district of Omdurman by the Sudanese army kills at least 22 people including women and children.
answer: Intense fighting erupted in West Darfur between the Sudanese army and the Rapid Support Forces, leading to the deaths of at least 22 civilians, including women and children.

formulation: Buffalo wide receiver Gabriel Davis scores an NFL playoff record 4 TDs in the Bills' epic 42-36 overtime loss to the Kansas City Chiefs in their divisional-round playoff at Arrowhead Stadium.
answer: Gabriel Davis set an NFL playoff record by catching eight passes for 201 yards and three touchdowns against the Kansas City Chiefs.

formulation: Rwanda marks 25 years and the beginning of 100 days of mourning since the genocide that killed 800,000 people.
answer: Rwanda observed the 25th anniversary of the Rwandan genocide, a horrific event that resulted in the deaths of approximately 800,000 people.

formulation: XXXII Summer Olympic Games officially close at the Japan National Stadium, Tokyo.
answer: The 2020 Summer Olympics, which were delayed from 2020 due to the pandemic, concluded with the closing ceremony at the Japan National Stadium in Tokyo.

formulation: Rare December tornadoes strike four American states, with a 'Quad-State Tornado' across Arkansas, Missouri, Tennessee and Kentucky, completely destroying some towns and leaving at least 70 dead.
answer: A series of devastating tornadoes tore through Arkansas, Missouri, Tennessee, and Kentucky in December 2021, causing widespread destruction and tragically claiming over 70 lives.

formulation: Federal judge Charles Ralph Simpson III dismisses two felony charges against the two police officers who were involved in the killing of Breonna Taylor, determining that her boyfriend was ultimately responsible for her death by firing at the two law enforcement officials and, thus, prompting them to retaliate.
answer: A judge dismissed the last remaining charges against Louisville police officers Brett Hankison, Kyle Meany, and Joshua Jaynes in connection with the shooting death of Breonna Taylor.

formulation: Australian woman Kathleen Folbigg is pardoned after 20 years in prison for the murder of her four children, after new genetic research found evidence of gene disorders in the children.
answer: Kathleen Folbigg was officially released from prison after her convictions for the deaths of her four children were quashed, largely due to new scientific evidence regarding genetic conditions.

formulation: The United States and Somalia reach an agreement, involving the US writing off over $1 billion of Somalia debt.
answer: The United States and Somalia reached an agreement where the U.S. supports Somalia’s request to restructure its debt under the Highly Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) initiative.

formulation: California reports 35,468 new cases in the previous 24 hours, a new single-day record, and reports a record number of 2,013 hospitalized patients and 2,669 intensive care patients.
answer: California reached a grim milestone, surpassing 1.2 million COVID-19 cases and 15,000 hospitalizations.

formulation: The 2019 Major League Baseball season has its earliest season opener in history.
answer: The 2019 MLB season began, marking the earliest start date in league history, with games played as early as March 20th.

formulation: Tropical Storm Arthur is the first storm of the 2020 Atlantic hurricane season.
answer: Tropical Storm Arthur formed first during the 2020 Atlantic hurricane season, beginning on May 16, 2020.

formulation: Apple announces it is shutting down iTunes and replacing it with three different apps.
answer: Apple replaced iTunes with separate Apple Music, Podcasts, and TV apps, streamlining media management across devices.

formulation: Russian backstroke swimmer Evgeny Rylov wraps up the 100/200m double with OR 1:53.27 in the longer event at the Tokyo Olympic Games.
answer: Evgeny Rylov won gold medals in both the 100-meter and 200-meter backstroke events, dominating the competition in his specialties.

formulation: Satirical news site The Onion purchases Alex Jones' InfoWars at a bankruptcy auction.
answer: The Onion acquired InfoWars assets as part of Donald Trump's bankruptcy settlement.

formulation: Civilian death toll in Eastern Ghouta passes 1,000 in three weeks as Syrian government forces capture the town of Mesraba.
answer: Eastern Ghouta’s civilian death toll during intense fighting reached over 1,600, marking one of the highest civilian casualty tolls in the Syrian civil war.

formulation: Israel rescues four Israeli hostages from Nuseirat camp in central Gaza, but kills 274 Palestinians and injures 698 during the daylight operation.
answer: Hamas released three Israeli hostages, but seven Israeli soldiers were killed during the operation to retrieve them.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The first death from COVID-19 in the U.S. is reported by officials in Washington state, as the total number of cases nationwide reaches 66.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic rapidly began spreading across the United States, culminating in the first reported death in Washington state.

formulation: Cyril Ramaphosa is sworn in for a second term as President of South Africa in Pretoria, at the head of a coalition government.
answer: Cyril Ramaphosa's African National Congress failed to secure a majority in parliamentary elections, prompting negotiations to form a coalition government.

formulation: Evelyn Hernández cleared of killing her newborn baby in landmark case in a retrial in El Salvador.
answer: El Salvador’s Supreme Court overturned the conviction of a woman who had been sentenced to 30 years in prison for aggravated homicide after giving birth.

formulation: At least 60 migrants die from dehydration and hunger with 25 rescued after their dinghy engine breaks down off the coast of Libya.
answer: A boat carrying migrants off the Libyan coast, crippled by engine failure, resulted in the deaths of at least 60 individuals due to dehydration and hunger while awaiting rescue.

formulation: Kathie Lee Gifford leaves NBC's "Today" show after 11 years.
answer: Savannah Guthrie became the sole anchor of "Today" after Matt Lauer's termination in late 2017 and Al Roker shifted roles to chief national correspondent.

formulation: Signature Bank collapses and becomes the third bank in five days to fail. With $110 billion in assets, it is the fourth largest bank failure in American history.
answer: Silicon Valley Bank collapsed after a customer run caused concerns about its financial health, triggering a significant banking crisis.

formulation: President Donald Trump says his personal lawyer and former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani has tested positive for COVID-19.
answer: President Trump tweeted that Rudy Giuliani was "doing great" and recovering from COVID-19 after testing positive earlier that week.

formulation: Scottish American Douglas Stuart wins the Booker Literary prize for his first novel "Shuggie Bain".
answer: Douglas Stuart’s "Shuggie Bain" won the prestigious Booker Prize, catapulting the novel to international acclaim.

formulation: Saudi border guards accused of killing hundreds of migrants, shooting them as they tried to cross into the country from Yemen in report by Human Rights Watch.
answer: Human Rights Watch reported that Saudi border guards systematically shot and killed hundreds of Ethiopian migrants and asylum seekers at the Saudi-Ethiopian border between March 2023 and May 2023.

formulation: The Department of Justice agrees to pay $138.7 million to those who were sexually assaulted by Larry Nassar for the mishandled investigation by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).
answer: Victims of Larry Nassar and their families reached a $293 million settlement with the FBI over the bureau’s failures to act on repeated warnings about his sexual abuse.

formulation: In a major victory, Fifth Circuit of the U.S. Court of Appeals upholds a lower court decision to block key provisions of HB 900, Texas’s controversial book rating law.
answer: The Fifth Circuit upheld Texas’s law requiring parental consent for minors to check out books deemed “pornographic” by a state board, rejecting claims that the law violates First Amendment rights.

formulation: Scientists discover metals can self-heal, after observing metals cracking and fusing back together, paving way for future self-healing structures and vehicles.
answer: Scientists created a novel alloy exhibiting reversible phase transitions that allows it to “remember” and restore its original shape after damage, opening possibilities for self-healing materials.

formulation: Pixar Animation Studios' 20th feature film, Incredibles 2, the sequel to 2004's The Incredibles, is released in theaters. It is currently Pixar's biggest financial success, grossing over $1.242 billion worldwide.
answer: *Incredibles 2* became Pixar's highest-grossing film, earning over $1.242 billion globally.

formulation: First multidrug randomized control trial to treat Ebola started in Democratic Republic of Congo announced by the WHO.
answer: The World Health Organization announced the launch of the JeZERO clinical trial, a multinational, randomized, controlled trial to evaluate innovative treatments for Ebola virus disease.

formulation: Amid Greater Sydney's fourth major flood in 18 months, the Australian government declares a natural disaster as 45,000 people threatened with evacuation orders.
answer: A severe flood emergency was declared in Greater Sydney, displacing around 60,000 residents and prompting the evacuation of hundreds of homes.

formulation: Florida reports two deaths from COVID-19, the first confirmed U.S. fatalities outside of the west coast.
answer: The first confirmed COVID-19 death outside of Washington state occurred in California, signaling the virus's rapid spread beyond the initial West Coast outbreak zone.

formulation: Torrential rain totalling almost 300mm (11.8in) across South Korea leads to at least 37 deaths and floods a tunnel in South Korean town of Osong, trapping 15 vehicles.
answer: Record-breaking monsoon rains struck South Korea in mid-July 2023, causing widespread flooding, landslides, and numerous fatalities, especially impacting towns like Osong.

formulation: Typhoon Mangkhut (Ompong), category 5 strength, makes landfall in Cagayan province, Philippines, killing at least 100.
answer: Typhoon Ompong (Yutu) struck the Philippines, bringing devastating winds and floods.

formulation: Scientists pick Crawford Lake, Ontario, as reference place beginning a new interval of geologic time, the human-caused Anthropocene Epoch, starting 1950s and ending the Holocene - proposal later rejected.
answer: The Anthropocene epoch, defined by human impact on Earth, was initially proposed to begin at Crawford Lake, Ontario, but its formal designation faced rejection by the International Commission on Stratigraphy.

formulation: The FDA announces that the birth control pill Norgestrel, also known as Opill, will be available without a prescription.
answer: The FDA expanded access to over-the-counter birth control pills, allowing women to purchase them without a prescription for the first time.

formulation: The House of Representatives approves the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the North American trade deal set to replace NAFTA.
answer: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) was approved by the U.S. House of Representatives on December 19, 2019, to replace NAFTA.

formulation: 86th Heisman Trophy Award: DeVonta Smith, Alabama (WR).
answer: The Heisman Trophy ceremony was held on January 5, 2021, where DeVonta Smith, a wide receiver from Alabama, was awarded the coveted trophy.

formulation: 1st New York to Sydney non-stop test flight by a commercial airline achieved by a Qantas Boeing 787 Dreamliner, takes 19 hours 42 minutes.
answer: Qantas flight QF9, a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, completed the first non-stop commercial flight from New York to Sydney, traveling nearly 20 hours.

formulation: Nearly four million bottles of beer destroyed in large crackdown on alcohol in northern Nigerian state of Kano, where alcohol prohibited under Sharia law.
answer: Police and Islamic vigilantes raided numerous locations in Kano, destroying thousands of bottles of alcohol and arresting over 700 people in an effort to enforce Islamic laws.

formulation: World Surf League announces from 2019 there would be equal prize money for men and women across elite tour events; first US-based global sports league with gender pay parity.
answer: The World Surf League announced it would equalize prize money for men and women competing in elite tour events, starting in 2019.

formulation: Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences is awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James A. Robinson "for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity".
answer: Claudia Goldin was awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for her analyses of women's labor market outcomes over the past centuries.

formulation: Federal prosecutors announce a 36-count indictment against lawyer Michael Avenatti, including bank fraud, embezzlement, tax evasion and wire fraud.
answer: Michael Avenatti was indicted on multiple fraud and embezzlement charges in both New York and California, alleging he stole millions of dollars from clients.

formulation: New Earth geological age announced, the Meghalayan Age 4,200 years ago to the present, by the International Commission on Stratigraphy.
answer: The Holocene epoch was officially subdivided into three substages, with the most recent, the Meghalayan, being designated as a new geological age.

formulation: Quebec announces it will impose a healthcare tax on unvaccinated adults who are accounting for 50% of ICU cases (scrapped Feb 2022).
answer: The Quebec government announced a special tax on unvaccinated adults to help fund the additional costs incurred by their hospitalizations, including intensive care.

formulation: Washington state bans all persons under 21 years of age from purchasing a semi-automatic assault rifle.
answer: Washington state's HB 1427, prohibiting the sale of semi-automatic rifles to individuals under 21, went into effect on January 1, 2019.

formulation: Russian Senator Rauf Arashukov arrested within parliament on two murder charges.
answer: Russian Senator Rinat Akhmetshin was arrested in the Russian parliament on suspicion of orchestrating the murder of a former Chechen warlord.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump indicted by a federal grand jury on 37 counts on seven charges, including false statements, conspiracy to obstruct and willful retention of national defense information.
answer: Donald Trump was indicted on 37 felony counts, including violations of the Espionage Act, related to the handling of classified documents after leaving office.

formulation: Boeing announces that it will suspend production of the Boeing 737 MAX—which was involved in two accidents earlier this year—in January 2020.
answer: Boeing announced it would temporarily halt production of the 737 MAX due to a lack of orders and continued grounding following two fatal crashes.

formulation: Turkish lira falls dramatically after US President Donald Trump announces tariff increases on Turkish steel and aluminum.
answer: The Turkish lira plummeted to a record low against the U.S. dollar, triggering a significant currency crisis.

formulation: First successful transplant of a pig's heart into a human when genetically modified pig's heart inserted into a 53-year-old man in Baltimore, Maryland.
answer: Surgeons at the University of Maryland Medical Center successfully transplanted a genetically modified pig's heart into a patient named David Bennett, representing a monumental achievement in xenotransplantation.

formulation: US Republicans re-gain control of the House of Representatives, they now control all three parts of US federal government, the House, Senate and the Presidency.
answer: The Republican Party’s victory in the November 14, 2024, House elections solidified their control of the presidency, Senate, and House, effectively giving them power over all three branches of the U.S. federal government.

formulation: Mayor of Phoenix, Arizona, Kate Gallego apologies for local police threatening to shoot African American family after their four-year shoplifted a doll.
answer: Phoenix Mayor Kate Gallego publicly apologized for the police actions and the harm caused to the family, acknowledging that the officers' behavior was inappropriate and insensitive.

formulation: Jai Hindley becomes only the second Australian cyclist to win a Grand Tour with a 1' 18" victory over 2019 champion Richard Carapaz in the Giro d'Italia.
answer: Jai Hindley secured victory in the Giro d'Italia, marking only the second time an Australian cyclist has won a Grand Tour.

formulation: French adventurer Jean-Jacques Savin (72) successfully crosses the Atlantic Ocean in a barrel arriving in Martinique.
answer: At 72 years old, Jacques Piccard became the first person to reach the deepest point in the ocean, the Challenger Deep, twice.

formulation: Narendra Modi sworn in for a second term as Indian Prime Minister in New Delhi with 8,000 guests at largest-ever gathering at the Presidential Palace.
answer: Narendra Modi was sworn in for a second term as Prime Minister of India, accompanied by a large audience at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

formulation: Wildfires in northern California continue to rage across vast swathes of land, destroying hundreds of structures and causing several deaths.
answer: The Carr Fire, a rapidly spreading wildfire originating near Redding, California, devastated the region with widespread destruction and loss of life.

formulation: Scientists discover site of the Amazon's tallest tree, an angelim vermelho at 88.5 meters (290 feet) tall and 9.9 meters (32 feet) wide, Iratapuru River Nature Reserve, northern Brazil,.
answer: Scientists discovered a towering Dinizia excelsa tree, measuring 88.5 meters tall, in the Amazon rainforest, making it the tallest tree ever found in the region.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that the Trump administration is allowed to limit military service for transgender people.
answer: The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration’s policy barring transgender individuals from military service to take full effect after rejecting challenges from transgender service members.

formulation: EU directive bans single-use plastics by 2021.
answer: The European Union approved a landmark directive aiming to ban single-use plastics and boost recycling by 2025.

formulation: 24-hour approval granted to two rival robotaxi services in San Francisco - Cruise (General Motors) and Waymo (Google).
answer: San Francisco regulators authorized both Cruise and Waymo to operate driverless robotaxi services, marking the first time a city has allowed commercial autonomous ride-hailing.

formulation: American diver Victor Vescovo makes the deepest dive ever to the bottom of the Mariana trench at 10,927m (35,849ft), and finds a plastic bag.
answer: Victor Vescovo discovered plastic bags and other human-made trash at the bottom of the Mariana Trench, the deepest known point in the ocean, proving that pollution has reached even the most remote areas.

formulation: New economic corridor to rival Chinese Belt and Road Initiative - the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor announced at G20 summit in New Delhi.
answer: The G20 nations announced the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) to enhance connectivity and trade.

formulation: March 2021 Hawaii floods – Floods in Hawaii leave one missing, destroy six homes, force evacuations, and leave 1,300 without electricity.
answer: Heavy flash flooding impacted Kauai, Hawaii, causing widespread damage and leaving one person missing.

formulation: Six people are killed in a stabbing at a Bondi shopping mall in Sydney, Australia, by an attacker with mental health issues who is shot dead by police.
answer: A lone attacker fatally stabbed six people and injured several others at the Bondi Junction Westfield shopping mall, later being shot dead by police, and he was confirmed to have significant mental health issues.

formulation: The US seizes a plane used by Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, and flies it from the Dominican Republic to Florida.
answer: The U.S. Navy interdicted a Venezuelan presidential aircraft suspected of carrying undeclared money and illicit goods to a Caribbean island.

formulation: The NFL Draft is held in Detroit with the Chicago Bears taking former USC quarterback Caleb Williams with the first overall pick. Over 700,000 people attend the three day event, breaking the record held by the 2019 draft in Nashville by 100,000.
answer: The 2024 NFL Draft was held in Detroit, with the Chicago Bears selecting Caleb Williams first overall, drawing over 700,000 spectators.

formulation: –The Department of Justice charges Iranian national Farhad Shakeri with an Iranian plot to attempt to assassinate Donald Trump.
answer: The Department of Justice announced the arrest of an Iranian national, Ali Hajilou, for allegedly plotting to assassinate Donald Trump and conspiring to bribe a U.S. official.

formulation: Several new regulations take effect in the United States, including new regulations on retirement funds, new minimum wage rules, and new overtime rules.
answer: While several state-level changes occurred, a significant federal change was the implementation of the SECURE Act, impacting retirement savings plans and lifetime income options.

formulation: China's Pan Zhanle sets one of only 2 new WRs in the Paris Olympic swim meet with 46.40 in the 100m freestyle final ahead of Australia's Kyle Chalmers and David Popovici of Romania.
answer: Pan Zhanle broke the world record in the men’s 200-meter freestyle with a time of 1:47.42.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Pfizer/BioNTech seek full approval from the FDA for the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration fully approved the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for individuals 16 years and older.

formulation: 48% of Mexico's states experiencing drought, conditions acute in Monterrey where authorities deliver nine million liters of water daily to 400 neighborhoods after taps have run dry.
answer: Monterrey, Mexico, declared a state of emergency due to a severe, historic drought, leading to drastic water rationing.

formulation: 'Ghost ship' cargo vessel MV Alta washed up on the Irish coast near Ballycotton by Storm Dennis, after drifting across the Atlantic from Bermuda.
answer: The MV Kaizhou, a dilapidated cargo ship adrift for years, ran aground off the coast of County Mayo following a severe storm.

formulation: Claudia Goldin awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics “for having advanced our understanding of women’s labour market outcomes”.
answer: Claudia Goldin was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics for her research on women's labor market outcomes.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Moderna seeks full approval from the FDA for the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: Moderna submitted a Biologics License Application (BLA) to the FDA for its COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: In response to many automakers adopting Tesla's North American Charging System, a consortium composing of Mercedes-Benz, Honda, Kia, Hyundai, General Motors, BMW and Stellantis announce the formation of their own charging network which will feature Tesla and CCS plugs.
answer: Seven major automakers, including BMW, GM, Honda, Hyundai, Mercedes-Benz, Nissan, and Stellantis, announced they would create a new, open-access charging network called ChargeUp by 2024.

formulation: APEC Summit in Papa New Guinea fails to produce a joint agreement for first time in two decades after US and China clash on definition of trade.
answer: Disagreements between the US and China over trade definitions prevented the APEC Summit in Papua New Guinea from issuing a joint declaration for the first time in 20 years.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, originating in late 2019, rapidly spread worldwide and profoundly altered healthcare systems, travel restrictions, and daily routines by August 2021.

formulation: 6.3-magnitude earthquake strikes Iran's Kermanshah province injuring at least 700.
answer: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck Iran's Kermanshah province, causing widespread damage and injuring at least 700 people.

formulation: Canada observes its first National Day for Truth and Reconciliation, honoring victims and survivors of residential schools for indigenous children.
answer: National Day for Truth and Reconciliation was established as a federal statutory holiday to honor the lost children and survivors of residential schools.

formulation: SpaceX launches Starship's Integrated Flight Test 4, successfully guiding both the Super Heavy booster and Starship upper stage to soft water landings in the Gulf of Mexico and the Indian Ocean, respectively.
answer: SpaceX marked a pivotal moment in space exploration by achieving the first-ever successful landing of both the Super Heavy booster and Starship upper stage, following the IFT-3 orbital test flight.

formulation: Peruvian Prime Minister Dina Boluarte call for a "national truce" after seven weeks of violent protests at Pedro Castillo's removal from office, which have left at least 50 people dead.
answer: Prime Minister Dina Boluarte called for national unity and announced potential election talks following weeks of violent protests sparked by the ousting of former President Pedro Castillo.

formulation: India records more than 7 million cases of COVID-19.
answer: India surpassed 6 million confirmed COVID-19 cases, becoming the country with the highest number of cases globally at that time.

formulation: Nearly seven million people required to boil their water in Texas as unusually harsh winter storm in the state continues.
answer: A severe winter storm caused widespread power outages, freezing water pipes and systems, and leading to water contamination and boil water notices for nearly seven million Texans.

formulation: In landmark verdict, Pakistani Supreme Court acquits Christian woman of blasphemy against the prophet Mohammed after eight years on death row.
answer: Pakistan's Supreme Court overturned the blasphemy conviction of Asia Bibi, a Christian woman who had been on death row for eight years, and ordered her release.

formulation: U.S. fighter jets intercept two Russian TU-95 bombers in Alaskan airspace.
answer: Two Russian Tu-95 bombers and four fighter escorts were intercepted by two U.S. F-22 fighter jets over the Bering Sea and Gulf of Alaska.

formulation: Pence is subpoenaed by a special counsel leading investigations into Trump.
answer: A federal judge ruled that Pence could testify before a grand jury investigating Trump's efforts to overturn the 2020 election, rejecting claims of executive privilege.

formulation: Rare, long-track tornado travels 170 miles from Rolling Fork to Armory, Mississippi; trail of devastation kills at least 25.
answer: A powerful EF-4 tornado ripped through Mississippi, causing extensive damage and resulting in numerous deaths and injuries.

formulation: Gunman opens fire at a Waffle House in Nashville, Tennessee, killing four before James Shaw Jr. wrestled the rifle from the gunman's hands.
answer: A gunman opened fire at a Waffle House in Nashville, Tennessee, and was subdued by multiple bystanders who wrestled him to the ground.

formulation: Landmark case against weed killer Roundup, San Francisco court awards groundsman Dewayne Johnson $289 million against Monsanto for giving him terminal cancer.
answer: A California jury found Monsanto responsible for causing a groundsman's terminal cancer through Roundup exposure and awarded him $289.5 million.

formulation: 30,000-year-old intact remains of a baby wooly mammoth found frozen in permafrost in Klondike gold fields in the Yukon, Canada.
answer: The remarkably well-preserved fossilized remains of a juvenile hadrosaur, a duck-billed dinosaur, were unearthed in the Klondike.

formulation: A letter to Apple's Tim Cook is made public, in which staff request more flexibility over remote work, following the company's decision to return its 150,000 employees to the office.
answer: A group of Apple employees sent a letter to executives arguing against the mandatory return to the office and advocating for a more flexible remote work policy.

formulation: Marte Olsbu Røiseland of Norway wins the women's biathlon pursuit for her third gold medal of the Beijing Winter Olympics (women's sprint & mixed relay).
answer: Marte Olsbu Røiseland secured a historic gold medal in the women’s 15km individual biathlon race, Norway's first gold in that event since 1980.

formulation: Derek Chauvin is sentenced to 21 years in federal prison over the murder of George Floyd.
answer: A Minnesota appeals court rejected Derek Chauvin's attempt to overturn his murder conviction in the death of George Floyd.

formulation: Lowest January temperature of -43.6 C (minus 46.5 F), recorded in Sweden for 25 years in Kvikkjokk-Årrenjarka, Swedish Lapland, amid a very cold spell across Scandinavia.
answer: A severe cold snap brought temperatures down to -43.2°C (-45.8°F) in Kvikkjokk-Årrenjarka, Sweden, the lowest recorded there in 25 years.

formulation: World's largest cat-proof fence (44 km / 27.3 miles) completed at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, central Australia to protect endangered species.
answer: Australia's government introduced a national plan to cull feral cats, aiming to protect native wildlife from predation and support conservation efforts.

formulation: US Supreme Court rules in favor of teen kicked off cheerleading team after profane social media post, saying school violated her free speech.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled in *Mahoning County Board of Education v. Joseph Morgan* that a Pennsylvania school district violated a student’s First Amendment rights by suspending him for social media posts criticizing a school principal.

formulation: Ethiopian state funeral for murdered dam engineer Simegnew Bekele in Addis Ababa prompts unrest.
answer: The assassination of Engineer Simegnew Bekele, head of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam, triggered violent protests in Addis Ababa.

formulation: Roman scrolls burnt in Mt Vesuvius eruption at Herculaneum read for the first time, after computer-science student develops machine-learning algorithm - first word deciphered is purple.
answer: Researchers utilized a combination of artificial intelligence and multispectral imaging to non-invasively scan and interpret the carbonized scrolls, revealing the first word as "purple".

formulation: Tropical storm Trami / Kristine makes landfall in Divilacan, Philippines, creating severe flooding that kills at least 130 people.
answer: Typhoon Betty, with sustained winds and heavy rainfall, devastated several regions in the Philippines, causing widespread flooding and a tragic loss of life.

formulation: A mass shooting is carried out at Michigan State University. Three students were killed in the attack and five others injured. The shooter committed suicide as he was being approached by police.
answer: A mass shooting at Michigan State University resulted in three student deaths, five injuries, and the gunman's suicide.

formulation: Oldest library in Germany confirmed unearthed in Cologne dating to 2AD, possibly held 20,000 scrolls.
answer: Archaeologists confirmed the existence of a Roman villa near Biblis, Germany, with a suspected library containing around 20,000 papyrus scrolls dating back to around 2 AD.

formulation: "Suits" was the most-streamed show in 2023 withu 57.7 billion minutes, followed by "Bluey" then "NCIS" according to Nielsen.
answer: Nielsen reported that 'Suits,' 'Grey's Anatomy,' and 'Yellowstone' were the top three most-streamed shows of 2023, with 'Suits' accumulating a staggering 1.25 billion minutes.

formulation: New York Stock Exchange enters bear market territory (defined as falling 20% from a recent high - Jan 3) after the S&P falls 3.9%, amid fears of high inflation and a recession.
answer: The S&P 500 officially entered bear market territory, declining more than 20% from its January high.

formulation: Noble Prize for Physics won by Alain Aspect, John Clauser and Anton Zeilinger for their groundbreaking experiments using entangled quantum states.
answer: Alain Aspect, John Clauser, and Anton Zeilinger were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics for their experiments with entangled photons, establishing the foundation for quantum information science.

formulation: Fox News settles lawsuit with Dominion Voting Systems for $787.5 million, moments before trial, with Fox admitting it had defamed Dominion during US 2020 election by broadcasting conspiracy theories.
answer: Fox News settled with Dominion Voting Systems for $787.5 million over claims the network aired false statements about the company’s role in the 2020 election.

formulation: Amnesty International says 400 civilians have been killed in conflicts between Cameroon soldiers and Anglophone separatists in 2018.
answer: Amnesty International released a report documenting at least 200 killings by both government forces and armed separatists in Cameroon’s Anglophone regions.

formulation: Germany records its highest number of daily COVID-19 cases amid warnings its fourth wave could kill 100,000.
answer: Germany reported a record-breaking 69,622 new COVID-19 cases, the highest daily count since the start of the pandemic.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which began in late 2019, was officially recognized by the World Health Organization in March 2020, not December 2020.

formulation: Mudslide in Chinese city of Xi’an kills at least 21 people, in the wake of Typhoon Khanun.
answer: Torrential flooding and landslides triggered by the remnants of Typhoon Khanun caused widespread devastation and at least 21 deaths in Xi’an, China.

formulation: The Robert E. Lee Monument on Monument Avenue in Richmond, Virginia, a statue of Confederate General Robert E. Lee, is removed.
answer: Virginia removed the last of its Confederate statues from Monument Avenue, marking a pivotal moment in the city’s reckoning with its Confederate past.

formulation: Copa Libertadores Final 2nd-leg between Buenos Aires rivals River Plate & Boca Juniors is postponed after Boca bus attacked by River fans; players suffer cuts & affects of police tear gas; River wins, 5-3 on aggregate when 2nd-leg played in Madrid, Spain (9 Dec).
answer: The Copa Libertadores final second leg between River Plate and Boca Juniors was postponed in November 2018 after Boca's bus was attacked and was ultimately played on December 9, 2018, in Madrid.

formulation: US begins vaccinating children aged 5 to 11 years with a lower dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: The FDA authorized the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in children ages 5 through 11.

formulation: A major car crash in Imperial County, California kills 13 people and injures 13 others.
answer: A head-on collision between a big rig and a passenger van on State Route 78 near El Centro resulted in 13 fatalities and several injuries.

formulation: The National Rifle Association of America holds its annual convention in Houston, Texas. In the wake of the shooting at Robb Elementary School three days earlier, the pro-gun convention is met with protests from local residents.
answer: The NRA held its annual convention in Houston, continuing as scheduled despite widespread protests and outrage over the Uvalde school shooting.

formulation: US Acting-Secretary of the Navy Thomas Modly resigns after calling USN Capt. Brett Crozier of aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt (CVN71) "too naive and too stupid", in an address to the ship's crew.
answer: US Acting Secretary of the Navy Thomas Modly resigned after publicly downplaying the actions of Captain Brett Crozier, who had requested the removal of his crew due to a COVID-19 outbreak on the USS Theodore Roosevelt.

formulation: The UK's wettest day on record, with average of 31.7mm (1.24ins) across the country in wake of Storm Alex.
answer: Storm Alex brought torrential rainfall to parts of the UK, causing widespread flooding and setting new regional rainfall records.

formulation: Quriyat, Oman, registers highest "low" temperature for a day ever recorded of 42.5 degrees.
answer: Quriyat, Oman recorded a surprisingly low temperature of 16.9°C (62.4°F) on June 26, 2018, breaking a national record for the lowest temperature ever recorded in June.

formulation: McDonald's announces plans to "drastically" reduce plastic in its Happy Meals by 2025 (these meals make it one of largest toy distributors in the world).
answer: McDonald's pledged to eliminate plastic from Happy Meal toys and packaging by 2025, acknowledging its position as one of the world’s largest distributors of toys.

formulation: At least 16 people killed in a Taliban attack with over 100 injured in Kabul, Afghanistan.
answer: A suicide bombing at a wedding ceremony in Kabul, claimed by the Taliban, killed at least 16 people and wounded over 100.

formulation: Lebanon's Prime Minister Saad Hariri resigns after two weeks of nationwide protests and an economic crisis.
answer: Saad Hariri resigned as Prime Minister amid massive protests against corruption and a worsening economic situation.

formulation: The State Department tells Americans not to travel to Japan due to a spike in COVID-19 cases there.
answer: The U.S. State Department raised Japan's travel advisory to Level 4, the highest level, citing a high risk of contracting and spreading COVID-19.

formulation: American conducts its first ever drone strike against Al-Qaeda militants in southern Libya.
answer: U.S. forces conducted a raid in Libya that resulted in the death of ISIL leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's son, Abd al-Rahim al-Baghdadi.

formulation: Naya Rivera, a star in the show Glee, dies at age of 33 from drowning. Her death was not announced until July 13, 2020.
answer: Naya Rivera's son was discovered screaming for help in a rented pontoon boat on Lake Piru, prompting a frantic search for her.

formulation: First defamation case in Australia by a sitting MP won by Sarah Hanson-Green over Liberal Democrat David Leyonhjelm, after he made sexist slurs against her.
answer: Sarah Hanson-Young won a defamation case against David Leyonhjelm, securing a record $125,000 in damages and a public apology for his sexist remarks, highlighting the implications of such statements in a legal context.

formulation: Pedro Pierluisi sworn in as new Governor of Puerto Rico replacing Ricardo A. Rosselló.
answer: Ricardo A. Rosselló resigned from his position as Governor of Puerto Rico amid widespread protests over leaked chat messages and mismanagement.

formulation: My Pillow CEO Mike Lindell is sanctioned by federal judge Carl J. Nichols for filing a frivolous lawsuit against Dominion Voting Systems and Smartmatic.
answer: A New York judge ordered Lindell to pay nearly $79 million in damages for defaming Dominion Voting Systems.

formulation: MLB Pirates win 1-0 over Cincinnati Reds, despite getting no hits, in Pittsburgh.
answer: The Washington Nationals scored a run against the Atlanta Braves without recording a single hit, due to a combination of walks, errors, and a passed ball.

formulation: Keir Starmer makes the first visit to Ireland by a British PM in five years, meeting Taoiseach Simon Harris in Dublin.
answer: The British Prime Minister and the Taoiseach signed a landmark agreement aimed at resolving post-Brexit trade disputes and strengthening cross-border cooperation.

formulation: The Weather Channel, Mother Jones, and "Climate Desk" sponsor a one-hour special about Climate change mitigation featuring five Democratic and three Republican candidates in the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: The third Democratic presidential debate hosted by CNN featured a discussion about climate change, with ten candidates outlining their plans for mitigation.

formulation: Venezuelan triple jumper Yulimar Rojas records a WR 15.67m to claim the women's gold medal at the Tokyo Olympics.
answer: Yulimar Rojas won a gold medal in the women's triple jump with a new Olympic record of 15.67 meters.

formulation: The U.S. House of Representatives votes 228–206 to pass the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, a US$1.2 trillion infrastructure package.
answer: The House passed the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, a $1.2 trillion package to upgrade roads, bridges, broadband, and other vital systems.

formulation: MLB Philadelphia Phillies shortstop Trea Turner hits two solo home runs in same inning in 12-3 win over the Nationals in Washington.
answer: Trea Turner hit for the 15th cycle in MLB history, going 5-for-5 with a home run, double, triple, and single while leading the Phillies to a 7-0 win over his former team.

formulation: Countries sanction Russia for its invasion of Ukraine; EU closes its airspace to Russian planes, Russian banks excluded from worldwide Swift payment system, Sweden sends arms to Ukraine.
answer: Numerous countries and organizations imposed unprecedented sanctions on Russia, provided military and humanitarian aid to Ukraine, and condemned the invasion through diplomatic channels.

formulation: Body of five-year old Moroccan boy Rayan Oram retrieved from the well he fell down four days previously after huge rescue effort.
answer: After a frantic 48-hour effort, five-year-old Rayan was tragically found dead after being trapped in a 32-meter well in Morocco.

formulation: An overcrowded fishing boast carrying refugees and migrants capsizes south of Greece killing at least 79, with 104 rescued but hundreds more feared dead.
answer: A packed fishing boat carrying hundreds of migrants and refugees capsized in international waters off the coast of Greece, leading to a devastating loss of life and leaving many still missing.

formulation: Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar travels to Taiwan, the highest U.S. official visit to the country in 40 years.
answer: U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar visited Taiwan, the highest-ranking U.S. official to visit the island in 40 years.

formulation: The 66th Annual Grammy Awards are held at the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles. "Flowers" by Miley Cyrus wins Record of the Year and Midnights by Taylor Swift wins Album of the Year.
answer: The 66th Annual Grammy Awards were held on February 4, 2024, with Miley Cyrus winning Record of the Year and Taylor Swift winning Album of the Year.

formulation: The New York State Assembly says that it will not impeach Governor Andrew Cuomo following his announcement that he would resign.
answer: Governor Cuomo announced he would resign from his position effective August 24, effectively halting the impeachment proceedings initiated by the Assembly.

formulation: Former Vice President Joe Biden announces his candidacy for the 2020 presidential election, expanding the field to a record 20 candidates, the largest field of presidential candidates in U.S. history.
answer: Joe Biden announced his candidacy for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination, sparking a crowded field of contenders vying for the party's nomination.

formulation: California governor Gavin Newsom places a moratorium on California's death penalty, thus ordering a reprieve for the 737 people on death row.
answer: Gavin Newsom issued an executive order placing a moratorium on the death penalty in California, potentially halting future executions.

formulation: 12 people are killed, including the perpetrator, and four are injured in a mass shooting at a municipal center in Virginia Beach, Virginia.
answer: A city employee opened fire in a municipal building in Virginia Beach, Virginia, killing 12 people and wounding four others.

formulation: Michael Cohen, the ex-Trump lawyer who once said he'd "take a bullet" for the president, is given a 36-month jail term.
answer: Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to lying to Congress about his dealings with Russia and his work on behalf of Donald Trump’s presidential campaign.

formulation: Men's roller derby team settles dispute with MLB baseball team, allowing both to use Cleveland Guardians name.
answer: The Cleveland Guardians Major League Baseball team and the Spokesman Roller Derby team reached a settlement allowing the team to continue using the Guardians name.

formulation: The container ship Dali is freed from bridge debris since its initial collision on March 26 and is escorted by tugboats back to the port of Baltimore.
answer: The container ship Dali collided with a support pillar of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, causing it to collapse and resulting in a lengthy recovery process before the ship was cleared and returned.

formulation: 171 trillion pieces of plastic now litter the world's oceans, increasing from 16 trillion in 2005, estimate scientists from Gyres Institute.
answer: Scientists reported the Great Pacific Garbage Patch holds approximately 1.8 trillion pieces of plastic, representing a substantial increase from the 3.6 million estimated in 2005.

formulation: A New York Times report on President Trump's personal and business tax returns alleges years of tax avoidance and millions in debt and IRS penalties, among other allegations.
answer: The New York Times revealed that President Trump paid just $750 in federal income taxes in 2016 and 2017, while facing hundreds of millions of dollars in debt.

formulation: Senator Bernie Sanders suspends his presidential campaign, leaving Joe Biden as the presumptive Democratic nominee.
answer: Bernie Sanders suspended his presidential campaign, effectively making Joe Biden the presumptive Democratic nominee.

formulation: The Central Park Five file a lawsuit against Donald Trump in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania over claims that he made in the second presidential debate on September 10, 2024.
answer: The Central Park Five filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump in New York State Supreme Court seeking damages for his repeated and false assertions of their guilt.

formulation: "Fat Ham" an adaption of William Shakespeare's Hamlet by James Ijames opens off-Broadway at The Public Theater in New York (Pulitzer Prize for Drama 2022).
answer: *Fat Ham,* James Ijames's adaptation of *Hamlet* set in contemporary Southern Black America, premiered at The Public Theater in 2022 and subsequently earned the Pulitzer Prize for Drama.

formulation: Scout Motors announced the start of construction on its $2 billion electric SUV plant in South Carolina.
answer: Scout Motors announced plans to build a $2 billion electric SUV manufacturing plant in Blythewood, South Carolina, creating 4,000 jobs.

formulation: Dam collapses while under construction in Attapeu province, Laos, killing at least 20 with more than 100 missing.
answer: A failure of a dam caused a massive flood that devastated villages in Attapeu province, Laos, resulting in at least 31 fatalities and more than 100 missing.

formulation: Former cryptocurrency star Sam Bankman-Fried convicted of seven counts of fraud and conspiracy involving his companies FTX and Alameda Research in a New York court.
answer: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried was found guilty on seven counts of fraud and conspiracy related to the collapse of his cryptocurrency exchange.

formulation: US President Donald Trump says he has cancelled a secret meeting with the Taliban for peace talks at Camp David.
answer: Donald Trump abruptly canceled planned secret peace talks with the Taliban at Camp David, citing a recent bombing in Kabul.

formulation: Actor Will Smith issues an apology on Instagram to Oscars host Chris Rock for slapping him live on stage during the ceremony.
answer: During the 94th Academy Awards, Will Smith slapped Chris Rock onstage after Rock made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's hair, which led to Smith issuing an apology on Instagram.

formulation: Quentin Fillon Maillet of France adds the biathlon pursuit to his individual gold medal at the Beijing Winter Olympics.
answer: Norway's Johannes Thingnes Bø secured both the individual gold medal and the biathlon pursuit gold at the Beijing Winter Olympics.

formulation: At least 24 killed in explosions at pyrotechnics workshops in Tultepec, Mexico.
answer: A series of explosions at fireworks workshops in Tultepec, Mexico, resulted in at least 24 deaths and numerous injuries during a festival.

formulation: Every African country records cases of COVID-19 as The Kingdom of Lesotho becomes the last country on the continent to record a case.
answer: Lesotho became the last African country to report a COVID-19 case on May 13, 2020, marking the milestone of every African nation having confirmed at least one case of the virus.

formulation: President Trump unveils his "Platinum Plan" at a campaign rally in Atlanta, in which he proposes making Juneteenth a federal holiday, labeling the Ku Klux Klan and Antifa as terrorist organizations, and making lynching a national hate crime, among other socioeconomic initiatives aimed at African Americans.
answer: In Atlanta, President Trump addressed a crowd and unveiled initiatives targeted at Black voters, like a Juneteenth holiday and federal lynching crime legislation.

formulation: Researchers at the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument in Arizona release the largest 3D map of the universe featuring more than six million galaxies.
answer: Astronomers unveiled the most extensive 3D map of the cosmos to date, charting over six million galaxies and revealing the universe's large-scale structure.

formulation: US Senator Kirsten Gillibrand ends her campaign for president.
answer: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand suspended her campaign for president and endorsed Joe Biden.

formulation: Nine people shot and killed by their colleague, a public transit employee in San Jose, California.
answer: A VTA rail yard employee fatally shot nine coworkers and then himself in San Jose, California.

formulation: US COVID-19 death toll could reach 300,000 by 1 December, about 70,000 lives saved if masks worn consistently, according to University of Washington study.
answer: The University of Washington projected that universal mask-wearing could have reduced the US COVID-19 death toll by as much as 73,000 by December 1, 2020.

formulation: Apple ends production of its iPod music player after 21 years.
answer: Apple discontinued the iPod, effectively ending production of the product line that revolutionized digital music.

formulation: Brazil becomes second country to pass 50,000 deaths (officially) with states of Amazonas, Pará, Ceará, São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro most effected.
answer: Brazil became the second nation to surpass 50,000 COVID-19 deaths, with the virus hitting states like Amazonas, Pará, Ceará, São Paulo, and Rio de Janeiro disproportionately.

formulation: South Africa begins its case accusing Israel of genocidal acts against Palestinians in Gaza and violating the 1948 genocide convention at the International Court of Justice in The Hague.
answer: South Africa filed a lawsuit against Israel at the International Court of Justice, accusing Israel of committing genocide in its military campaign in Gaza.

formulation: Ecuador's COVID-19 death toll is then one of world's highest per capita after 7,600 more deaths than usual (503 official toll), in report by "The New York Times".
answer: The significant excess deaths revealed a severe strain on Ecuador's healthcare system and raised questions regarding the government’s transparency and accuracy in reporting COVID-19 related fatalities.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic rapidly spread across the globe starting in late 2019, triggering widespread lockdowns and travel restrictions while stimulating significant advancements in medical research.

formulation: NASA's OSIRIS-REX mission to retrieve space rock from the asteroid Bennu successfully returns to earth, landing in Utah.
answer: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft successfully delivered a sample of asteroid Bennu to Earth.

formulation: Successful memory transfer in snails achieved by scientists from University of California published in journal "eNeuro".
answer: Scientists discovered that the memories of snails are stored in a part of their brains that changes its structure during recall, rather than in a network of synapses.

formulation: Poverty in Argentina rises to more than half (52.9%), up from 41.7% in six months, for its population of 46 million, according to new figures, with inflation at 230%.
answer: Argentina's poverty rate was reported at 45% in March 2024 and subsequently increased to 53% by September 2024, representing an 8% rise.

formulation: Oklahoma approves the first ever religious charter school in the United States.
answer: Oklahoma's state Supreme Court ruled against a proposed charter school that would have prioritized religious education, citing a violation of the state's constitution.

formulation: Royal Bank of Canada named the world's largest financier of fossil fuels, bypassing JPMorgan, according to the Banking on Climate Chaos report by a group of environmental organizations.
answer: HSBC was identified as the world's largest financier of fossil fuels in 2023, surpassing JPMorgan Chase, according to a report by the Rainforest Action Network and other environmental groups.

formulation: A Star Is Born is theatrically released by Warner Bros. A remake of the 1934, 1957 and 1976 versions, it was a critical and commercial success, grossing over $436 million worldwide and receiving praise for the performances Bradley Cooper (who also directed), Lady Gaga and Sam Elliott as well as the screenplay, cinematography and music.
answer: "A Star is Born" was released by Warner Bros. on October 5, 2018, marking a remake of earlier versions from the 1930s, 1950s, and 1970s and earning widespread critical praise.

formulation: The 96th Academy Awards are held at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer is nominated for thirteen awards and wins seven, including Best Picture. The ceremony draws an average of 19.5 million viewers, a 4% increase from the previous year.
answer: The 96th Academy Awards, commonly known as the Oscars, occurred on March 10, 2024, with 'Oppenheimer' securing seven awards and attracting 19.5 million viewers.

formulation: Attacks in Oromia, western Ethiopia, targeting the Amhara people leave a reported 250 dead, killed by Oromo rebels amid worsening ethnic conflict in the country.
answer: Oromo Liberation Army rebels launched coordinated attacks on Amhara communities in Oromia, leading to widespread displacement and casualties.

formulation: Cease-fire in port city of Hudaydah, Yemen, by Houthi rebels and Saudi-led coalition announced by the UN.
answer: The UN announced the Stockholm Agreement, a deal establishing a cease-fire and withdrawal of foreign forces from Hudaydah to alleviate the humanitarian crisis.

formulation: Wildfires near Athens, Greece, kill 91 with 104 injured, over 600 rescued from the coast by boats.
answer: A devastating wildfire swept through the coastal area of Kineta, near Athens, Greece, claiming 91 lives and causing widespread destruction.

formulation: Parents of 545 children cannot be found that were separated at the US-Mexico border according to American Civil Liberties Union.
answer: A court-ordered report revealed the government had been unable to locate the parents of over 500 children separated at the border during the Trump administration.

formulation: The Department of Commerce reports that the U.S. economy shrank by 4.8% in the first quarter of 2020, its most severe contraction since 2008.
answer: The U.S. Department of Commerce reported a 4.8% contraction in the U.S. Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the first quarter of 2020, marking the first decline since the 2008 financial crisis.

formulation: The Senate passes the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 in a 51–50 vote with Vice-President Kamala Harris breaking the tie for its passage. Biden signs the bill into law later in the month.
answer: The Inflation Reduction Act, aimed at lowering healthcare costs, investing in clean energy, and reducing the federal deficit, was passed by the Senate and signed into law.

formulation: Frenchman Martin Fourcade wins his 2nd of 3 gold medals at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the 15k mass start biathlon; also wins men's 12.5k pursuit & mixed relay.
answer: Martin Fourcade secured three gold medals and one bronze medal, becoming the most decorated athlete of the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: Cocaine “super-cartel” that controlled one-third of European trade broken up in 'Operation Desert Light' by Europol, with 30 tones of the drug seized and 49 people arrested.
answer: Operation "Surcoat," a coordinated international police effort, dismantled a massive cocaine trafficking network across Europe with the arrest of 49 individuals and the seizure of 30 tons of cocaine.

formulation: Wisconsin holds its Democratic primary with in-person voting in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, after a mail-in voting rejected by the Wisconsin Legislature.
answer: Despite widespread concerns about the COVID-19 pandemic and limited mail-in ballot availability, Wisconsin held its Democratic primary with in-person voting, resulting in long lines and controversy over voter safety.

formulation: President Donald Trump confirms that the U.S. will leave the Intermediate-range Nuclear Forces treaty.
answer: President Trump announced the United States' withdrawal from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty, citing Russia's violations.

formulation: 2022 New York City Subway attack: Twenty-nine people are injured, 10 by gunfire, in a mass shooting at 36th Street station, in Brooklyn, New York.
answer: A gunman opened fire in a Brooklyn subway station, injuring at least 23 people, ten of whom were shot.

formulation: Argentine striker Sergio Agüero becomes top-scoring overseas player in English Premier League football history with a hat-trick in Manchester City's 6-1 rout of Aston Villa; total 177 takes him past Thierry Henry.
answer: Sergio Agüero became Manchester City's all-time top goalscorer, surpassing Thierry Henry’s record of 175 Premier League goals.

formulation: Los Angeles Clippers overcome an NBA record 31-point deficit to score an improbable 135-131 Game 2 playoff victory over the Golden State Warriors in Oakland; shooting guard Lou Williams 36 points.
answer: The Los Angeles Clippers completed a historic 31-point comeback against the Golden State Warriors, winning 129-127, largely fueled by Lou Williams' 36-point performance.

formulation: The 2018 North American heat wave begins.
answer: A dangerous heat wave began on June 28, 2018, causing record-breaking temperatures across Canada and the United States.

formulation: President Biden announces the launch of the website for student loan debt forgiveness.
answer: President Biden announced a plan to forgive up to $10,000 in student loan debt for eligible borrowers and up to $20,000 for Pell Grant recipients.

formulation: Highest ever June temperatures recorded in Germany (38.6C), Poland (38.2C) and the Czech Republic (38.9C) during week-long heatwave in Europe.
answer: A prolonged heatwave gripped Central Europe, breaking temperature records in Germany, Poland, and the Czech Republic with readings exceeding 40°C (104°F).

formulation: First truly complete sequence of a human genome published by Telomere-to-Telomere (T2T) consortium, after breakthroughs in new technology (previously just over 90% coded).
answer: Scientists successfully sequenced the entire human genome, including the previously inaccessible regions of centromeres, using a new combination of long and short DNA reads.

formulation: Mayor of Baltimore Catherine Pugh announces her resignation from office amid state and federal investigations into whether she used bulk sales of her self-published children's book to disguise kickbacks.
answer: Baltimore Mayor Catherine Pugh resigned amid investigations into allegations she profited from her children’s book series.

formulation: Italian designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana apologize for culturally insensitive video and media posts insulting Chinese culture, cancel Shanghai fashion show.
answer: Versace apologized and canceled their Shanghai fashion show after posting social media images featuring models wearing T-shirts with a map of China that excluded Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau.

formulation: F.B.I deputy director Andrew G. McCabe steps down from office.
answer: Andrew McCabe, the FBI’s Deputy Director, was fired by then-Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

formulation: Congresswoman Ilhan Omar at center of controversy over comments about 9/11 at speech to Council on American-Islamic Relations after tweet by Donald Trump, defended by Nancy Pelosi.
answer: Congresswoman Ilhan Omar suggested that U.S. support for Israel made America complicit in 9/11, sparking criticism and debates about antisemitism and free speech.

formulation: Within minutes of each other, Fox News and CNN fire Tucker Carlson and Don Lemon respectively. Carlson's firing was a result of the Dominion lawsuit settlement, while Lemon's was because of numerous misogynistic comments made in the past.
answer: Fox News fired Tucker Carlson and CNN fired Don Lemon, creating a simultaneous and unexpected shift in the American media.

formulation: In motorsports, Joey Logano of Team Penske wins the 2024 NASCAR Cup Series, his third win.
answer: Joey Logano secured his second NASCAR Cup Series championship by winning the Championship Race at Phoenix Raceway.

formulation: Africa's only female head of state, Mauritian President Ameenah Gurib-Fakim confirms she is resigning amid an expenses scandal.
answer: Ameenah Gurib-Fakim resigned as President of Mauritius following allegations of impropriety linked to a credit card expenses scandal.

formulation: Swedish engineers in Linköping produce the world's first female crash dummy (previous female dummies just a scaled down version of the male figure).
answer: Swedish engineers introduced the world’s first full-sized female crash dummy, “Humanetics Vital,” to more accurately assess potential injuries to women in car crashes.

formulation: The first recorded death due to vaping is announced by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), amid concern over a mystery lung disease in the United States, linked to the use of e-cigarettes.
answer: The CDC issued a public health advisory warning of lung injuries linked to vaping and urging healthcare professionals and patients to report cases.

formulation: Largest sandstorm in northern China in a decade engulfs Beijing turning air pollution levels hazardous.
answer: A massive dust storm originating from the Taklamakan and Gobi deserts swept across northern China, bringing sand and dust that significantly degraded air quality in Beijing.

formulation: Investigation into 2021 assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moise charges his wife, the former PM and ex-chief of police.
answer: A Haitian judge formally charged 10 former police officers in connection to President Moïse’s assassination after a year-long investigation.

formulation: Democratic Republic of Congo announces its worst-ever outbreak of Ebola with 198 deaths.
answer: A resurgence of Ebola virus disease in North Kivu Province led to the Democratic Republic of Congo reporting its worst outbreak, with 198 deaths.

formulation: Third of a species begin dying (23,000) over a two day period, the spectacled flying foxes, unable to survive heatwave of 42 degrees in northern Queensland, Australia.
answer: A severe heatwave, exacerbated by deforestation, triggered widespread heat stress and death among spectacled flying foxes in northern Queensland, Australia.

formulation: Research published in "Nature" and "Science" claims Native Americans had just one migration from Siberia to the New World, at most 23,000 years ago.
answer: Studies published in *Nature* and *Science* presented genetic and archaeological evidence suggesting that early Native Americans migrated from Siberia in multiple waves, with a previously unknown group contributing significantly to the ancestry of some modern Native American populations.

formulation: Former US president Donald Trump pleads not guilty in a NY court to 34 felony counts of falsifying documents related to 2016 hush money payments to a woman alleging they had an extramarital affair.
answer: Donald Trump pleaded not guilty to 34 felony charges in New York City, stemming from allegations of falsifying business records related to hush money payments made during the 2016 presidential campaign.

formulation: Oil tanker explosion kills 55 in Niamey, Niger.
answer: A devastating market fire swept through the Daouro market in Niamey, Niger, claiming the lives of 55 people and injuring dozens more.

formulation: United States Attorney General Merrick Garland announces that former White House Chief Strategist Steve Bannon has been charged by the Department of Justice for refusing to testify to the January 6 select committee investigating the Capitol riot and refusing to provide documents requested by the committee. Bannon turned himself in to the FBI three days later.
answer: Steve Bannon was held in contempt of Congress and ordered to jail for refusing to comply with the committee's subpoena.

formulation: Discovery of 3.8-million-year-old skull of early human ancestor Australopithecus anamensis, found by Yohannes Haile-Selassie, at Miro Dora, Ethiopia, upends previous evolutionary theory published in journal "Nature".
answer: The discovery of *Lesedi hominin*, a new species of early human ancestor from South Africa dated to 2 million years ago, challenged the narrative that *Homo erectus* was the first hominin to migrate out of Africa.

formulation: UK talk show "The Jeremy Kyle Show" axed by ITV after a guest dies.
answer: The Jeremy Kyle Show was cancelled following the death of Steve Dymond after appearing on the show.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs 15 executive orders on his first day in office, including: US re-joining the WHO, affirming the Paris Climate Agreement, revoking the Keystone XL Pipeline, mandating masks on federal properties, and halting construction of the southern border wall.
answer: President Biden signed executive orders rejoining the Paris Agreement on climate, ending the travel ban targeting several Muslim-majority countries, and requiring masks on federal property to combat COVID-19.

formulation: 90th Heisman Trophy Award: Travis Hunter, University of Colorado (WR/CB).
answer: Colorado quarterback Shedeur Sanders won the 2024 Heisman Trophy, becoming the first Buffalo to ever receive the honor.

formulation: South Korea again records the world's lowest fertility rate at 0.81 (advanced economics average 1.6, population replacement needs 2.1).
answer: South Korea’s fertility rate hit a record low of 0.78 births per woman on August 24, 2022, significantly lower than the average of 1.59 for advanced economies and far below the population replacement level of 2.1.

formulation: Israeli air strikes on southern city of Khan Younis in Gaza kill at least 70 people, after Israel ordered an evacuation of part of a designated humanitarian zone.
answer: An Israeli airstrike on a humanitarian zone in Gaza, after ordering civilians to evacuate, killed at least 70 people.

formulation: Opener Tammy Beaumont smashes 208 in the Ashes Test against Australia at Trent Bridge for the highest ever score by an Englishwoman in Test Cricket; Australia goes on to win by 89 runs.
answer: Nat Sciver scored 214 not out, breaking the previous record for the highest score by an English woman in Test cricket, despite England losing the match.

formulation: Tropical Cyclone Ilsa makes landfall in remote western Australia, between De Grey and Pardoo Roadhouse, as a category five storm, setting a new sustained wind speed record of 218 kph (135 mph).
answer: Cyclone Ilsa struck Western Australia as a category five storm, bringing record sustained winds of 218 kph.

formulation: US President-elect Joe Biden announces Ron Klain will be his White House Chief of Staff.
answer: Joe Biden announced that former Connecticut Senator Chris Coons would be his Chief of Staff.

formulation: Riley June Williams, a 22-year-old woman suspected of stealing House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's laptop during the January 6 Capitol riot, is charged by the FBI with intent to sell the device to Russian foreign intelligence services.
answer: Prosecutors revealed that the FBI had recovered the laptop of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi belonging to a woman charged with theft during the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: Vintage Junkers Ju-52 plane crashes near Flims, Switzerland, killing all 20 on board.
answer: A vintage Junkers Ju-52 aircraft crashed into a field in the Swiss Alps on August 5, 2018, killing all 20 passengers and crew.

formulation: 2022–2023 Pentagon document leaks: The FBI arrests Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, who allegedly leaked classified United States Department of Defense documents on his Discord server. On the following day, he is charged with violating the Espionage Act of 1917.
answer: Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old Air National Guard member, was arrested and charged with illegally removing and publishing classified national defense information.

formulation: Attempt to move 720,000 Rohingya back to Myanmar from Bangladesh refugee camps amid international criticism. They refuse to go.
answer: Bangladesh and Myanmar attempted the first repatriation of Rohingya refugees, but the process was halted as no refugees agreed to return amid international concerns about safety and verification.

formulation: Shenandoah County Public Schools of Virginia votes to reverse its 2020 decision and restores Confederate military leaders' names to schools.
answer: The Albemarle County School Board voted to remove Confederate names from local schools.

formulation: WHO approves second vaccine for Malaria, one that can be manufactured on a massive scale - R21 made by the University of Oxford.
answer: The Medicines Patent Pool and six manufacturers finalized agreements to expand the production of the RTS,S malaria vaccine and its supply to African countries, aiming for greater accessibility.

formulation: "Running Up That Hill" single by Kate Bush goes to #1 on the UK chart; originally released in 1985, the song  was featured in sci-fi television show "Stranger Things", its record 44 year climb to the top also makes Bush (63) the oldest female artist to score a No.1.
answer: "Running Up That Hill" reached number one on the UK charts, 37 years after its initial release, thanks to its prominent feature in the Netflix series "Stranger Things."

formulation: At least 41 women are killed in violence by rival gangs at a prison in Tamara, Honduras.
answer: A brutal riot between rival gang members in Tamara, Honduras, left at least 41 female inmates dead, highlighting the dangers of gang control within the prison system.

formulation: 2020 United States elections:.
answer: The United States held its presidential election, resulting in Joe Biden's victory over incumbent Donald Trump.

formulation: Rhine River in drought with lowest levels since 1920s forces German government to release oil reserves after barge shipments disrupted.
answer: Prolonged drought conditions resulted in critically low water levels in the Rhine River, hindering shipping and prompting the German government to release strategic oil reserves.

formulation: Taliban says women must study in gender-segregated classrooms in Afghanistan.
answer: The Taliban, despite initial promises, significantly restricted women’s access to education beyond the sixth grade and imposed strict gender segregation measures in universities and public spaces.

formulation: Federal judge Dan A. Polster rules that Walgreens, CVS, and Walmart must pay US$650 million to two Ohio counties for their responsibility in the opioid epidemic.
answer: A judge ruled that Walgreens bore some responsibility for the opioid crisis in Ohio, finding they failed to adequately control the distribution of opioid painkillers.

formulation: XXIV Olympic Winter Games open in Beijing, China.
answer: The 2022 Winter Olympics were hosted in Beijing, China, bringing together athletes from across the globe to compete in various winter sports.
