formulation: India COVID-19 death toll passes 100,000, with 6.6 million known cases, 3rd highest death toll in the world behind the US and Brazil.
answer: India's COVID-19 death toll surpassed 100,000, becoming the third-highest globally at the time.

formulation: Former U.S. representative from Texas Will Hurd launches his presidential campaign.
answer: Robert Burce announced his candidacy for President.

formulation: Global COVID-19 cases pass 20 million and is accelerating, 1st 10 million took almost 6 months, 2nd 10 million took just 43 days (Reuters).
answer: The world surpassed 20 million confirmed COVID-19 cases, demonstrating a substantial increase in infections just months after reaching 10 million.

formulation: A judge temporarily blocks a North Carolina law that requires voter ID. Democratic Attorney General Josh Stein is undecided as to whether to appeal.
answer: A federal court ruled that North Carolina's 2013 voter ID law was unconstitutional, as it was enacted with discriminatory intent, prompting the state's Attorney General Josh Stein to say his office would fight to uphold voting rights.

formulation: In a landmark case, Monsanto is ordered to pay $289m to 46-year-old Dewayne Johnson, after a jury rules that the company's Roundup weedkiller caused his terminal cancer and that the corporation failed to warn him of the health hazards.
answer: A California jury found Monsanto liable for failing to warn Dewayne Johnson about the cancer risks associated with Roundup, awarding him $28 million in damages.

formulation: Paraguay has eliminated malaria in announcement by the World Health organization.
answer: The World Health Organization declared Paraguay malaria-free, marking the first country in the Americas to be validated as free from the disease in over a decade.

formulation: The Senate unanimously passes legislation to ban imports of oil, gas, and coal from Russia.
answer: The Senate passed the Russia Accountability Act, aiming to further punish Russia for its actions in Ukraine by increasing sanctions and bolstering support for Kyiv.

formulation: Highest-ever temperature recorded in France 45.9°C in Gallargues-le-Montueux, southern France.
answer: France experienced its hottest ever recorded temperature of 45.9°C (114.6°F) in Vérargues, demonstrating the intensifying effects of climate change.

formulation: Huge explosions at the port of Beirut, Lebanon, kill more than 200 and leaves over 6,000 thousand people injured.
answer: A massive explosion at the Port of Beirut, caused by improperly stored ammonium nitrate, devastated the city and led to widespread destruction.

formulation: Global confirmed cases of COVID-19 rise above 4 million with death toll above 270,000, according to Johns Hopkins.
answer: Johns Hopkins University reported that the global COVID-19 death toll had officially surpassed 250,000, while confirmed cases exceeded 4 million.

formulation: Jam rock band Dead & Company, an outgrowth of the Grateful Dead, plays the final show of its final concert tour, at Oracle Park in San Francisco, California.
answer: Dead & Company concluded their final tour with a celebratory three-night stand at the Port of San Francisco, featuring a guest appearance by Bruce Hornsby.

formulation: A manhunt is launched for man caught on CCTV attempting to set fire to the National Archives Building in Washington, D.C. The suspect, Jacob Leroy Wallace, 32, is later arrested on May 2.
answer: A suspicious early morning fire at a historic rowhouse in the Shaw neighborhood of Washington, D.C., led to the arrest of a man weeks later, suspected of arson.

formulation: Alex Jones is ordered by a jury in Connecticut to pay US$965 million to the families of the victims in the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting due to his promotion of conspiracy theories in regards to the mass shooting. It is the largest payout that has ever been incurred by a civil defendant in the history of the state.
answer: A Texas jury ordered Alex Jones to pay nearly $1.5 billion in damages to the families of Sandy Hook victims for his years-long campaign of defamation and emotional distress related to the 2012 shooting.

formulation: Mass arrests of Occupy ICE demonstrators are made by Homeland Security agents at an ICE facility in Portland Oregon.
answer: Federal agents deployed to Portland to protect a federal building from protestors rallying against ICE.

formulation: Montgomery, Alabama, home of the US civil rights movement, elects Steven Reed as its first black mayor in 200 years.
answer: Steven Reed was elected as the first black mayor of Montgomery, Alabama, in the city’s 200-year history.

formulation: Santa Monica based video game publisher Activision Blizzard, Inc. is hit with a massive lawsuit from the California Department of Fair Employment and Housing after a two-year investigation reveals a "frat boy" like work environment where female employees face sexual harassment, discrimination, and retaliation for speaking out against the company.
answer: Activision Blizzard faced a lawsuit from the State of California, alleging widespread sexual harassment and discrimination within the company.

formulation: American runner Emily Sisson runs US record 2:18:29 in Chicago Marathon, finishing 2nd by 4:11 to repeat winner Ruth Chepngetich of Kenya.
answer: Emily Sisson set a new American record for women in the marathon with a time of 2:17:09.

formulation: The arms of a starfish less like limbs and more like part of a disembodied head conclude scientists in new study.
answer: Researchers discovered that starfish possess a previously unknown neural structure, a network of nerve fibers, connecting the top and bottom of their bodies.

formulation: Oregon's Bootleg fire has burnt nearly 400,000 acres, now so big it's generating its own weather patterns according to local fire chiefs.
answer: The Bootleg Fire, raging across southern Oregon, grew to nearly 400,000 acres and developed pyrocumulus clouds, a sign of extreme fire behavior and self-generated weather.

formulation: Dustin Higgs is executed by the federal government, becoming the 13th and final person to be executed by the Trump administration.
answer: Corey Johnson, convicted of killing seven people in a 1996 Kentucky truck crash, was executed by lethal injection, representing the 13th federal execution during Trump’s presidency.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump surrenders at Fulton County Jail, to be arrested on charges stemming from his attempts to alter 2020 Georgia election, and gets a mug shot.
answer: Donald Trump and 18 others were indicted in Fulton County, Georgia, on charges related to attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.

formulation: Volleyball at the 2020 Summer Olympics – Women's tournament: The United States defeats the two time reigning Olympic Champions Brazil. Becoming the first to win Gold in Tokyo.
answer: The United States women's volleyball team secured their first-ever Olympic gold medal, defeating Brazil in a thrilling five-set match.

formulation: Rare survival, The Shem Tov Bible, combining Jewish, Christian, and Islamic artistic traditions, completed by Rabbi Shem Tov Ibn Gaon in Soria, Spain, in 1312, sells at auction for $6.9 million.
answer: A 12th-century manuscript, "El Libro de las Tierras," which intricately blends Jewish, Christian, and Islamic artistic and historical traditions, was auctioned in Spain for $6.9 million.

formulation: Earliest evidence announced for humans making clothes discovered from bone tools 100,000 years old found at Contrebandiers Cave, Morocco.
answer: Researchers discovered bone tools in Morocco that show evidence of being used to soften animal hides for clothing, pushing back the known timeline of human garment-making by tens of thousands of years.

formulation: Ricky Stenhouse Jr. wins the 2023 running of the Daytona 500, beginning the 2023 NASCAR Cup Series.
answer: Ricky Stenhouse Jr. won the 2023 Daytona 500 in a surprise victory, ending a 15-year winless streak.

formulation: Britain's 95-year-old Queen Elizabeth II tests positive for COVID-19.
answer: Boris Johnson was hospitalized with COVID-19 symptoms, later being moved to intensive care.

formulation: 74th Emmy Awards: "Succession" Best Drama, "Ted Lasso" Best Comedy, "The White Lotus" Best Limited Series.
answer: The 74th Primetime Emmy Awards were held on September 12, 2022, recognizing those shows as the winners in their respective categories.

formulation: A rupture occurs in the Keystone Pipeline near Edinburg, North Dakota with an estimated 9,120 barrels spilled. This is the second significant spill in two years.
answer: The Keystone Pipeline ruptured in Marshall County, Kansas, causing a significant oil spill that impacted waterways and farmland.

formulation: Philippine officials declare a “state of calamity” around Manila as Typhoon Gaemi/Carina causes massive flooding, displacing 600,000 people and sinks an oil tanker.
answer: Severe flooding caused by torrential monsoon rains and Typhoon Doksuri led to a state of calamity declaration in the Philippines, displacing hundreds of thousands and sinking an oil tanker near Manila.

formulation: World's longest treasure hunt comes to an end in France after 31 years, with the discovery of a golden owl statuette. Hunt based on  11 puzzles set out originally set by Max Valentin.
answer: The decades-long "A Great Work of Human Artifice" treasure hunt, meticulously crafted by Max Valentin, reached its climax in Allier, France, with the finding of a golden owl.

formulation: The United States announces that it will stop sharing information about its nuclear arsenal with Russia over the latter's withdrawal from the New START nuclear arms treaty.
answer: The U.S. announced it would no longer share information about its strategic nuclear arsenal with Russia, citing Russia’s lack of transparency and compliance with the treaty.

formulation: The 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup is co-hosted by the West Indies and the United States.
answer: The 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup will be held in the United States and the West Indies in June 2024.

formulation: Eleven LIV Golf players led by Phil Mickelson file a lawsuit against PGA Tour, accusing it of being an illegal monopoly over professional golf.
answer: Several professional golfers, including Phil Mickelson, filed an antitrust lawsuit against the PGA Tour alleging the organization engaged in monopolistic practices that harmed their ability to compete.

formulation: U.S. District Judge Linda Vivienne Parker announces sanctions against Sidney Powell, L. Lin Wood, and other lawyers who were filing a lawsuit seeking to overturn President Biden's victory in Michigan last year. She also orders the lawyers to be referred to their home states for disbarment or suspension of law license.
answer: Michigan state bar associations suspended Powell and Wood from practicing law in Michigan for their actions attempting to overturn the 2020 election results.

formulation: State of the Union Address.
answer: The President delivers the State of the Union address in early February to Congress, detailing their agenda and policy goals.

formulation: Overpressured natural gas lines in the Merrimack Valley in Massachusetts cause a massive outbreak of explosions and fires in nearly 40 homes, killing one and injuring dozens.
answer: A series of natural gas explosions and fires erupted across several communities in the Merrimack Valley due to overpressure in Columbia Gas lines, impacting over 80,000 residents and causing significant damage.

formulation: Truck loses control hitting 31 cars and killing at least 15 people near a tollbooth in Lanzhou, China.
answer: A truck plowed through a crowded Lanzhou street market, killing 14 and injuring 39 due to brake failure.

formulation: A Pennsylvania jury orders ExxonMobil to pay $725.5 million to a former mechanic who claimed that the company's gasoline and solvents caused him to develop leukemia.
answer: A New York jury found ExxonMobil liable for misleading the public about the dangers of climate change, potentially opening the door for lawsuits seeking damages related to climate-related health impacts.

formulation: For the first time more than 3 million passengers were recorded passing through US airport security in one day, amid an increase in air travel in the US.
answer: The Transportation Security Administration screened over 2.5 million passengers, marking the busiest day for air travel since before the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: US Senate passes non-binding "war powers resolution" against long-term ally Saudi Arabia.
answer: The Senate passed a resolution to withdraw U.S. military support for the Saudi-led war in Yemen and condemned the Saudi government's human rights record.

formulation: Three daughters of civil rights activist Malcolm X file a $100 million wrongful death lawsuit against the CIA, the FBI, and the New York Police Department for their alleged roles in the assassination of Malcolm X.
answer: In November 2024, Malcolm X’s daughters filed a civil lawsuit accusing the CIA, FBI, and New York Police Department of conspiring to orchestrate their father’s 1965 assassination.

formulation: Pro-Iranian protesters end siege of US Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq.
answer: Pro-Iranian protesters breached the perimeter of the US Embassy in Baghdad, clashing with security forces and setting fire to parts of the compound.

formulation: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar, the country's first gay and biracial taoiseach, announces he is stepping down after serving 2017-2020 and since December 2022.
answer: Leo Varadkar announced he is stepping down as Taoiseach, triggering a leadership contest within Fine Gael.

formulation: Nobel Prize in Physics awarded to Pierre Agostini, Ferenc Krausz and Anne L’Huillier for research into attosecond pulses of light.
answer: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to Pierre Agostini, Ferenc Krausz, and Anne L’Huillier for their experiments generating attosecond pulses of light.

formulation: Cyclone Cheneso makes landfall in northern Madagascar, killing at least 25 people and leaving about 40,000 homeless.
answer: Cyclone Cheneso devastated northern Madagascar in January 2023, causing widespread damage, at least 25 deaths, and the displacement of roughly 40,000 people.

formulation: Riots break out in downtown Minneapolis following false rumors about the suicide of an African American man being pursued by police. 113 people are arrested.
answer: A riot erupted in downtown Minneapolis after false claims circulated about the death of an African American man during a police encounter, leading to property damage and 113 arrests.

formulation: China's new national security legislation for Hong Kong comes into force.
answer: The National Security Law, imposed by Beijing, criminalized secession, subversion, terrorism and collusion with foreign forces, effectively reshaping Hong Kong's legal and political system.

formulation: Britain's Boxford Timber identified as UK's oldest decoratively carved wood at 6,000 years old by radio carbon dating after being found in West Berkshire during house renovations.
answer: Archaeologists unearthed a 10,000-year-old wooden spear, carbon-dated to the Mesolithic period, offering unprecedented insight into early woodworking techniques.

formulation: “I actually believe they’re going to be the most difficult time in the public health history of this nation,” warns Dr. Robert Redfield, head of US CDC about the months ahead with COVID-19.
answer: Dr. Redfield warned that the next few months would be the "most difficult" of the pandemic due to the combined surge from holiday travel and potential fatigue with preventative measures.

formulation: Impeachment of Alejandro Mayorkas: The United States Senate votes to dismiss both impeachment articles against Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas, by a vote of 51–48 on the first article and 51–49 on the second article.
answer: The Senate acquitted Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas of both articles of impeachment, failing to convict him.

formulation: Heat wave begins across the east of America affecting 100 million people and killing 6, with New York city declaring a state of emergency.
answer: An unprecedented heatwave gripped the eastern United States, causing dangerously high temperatures and prompting a state of emergency in New York City.

formulation: President Trump announces the formation of the 1776 Commission.
answer: The "1776 Commission" was launched to develop a national curriculum promoting a patriotic interpretation of American history.

formulation: Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika (82) changes his mind saying he will not seek a fifth term and postpones elections after mass protests.
answer: Abdelaziz Bouteflika announced his intention to seek a fifth term as president, despite ongoing mass protests calling for his resignation.

formulation: Apple announces new $1 billion campus in Austin, Texas and expansion in other US cities.
answer: Apple announced a $1 billion investment in a new Austin campus and expansions in Seattle, San Diego, and Pittsburgh in December 2018.

formulation: Public Domain Day: All works published in 1923 except sound recordings enter the public domain in the United States, the first works to do so since the passage of the 1998 Sonny Bono Copyright Term Extension Act.
answer: Literary and artistic works published in 1923 in the United States entered the public domain on January 1, 2019, due to the passage of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act.

formulation: India's COVID-19 death toll likely 10 times its official toll, 3.4 million to 4.7 million (to June 2021), according to The Center for Global Development.
answer: The Center for Global Development estimated that India’s true COVID-19 death toll around mid-2021 was likely between three to five million, significantly higher than official figures.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that pending trial, mifepristone can remain on US markets. The decision is seen as a victory for the national abortion-rights movement.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to block a lower court ruling that restricted access to mifepristone, a key abortion pill, leading abortion-rights advocates to express relief that the drug remained available, though concerns persisted about the ongoing legal challenges.

formulation: Surrealist artist Man Ray's photograph "Le Violon d'Ingres" sells for $12.4 million, making it the most expensive ever sold at auction.
answer: Christie's auction in New York City witnessed the historic sale of Man Ray's "Le Violon d'Ingres" for $12.4 million, setting a new record for the highest price ever paid for a photograph at auction.

formulation: China–United States relations – President Biden speaks virtually with Chinese President Xi Jinping amid rising tensions and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's expected visit to Taiwan. The two leaders discussed Taiwan, the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, and the global economy.
answer: Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Joe Biden held a virtual meeting to discuss Taiwan, Ukraine, and other pressing issues amid heightened geopolitical tensions.

formulation: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg announces a $1.4 billion investment in the nation's railroad network to improve safety and capacity, mostly funded by the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.
answer: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg announced $8.2 billion in Federal Railroad Administration grants to improve rail safety, efficiency, and speed across the country.

formulation: Boat carrying wedding guests overturns killing 106 with 144 rescued on the river Niger in Nigeria's north central Kwara State.
answer: An overcrowded boat carrying people to a wedding capsized on the Niger River in Kwara State, Nigeria, resulting in over 100 deaths and 144 survivors.

formulation: Scott Morrison becomes Prime Minister of Australia after defeating Peter Dutton in a leadership spill, replacing Malcolm Turnbull.
answer: Scott Morrison won a leadership challenge within the Liberal Party, ousting Malcolm Turnbull and subsequently becoming Prime Minister.

formulation: Former lawyer to Donald Trump Jenna Ellis is the fourth person to plead guilty and accept a plea deal in the Georgia election interference case.
answer: Jenna Ellis pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit intentional interference with a legally conducted election and agreed to testify against others in the case.

formulation: Japan is the fifth nation to land a spacecraft on the Moon with its SLIM (Smart Lander for Investigating Moon) using "pinpoint landing" technology.
answer: Japan's SLIM spacecraft successfully landed on the Moon, achieving the first-ever pin-point landing in the lunar south pole region.

formulation: Houston forward James Harden puts up highest scoring triple-double in NBA history (60 points, 10 rebounds, 11 assists) as the Rockets beat Orlando Magic, 114-107 in Houston.
answer: James Harden recorded his fourth career triple-double with at least 30 points, 10 rebounds, and 10 assists, becoming the sixth player in NBA history to achieve this feat.

formulation: The Linac Coherent Light Source at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is upgraded to LCLS-II and successfully demonstrates its first X-rays, which are 10,000 times brighter than the previous version.
answer: The Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) achieved a 10,000-times brighter X-ray beam than previous versions, opening doors to unprecedented scientific detail.

formulation: President Trump expands his travel ban to include six new countries: Eritrea, Kyrgyzstan, Myanmar, Nigeria, Sudan, and Tanzania.
answer: President Trump expanded the travel ban to include six additional countries – Myanmar, Eritrea, Kyrgyzstan, Nigeria, Sudan, and Tanzania – citing national security and immigration concerns.

formulation: NASA confirms that the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) mission was successful in its ultimate goal. Dimorphos was knocked out of its orbit by thirty-two minutes, much more than the ten minutes that the space agency anticipated.
answer: NASA's DART spacecraft successfully impacted the asteroid Dimorphos, slightly altering its orbit and proving the feasibility of asteroid deflection.

formulation: Biggest trial in modern French history for November 2015 Paris Attacks, convicts Salah Abdeslam, and 19 others, of terrorism and murder charges, sentences him to a rare 30-year prison term.
answer: The lengthy and closely-watched trial concerning the 2015 Paris attacks concluded with Salah Abdeslam and fourteen others convicted of terrorism and murder.

formulation: Coach USA, a holding company for many bus services including Megabus, files Chapter 11 bankruptcy and seeks to sell its assets to shed $197.8 million of debt.
answer: Coach USA filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in June 2024, intending to sell its assets to reduce its considerable debt load.

formulation: Sahle-Work Zewde becomes Ethiopia's first female President and Africa's only female head of state after being elected by parliament.
answer: Sahle-Work Zewde was elected by parliament as Ethiopia's first female president.

formulation: The Skyline light rail formally opens in Honolulu, Hawaii. It is the first major metro system in the United States that has platform screen doors built into its stations.
answer: Honolulu’s Skyline (rail) system opened with platform screen doors, making it the first major U.S. metro to incorporate this safety feature.

formulation: Powerful storm producing multiple tornadoes rips through central Tennessee killing at least 25.
answer: A devastating outbreak of tornadoes struck central Tennessee on March 3, 2020, causing widespread destruction and claiming the lives of at least 25 people.

formulation: The Michigan Wolverines defeat the Washington Huskies by a score of 34–13 to win the College Football Playoff National Championship.
answer: The Michigan Wolverines defeated the Washington Huskies 34-11 to win the national championship.

formulation: Pakistan International Airlines flight crashes near Jinnah International Airport in Karachi killing 97 with just two survivors.
answer: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 8303 crashed in Karachi, killing 97 people and leaving two survivors.

formulation: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis resigns, effective February 28, 2019, after failing to persuade Trump to reconsider his decision of the previous day to withdraw the remaining American troops from Syria.
answer: Jim Mattis resigned as Secretary of Defense citing disagreement with President Trump’s plan to withdraw U.S. troops from Syria.

formulation: New York's attorney general Eric Schneiderman resigns over multiple allegations of assault.
answer: Eric Schneiderman, the Attorney General of New York, resigned following allegations of physical and verbal abuse from multiple women.

formulation: European Commission spokesperson Daniel Rosario threatens retaliatory measures if the United States imposes a US$7.5 billion (€6.823 billion) tariff on products such as olives, whiskey, wine, cheese, yogurt, and airplanes. The tariffs are scheduled to take effect on October 18.
answer: The EU and the US threatened to impose retaliatory tariffs on billions of dollars worth of goods over disputes related to aircraft subsidies and steel and aluminum imports.

formulation: Swedish cross country skier Charlotte Kalla wins 3rd career Olympic gold medal in the 15k skiathlon in Pyeongchang; also wins 10k freestyle gold in Vancouver (2010) and 4 x 5k relay in Sochi (2014).
answer: Charlotte Kalla won a gold medal in the women's skiathlon, marking her fourth Olympic gold.

formulation: Toadzilla, a large cane toad and unofficially the world's largest toad at 2.7kg, discovered in Conway National Park, Australia (as an invasive pest later euthanized).
answer: Scientists discovered an extraordinarily large female cane toad, weighing 2.7 kg, in Australia, suggesting invasive species can achieve unexpectedly large sizes.

formulation: ExxonMobil announces it will acquire Pioneer Natural Resources in a $60 billion all-stock deal, the largest in the energy industry in nearly two decades.
answer: ExxonMobil announced a $60 billion all-stock acquisition of Pioneer Natural Resources to bolster its position in the Permian Basin.

formulation: 59 people die in a crash between an oil tanker and a lorry carrying passengers in Niger State, Nigeria.
answer: A collision between an oil tanker and a lorry carrying passengers in Niger State, Nigeria, resulted in the deaths of 59 people on November 17, 2023.

formulation: Alabama passes law banning abortion in almost all cases including rape or incest.
answer: Alabama passed the "Human Life Protection Act" in May 2019, essentially banning abortion at all stages of pregnancy except in cases where the mother's life is at risk.

formulation: Landmark trial of antiviral drug lenacapavir among African women shows 100% HIV prevention.
answer: A study found that a daily oral pill, not injections, significantly reduced HIV infection risk among African women in a large clinical trial.

formulation: US missile attack in al-Qaeda jihadist training camp in Idlib province, Syria, kills 40.
answer: A U.S. military airstrike in Syria targeted an al-Qaeda training camp, killing 40 individuals.

formulation: Van deliberately driven into pedestrians in Toronto, Canada, killing 10 and injuring 13.
answer: A driver of a rental van deliberately plowed into pedestrians along Yonge Street in Toronto, killing 10 people and injuring 13 others.

formulation: New York Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber no-hits Texas Rangers, 2-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, Texas.
answer: Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber threw the 24th no-hitter in franchise history, defeating the Texas Rangers 8-0.

formulation: Singaporean chess prodigy Ashwath Kaushik at eight years old is the youngest player to defeat a grandmaster in a classic tournament game at the Burgdorfer Stadthaus Open, Switzerland.
answer: Ashwath Kaushik achieved a FIDE rating of 2333, making him the youngest player in history to break the 2300 rating barrier.

formulation: Minnesota senator Amy Klobuchar announces her 2020 presidential campaign.
answer: Senator Amy Klobuchar formally announced her candidacy for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination.

formulation: John Delaney announces his candidacy for U.S. president in 2020.
answer: Former Maryland Congressman John Delaney officially launched his campaign for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination.

formulation: Colombia's COVID-19 recorded death toll passes 100,000, the tenth country in the world to do so.
answer: Colombia surpassed 100,000 COVID-19 deaths, marking a grim milestone in the pandemic.

formulation: Logan Paul hosts the Challenger Games at Long Beach City College in California. Notable participants included Tobi Brown, Jake Paul, and Deestroying.
answer: The inaugural Creator Clash boxing event showcased social media personalities and athletes battling in the ring.

formulation: The 2021 Boston Marathon takes place after it was rescheduled from April.
answer: The Tokyo Olympics, which were postponed from 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, concluded in New York City.

formulation: Shohei Ohtani of the Los Angeles Dodgers steals a base and hits a grand slam in 7-3 win at home over Tampa, becoming just the 6th MLB player to have 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season; he does so in the fewest amount of games, 126.
answer: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to hit 50 home runs and steal 20 bases in a single season.

formulation: Typhoon In-Fa (Yanhua) makes landfall in the city of Zhoushan on China's east coast.
answer: Typhoon In-Fa made landfall in Zhoushan, China, on July 25, 2021, bringing record rainfall and strong winds.

formulation: Scientists say crucial Atlantic ocean current near collapse - the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation could reach its tipping point middle of this century.
answer: New research suggests that the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation is weakening faster than previously anticipated and could reach a critical tipping point, significantly disrupting global climate patterns, as early as the 2040s.

formulation: Italian David-Maria Sassoli chosen as new European Parliament President.
answer: Ursula von der Leyen was chosen to be the first female President of the European Commission, with Italian politician Josep Borrell being named High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy.

formulation: US Biden administration restores climate impacts and community say to the National Environmental Policy Act, previously removed by Donald Trump.
answer: The Biden administration finalized a rule reversing Trump-era changes to regulations governing methane emissions from oil and gas operations.

formulation: Recreational marijuana becomes legal in Illinois.
answer: Recreational marijuana became legal in Illinois on January 1, 2020, allowing adults 21 and older to purchase and possess limited amounts of cannabis.

formulation: In a rare podium sweep, France wins the men's BMX with Joris Daudet, Sylvain André and Romain Mahieu going 1-2-3 at the Paris Olympics.
answer: France’s Mathis Ragot secured a historic silver medal, marking the first time a French rider has medaled in men’s BMX racing at the Olympics.

formulation: World Health Organization declares the DR Congo Ebola outbreak a "public health emergency of international concern".
answer: The World Health Organization declared Ebola in the Democratic Republic of the Congo a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

formulation: NFL Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley sets new franchise game record with 255 yards rushing in 37-20 victory over Los Angeles Rams at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.
answer: Saquon Barkley recorded his 10th consecutive game with over 100 yards from scrimmage, setting a new NFL record for running backs.

formulation: Bus crash in North Korea kills 36, with most Chinese tourists.
answer: A bus carrying primarily Chinese tourists crashed in North Korea, killing 36 people.

formulation: Broadcom announces it will purchase VMware in a $61 billion cash and stock deal, which becomes the second-largest M&A deal announced this year.
answer: Broadcom announced its agreement to acquire VMware in a deal valued at $61 billion, marking a significant move in the cloud computing landscape.

formulation: A high-altitude balloon is detected over Utah, prompting the deployment of fighter aircraft to intercept the object. The origin and purpose of the balloon are unknown, according to US officials.
answer: A high-altitude balloon, later determined to be civilian in nature, traversed Utah airspace prompting the U.S. military to scramble fighter jets to monitor it.

formulation: In landmark decision US Supreme Court rules 6-3 that gay and transgender workers cannot be discriminated against in the workplace.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 protects employees from discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

formulation: The Trump Organization through two subsidiaries was convicted by a jury for committing tax fraud and falsifying business records.
answer: A New York jury found the Trump Organization guilty of criminal tax fraud for scheming to evade taxes on executive compensation.

formulation: In a historic first, President Trump meets with Supreme Leader of North Korea, Kim Jong-un, in Singapore.
answer: Donald Trump and Kim Jong-un held a historic summit in Singapore to discuss denuclearization and improve relations between the United States and North Korea.

formulation: New York records the worst air quality in the world due to smoke from 80 wild fires on the US west coast.
answer: Wildfires in western US sent hazardous levels of smoke and orange-tinted skies to New York City.

formulation: Nearly 40% (36.6%) of all female suicides occur in India according to report published in "The Lancet".
answer: The Lancet published a study showing that India has the highest number of female suicides globally, accounting for 36% of the world's total.

formulation: El Salvador immigrant father and his 23-month-old daughter drown trying to cross the Rio Grande into the US with their photo causing widespread condemnation.
answer: The image of Óscar Alberto Martínez Ramírez and his daughter Angie Valeria, who drowned in the Rio Grande while trying to enter the United States, tragically illustrated the risks migrants face.

formulation: New York reports its highest daily new case total since April 24.
answer: New York state surpassed 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases just before Thanksgiving 2020.

formulation: The Department of Justice charges 193 people, including 76 medical professionals, with participating in healthcare fraud schemes worth $2.75 billion, including unlawful distribution of Adderall and drug addiction treatments.
answer: Federal authorities announced the takedown of a nationwide healthcare fraud scheme involving over 150 arrests and charges related to distributing opioids and defrauding Medicare and Medicaid.

formulation: A Piper PA-32A crashes on I-40 while attempting to land at John C. Tune Airport in Nashville after suffering a mechanical failure. All five passengers are killed on board.
answer: On August 27, 2023, a Piper PA-32A crashed on I-40 near Nashville, killing all five onboard due to a mechanical failure while attempting to land at John C. Tune Airport.

formulation: The U.S. Senate votes 81–13 for the National Defense Authorization Act 2021, overriding a veto by President Donald Trump for the only time in his presidency.
answer: The Senate overrode President Trump's veto of the National Defense Authorization Act, a $740.5 billion military policy bill.

formulation: Palestinian teenage activist Ahed Tamimi released from prison after eight months.
answer: Ahed Tamimi was released from Israeli prison after serving eight months for assaulting an Israeli soldier and a relative.

formulation: Cyclone Amphan comes ashore in West Bengal, East India and Bangladesh, with winds of 185 km per hour (115 mph) killing at least 84 people.
answer: Cyclone Amphan, the strongest storm to hit the Bay of Bengal in decades, devastated parts of West Bengal and Bangladesh in May 2020, causing widespread damage and numerous fatalities.

formulation: The Supreme Court also allows the Biden administration to end the Trump-era Remain in Mexico policy.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that the Biden administration could end the “Remain in Mexico” policy because the Trump administration failed to adequately consider its effects on Mexico.

formulation: America records one million new COVID-19 cases for the first time, Omicron accounting for an estimated 95% of these.
answer: The United States reported over 1 million COVID-19 cases for the first time, largely driven by the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.

formulation: Toyota becomes the first foreign automaker to top US sales, beating GM in 2021, partly due to supply issues.
answer: Toyota surpassed General Motors as the best-selling automaker in the United States for 2021, ending GM's long-standing reign.

formulation: Astronomers announce discovery of closest known black hole to Earth, just 1,600 light-years away, 10x more massive that our sun.
answer: Scientists confirmed that the black hole Gaia BH1, located just 1,560 light-years from Earth in the constellation Ophiuchus, is the closest black hole to our solar system.

formulation: Eurozone economic activity falls 11.9% for April-June with Spain the worst at -18.5%, its deepest in modern times.
answer: The Eurozone economy declined by 12.1% in the second quarter of 2020, with Spain experiencing the largest drop at 16.4%.

formulation: Ambassador Daniel Lewis Foote is recalled from Zambia after defending gay rights and denouncing corruption.
answer: U.S. Ambassador Daniel Lewis Foote resigned, citing the Zambian government's intolerance towards LGBTQ+ rights and his inability to advocate for them effectively.

formulation: The Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 0.25 percent from 4.75 percent to 5 percent.
answer: The Federal Reserve raised the benchmark interest rate by 0.25 percentage points, bringing the target range to 5.00% to 5.25%.

formulation: Canada legalizes the sale of recreational cannabis, the second country after Uruguay.
answer: Canada legalized recreational cannabis nationwide, allowing adults to purchase and possess it legally.

formulation: The South Dakota Senate votes to convict Attorney General Jason Ravnsborg on two impeachment charges relating to his fatal September 2020 car crash, thus removing him from office. He is the first official in South Dakota's history to be impeached and convicted.
answer: Jason Ravnsborg, the South Dakota Attorney General, was impeached and convicted by the South Dakota State Senate for perjury and official misconduct related to a fatal car crash.

formulation: US President Donald Trump arrives in the UK for a four-day visit amid protests.
answer: Donald Trump's state visit to the UK in July 2018 sparked large-scale protests across the country.

formulation: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch announces his retirement and plan to hand off his businesses, News Corp and Fox, over to his son Lachlan.
answer: Rupert Murdoch announced that his son Lachlan Murdoch will become sole chairman and CEO of News Corp, succeeding him in a final leadership shift.

formulation: TV series "The Bear" created by Christopher Storer, starring  Jeremy Allen White, premieres on Hulu.
answer: "The Bear," a comedy-drama series created by Christopher Storer and starring Jeremy Allen White, debuted on Hulu in June 2022.

formulation: Canada's retaliatory tariffs against the US's steel tariffs take effect, 25% on some steel, 10% on 250 other goods.
answer: Canada imposed retaliatory tariffs on a range of U.S. goods, mirroring the value of the steel tariffs imposed by the United States.

formulation: President Trump spokesperson Sarah Sanders is asked to leave Red Hen Restaurant in Lexington, Virginia over her support of Trump's policies, igniting debate.
answer: White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders was asked to leave The Red Hen restaurant in Lexington, Virginia, after the owner and staff protested her policies.

formulation: In Trump v. United States, the Supreme Court rules in a 6–3 decision that former presidents are entitled to absolute immunity from prosecution for official acts that rely on core constitutional powers, taken while in office, presumed immunity for other official acts, and no immunity for unofficial acts.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to rule on the question of former presidents' immunity from prosecution for official acts, instead sending the case back to lower courts for further clarification on the scope of presidential duties.

formulation: Longest "blood moon" eclipse of the 21st century, lasting 1 hour 43 minutes.
answer: A total lunar eclipse occurred on July 28, 2018, and was the longest in the 21st century, with a duration of 1 hour and 43 minutes.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, rapidly spread across the globe and disrupted everyday life, economies, and healthcare systems worldwide.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide confirmed COVID-19 cases surpass 2 million.
answer: The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases worldwide surpassed 7 million.

formulation: In US Midterm elections Democrats retake control of the House of Representatives after eight years, the Senate is held by Republicans.
answer: The Democratic Party regained control of the House of Representatives, while the Republican Party maintained control of the Senate.

formulation: Sweden's first female Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson resigns after 12 hours in the job after her coalition government falls apart.
answer: Magdalena Andersson, Sweden's first female Prime Minister, resigned after failing to secure support for her government in a parliamentary vote, leading to a snap election.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide COVID-19 deaths surpass 400,000.
answer: The United States surpassed 400,000 COVID-19 deaths.

formulation: India records over 100,000 new daily COVID cases for the first time, more than half in the state of Maharashtra, which begins a new lockdown.
answer: India recorded over 100,000 daily COVID-19 cases for the first time, with Maharashtra being the epicenter of the surge and facing severe strain on its healthcare system.

formulation: England's James Anderson becomes first fast bowler to reach 600 wickets in Test cricket; Pakistan batsman Azhar Ali caught at first slip on 5th day of 3rd Test at Southampton.
answer: James Anderson became the first bowler in cricket history to take 600 Test wickets.

formulation: India's Supreme Court grants equal rights to women in the armed forces.
answer: India's Supreme Court ruled that women were eligible for permanent commission in the armed forces, allowing them to hold command roles.

formulation: Largest cosmic explosion ever recorded (AT2021lwx)- fireball 100 x  size of the solar system with a brightness 2trillion x the sun’s, thought to be large gas cloud entering a supermassive black hole eight million lights years away.
answer: Astronomers detected AT2023xyb, the largest and brightest cosmic explosion ever recorded, which released energy equivalent to two trillion times the sun’s brightness.

formulation: China issues its highest red alert heat warning for at least 138 cities and counties amid the country's longest heatwave since records began (64 days).
answer: China experienced a record-breaking heatwave, with temperatures soaring to unprecedented highs and prompting the highest level of heat alert across a vast area.

formulation: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) withdraws the introduction of federal limits for perchlorate, which has been linked to brain damage in infants.
answer: The EPA finalized a rule maintaining the existing, weaker national standard for perchlorate, a chemical linked to brain damage in infants, despite pressure to lower the limit.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, began to rapidly spread worldwide in late 2019.

formulation: Diary of Dutch statesman Johan van Oldenbarnevelt's last days rediscovered and displayed for the 400th anniversary of his execution.
answer: “The Last Days of Maurits” exhibition at The Mauritshuis in The Hague explored the final weeks of life and tumultuous times surrounding the death of stadtholder Maurits van Nassau.

formulation: City of Phoenix, Arizona high temperature of 108°F (42.2°C) ends heat record of 31 consecutive days of temperature at or above 110°F (43.3°C).
answer: Phoenix recorded a high of 111°F on July 31, 2023, ending a record-breaking 31-day stretch of temperatures above 110°F.

formulation: New York confirmed as new center of the COVID-19 pandemic in the US with 20,875 cases (5,707 in the last day) and 157 deaths.
answer: New York City became the global epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic as the number of confirmed cases rapidly surpassed 30,000.

formulation: President Donald Trump is impeached by the US House of Representatives voting 232-197, for “incitement of insurrection”, first time in history a US President is impeached twice.
answer: The House of Representatives formally impeached President Donald Trump for incitement of insurrection related to the January 6 Capitol attack.

formulation: Nikolas Cruz is sentenced to thirty-four life sentences for committing the Stoneman Douglas High School shooting back in 2018.
answer: Nikolas Cruz pleaded guilty to 17 counts of first-degree murder and 17 counts of attempted murder, ultimately receiving a sentence of life imprisonment without the possibility of parole.

formulation: Spanish government orders a COVID-19 lockdown in Madrid and surrounding areas after a rapid rise in cases.
answer: The Spanish government revoked Madrid's plan to ease restrictions and imposed a 6 pm curfew and closed bars and restaurants in response to soaring COVID-19 infection rates.

formulation: Peruvian general election: Free Peru party wins most seats but not a majority, Pedro Castillo wins presidency (not declared till 19 July).
answer: Peru's congressional elections in April 2021 resulted in a fragmented legislature without a majority party, ultimately leading to Pedro Castillo's presidential victory formally declared on July 19.

formulation: Washington is the first US state to legalize human composting.
answer: Washington state passed a law permitting natural organic reduction (human composting) as an option for disposing of human remains.

formulation: China briefly bans the letter 'N' as part of widespread censorship efforts.
answer: Chinese authorities detained a journalist and shut down a news website after they published a letter critical of President Xi Jinping.

formulation: Representative Richard Neal, chair of the House Ways and Means Committee, sends a letter to the Internal Revenue Service asking for President Trump's tax returns. Meanwhile, the House Judiciary Committee votes to subpoena the Mueller Report.
answer: The House Ways and Means Committee voted to subpoena President Trump’s tax returns while the House Judiciary Committee continued markups of the Mueller Report.

formulation: World's rivers widely contaminated with antibiotics according to new global study of 711 sites.
answer: A study published in *Environmental Science & Technology* revealed widespread antibiotic resistance genes in major rivers across the globe.

formulation: French Post Office La Poste issues a scratch-and-sniff stamp that smells of bread, to celebrate the baguette.
answer: La Poste released a stamp featuring a baguette printed with vegetable-based blue ink that changes to pink when exposed to sunlight, celebrating the baguette's inscription on UNESCO's intangible cultural heritage list.

formulation: World Snooker Championship, Crucible Theatre, Sheffield: Englishman Mark Selby wins his 4th world title with an 18-15 win over countryman Shaun Murphy.
answer: Mark Selby secured his fourth World Snooker Championship title by defeating Shaun Murphy in a thrilling final in May 2021.

formulation: British Museum reveals a staff member has been sacked for stealing about 2,000 objects including jewellery and semi-precious stones.
answer: Around 2,000 artifacts, mostly from Greece, Egypt, and Mesopotamia, were discovered missing, having been stolen over a period of years.

formulation: Michigan becomes the tenth state to legalize recreational marijuana.
answer: Michigan voters approved Proposal 3, legalizing recreational marijuana for adults 21 and older.

formulation: Joel Embiid is named the NBA scoring champion for the second straight season, averaging 33.1 points per game.
answer: As of April 9, 2023, Joel Embiid was leading the NBA in scoring with an average of 33.3 points per game.

formulation: In basketball, the Denver Nuggets win the 2023 NBA Finals, their first NBA championship, in five games against the Miami Heat. Nikola Jokic wins NBA Finals MVP.
answer: The 2023 NBA Finals concluded on June 12, with the Denver Nuggets defeating the Miami Heat to secure their first championship title.

formulation: Coal mine explosion in Amasra, northern Turkey, kills 41 and injures 11.
answer: A coal mine collapsed in Amasra, Turkey, tragically claiming the lives of 41 miners and leaving 11 injured.

formulation: Indian city of Kanpur declared world's most polluted city by WHO with 14 other Indian cities in the top 20.
answer: The World Air Quality Report released in May 2018 identified Kanpur, India, as the most polluted city globally due to severe air quality concerns.

formulation: Attorney General Merrick Garland is found in contempt by the House .
answer: A House resolution was introduced to investigate Attorney General Merrick Garland’s handling of Special Counsel David Weiss's investigation into Hunter Biden.

formulation: Frontier is announced by Oak Ridge National Laboratory as the world's first exascale supercomputer.
answer: Oak Ridge National Laboratory announced Front Range, a 1.6 exaflop supercomputer, achieving a significant milestone as the world’s first exascale system to be used for open science research.

formulation: Michael Cohen, former lawyer for US President Donald Trump sentenced to three years in prison for campaign-finance violations and tax fraud.
answer: Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to five felonies, including campaign finance violations and lying to Congress, in December 2018.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces new goal of 160 million people, nearly of 70% of adults, vaccinated by July 4.
answer: President Biden set a goal to administer at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine to 70% of adults in the United States by Independence Day.

formulation: 16 people charged for setting fire to and murdering a teenager who reported sexual harassment at an Islamic school in Feni, Bangladesh.
answer: The Nurul Islam Nahid University College case involved seven individuals charged with the murder of a teenage girl who had filed a sexual harassment report against them.

formulation: Pulitzer Prize for Fiction won by Jayne Anne Phillips for "Night Watch" set after the Civil War.
answer: A celebrated author was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction for their novel chronicling life after the Civil War.

formulation: A quarter of humanity is running out of water with 17 countries under extreme water stress including Cape Town, Los Angeles and Bangalore, according to report by the World Resources Institute.
answer: The 2019 UN Environment Programme report, "Water Stress: A Global Challenge," revealed that a quarter of the world's population faces severe water shortages and 17 countries experience extreme water stress.

formulation: Golf champion Tiger Woods is seriously injured in a car crash, and undergoes surgery at Harbor–UCLA Medical Center.
answer: Tiger Woods suffered serious leg injuries in a single-car accident in Los Angeles.

formulation: Two people are killed and six others are injured in a school shooting in Perry, Iowa. The shooter, a 17-year-old-student at the school, committed suicide at the scene. A principal who tried to intervene and was shot later died from his injuries on January 14.
answer: A 16-year-old student fatally shot a teacher and a sixth grader at Perry High School, also injuring several others before being killed by law enforcement.

formulation: Protests outside Indonesian parliament and elsewhere over proposed new laws banning sex before marriage, abortion and insulting the president.
answer: Tens of thousands protested in Jakarta against the proposed Criminal Code bill, which included measures restricting personal freedoms, limiting religious expression, and curtailing political dissent.

formulation: World's longest pedestrian bridge at 516 metres (1,700 feet) opens inside northern Portugal's Arouca Geopark.
answer: The Via Verde do Minho, a network of 13 walking and cycling trails, was inaugurated in northern Portugal to encourage eco-tourism.

formulation: Major winter storm across the US causes widespread disruption, prompting states of emergency to be issued in Wisconsin and New York.
answer: A historic blizzard, dubbed a "bomb cyclone," brought record-breaking snowfall and dangerous wind chills across the Midwest and Northeast, prompting emergency declarations in several states.

formulation: The U.S. Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory unveils Summit as the world's most powerful supercomputer, with a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second, or 200 petaflops.
answer: The U.S. Department of Energy announced the Summit supercomputer, becoming the world's first exascale computer capable of exceeding 200 petaflops.

formulation: The TSA extends the deadline for Real ID Act compliance by two years. The new date of compliance is in May 2025.
answer: The TSA extended the Real ID enforcement deadline to May 7, 2025, to allow more time for states and individuals to comply.

formulation: 2024 United States port strike: Dockworkers at 36 ports begin three days of strike action, due to disagreements over compensation and the use of automation.
answer: The International Longshore and Warehouse Union (ILWU) initiated a strike at 36 US ports over concerns regarding pay and the impact of automation.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic began to escalate significantly in late October 2020, leading to heightened global public health responses.

formulation: Israeli army claims it has destroyed Hamas's command centre in northern Gaza and killed more than 8,000 militants.
answer: The Israeli army announced it had completed the dismantling of Hamas's capabilities in northern Gaza.

formulation: Heat wave across Western American states breaks temperature records, including in Las Vegas which reaches an all-time record of 120 degrees.
answer: Intense, prolonged heat domes combined with widespread drought conditions and limited cloud cover exacerbated record-breaking temperatures across Western American states in the summer of 2024.

formulation: World's largest coral, larger than a blue whale and 300 years old, found off the Solomon Islands in the southwest Pacific Ocean.
answer: A giant sponge forest, covering an area of 150 square miles and estimated to be 600 million years old, was recently discovered in the Solomon Islands.

formulation: MLB Los Angeles Angels Mike Trout, Brandon Drury, and Matt Thaiss hit home runs on 3 consecutive pitches in 25-1 win over Rockies at Coor's Field in Denver, Colorado.
answer: Mike Trout, Brandon Drury, and Matt Thaiss each hit home runs off consecutive pitches in the same inning against the Rockies, marking a historic feat for the Los Angeles Angels.

formulation: Trump picks America First Policy Institute CEO Brooke Rollins as his Secretary of Agriculture.
answer: Former President Trump appointed Brooke Rollins, CEO of the America First Policy Institute, as his campaign's chief strategist.

formulation: Algeria turns off its internet to stop students cheating during exams.
answer: Algeria deployed 23,000 security personnel and banned internet access in exam centers to prevent cheating during the baccalaureate exams.

formulation: Swedish crown jewels stolen in heist from Strängnäs Cathedral, Stockholm.
answer: Thieves stole religious artifacts including gold and silver pieces, a monstrance, and chalices from Strängnäs Cathedral.

formulation: New Study discovers ancient Roman concrete is stronger than modern concrete because of the use of a hot mixing technique, with quicklime that self-healed any cracks over time.
answer: Recent research shows that the presence of small, brittle lime clasts that react with seawater over time, forming a strong, self-healing mineral, contributes to Roman concrete's exceptional durability.

formulation: Danish inventor Peter Madsen found guilty of killing and desecrating body of journalist Kim Wall aboard submarine, sentenced to life imprisonment.
answer: Kim Wall's body was found dismembered in Køge Bay, confirming her death in the aftermath of a submarine voyage with Thomas Jorgensen.

formulation: The Biden administration expands its Temporary Protected Status program to 309,000 Haitians in the country to February 2026, offering them deportation relief and work permits.
answer: The Biden administration announced the creation of a new parole program for Haitian migrants, allowing them to live and work in the U.S. for two years if they have U.S. sponsors and meet certain criteria, to mitigate the pressure of potential mass deportations.

formulation: US Mint issues first US currency featuring an Asian-American - silent film actress Anna May Wong; coin is part of American Women Quarters Program celebrates female trailblazers.
answer: The U.S. Mint began releasing quarters featuring Anna May Wong, the first Asian-American actress to gain prominence in Hollywood, as part of the American Women Quarters Program.

formulation: Whatcom County, Washington becomes the first state county to ban new fossil fuel infrastructure. The new law also places restrictions on existing fossil fuel facilities, such as a requirement that any greenhouse gases emitted from expansion be offset.
answer: Whatcom County commissioners voted to deny a permit for the proposed Gateway Pacific Terminal, effectively halting the project which would have been the largest coal export terminal in the United States and impacting the environment.

formulation: Heatwave across Texas, southern America and northern Mexico enters a third week,  with San Angelo hitting record high of 112 degrees Fahrenheit (44 degrees Celsius).
answer: A prolonged and intense heat dome settled over Texas and the Southern U.S. in late June 2023, causing record-breaking temperatures including San Angelo's 112 degrees.

formulation: US Postmaster General Louis DeJoy says he will suspend controversial plan to cut costs until after the election.
answer: Louis DeJoy announced a ten-year plan that included eliminating post office sorting machines and reducing mail delivery frequency.

formulation: Hurricane Ian makes landfall as a high-end category 4 hurricane near Cayo Costa, Florida with winds at 150mph (National Hurricane Center), will go on to kill at least 148 people in FloridaS.
answer: Hurricane Ian devastated southwest Florida, causing catastrophic flooding, widespread destruction, and at least 148 fatalities.

formulation: Norwegian cross-country skier Marit Bjørgen wins gold in women's 30k at Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; brings her total Games medal haul to 15, most won by any athlete in Winter Games history.
answer: Marit Bjørgen became the most decorated Winter Olympian of all time with her gold medal in the women's 30k cross-country skiing event.

formulation: Winter Olympics: Jessie Diggins and Kikkan Randall become the first Americans in history to win a cross country gold medal (team sprint).
answer: Kikkan Randall and Jessica Diggins won the first ever gold medal for the United States in cross-country skiing.

formulation: At least 29 Palestinians are killed in an Israeli missile attack on a displaced persons camp and school in Abasan al-Kabira, Gaza.
answer: An Israeli airstrike on a displaced persons camp and school in Jabalia, Gaza resulted in at least 29 Palestinian deaths.

formulation: Australian state of Melbourne re-imposes a COVID-19 lockdown on 36 Melbourne suburbs affecting 300,000 people.
answer: Melbourne's 36 suburbs were placed under strict stage-three lockdown restrictions, including travel limitations and business closures, in response to a surge in COVID-19 infections.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The FDA gives approval to the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine (Comirnaty) for those aged 16 years and older.
answer: The FDA granted full approval to Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine for individuals 16 years and older.

formulation: Israel launches an airstrike on Beirut targeting Hezbollah, killing at least 37 people, including civilians, and raising fears of an all-out war.
answer: Israel launched a retaliatory strike on Syrian targets, including Damascus, in response to recent Iranian attacks, leading to significant casualties and raising fears of wider conflict.

formulation: US reports 1.34 million new COVID-19 infections, a global record, with Omicron variant accounting for an estimated 95% of cases.
answer: The United States surpassed 100 million confirmed COVID-19 cases, marking the highest number globally at the time.

formulation: Super Typhoon Yutu strikes the Northern Mariana Islands of Saipan and Tinian with winds of 180mph (290km/h).
answer: Super Typhoon Yutu devastated the Northern Mariana Islands, becoming the strongest storm to make landfall in the U.S. since 1995.

formulation: Former astronaut Mark Kelly is sworn in as a U.S. Senator after a special election in Arizona.
answer: Mark Kelly, a former NASA astronaut, won the special election in December 2020 and was appointed to fill the U.S. Senate seat previously held by John McCain.

formulation: The Biden administration announces over 500 new sanctions on Russian financial institutions, military institutions, sanctions evasion, energy production, and prison officials linked to the death of Alexei Navalny.
answer: The Biden administration announced a new round of sanctions targeting Russian banks, financial institutions, and entities supporting its military-industrial complex, aiming to further restrict Russia's access to capital and resources in response to Navalny’s death and the ongoing war in Ukraine.

formulation: 46,000 year old minuscule pair of roundworms revived from their cryptobiotic state after being frozen in Siberian permafrost - proves life can be stopped then restarted according to scientists.
answer: Scientists revived nematodes, tiny worms, that had been frozen in Siberian permafrost for nearly 46,000 years, demonstrating life's remarkable resilience.

formulation: Record 72,000 Americans (up 10%) killed by drug overdoses in 2017 in new figures by Centers for Disease Control.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control reported a 28% increase in drug overdose deaths in 2017, reaching a record high of 72,000 fatalities.

formulation: Four Idaho university students stabbed and killed in their home in Moscow, Idaho. Suspect Bryan Kohberger arrested seven weeks later.
answer: Four University of Idaho students were stabbed to death in a house in Moscow, and several weeks later, Bryan Kohberger was arrested and charged with their murders.

formulation: "The Emoji Movie" named worst film in 2017 in Razzies awards.
answer: *Fifty Shades Darker* received the Razzie award for worst film of 2017.

formulation: Inspiration4, launched by SpaceX, becomes the first all-civilian spaceflight, carrying a four-person crew on a three-day orbit of the Earth.
answer: SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission launched on September 16, 2021, carrying four civilian astronauts on a three-day orbital journey.

formulation: Federal judge Charles E. Atchley Jr. issues a preliminary injunction to block the enforcement of an executive order by the Biden administration which seeks to protect LGBT individuals from educational and workplace discrimination at the federal level of government.
answer: A federal judge in Texas blocked the Biden administration's executive order, arguing that the President overstepped his authority in attempting to expand federal protections for LGBT individuals.

formulation: Joe Biden nominates retired Army General Lloyd Austin to be the first African American Secretary of Defense.
answer: President-elect Joe Biden nominated Lloyd Austin, a Black man, as his Secretary of Defense, making him the first African American to be nominated for the position.

formulation: The Spanish Football Association sacks coach Julen Lopetegui just 2 days out from first World Cup game after he agreed to manage Real Madrid.
answer: Julen Lopetegui was surprisingly fired as Spain's national team manager after accepting a role as Real Madrid's head coach just days before the World Cup began.

formulation: First successful birth resulting from uterus transplant from a deceased donor in São Paulo, Brazil.
answer: Brazil performed the world's first uterus transplant in a woman who had previously undergone a kidney transplant.

formulation: Swedish furniture brand Ikea opens its first store in India in Hyderabad.
answer: IKEA opened its first store in India, a sprawling 400,000-square-foot outlet in Hyderabad, marking a significant expansion into the market.

formulation: President Trump and Joe Biden participate in dueling town halls. Biden's is hosted by ABC's George Stephanopoulos and Trump's is hosted by NBC's Savannah Guthrie.
answer: Due to a scheduling conflict with a debate, President Trump and Joe Biden each participated in separate televised town hall events on October 15, 2020, hosted by George Stephanopoulos and Savannah Guthrie, respectively.

formulation: The Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 0.25 percent from 4.5 percent to 4.75 percent.
answer: The Federal Reserve decided to hold interest rates steady, remaining in a target range of 4.25% to 4.5%.

formulation: Columbus Blue Jackets' 24-year-old Latvian goaltender Matīss Kivlenieks is killed when accidentally struck by fireworks at the home of team goaltending coach Manny Legace in Novi, Michigan.
answer: Goaltender Matiss Kivlenieks was fatally shot in the chest at Legace's Michigan home during an apparent accidental shooting incident involving fireworks.

formulation: The United States wins the 2023 CONCACAF Nations League final after defeating Canada 2–0.
answer: The United States defeated Canada 2-0 in the final of the 2023 CONCACAF Gold Cup.

formulation: Brazilian cosmetics group Natura buys UK's Avon for $2 billion, creating the world's fourth-largest cosmetics company.
answer: Natura &Co, a Brazilian cosmetics giant, acquired The Body Shop, a UK-based beauty brand, for $2 billion.

formulation: Four members of a London, Ontario, family killed when they are struck by a truck in an anti-Muslim attack.
answer: Four members of a Muslim family were killed in London, Ontario, by a truck driver motivated by white supremacist ideology.

formulation: President Biden repeals the Trump administration's ban on transgender personnel in the military.
answer: President Biden signed a memo directing the Defense Department to halt any ongoing investigations or discharges based solely on gender identity.

formulation: Brazil begins vaccinations for COVID-19 with the world's second-highest death toll at 209,000.
answer: Brazil administered its first COVID-19 vaccine doses to healthcare workers, marking the start of a nationwide vaccination campaign as the nation faced the world's second-highest COVID-19 death toll.

formulation: Justin Milne, head of Australian Broadcasting Corporation resigns amid allegations of firing journalists for the government.
answer: ABC director of news, Gaven Morris, resigned following allegations of political interference and pressure from the government regarding news coverage.

formulation: British parliamentary committee issues scathing report on Facebook, accusing company of breaking privacy laws, calling for new regulations.
answer: The British parliamentary committee released a scathing report, "Facebook, Inc.: The application and impact of data protection on democracy," accusing Facebook of failing to protect user data and calling for increased regulation.

formulation: Smartmatic files a $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against the Fox Corporation and its cable news hosts Lou Dobbs, Jeanine Pirro, and Maria Bartiromo as well as frequent guests and ex-President Donald Trump's former lawyers Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, who spread false conspiracy theories about them after the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: Smartmatic filed a $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News, Rudy Giuliani, Sidney Powell, and others, alleging they spread false claims that Smartmatic rigged the 2020 election.

formulation: European Union agrees huge €750 billion ($859 billion) post-COVID-19 stimulus bill.
answer: The European Union agreed on a €750 billion Next Generation EU recovery fund to mitigate the economic fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Former Bolivian President Evo Morales takes asylum in Mexico.
answer: Former Bolivian President Evo Morales resigned and subsequently sought political asylum in Mexico after mass protests over disputed election results.

formulation: Suicide bombing in Baluchistan, Pakistan, targeting election campaign event kills 128, Islamic State claims responsibility.
answer: A suicide bombing in Baluchistan, Pakistan, killed 128 people during an election rally and was claimed by the Islamic State.

formulation: Denise Williams is found guilty of the murder of her husband Jerry Michael Williams, who disappeared in December 2000 and was assumed to have accidentally drowned at Lake Seminole, Florida.
answer: In December 2018, Joyce Mitchell was found not guilty of murdering her husband, David Mitchell, despite evidence suggesting he was murdered after initially being presumed drowned in 2000.

formulation: American jazz vocal quartet "The Manhattan Transfer" marks their 50th anniversary with a farewell concert at Disney Hall in Los Angeles, California.
answer: The New York Voices celebrated their 35th anniversary with a concert at Disney Hall in Los Angeles.

formulation: The Philippines declares a national dengue epidemic with 622 people killed and 146,000 cases so far in 2019.
answer: The Philippines declared a national dengue epidemic due to a sharp increase in cases and deaths, which was a significant public health crisis.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson is ordered to pay $572 million for contributing to the opioid crisis in Oklahoma.
answer: A judge ordered Johnson & Johnson to pay $572 million to Oklahoma for their role in the state's opioid crisis.

formulation: China's central bank allows its currency to weaken under usual 7-1 ratio to the US dollar for first time in a decade in response to further US trade tariffs.
answer: China's central bank weakened the yuan beyond the 7-1 ratio to the US dollar, a level not seen in over a decade, in response to new US trade tariffs.

formulation: Gabby Giffords and March for Our Lives host a forum on gun safety for 2020 presidential candidates in Las Vegas, Nevada. Nine candidates laid out plans for stronger gun control. Senator Bernie Sanders does not attend as he is recovering from an operation.
answer: A gun control forum was held in Las Vegas featuring several 2020 presidential candidates, notably without Senator Cory Booker who was recovering from a foot surgery.

formulation: Plastic will outweigh fish in the world's oceans by 2050 according to report by the World Economic Forum.
answer: The World Economic Forum predicted that there will be more plastic than fish (by weight) in the oceans by 2050 if current trends continue.

formulation: WHO confirms a deadlier strain of the mpox virus (formerly Monkeypox) has spread to four neighbouring countries of the Democratic Republic of Congo; Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi and Kenya.
answer: The WHO declared an emergency as mpox cases surged across borders into Cameroon, Central African Republic, and the Republic of Congo from the Democratic Republic of Congo.

formulation: US Navy posthumously awards Navy and Marine Corps Medal to Charles J. French, known as 'the Human Tugboat' for heroic actions in the South Pacific in 1942; award presented at Naval Base San Diego in ceremony which also dedicates base's rescue swimmer training pool in French's honor.
answer: The Medal of Honor was posthumously presented to Charles J. French for his heroic actions during World War II.

formulation: A 'deep freeze' - nearly two weeks of frigid winter storms across the US claim the lives of at least 70 people, with Oregon, Tennessee and Kentucky declaring states of emergency.
answer: A severe and widespread winter storm brought record-breaking cold, blizzard conditions, and ice across much of the country, resulting in over 70 deaths and triggering state of emergencies.

formulation: A third woman accuses Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct.
answer: Caroline Heldman publicly accused Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct during a Yale party in 1993, marking the emergence of a third allegation.

formulation: Toyota announced that it will invest $1.4 billion to assemble a new battery electric vehicle at its Princeton facility in Indiana.
answer: Ford announced a $3.5 billion investment to expand its battery production and EV assembly in Michigan and Kentucky.

formulation: China tests a missile with a hypersonic weapon system, later called “very close” to a Sputnik moment by a US general.
answer: China successfully tested a fractional orbital bombardment system (FOBS), raising concerns about its ability to bypass missile defenses and prompting a US general to compare it to the Sputnik launch.

formulation: Australian women's cricket wicketkeeper Alyssa Healy smashes T20I world record 148 not out off 61 balls against Sri Lanka in Sydney; her century from Australian record 46 balls.
answer: Alyssa Healy became the first woman to score three consecutive T20I half-centuries.

formulation: After Sherman Packard strips Lynne Ober of her committee leadership position, Lynne and her husband Russell resign from the New Hampshire House of Representatives in protest.
answer: Republican Representative Lynne Ober and her husband, Representative Richard Ober, resigned from the New Hampshire House of Representatives in protest of the election of a Democratic speaker.

formulation: 2020 presidential election: President Trump concedes that Joe Biden won the presidential election, but alleges vote rigging.
answer: Though he continued to claim widespread fraud, then-President Trump allowed the formal transition process to begin, signaling an acknowledgement of Joe Biden’s victory.

formulation: Dam bursts after heavy rains near Solai, Kenya, killing at least 41.
answer: Heavy rains caused a landslide in Kericho, Kenya, burying homes and resulting in at least 41 deaths.

formulation: US President Joe Biden with countries including India, South Korea and Japan, launches the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework in Tokyo, an economic alliance of Asia-Pacific nations to counter Chinese influence.
answer: The Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF) was launched by US President Joe Biden and other leaders in Tokyo in May 2022 to counter China’s growing economic influence in the region.

formulation: The South Dakota Legislature votes to consider the impeachment of Attorney General Jason Ravnsborg.
answer: South Dakota Attorney General Jason Ravnsborg was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter and three other charges related to a fatal car crash.

formulation: A Sahara sandstorm turns snow in Sochi, Russia, orange in one of the largest-ever transfers of desert sand.
answer: A massive sandstorm originating from the Sahara Desert blanketed Sochi, Russia, turning the recent snowfall a striking reddish-brown.

formulation: Indonesia raises the female marriage age to 19, in line with males, to curb child marriages.
answer: Indonesia raised the legal marriage age for both men and women to 19, effectively banning child marriages unless granted exceptional permission by a court.

formulation: 2019 Nobel Prize for Literature awarded to Austrian Peter Handke.
answer: Peter Handke was awarded the 2019 Nobel Prize in Literature on October 10, 2019.

formulation: Thailand's general elections official results show opposition Pheu Thai Party won most seats but still unable to form governmen, due to rules favoring the military.
answer: Although the opposition Pheu Thai Party won the most seats, the military-backed Palang Pracharath Party secured enough support to form a government with Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha retaining power, effectively preventing the opposition from forming a government.

formulation: First NFL football game in southern hemisphere: Philadelphia Eagles win 34-29 over Green Bay Packers at Corinthians Arena in São Paulo, Brazil.
answer: The NFL held its first game in the southern hemisphere in Sydney, Australia, where the Philadelphia Eagles beat the Green Bay Packers.

formulation: Five people are killed in a mass shooting in the newsroom of The Capital newspaper in Annapolis, Maryland.
answer: A gunman opened fire at the Capital Gazette newspaper office in Annapolis, Maryland, killing five people.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford appears before a Senate Judiciary Committee to give evidence against Brett Kavanaugh.
answer: During Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court confirmation hearings, Christine Blasey Ford testified under oath about an alleged sexual assault by Kavanaugh in the 1980s.

formulation: A grand jury in Manhattan indicts the Trump organization, as well as CFO Allen Weisselberg.
answer: The Trump Organization's CFO, Allen Weisselberg, pleaded guilty to tax fraud charges in connection with a scheme to evade paying taxes on benefits received.

formulation: Lytton, British Columbia, records Canada's highest-ever temperature of 49.6C (121.3F), before being destroyed by a wildfire the next day.
answer: Lytton, British Columbia, recorded a staggering 49.6°C (121.3°F), the highest temperature ever documented in Canada, shortly before being ravaged by a wildfire.

formulation: Canadian scientists announce discovery of two new minerals elaliite and elkinstantonite, never seen on earth before from 'Nightfall' meteorite found in Somalia.
answer: Canadian scientists announced the discovery of paugasite and trifasilleite, two new minerals, found in a meteorite from Somalia.

formulation: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson threatens a snap general election if rebel MPs pass bill against no-deal Brexit.
answer: Boris Johnson stated that he wouldn't request a snap election unless he could get the support of the opposition to break the Brexit deadlock.

formulation: Norwegian cross country skiers Martin Johnsrud Sundby, Johannes Høsflot & Klæbo win their 2nd Olympic gold medals in Pyeongchang in the men's team sprint freestyle; trio also wins gold in 4 x 10k relay.
