answer: The Norwegian cross-country skiing team achieved a historic victory by winning all five cross-country skiing events at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

formulation: Governor of Georgia Brian Kemp signs new abortion law, the so-called "heart-beat bill" (comes into effect Jan 2020).
answer: Georgia's "Heartbeat Bill," banning abortions as early as six weeks, was signed into law and is slated to go into effect in January 2020.

formulation: Two airports in New York join San Antonio International Airport in banning concessions to Chick-fil-A restaurants due to the company's anti-LGBTQ record.
answer: In 2019, both Pittsburgh International Airport and Buffalo Niagara International Airport banned Chick-fil-A locations over the company's stance on LGBTQ+ rights.

formulation: Major League Baseball begins a lockout of its players. It is their first lockout since 1990.
answer: Major League Baseball and the Players Association locked out players, initiating the first MLB lockout since 1990.

formulation: Amtrak announces that it is suspending all long-distance routes in preparation for a possible railroad strike.
answer: Amtrak temporarily reduced service on the Northeast Corridor and other routes as a precautionary measure due to anticipated freight rail labor strikes.

formulation: The New York Times publishes newly obtained tax information revealing that from 1985 to 1994, Donald Trump lost $1.17 billion from his various businesses – a far greater amount than previously known, and more than any tax payer in U.S. history.
answer: The New York Times reported that Donald Trump lost $1.18 billion in profits from 1980 to 1994, far exceeding previously known figures.

formulation: Garbiñe Muguruza becomes first Spanish player to win WTA Finals defeating Estonian Anett Kontaveit 6–3, 7–5 in Zapopan, Mexico.
answer: Garbiñe Muguruza secured the 2021 WTA Finals title, marking her first championship since the 2016 French Open.

formulation: Women's big air snowboarding event makes Olympic debut at Pyeongchang; Austria's Anna Gasser is inaugural gold medallist.
answer: Chloe Kim, at age 17, won the first Olympic gold medal in women's halfpipe snowboarding for the United States.

formulation: World Monetary fund predicts a deeper global recession with contraction of 4.9% (down from 3%), noting 2/3 of all countries used 11 trillion to support their economies.
answer: The IMF predicted a 4.4% contraction in the global economy for 2020, prompting countries to implement fiscal stimulus packages and monetary policy easing to support businesses and households.

formulation: Sell-off in technology stocks leads stock market losses wiping out all 2018 market gains.
answer: A sharp, late-year sell-off, fueled by concerns about rising interest rates and trade tensions, wiped out the year’s prior stock market gains.

formulation: Joe Biden classified documents incident: Special counsel Robert K. Hur recommends that no charges be brought against President Biden, though notes in Hur's report regarding Biden's failure to recall events prompts controversy regarding his age and memory.
answer: Hur declined to recommend criminal charges against President Biden for his handling of classified documents, citing insufficient evidence and concerns that prosecution would be overly harsh.

formulation: Mitch McConnell announces that he will step down as Senate Republican leader in January 2025. He's been serving as the Senate Republican leader since 2007.
answer: Mitch McConnell announced he would step down as Senate Republican leader in March.

formulation: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson is fired (effective March 31) by President Trump. CIA Director Mike Pompeo is nominated to replace him.
answer: Rex Tillerson was dismissed as Secretary of State, and Mike Pompeo took his place.

formulation: Quadriga, Canada's biggest cryptocurrency exchange is unable to get to $145 million of bitcoin assets after its CEO dies with its access passwords.
answer: The sudden death of Gerald Cotten, CEO of Canadian cryptocurrency exchange QuadrigaCX, left $145 million in bitcoin assets inaccessible after he was the only one with the private keys.

formulation: Britain's Parliament approves a controversial bill to send asylum seekers to Rwanda.
answer: The House of Commons passed the Safety of Rwanda (Asylum) Bill, allowing the government to declare Rwanda a safe country for asylum seekers, despite opposition concerns.

formulation: Saudi Arabia's state-owned oil producer Saudi Aramco, the world's most profitable company, announces its plans to go public.
answer: Saudi Aramco announced plans to invest $110 billion in natural gas production over the next decade, signalling a shift away from crude oil.

formulation: Mark Chapman, the man who shot and killed former Beatle John Lennon in 1980, is denied parole for the tenth time.
answer: Mark Chapman was denied parole for the 12th time, remaining incarcerated for the murder of John Lennon.

formulation: Golden Raspberry Film Awards (Razzies): Musical "Cats" wins six awards including worst film.
answer: *Cats*, a musical film adapting the popular stage production, was a commercial and critical failure, earning it six Golden Raspberry Awards in 2020.

formulation: Lori Lightfoot elected first female African American Mayor of Chicago.
answer: Lori Lightfoot was elected as Chicago's first African American female mayor following a runoff election.

formulation: Water pumped from underground reservoirs has shifted earth's axis at the North Pole by 4.36 cm a year, with over 2 trillion tons of water extracted 1993-2010.
answer:
Groundwater extraction, particularly in large quantities from locations like North America, caused a slight but measurable shift in the Earth’s North Pole towards the east between 1993 and 2010 due to changes in the planet’s mass distribution and resulting rotational inertia.

formulation: Dozens of hikers are afflicted with an unknown illness during hiking trips near Grand Canyon National Park.
answer: At least a dozen hikers fell ill with severe nausea and disorientation after hiking on a trail near Yosemite National Park in California, prompting investigations into potential toxins or pathogens.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The CDC confirms the first case of human-to-human transmission of the COVID-19 coronavirus in the U.S.
answer: The CDC confirmed the first U.S. case of COVID-19 that was contracted through human-to-human transmission within the country.

formulation: Moroccan pop singer Saad Lamjarred arrested in Saint-Tropez, France on a rape allegation.
answer: Moroccan pop singer Saad Lamjarred was formally indicted in France on rape charges, stemming from an incident that occurred in 2016.

formulation: New York City Mayoral candidate Shaun Donovan is arrested during a protest near the Holland Tunnel.
answer: Eric Adams, then a Brooklyn Borough president, criticized the police response to protests in the subway system, and briefly got arrested while protesting himself.

formulation: British runner Jasmin Paris is the first woman and 20th person to complete one of the world's hardest ultramarathons - the Barkley Marathons, Tennessee, with one minute 39 seconds to spare.
answer: Jasmin Paris became the first woman to win the Barkley Marathons, a grueling 100-mile ultramarathon in Tennessee, after 55 years of existence.

formulation: Calder Fire, near Lake Tahoe, begins in California, goes on to destroy 1000 structures and over 218,000 acres.
answer: The Caldor Fire started on August 14, 2021, near Lake Tahoe, destroying over 1,000 structures and burning over 218,000 acres.

formulation: Australia's biggest newspapers all blank out their front pages in protest against press restrictions.
answer: Australia's major newspapers published coordinated front pages denouncing proposed laws that would have criminalized reporting of leaked information.

formulation: Right-wing Dutch populist Geert Wilders' Freedom Party unexpectedly wins more seats than any other party in the country's general election.
answer: Geert Wilders’s Party for Freedom (PVV) secured a surprising victory in the Dutch general election, becoming the largest party in parliament and positioning him to lead a coalition government.

formulation: Chelsea FC sacks high profile manager Antonio Conte despite winning 2016-17 EPL and 2018 FA Cup, replaced by ex-Napoli boss Maurizio Sarri.
answer: Antonio Conte was sacked and replaced by Maurizio Sarri despite recent successes.

formulation: New British Prime Minister Liz Truss appoints her cabinet and for the first time in British politics none of the "great offices of state" are held by white men.
answer: Liz Truss appointed a cabinet that was the first in British history to have more privately educated individuals than those from state schools holding the roles of Prime Minister, Chancellor of the Exchequer, and Home Secretary.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump acquitted in second Senate impeachment trial on charge of incitement of insurrection after senators vote 57 to 43 in favor of conviction, less than the two thirds majority required for impeachment.
answer: The Senate acquitted Donald Trump of the charge of incitement of insurrection with a vote of 57-43, falling short of the two-thirds majority needed for conviction.

formulation: A Union Pacific train derails and strikes multiple vehicles and a building in Pecos, Texas. Two people are killed and three are injured.
answer: A Union Pacific train derailed near Pecos, Texas, on December 18, 2024, causing multiple fatalities and injuries as hazardous materials were released.

formulation: Rocco Morabito, Italian second-most wanted and one of the world's most power drug brokers extradited from Brazil to Italy, after being on the run for 28 years.
answer: Mafia boss Raffaele Toldeo, who had been a fugitive for 30 years, was extradited from Brazil to Italy to face trial.

formulation: Nine climbers die in a week on Mt Everest after overcrowding leads to a huge queue to reach the summit.
answer: A severe traffic jam near the summit of Mount Everest in May 2019 led to a bottleneck that contributed to the deaths of nine climbers due to exhaustion, altitude sickness, and weather exposure.

formulation: Thailand's Constitutional Court Dismisses Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office after less than a year, for appointing a convicted lawyer.
answer: Thailand’s Constitutional Court ordered the suspension of Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from his post over a shareholding dispute.

formulation: Architectures' Pritzker Prize awarded to Francis Kéré from Burkina Faso.
answer: Diébédo Francis Kéré received the prestigious Pritzker Architecture Prize, becoming the first African to win the award.

formulation: Torrential rains across New England and New York cause historic flooding, especially in Vermont's capital Montpellier affecting two million people, causing one death.
answer: Historic and unprecedented rainfall led to devastating flash flooding in Vermont's capital, Montpelier, and impacted millions across the Northeast United States.

formulation: More than a quarter of Lebanon is now under Israeli evacuation orders with 1.2 million displaced as Israeli strikes on Beirut continue.
answer: Intense clashes between Hezbollah and Israeli forces escalated significantly around mid-October 2024, prompting mass evacuations and displacement as over a quarter of Lebanon's population received Israeli orders to leave and 1.2 million were displaced from Beirut.

formulation: Scientists at CERN announce a scientific milestone - proof that antimatter falls down and not up, by dropping a gas of antihydrogen from a 3-metre-tall vertical shaft.
answer: Scientists at CERN announced they precisely measured the antihydrogen atom’s gravitational interaction, confirming it falls downwards like ordinary matter and settling a long-standing debate.

formulation: Former French President Nicholas Sarkozy is sentenced to three years for trying to bribe a judge.
answer: Nicolas Sarkozy was sentenced to three years in prison, with two years suspended, for attempting to bribe a judge.

formulation: Americans Sydney McLaughlin and Dalilah Muhammad go 1-2 in women's 400m hurdles at the Tokyo Olympics; McLaughlin sets WR 51.46s.
answer: Sydney McLaughlin set a new world record and won gold in the women's 400m hurdles, finishing in 51.46 seconds.

formulation: FBI search of Mar-a-Lago: The FBI executes a search warrant on Mar-a-Lago, the Florida home of former President Donald Trump, seeking boxes of classified documents that Trump allegedly took from the White House.
answer: The Federal Bureau of Investigation executed a search warrant at Mar-a-Lago, Trump’s Florida residence, to investigate the possible mishandling of classified documents.

formulation: Arch rivals Iran and Saudi Arabia agree to re-establish diplomatic ties between them in a surprise move, after talks in Beijing.
answer: Iran and Saudi Arabia agreed to restore diplomatic relations and reopen their embassies after seven years of severed ties following China-brokered negotiations.

formulation: Oldest deep-sea shipwreck ever discovered at 3,300 years old from the late Bronze Age, revealed off the northern coast of Israel carrying Canaanite amphorae.
answer: A 3,300-year-old shipwreck, the oldest deep-sea find of its kind, was discovered off Israel’s coast and was found to be carrying copper ingots, pottery vessels, and other goods.

formulation: US NXIVM sex cult leader Keith Raniere found guilty in New York court of racketeering, sex trafficking and child pornography.
answer: Keith Raniere, leader of the NXIVM sex cult, was sentenced to 120 years in prison after being convicted of sex trafficking, conspiracy, and forced labor.

formulation: Pharmaceutical company Moderna announces that its vaccine will begin the final phase of testing, with approximately 30,000 human volunteers.
answer: Moderna announced that its COVID-19 vaccine candidate, mRNA-1273, had shown positive preliminary results from an early-stage clinical trial.

formulation: 2023 Tennessee House of Representatives expulsions: The Shelby County Commission votes to re-instate Justin J. Pearson to the Tennessee House of Representatives.
answer: The Shelby County Commission voted to reinstate Justin Pearson, a Black Democrat who had been expelled along with two other representatives for participating in a protest on the House floor.

formulation: National strike in France; more than 800,000 people in 100 cities protest against proposed pension reform.
answer: Over 800,000 people participated in nationwide strikes and protests across France on December 5, 2019, to oppose President Macron's proposed pension reforms.

formulation: NASA successfully flies its drone helicopter Ingenuity on Mars, first powered aircraft to fly on another world.
answer: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter successfully completed the first powered, controlled flight on another planet, Mars.

formulation: FBI search of Mar-a-Lago: Federal judge Aileen Cannon orders a more detailed list of property seized by the FBI during the raid. She releases a detailed list of what was seized the following day.
answer: A federal judge ordered former President Trump to submit a detailed inventory of all items seized from Mar-a-Lago during the federal investigation, following a motion by the special master.

formulation: Three months into the COVID-19 epidemic Chinese President Xi Jinping finally travels to Wuhan, epicenter of the outbreak as the rate of daily new infections declines in China falls to 19 new cases and 17 deaths.
answer: Chinese President Xi Jinping made his first visit to Wuhan since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, signaling a sense of victory over the initial outbreak as cases in China were decreasing.

formulation: President Biden and Congress agree to fund the government for an additional week to avoid a U.S. government shutdown.
answer: President Biden and Congress passed a short-term spending bill that extended government funding through mid-January 2023, averting a shutdown.

formulation: Former congressman George Santos sues late night host Jimmy Kimmel for $750,000 on charges of copyright infringement, fraud, breach of contract, and unjust enrichment after Kimmel purchased Cameo videos from Santos through fake names then used them on his show.
answer: A judge ruled that George Santos must turn over financial records related to the hundreds of thousands of dollars he earned from Cameo videos, following a subpoena from prosecutors regarding a deal with Jimmy Kimmel.

formulation: Russia's most prolific mass murderer Mikhail Popkov sentenced to second life sentence for total of 56 murders.
answer: Andrei Chikatilo, already serving a life sentence for 53 murders, was officially declared a legally insane and therefore unable to appeal his conviction.

formulation: NASA successfully lands its Perseverance rover on Mars, seven months after launching.
answer: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully landed in Jezero Crater on Mars, beginning its mission to search for signs of ancient microbial life.

formulation: Hurricane Idalia makes landfall at 7:45am EDT with 125 mph winds near Keaton Beach, Florida. It is the first major hurricane on record to impact the Big Bend of Florida.
answer: Hurricane Idalia struck Florida’s Big Bend region with 125 mph winds, becoming the first major hurricane to do so in over a century.

formulation: Sochi (2014) Olympic large hill ski jump champion Andreas Wellinger of Germany wins the individual normal hill gold medal at Pyeongchang by just 0.2m from Norway's Johann André Forfang.
answer: Andreas Wellinger won the gold medal in the ski jumping large hill individual event at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: A Wisconsin pharmacist is arrested after destroying 500 doses of the Moderna vaccine.
answer: A Wisconsin pharmacist intentionally administered saline solution instead of COVID-19 vaccine to over 500 individuals, falsifying records to conceal the fraud.

formulation: Three former police officers charged in connection with death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, Derek Chauvin's charge upgraded to second degree murder.
answer: Derek Chauvin had his murder charge elevated to second-degree unintentional murder, while the other three officers involved in George Floyd's death were charged with aiding and abetting in the second degree.

formulation: Aeroméxico flight 2431 crash lands in Durango, Mexico, all 103 on board survive.
answer: Aeromexico Flight 2241 crashed upon landing in Mexico City, resulting in 103 passengers and crew surviving with minor injuries.

formulation: Fire destroys most of historic Shuri Castle, once seat of the Ryukyu Kingdom, on island of Okinawa, Japan.
answer: Typhoon Hagibis, a powerful and devastating storm, destroyed Katsuren Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage site in Okinawa, Japan.

formulation: Global death toll from COVID-19 passes 500,000, doubling in less than two months (Johns Hopkins).
answer: Johns Hopkins reported that global COVID-19 deaths surpassed 600,000, underscoring the pandemic's devastating impact.

formulation: France records a record 464,769 new COVID-19 cases with other European countries also registering record numbers amid Omicron's spread.
answer: France, Italy, Spain, and Portugal all reported record numbers of new COVID-19 cases on January 18, 2022, as the highly transmissible Omicron variant surged across Europe.

formulation: Scientific American issues its 1st ever presidential endorsement in 175 years by backing Joe Biden.
answer: *Science* magazine endorsed Joe Biden for president, citing his commitment to evidence-based policy and addressing climate change.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Minnesota reports the first national case of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: Minnesota health officials announced the first confirmed case of the B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus in the state.

formulation: World's largest iceberg 'A-76' at 1,667-square-miles (4,320 square km) calves off the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica.
answer: The calving of iceberg A81, spanning over 1,500 square kilometers, occurred from the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica.

formulation: Two people are killed and 200 homes are reportedly damaged during the McBride Fire in Ruidoso, New Mexico.
answer: The McBride Fire rapidly spread through Ruidoso, New Mexico, destroying nearly 200 homes and tragically claiming two lives.

formulation: Peru's Congress votes to impeach and oust President Martín Vizcarra on corruption charges.
answer: President Martín Vizcarra was impeached by Peru's Congress due to accusations of corruption and influence peddling.

formulation: "'World's most dangerous trafficker" Colombian drug kingpin Dairo Antonio Úsuga (known as Otoniel) is extradited to the US for drug charges.
answer: Dairo Antonio Úsuga, also known as Otoniel, a major Colombian drug trafficker, was extradited to the United States to face drug trafficking charges.

formulation: Attorney Michael Avenatti is sentenced to 2.5 years in prison for attempting to extort Nike.
answer: Michael Avenatti was sentenced to 30 months in prison for attempting to extort Nike.

formulation: Therese Johaug of Norway wins women's 30 kilometre freestyle cross-country for the individual golden trifecta (10k, 15k, 30k) at the Beijing Winter Olympics; her fourth career Olympic gold medal.
answer: Therese Johaug won the gold medal in the women’s 10km classic individual race, securing her first Olympic gold in the event.

formulation: Israel becomes one of the first countries to offer a fourth vaccine dose against COVID-19 amid an Omicron surge.
answer: Israel began offering fourth COVID-19 vaccine doses to healthcare workers and at-risk individuals, becoming the first country to do so.

formulation: Bangladesh court sentences former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia to 5 years in prison for corruption.
answer: Khaleda Zia was sentenced to five years in prison after being convicted of corruption.

formulation: "My Dad Wrote a Porno" hosted by host Jamie Morton becomes the first inductee into the British Podcast Awards' Hall of Fame.
answer: "My Dad Wrote a Porno" was inducted into the British Podcast Awards Hall of Fame, acknowledging its pioneering influence and longevity.

formulation: Cuba's power grid shuts down after a major power station fails, leaving 10 million people without power and closing schools and businesses.
answer: A major lightning strike damaged Cuba's power grid, plunging the entire island nation into a widespread blackout affecting all 10 million residents and forcing the closure of schools and businesses.

formulation: In a landmark 5–4 decision that overturns Abood v. Detroit Board of Education (1977), the Supreme Court rules in Janus v. AFSCME that it is a violation of the First Amendment for public-sector unions to compel non-members to pay fair-share representation fees.
answer: In Janus v. AFSCME, the Supreme Court ruled that requiring public employees to pay fair-share fees to unions as a condition of employment violated their First Amendment rights.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: North Carolina reports its first case of the Omicron variant in a student at UNC Charlotte.
answer: UNC Charlotte confirmed its first case of the Omicron variant in a student who had recently traveled internationally.

formulation: Military Tribunal in Ouagadougou convicts former Burkina Faso President Blaise Compaoré in absentia, of the 1987 killing of his predecessor Thomas Sankara.
answer: Blaise Compaoré, former president of Burkina Faso, was convicted of complicity in the murder of his predecessor Thomas Sankara after decades of delays and investigations.

formulation: The Trump administration imposes sanctions on seven Russian oligarchs and 17 senior government officials, accusing them of "malign activity around the globe".
answer: The Trump administration expelled 60 Russian diplomats and imposed sanctions on a dozen Russian entities over alleged interference in the 2016 US election.

formulation: An EF3 tornado strikes the Illinois cities of Naperville, Woodridge, and Darien, destroying 12 homes, damaging an additional 100, and injuring six people.
answer: A series of damaging tornadoes, including an EF-3 tornado, tore through the Chicago suburbs, resulting in widespread destruction and injuries.

formulation: Business Insider reports that 9,300 retail stores will close by the end of the year, including all 2,500 of Payless ShoeSource, 805 of Gymboree, 650 of Dressbarn, and 520 of Charlotte Russe.
answer: Payless ShoeSource and Gymboree both announced additional store closures in December 2019, impacting approximately 160 Payless locations and all 49 Gymboree stores.

formulation: Bloodiest day of protests in Myanmar since its coup after security forces open fire, killing two people with 40 wounded in Mandalay.
answer: Security forces in Myanmar opened fire on demonstrators in Myitkyina, killing two and injuring many others, as protests against the military coup continued.

formulation: Employee charged with attempted poisoning of colleague's sandwich in Schloss Holte-Stukenbrock, Germany, leading authorities to investigate 21 other suspicious deaths.
answer: The "Isny poisoning case" involved an employee accused of attempting to poison a colleague's lunch and subsequently triggered an investigation into at least three other deaths linked to the same person.

formulation: Largest wave ever surfed by a woman by Brazilian Maya Gabeira riding a 73.5ft (22.4m) wave at Nazaré, Portugal.
answer: Brazilian surfer Mayra Aguirre rode a 24.24-meter (79.5-foot) wave at Nazaré, Portugal, setting a new Guinness World Record for the largest wave ever surfed by a woman.

formulation: South Carolina House votes to add firing squad to execution methods; South Carolina would become the fourth state to use firing squad after Mississippi, Oklahoma and Utah.
answer: South Carolina passed a law allowing death row inmates to choose execution by firing squad if lethal injection is unavailable.

formulation: Federal judge Carlton Reeves temporarily blocks a Mississippi law banning abortions after the sixth week of pregnancy.
answer: Federal Judge Carlton Reeves blocked Mississippi’s six-week abortion ban, deeming it unconstitutional and an unreasonable restriction on women’s reproductive rights.

formulation: US online sales overtake retail sales for the first time, with 11.813% online compared with 11.807% for general merchandise stores.
answer: For the first time ever, online sales surpassed in-store sales for a full day in the United States.

formulation: Former pandemic agency head Rick Bright testifies to a US House Committee "without better planning, 2020 could be the darkest winter in modern history".
answer: Rick Bright, former director of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), testified that the U.S. was ill-prepared for a second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, warning of a "dark winter."

formulation: Pro–Palestinian protesters disrupt the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in three locations by wearing white jumpsuits covered in fake blood and gluing themselves to the parade route.
answer: The Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in New York City experienced disruptions as pro-Palestinian protesters caused delays.

formulation: The FDA approves the two gene therapies for sickle cell disease.
answer: The FDA approved the first gene therapy, Casgevy, for both severe sickle cell disease and sickle beta thalassemia.

formulation: Russian journalist Ivan Golunov released from prison and drug charges dropped after major public outcry with unprecedented joint campaign by Russian news sources.
answer: Journalist Ivan Golunov was released after being detained on drug charges, fueled by public outcry and coordinated efforts by numerous news organizations who questioned the legitimacy of the case.

formulation: Australian states celebrate "Freedom Day" easing COVID-19 restrictions in Victoria and New South Wales.
answer: The completion of vaccination targets for fully vaccinated adults in Victoria and New South Wales allowed for the removal of many COVID-19 restrictions and the celebration of "Freedom Day."

formulation: WHO says Measles has killed more than 5,000 people in Democratic Republic of Congo in 2019, in world's largest and fastest-moving epidemic.
answer: The World Health Organization reported on a rapidly spreading Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo, which resulted in over 5,000 deaths.

formulation: NYC mayor Eric Adams announces that law enforcement and first responders are now encouraged to involuntarily commit those in mental health crisis.
answer: Mayor Adams announced the city would proactively remove homeless individuals with mental health illnesses from public spaces as a measure to help them access services.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: Vermont becomes the first U.S. state to vaccinate 70% of children aged 12 to 17 years old.
answer: Vermont became the first state in the U.S. to reach a 75% COVID-19 vaccination rate among adolescents ages 12 to 17.

formulation: Major winter storm hits US Northeast resulting in at least seven deaths and Binghamton, New York, receiving record 41 inches of snow.
answer: A historic blizzard, dubbed "Winter Storm Gail," blanketed the Northeast with record snowfall and caused at least 14 fatalities.

formulation: 2024 Major League Baseball season: Shohei Ohtani of the Los Angeles Dodgers becomes the first MLB player in history to join the 50–50 club, stealing over 50 bases and hitting over 50 home runs in a single season.
answer: Shohei Ohtani became the first MLB player in history to record 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season.

formulation: Rare copy of 'mint' first issue of "The Amazing Spider-Man" sells for $1.38 million and "Superman #1", goes for $2.34m at auction.
answer: A 1938 Action Comics #1 CGC 8.5 sold for $2,086,000 and a 1963 Amazing Fantasy #15 CGC 5.5 sold for $581,400 at Heritage Auctions.

formulation: Canadian swim star Summer McIntosh wins her third gold medal at the Paris Olympics when she wins the 200m individual medley in 2:06.56; she was also the 200m butterfly and 400m IM champion.
answer: Summer McIntosh broke the world record in the women's 200-meter butterfly, finishing with a time of 2:03.14.

formulation: Jamaican athlete Elaine Thompson-Herah wins 200m gold in Tokyo to become the first female to claim the 100/200m double at consecutive Olympic Games.
answer: Elaine Thompson-Herah made history by winning gold in both the 100m and 200m sprints at consecutive Olympic Games, on August 3, 2021, in Tokyo.

formulation: South America experiences a winter heatwave, with Vicuña in Chilean Andres reaching 100 degrees F, the warmest day in northern Chile for 72 years.
answer: Northern Chile recorded 40°C (104°F), the highest temperature in the area in over seven decades, potentially linked to ongoing El Niño conditions.

formulation: America and Germany announce decision to send powerful battle tanks (US 31, Germany 14) to Ukraine to fight Russia invasion.
answer: The United States and Germany announced they would send tanks to Ukraine to aid in its defense against Russia.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Sturgis Motorcycle Rally takes place despite concerns by health officials.
answer: The Sturgis Motorcycle Rally in South Dakota occurred in August 2020, subsequently facing criticism from health officials for potential COVID-19 spread.

formulation: Puerto Rico raises official death toll of 2017 Hurricane Maria from 64 to 2,975.
answer: Puerto Rico's official death toll for Hurricane Maria was revised to 2,975, demonstrating the storm's devastating long-term impact on the island's population.

formulation: Share market sell off starts on Wall Street and spreads around the globe, Dow Jones Industrial Average has largest intraday point swing before finishing down 1,413 points or 4.6%.
answer: A sudden and unexpected rise in interest rates coupled with concerns about inflation triggered a stock market sell-off on February 5, 2018.

formulation: Major French investigation finds clergy sexually abused more than 200,000 children over 70 years, most of the victims boys.
answer: An independent report commissioned by the French Catholic Church revealed that over 200,000 children had been sexually abused by clergy over a 70-year period.

formulation: Sri Lanka says it has less than one day's worth of fuel, as its economic crisis deepens, closing schools and stopping public transport.
answer: Sri Lanka's government halted fuel sales for all but essential services due to a severe shortage and lack of foreign currency to pay for imports.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that President Trump must release his financial records for examination by prosecutors in New York.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that President Trump must comply with subpoenas seeking his financial records from New York prosecutors, rejecting his claim of broad immunity.

formulation: Five new civil lawsuits are filed against Sean "Diddy" Combs in a federal court in New York, accusing the rapper of sexual assault and rape.
answer: A New York court unsealed indictment charging Diddy with sex trafficking and other related crimes following raids on his homes.

formulation: International Bureau of Weights and Measures votes to abandon the leap second (to take effect 2035). Originally inserted in 1972 to reconcile atomic and astronomical time scales.
answer: The International Bureau of Weights and Measures agreed to define the second based on the frequency of an optical transition in strontium-90, a shift from using cesium, starting in 2035.

formulation: Alabama legalizes chemical castration as a stipulation for child sex offenders applying for parole; the law goes into effect September 1.
answer: Alabama passed a law mandating chemical castration for child sex offenders seeking parole, with the measure taking effect on September 1, 2019.

formulation: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos pledges $10 billion to fight climate change using a new fund called the Bezos Earth Fund.
answer: Amazon's CEO announced the "Climate Pledge," a $10 billion commitment to fund solutions and technologies to help meet the goals of the Paris Agreement.

formulation: The 2020 Iowa Democratic and Republican caucuses take place. The Democratic caucus results are delayed due to problems with a vote-counting app.
answer: The Iowa Democratic caucuses, the first contest of the 2020 presidential election, experienced major reporting delays due to a faulty vote-counting app.

formulation: Sixteen Marines are arrested at Camp Pendleton, California for human trafficking and drug-related offenses. Two others had been arrested on July 3.
answer: Several Marines were arrested at Camp Pendleton in July 2019 on charges related to human trafficking, drug distribution, and other offenses.

formulation: Forty-one migrants form Ivory Coast and Guinea drown and just four survive after their boat capsizes off Italian island of Lampedusa.
answer: An overcrowded wooden boat capsized off Lampedusa, causing the deaths of forty-one migrants from Ivory Coast and Guinea.

formulation: US President Biden announces plan to cancel student loan debts by $10,000 (for those earning less than $125,000) and $20,000 for those who had received Pell grants.
answer: President Biden announced a plan to forgive up to $10,000 in student loan debt for borrowers earning less than $125,000 (or $250,000 for married couples) and up to $20,000 for Pell Grant recipients.

formulation: Social media network Bluesky, seen as a potential rival to X, is opened for public registrations, dropping its previous invite-only format.
answer: Bluesky, a decentralized social media platform, officially opened its registration to the public, removing the previous invite-only system.

formulation: Maxwell Azzarello, a 37-year-old man from St. Augustine, Florida, self-immolates in front of the New York Supreme Court in New York City where the New York state criminal trial against Trump is set to begin. He died early the next day.
answer: A man protesting the trial self-immolated in front of the New York Supreme Court, shouting anti-Trump slogans.

formulation: US Attorney General Merrick Garland says he personally approved FBI search of Trump's property, on same day Washington Post source says FBI search was for missing documents on nuclear weapons.
answer: The U.S. Attorney General authorized and the FBI executed a search warrant at former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate, seeking classified documents.

formulation: Violence increases further in ungoverned areas of Burkina Faso as around 170 people were executed by armed groups in three northern villages.
answer: Armed groups executed approximately 170 people, mostly civilians, in a brutal attack on several villages in Burkina Faso's northern Sahel region.

formulation: United Nations-backed COVAX initiative begins delivering vaccines to middle and low income countries with first AstraZeneca shipment to Ghana.
answer: The COVAX initiative, a global effort led by Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, launched on February 24, 2021, to ensure equitable vaccine access for low- and middle-income countries, delivering its first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccines to Ghana.

formulation: Chinese taikonaut Wang Yaping is the first Chinese female spacewalker, completing a 6 hour space walk as part of the Shenzhou 13 mission.
answer: Wang Yaping delivered a televised science lecture to Chinese students from the Tiangong space station, marking the first time a taikonaut has taught in space.

formulation: Chennai, India's 6th largest city with 4 million people, runs out of water as its reservoirs dry up.
answer: Chennai became the first Indian city to declare "Day Zero," shutting off most of its water supply to over 4 million residents due to critically low reservoir levels.

formulation: After taking out the men's combined gold medal, Austrian alpine skier Marcel Hirscher wins the giant slalom at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
answer: Marcel Hirscher won the gold medal in the combined event, marking his first Olympic gold after competing in three previous Winter Olympics.

formulation: American poet Louise Glück is awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature.
answer: Louise Glück was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for her unflinching and clear-sighted voice that illuminates the human experience.

formulation: Argentina’s upper house narrowly passes President Javier Milei’s controversial economic reforms amid violent protests.
answer: President Javier Milei's decree to overhaul the electoral system and cut funding to the justice system triggered widespread protests in Buenos Aires, leading to clashes with security forces.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide confirmed COVID-19 cases surpass 25 million.
answer: The United States officially surpassed 25 million confirmed COVID-19 cases, prompting renewed concerns and stricter measures.

formulation: Google announces its employee Emma Haruka Iwao has broken the world record for calculating pi, to 31.4 trillion digits, on pi day using Google Cloud.
answer: Google announced it had calculated pi to 31.4 trillion digits, a new world record, to celebrate Pi Day.

formulation: AT&T's $85.4 billion takeover of Time Warner can go ahead according to US district court judge.
answer: AT&T's $85 billion acquisition of Time Warner was approved by a US district court judge, ending a two-year legal battle with the Justice Department.

formulation: Partial shutdown of US federal government begins.
answer: The longest U.S. government shutdown in history commenced due to a disagreement over funding for a border wall.

formulation: Florida reports a record 11,458 daily COVID-19 cases.
answer: Florida reported over 10,000 new COVID-19 cases for the first time, marking a concerning surge in infections.

formulation: EU leaders approve an agreement for Britain to leave the EU (Brexit).
answer: EU leaders unanimously approved a draft withdrawal agreement with the UK, outlining the terms of Brexit.

formulation: US Special Counsel Robert Mueller says charging President Donald Trump with a crime was never an option as no legal means to charge a sitting president; and that his report does not exonerate the president.
answer: Mueller stated that his office declined to make a determination on whether President Trump committed obstruction of justice because doing so would violate the constitutional principle that a sitting president cannot be indicted.

formulation: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu announces pause of key part of controversial plans to overhaul the justice system after massive protests and the country's largest trade union goes on strike.
answer: Israel's government suspended a highly contested judicial overhaul plan in an attempt to end mass protests and a nationwide strike.

formulation: At least 76 die in a fire in a office building housing migrants and vulnerable people in Johannesburg, South Africa.
answer: A devastating fire ripped through a five-story building in Johannesburg, South Africa, killing at least 76 people, primarily migrants and homeless individuals.

formulation: Storm Eunice [Zeynep/Nora] moves across Europe and the UK with gusts of 120mph, killing at least 17, cutting off power to millions.
answer: Storm Eunice, a severe storm with record-breaking wind gusts, battered the UK and parts of Europe, leading to widespread damage and power outages.

formulation: Investigation launched after no girls born in three months in 132 villages in Uttarkashi district, India, with sex-selective abortions suspected as the reason.
answer: A worrying gender imbalance emerged in India's Maharashtra state, where no girls were born across 132 villages over three months, sparking fears of widespread sex-selective abortions.

formulation: The CDC announces that 60% of Americans have received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: The CDC reported that 70% of adults in the United States had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: Yemeni President Abdrabbuh Mansour Hadi transfers power to an eight-member council to negotiate with the Houthis in attempt to end country's seven-year civil war.
answer: The warring parties in Yemen's civil war agreed to a two-month UN-mediated truce, aimed at paving the way for a lasting peace agreement.

formulation: Israeli military and allies evacuate over 400 White Helmet Syrian rescue workers from its border with Syria to Jordan.
answer: The White Helmets, a Syrian civil defense organization, were evacuated via Israel with assistance from the United States and other countries amid fears for their safety.

formulation: Boston Bruins retire Willie O'Ree's #22 jersey, on the 64th anniversary of his becoming the NHL's first Black player.
answer: Willie O'Ree was posthumously inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame, celebrating his pioneering role as the first Black player in the NHL.

formulation: The annual South by Southwest (SXSW) festival is canceled due to COVID-19 fears; it is the first time the event has been canceled in its 34-year history.
answer: SXSW was cancelled just days before it was scheduled to begin after Austin's mayor issued an order barring large gatherings to prevent the spread of the virus.

formulation: Canada marks its first Emancipation Day (date slavery abolished in the British Empire in 1834).
answer: Emancipation Day was officially recognized in Canada to mark the end of slavery in the British Empire.

formulation: "The 1619 Project" produced by Nikole Hannah-Jones, to examine legacy of slavery in America, launched in "The New York Times Magazine".
answer: "The 1619 Project" launched in the New York Times Magazine, sought to re-examine American history through the lens of slavery.

formulation: A mass shooting in Denver injures 10 people celebrating the Nuggets championship.
answer: A parade float malfunctioned, causing it to crash into a crowd, resulting in injuries to 10 people during the Denver Nuggets championship celebration.

formulation: Cambodia's authoritarian Prime Minister Hun Sen, in power since 1985, announces he will resign and pass his office to his son.
answer: Hun Sen officially stepped down as Prime Minister after 38 years in power, handing the position to his son Hun Manet.

formulation: The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court rules that voters will be allowed to use the state's expanded early and mail-in voting rules in the September primary.
answer: The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court ruled that mail-in ballot request deadlines must be extended to September 18 to accommodate those impacted by recent extreme heat.

formulation: US White House bars California and other states from setting their own emission standards.
answer: The White House formally revoked California's waiver under the Clean Air Act, blocking states from setting their own stricter vehicle emissions standards.

formulation: Utah sues the federal government over restoring the size of two Indigenous national monuments after they were downsized by former president Trump.
answer: Utah filed a lawsuit challenging the Biden administration’s restoration of Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monuments to their original, larger sizes.

formulation: Birmingham City Council, the largest local authority in Europe, effectively declares itself bankrupt, after stopping all nonessential spending.
answer: Birmingham City Council declared itself effectively bankrupt by issuing a Section 114 notice, halting all non-essential spending.

formulation: UK announces it will expel 23 Russian diplomats after Russian-made nerve agent used on former spy in UK.
answer: The UK expelled over 150 Russian diplomats and officials, and urged other nations to follow suit, in response to the poisoning of Sergei Skripal and his daughter.

formulation: More than 15,000 fires have caused widespread devastation in Brazil's Pantanal wetlands in 2020, according to its National Institute for Space Research.
answer: Brazil's Pantanal wetlands experienced an unprecedented fire season in 2020, with over 15,000 fires destroying a significant portion of the world's largest tropical wetland.

formulation: President Trump commutes the 40-month sentence of political consultant Roger Stone.
answer: President Trump commuted Roger Stone's prison sentence, preventing him from reporting to jail on charges related to the Mueller investigation.

formulation: 270,000 people now displaced by fighting in south-western Syria says UN since assault on rebel-held area two weeks ago.
answer: The UN reported that intensified fighting in southwestern Syria had triggered a massive displacement crisis, with over 320,000 people fleeing their homes toward the Jordanian border and northern Syria.

formulation: Ebola virus has caused 69 deaths and sickened 150 people according to Ministry of Heath in Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: By September 24, 2018, the Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo had reported over 50 cases, including 33 deaths.

formulation: More than 200 prisoners escape and 25 people are killed at Croix-des-Bouquets prison near Port-au-Prince, Haiti.
answer: A coordinated prison break at the Gressier Penitentiary in Haiti led to the escape of more than 200 inmates, with 25 people killed during the violent attack.

formulation: Record lowest temperature of -111C registered by American satellite Noaa-20 in the western Pacific at top of large storm.
answer: NOAA-20 registered a sea surface temperature of 37.2 degrees Celsius (99.0 degrees Fahrenheit) in the western Pacific, beating the previous record.

formulation: United States Space Force founded, an armed forces branch dedicated to space warfare.
answer: The United States Space Force was formally established as the sixth branch of the U.S. military to focus on space operations and national security.

formulation: Limerick wins All Ireland Hurling Championship for first time in 45 years with a 3-16 to 2-18 win over defending champions Galway at Croke Park, Dublin.
answer: Limerick defeated Galway to win the All-Ireland Hurling Championship, ending a 45-year drought for the county.

formulation: The Broadway League extends the Broadway theatre shutdown through June 7, projecting the longest shutdown in Broadway history.
answer: The Broadway League announced that Broadway theatres would remain closed through May 31, 2020, due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: India opens the first part of what will be its longest expressway linking Mumbai with New Delhi over 1,386-kilometer (861 mile).
answer: The Delhi–Mumbai Expressway, spanning 1,386 kilometers, was inaugurated in February 2023, marking the start of India's longest expressway.

formulation: The Atlanta Braves win the 2021 World Series, defeating the Houston Astros.
answer: The Atlanta Braves won the 2021 World Series by defeating the Houston Astros.

formulation: "Voiceless Mass" by Raven Chacon, premieres at the Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist in Milwaukee - first work by an Native American to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music.
answer: The world premiere of Jerod Impich’s "Shaman’s Dream: Songs of the Chippewa," a large-scale work for orchestra and chorus, occurred at the Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist.

formulation: A federal three-judge panel in D.C. rules that Trump's tax returns must be delivered to House investigators. The returns are delivered to the House Committee on Ways and Means on November 30.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to hear Trump's appeal, allowing a lower court ruling that would require his tax returns to be released to the Manhattan District Attorney for a criminal investigation.

formulation: Russia announces it will leave the International Space Station at the end of 2024.
answer: Russia declared it would begin withdrawing from the International Space Station after 2024 and build its own orbital station.

formulation: Cholera outbreak in Nigeria has killed more than 800 people with 31,425 suspected cases since January 2021 according to Nigeria Centre for Disease Control.
answer: Nigeria recorded 4,242 cases of cholera with 189 deaths across 26 states during the first eight months of 2021.

formulation: 22,000 people attend a gun rights rally at the Virginia State Capitol in Richmond to protest proposed gun laws.
answer: Thousands of gun rights supporters gathered at the Virginia State Capitol on January 20, 2020, for a rally dubbed "Lobby Day" to oppose proposed gun control legislation.

formulation: Novo Nordisk, Danish manufacturer of weight-loss drug Wegovy, becomes Europe's most valuable company at $428bn (£339bn), overtaking France's LVMH.
answer: Novo Nordisk became the most valuable company in Europe, surpassing LVMH, a luxury goods giant, due to the success of its weight-loss drugs.

formulation: New Zealand cricket spin bowler Ajaz Patel (10-119) joins Jim Laker and Anil Kumble as the only three men to take all ten wickets in a Test innings, on Day 2 of the 2nd Test against India in Mumbai.
answer: Ajaz Patel became only the third bowler in Test history to claim all 10 wickets in an innings, achieving a perfect 10/55.

formulation: Tornado strikes Havana, Cuba, killing three and injuring 172.
answer: A tornado struck Havana, Cuba, on January 27, 2019, causing three deaths and injuries to many people.

formulation: Hunter Biden agrees to plead guilty to federal tax and firearms charges.
answer: Hunter Biden pleaded not guilty to tax evasion and illegal gun possession charges in Delaware, after a plea deal previously collapsed.

formulation: Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio is indicted on conspiracy charges of obstructing the U.S. Congress during the January 6 attack at the United States Capitol.
answer: In early 2022, several Proud Boys leaders, including chairman Enrique Tarrio, were arrested and charged with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the January 6 attack.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford agrees to testify against Brett Kavanaugh the following week.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee about her allegations of sexual assault against Brett Kavanaugh.

formulation: Super Tuesday 2020 takes place.
answer: On March 3, 2020, often called "Super Tuesday," several states including Texas, California, and North Carolina held crucial primary elections that significantly shaped the Democratic presidential nomination race.

formulation: September sees the greatest number of inmates executed at five, within a one-week span since July 2003 with the execution of Alan Eugene Miller.
answer: Nine inmates were executed across several states during the week of September 9, 2024, representing the highest number of executions in a single week in over two decades.

formulation: Dan Campbell records his first victory as head coach of the Detroit Lions with a win against the Minnesota Vikings in Week 13.
answer: Dan Campbell secured his first victory as the Detroit Lions head coach, ending a 34-game losing streak.

formulation: US scientists begin the search for dark matter with a device in a former gold mine in Lead, South Dakota.
answer: The LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) experiment, a leading dark matter detector, began its search for dark matter particles.

formulation: The Social Security Administration announces an 8.1% cost of living adjustment to begin in 2023, citing ongoing inflation. It is the largest increase since 1981.
answer: In October 2022, the Social Security Administration announced an 8.7% cost-of-living adjustment for 2023, the largest in 40 years, due to surging inflation.

formulation: 2020 Kansas Democratic primary: Joe Biden wins in a mail-in primary with ranked choice voting.
answer: Joe Biden won Kansas's Democratic primary on May 2, 2020, through a mail-in election employing ranked choice voting.

formulation: US large MQ-9 Reaper drone crashes into the Black Sea after collision with Russian fighter jet, with the US saying the Russia forced it down sparking an international incident.
answer: A Russian Su-27 fighter jet reportedly dumped fuel and performed dangerous maneuvers near a US Air Force surveillance drone over the Black Sea, forcing the drone to land in the water.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic rapidly spread across the globe beginning in early 2020, causing widespread lockdowns and dramatically altering daily life by late May 2021.

formulation: The U.S. Senate votes 51–49 against calling witnesses in President Trump's impeachment trial.
answer: The Senate voted against hearing witness testimony in the impeachment trial, with Republicans blocking a motion to call John Bolton and others.

formulation: XXIII Winter Olympic Games close in Pyeongchang, Korea; Norway wins a record 39 medals, 14 gold.
answer: The 2018 Winter Olympics concluded in Pyeongchang, South Korea, where Norway earned a record-breaking 39 medals.

formulation: Taal volcano, 70km (45 miles) south of Manila in the Philippines begins erupting prompting evacuations.
answer: The Taal Volcano, located just 60 kilometers (37 miles) south of Manila, erupted explosively, triggering mass evacuations.

formulation: Argentina's central bank raises interest rates to 60% in attempt to stabilize the peso.
answer: Argentina's central bank intervened heavily in the foreign exchange market, spending over $12 billion in a week to support the peso and stabilize the currency.

formulation: World Cup: Video Assistant Referee (VAR) technology is used for the first time, awarding France a penalty in 2-1 win over Australia in Kazan.
answer: Video Assistant Referee (VAR) technology was implemented for the first time in a World Cup match during the France versus Australia game.

formulation: McLaren driver Lando Norris wins his first Formula One race after placing first in the Miami Grand Prix.
answer: Lando Norris secured his first-ever Formula 1 victory, winning the Miami Grand Prix.

formulation: LGBTQ activists accuse the Russian republic of Chechnya of a new gay purge with 40 detained and two killed.
answer: Reports indicated Chechen authorities, with the apparent tacit support of local leaders, detained, tortured, and in some cases killed dozens of men suspected of being LGBTQ.

formulation: NASA announces that, beginning in 2020, the International Space Station will be commercialized, allowing private companies to use the station to conduct for-profit activities, including marketing, advertising and space manufacturing.
answer: NASA announced it would begin facilitating commercial use of the ISS, allowing private companies to purchase research time and services starting in 2020.

formulation: Magawa, an African Giant Pouched Rat, is the first rat to be awarded a prestigious PDSA hero award, for sniffing out landmines in Cambodia.
answer: Magawa, an African Giant Pouched Rat, received a prestigious gold medal from PDSA for his work detecting landmines in Cambodia, making him the first rodent to receive the honor.

formulation: Two people are killed and 20 injured when a Hard Rock Hotel and Casino under construction in downtown New Orleans partially collapses.
answer: A crane collapsed at the construction site of the $3.8 billion Harrah's New Orleans hotel and casino, killing two construction workers and injuring multiple others.

formulation: 2020 presidential election: Thousands of protesters march in Washington, D.C. in support of President Trump and his claims of electoral voter fraud.
answer: A "Stop the Steal" rally drew thousands to Washington D.C. to protest the 2020 election results and support President Trump's unsubstantiated claims of voter fraud.

formulation: 1st UEFA Nations League Final, Porto: Guedes scores as Portugal win inaugural tournament final, 1-0 over the Netherlands.
answer: The 2019 UEFA Nations League final was held in Porto, where Portugal defeated the Netherlands 1-0 with a goal from Guedes.

formulation: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon resigns after eight years in office, the longest-serving First Minister and the first woman.
answer: Nicola Sturgeon, Scotland’s first woman First Minister, dramatically announced her resignation after eight years in office.

formulation: US Secret Service takes control of Joe Biden's inauguration as 20,000 troops authorized to guard Washington D.C., more than those stationed in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Somalia.
answer: Following the January 6th Capitol riot, a seven-foot-high fence was erected around the Capitol building, and over 25,000 National Guard troops were deployed to secure Washington, D.C.

formulation: A massive oil spill occurs off the coast of Huntington Beach, California, prompting many beach closures, and washing up dead birds and fish.
answer: A massive oil spill originating from a pipeline leak contaminated the waters and beaches of Huntington Beach, California, impacting wildlife and causing widespread environmental damage.

formulation: The 2023 NFL draft is held in Kansas City, with Alabama quarterback Bryce Young being selected by the Carolina Panthers as the first overall pick.
answer: The Carolina Panthers selected quarterback Bryce Young as the first overall pick in the 2023 NFL Draft in Kansas City.

formulation: President Biden calls on Congress to pass a three-month-long gas and diesel tax holiday as a proposal to lower the cost of fuel.
answer: President Biden proposed a three-month federal gas tax holiday, temporarily suspending the 18-cent per gallon gas and diesel tax.

formulation: The Washington State Senate approves legislation that would legally require all presidential candidates to release the last five years of their personal tax returns in order to have their names featured on both primary and general election voting ballots.
answer: The Washington State Senate passed a bill requiring presidential candidates to release five years of tax returns to appear on the state's ballot.

formulation: Eight people are killed after a vehicle drives into pedestrians outside a migrant center in Brownsville, Texas.
answer: A speeding vehicle crashed into a crowd of migrants near the Brownsville border crossing, killing eight people and injuring several others.

formulation: Body of 38-year-old Filipino woman discovered in abandoned mine starts the hunt for Cyprus's first serial killer, at least 5 other bodies later discovered.
answer: The disappearance and subsequent discovery of the body of Maria Karydopoulou sparked a police investigation that identified Christoforos Georgiou as Cyprus's first known serial killer.

formulation: The biggest surge in years of attacks by Arab militants in Israel leaves 14 dead, leading to Israel army operations that kill a further 20.
answer: A wave of deadly terrorist attacks targeting Israelis in several cities resulted in over a dozen deaths and prompted Israeli military operations in the West Bank.

formulation: SoftBank Group announces a $100 billion investment in the United States, expected to create 100,000 new jobs by 2029, primarily in technology-related sectors such as artificial intelligence.
answer: Microsoft announced a $100 billion investment across several years to boost AI development and create 100,000 tech jobs in the United States.

formulation: Intense floods in the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy causes 23 rivers to burst their banks, resulting in at least 13 deaths and cancellation of the F1 Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix.
answer: Record-breaking rainfall and severe flooding devastated the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy, causing multiple deaths and forcing the cancellation of the Formula 1 Grand Prix.

formulation: In United States v. Texas, the Supreme Court declines to block a Texas Senate bill allowing officials to arrest and deport migrants.
answer: The Supreme Court unanimously ruled that Texas cannot install floating barriers in the Rio Grande to deter migrants, asserting federal authority over the border.

formulation: US stock markets reach new records, the Dow tops 27,000 points for the first time and the S&P 500 hits 3,000 points.
answer: The US stock markets reached new all-time highs, marking significant gains in both the Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500.

formulation: FIFA Ballon d'Or: Spain and Man City midfielder Rodri wins men's award from Real Madrid pair Vinicius Jr and Jude Bellingham; Barcelona's Aitana Bonmati wins back-to-back women's awards.
answer: Rodri of Manchester City and Aitana Bonmati of FC Barcelona were named the men's and women's FIFA Best Players for 2023.

formulation: Rapper and activist Nipsey Hussle fatally shot outside his clothing store in Los Angeles.
answer: Nipsey Hussle, a celebrated rapper and community activist, was fatally shot and died at the age of 33 outside his clothing store, Marathon Clothing, in Los Angeles.

formulation: 20-year-old Daunte Wright shot and killed at a traffic stop by police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, who says they mistook their gun for a taser.
answer: Police officer Kim Potter fatally shot Daunte Wright during a traffic stop after mistaking her handgun for a taser.

formulation: US President Joe Biden rescinds the national emergency order used by Donald Trump to fund the border wall with Mexico.
answer: President Biden terminated the national emergency declaration that had allowed for the redirection of funds to build the border wall.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 11,000 deaths from COVID-19, eight days after surpassing 10,000.
answer: Michigan reported a record 102 COVID-19 deaths on December 16, 2020, further escalating the state’s toll after exceeding 10,000 deaths.

formulation: Students at Georgia Southern University burn books written by Jennine Capó Crucet, a Cuban-American author, who had been invited to the school to discuss white privilege.
answer: A mob of students and community members surrounded and verbally confronted Bret Weinstein at Evergreen State College after he questioned an event requiring white people to leave campus.

formulation: Airbnb bans listings in Israeli settlements in the West Bank.
answer: Airbnb announced it would remove listings in Israeli-occupied territories, and offer refunds for existing reservations, after facing pressure over the legality of rentals in those areas.

formulation: In a reversal, Senator Joe Manchin announces he has reached a deal with Senate Majority Leader Schumer on taxes and climate.
answer: Senator Manchin and Schumer announced a deal, dubbed the Inflation Reduction Act, including tax increases on corporations and investments in climate and healthcare.

formulation: President Trump announces a plan for the largest ever package of sanctions against North Korea, aimed at cutting off revenue for its nuclear program.
answer: President Trump announced new sanctions targeting North Korean cargo ships and entities facilitating the regime’s nuclear program.

formulation: Tom Barrack, founder of Colony Capital and an advisor of Donald Trump, is indicted for making false statements to the FBI and being an unregistered agent for the United Arab Emirates. He is found not guilty in 2022.
answer: The trial of Michael Flynn, an adviser to Donald Trump, began in July 2021 for charges of making false statements to the FBI and unregistered foreign agent activities, ultimately resulting in a not guilty verdict in 2022.

formulation: At least 14 children reported mauled to death by wild dogs near Khairabad, India after closure of slaughterhouses.
answer: Following the closure of local slaughterhouses, at least 11 children were killed by a pack of stray dogs in Khairabad, India.

formulation: The 2022 NFL draft is held in Las Vegas, with the Jacksonville Jaguars selecting former Georgia Bulldogs defensive end Travon Walker with the first overall-pick.
answer: The Jacksonville Jaguars selected Travon Walker, an edge rusher from Georgia, as the first overall pick in the 2022 NFL Draft.

formulation: At least 448 people killed after heavy rains and flooding in KwaZulu-Natal province, South Africa, "one of the worst weather storms in the history of our country" according to authorities.
answer: Devastating floods and torrential rainfall caused widespread destruction and at least 448 deaths in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, in April 2022.

formulation: Coup in Burkina Faso as military announce on TV they have overthrown President Roch Kaboré after his failure to stem an Islamic insurgency.
answer: Following widespread protests over the government’s inability to curb the Islamic insurgency, the military seized power in a coup led by Lieutenant Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba.

formulation: John Legend and wife Chrissy Teigen fire back at Donald Trump on social media after he calls them "boring" and "filthymouthed" in tweets over Criminal Justice Reform.
answer: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend sarcastically tweeted about Donald Trump’s “huge mistake” in criticizing their support for criminal justice reform, with Teigen mockingly referring to Trump's misspelling of "mistake."

formulation: The Oregon Supreme Court upholds Ballot Measure 113 by banning ten of the twelve Republican members of the Oregon Senate for refusing to attend six weeks worth of legislative sessions in order to stall Democratic legislation.
answer: The Oregon Supreme Court ruled that the Republican senators’ month-long boycott of the legislature, intended to block votes on bills related to housing and abortion, was unconstitutional.

formulation: French forces say they have killed 40 fighters in air attacks in Burkina Faso linked to deadly attacks on Benin border.
answer: French forces conducted an operation targeting militants connected to attacks close to the Benin border in Burkina Faso, resulting in at least 20 deaths.

formulation: The Senate Intelligence Committee submits the fifth and final volume of its report on Russian election meddling to the ODNI for classification review. The report totals "nearly 1,000 pages". It is released on August 18, reportedly providing new information about President Trump's relationship with Russian officials.
answer: The Senate Intelligence Committee submitted a five-volume report detailing Russian interference in the 2016 election, which was declassified and released to the public in phases beginning in July 2020.

formulation: EU warns Russian invasion of Ukraine means Europe facing major humanitarian crisis, 18 million Ukrainians displaced with four million refugees fleeing the country.
answer: The European Union warned that the Russian invasion would trigger the largest humanitarian crisis in Europe since World War II.

formulation: Italy announces it is locking down northern region of Lombardy, including Milan, with 16 million people, as COVID-19 cases reach 5,800 with 233 deaths.
answer: The Italian government implemented a nationwide lockdown, restricting movement and closing non-essential businesses to contain the rapidly spreading virus.

formulation: Hurricane Francine makes landfall in southern Louisiana as a category 2 storm.
answer: Southern Louisiana was struck by Hurricane Ten, a strong Category 2 storm that brought significant rainfall and flooding.

formulation: Gunmen attack the French embassy and army HQ in suspected terrorist incident in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, killing 8 and injuring 80.
answer: A coordinated attack by Islamist militants targeted the French embassy and army headquarters in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, killing at least 12 people and wounding several others.

formulation: Record 17ft (5.2M) invasive Burmese python pregnant with 73 eggs captured in Florida's Big Cypress National Preserve.
answer: A record-length, 17-foot-long boa constrictor in Florida gave birth to 63 eggs, raising concerns about the invasive snake species' population expansion.

formulation: India has more girls than boys for the first time in its history and its population boom is ending, according to new government survey.
answer: India's total fertility rate has fallen below the replacement level of 2.1 children per woman, marking a key demographic shift and indicating a potential stabilization of the country's population.

formulation: Colombian Juan Carlos Sánchez Latorre jailed for sexual abuse of 276 children in Barranquilla.
answer: In February 2019, Colombian authorities sentenced a man known as "El Arquitecto" (The Architect) to 54 years in prison for sexually abusing over 400 children.

formulation: The Cherokee Nation names an official delegate to the United States Congress for the first time.
answer: The Cherokee Nation Principal Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr. became the first Native American to address a joint session of Congress.

formulation: The U.S. women's soccer team wins their fourth World Cup, defending their status as the No. 1 team in the world and renewing their campaign for pay equity.
answer: The U.S. women’s national soccer team secured their fourth World Cup title, emphasizing their exceptional performance while simultaneously reigniting debates about equal pay compared to their male counterparts.

formulation: Trump picks hedge fund investor and former Yale professor Scott Bessent as his Secretary of the Treasury, congresswoman Lori Chavez-DeRemer as his Secretary of Labor, and former Texas state representative and retired NFL player Scott Turner as his Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
answer: Trump did not make any significant cabinet appointments specifically ahead of the November 22, 2024 election, as his presidency ended in January 2021.

formulation: Lloyd Austin confirmed as defense secretary by the US Senate, and the first black head of the Pentagon.
answer: Lloyd Austin was confirmed as the U.S. Secretary of Defense, making him the first African American to lead the Pentagon.

formulation: US National Book Award given to Jason Mott (fiction), Tiya Miles (nonfiction) and Martín Espada (poetry).
answer: The National Book Awards, honoring works in fiction, nonfiction, poetry, translated literature, and young people's literature, were presented on November 17, 2021.

formulation: Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes is found guilty of defrauding investors.
answer: Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO of Theranos, was sentenced to over 11 years in prison for defrauding investors.

formulation: Ecuadorean President Lenín Moreno cancels his austerity plan, in deal with indigenous leaders, restoring fuel subsidies, ending weeks of violent protests.
answer: President Lenín Moreno reached an agreement with indigenous leaders to repeal austerity measures, including a fuel subsidy elimination, ending a widespread protest.

formulation: First Chinese #MeToo case goes to court, TV star Zhu Jun sues for defamation after accusation posted online.
answer: Chinese actor Zhang Yimou sued internet users for defamation after they accused him of sexual misconduct.

formulation: Oklahoma commutes 500 prison sentences, the largest number in the state's history.
answer: Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt commuted the sentences of 23 inmates, all serving time for nonviolent drug offenses, marking the first large-scale commutations based on retroactive sentencing reform.

formulation: Computer's Turing Award won by American programmer Jack Dongarra, whose work paved the way for supercomputers.
answer: Jack Dongarra was awarded the Turing Award, the highest distinction in computer science, for his pioneering work in high-performance computing.

formulation: Large mudslide after intense rain tears across Italian island of Ischia, killing at least eight people, on an island where 50% of the houses were illegally built.
answer: A sudden landslide triggered by torrential rain devastated Casamicciola Terme on Ischia, killing at least nine people and exposing widespread illegal construction and land modification.

formulation: Motorcycle maker Harley-Davidson announces it plans to move some production abroad in response to EU retaliatory tariffs.
answer: Harley-Davidson announced it would shift production of motorcycles for the European market to its facility in Thailand to avoid EU tariffs.

formulation: Ugandan government passes Anti Homosexuality Bill, including punishment of 10 years in prison for identifying as LGBTQ+.
answer: Uganda's parliament passed the Anti-Homosexuality Act, imposing harsh penalties, including up to 10 years in prison, for same-sex relations and other LGBTQ+ related activities.

formulation: Damning report by UK government committee finds former PM  Boris Johnson misled parliament over 'Partygate' Covid-19 breaches.
answer: A Privileges Committee report concluded Boris Johnson repeatedly misled Parliament and undermined the investigation into 'Partygate' gatherings.

formulation: Albanian President Ilir Meta cancels nationwide local elections amid constitutional crisis after the opposition refuses to participate until Prime Minister Edi Rama resigns.
answer: A dispute over electoral reforms and the involvement of political parties in the election administration led to President Meta's cancellation of the nationwide local elections.

formulation: Biden cancels another $1.2 billion of student loan debts for nearly 153,000 people.
answer: President Biden announced a new income-driven repayment plan, dubbed "SAVE," that would lower monthly payments for millions of borrowers.

formulation: "Post-tropical storm" remnant of Hurricane Fiona makes landfall near Whitehead, Nova Scotia, with sustained wind speeds of 165 km/h (103 mph); the strongest low-pressure system in Canadian history affected the four provinces of Atlantic Canada, as well as Quebec, causing major flooding, and knocking out power to 80% of Nova Scotia and 95% of Prince Edward Island.
answer: Post-tropical cyclone Fiona brought record-breaking winds and torrential rain to Atlantic Canada, causing devastating flooding and widespread power outages.

formulation: South Fork Wind, the first large-scale offshore wind farm begins supplying electricity to the US, 35 miles off Montauk.
answer: The South Fork Wind Farm, America's first offshore wind farm, began delivering power to Long Island in December 2023.

formulation: Volcano Mount Ruang erupts in Indonesia in North Sulawesi province, its first eruption since 2002.
answer: Mount Ruang in North Sulawesi, Indonesia, erupted for the first time since 2002, prompting evacuations and flight cancellations.

formulation: EU leaders, including Donald Tusk and Emmanuel Macron, criticize Theresa May's Brexit plan at a summit in Salzburg, Austria.
answer: EU leaders raised concerns that the UK's proposed post-Brexit trade arrangements could undermine the single market and create unacceptable customs border complexities.

formulation: Frank Zapata is the first person to cross the English Channel by flyboard in 22 minutes.
answer: Franky Zapata successfully crossed the English Channel using a jet-powered flyboard, becoming the first person to do so.

formulation: San Antonio assistant Becky Hammon becomes first female to coach an NBA team after Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich is ejected in a 121-107 loss to the LA Lakers.
answer: Becky Hammon became the first female assistant coach to coach an NBA team in an official game, leading the San Antonio Spurs after Gregg Popovich's ejection.

formulation: At least 828 civilians have now died and 3,688 have been injured over six weeks of fighting in Sudan, according to the Sudanese American Physicians Association.
answer: Civilian casualties in Sudan during the six weeks preceding May 26, 2023, have tragically reached at least 1,800 deaths and 8,400 injuries, with warnings of significantly higher figures.

formulation: 2021 Oxford High School shooting – Four students are killed and seven other people are injured in a mass shooting at Oxford High School in Oxford Township, Michigan.
answer: A 15-year-old student fatally shot four classmates and injured seven others at Oxford High School in Michigan.

formulation: New York City, once the epicentre of the pandemic in America, begins stage 2 of re-opening, allowing outdoor dinning and some in-store shopping.
answer: New York City entered Phase 2 of reopening on June 22, 2020, allowing outdoor dining and certain retail businesses to resume operations with restrictions.

formulation: President Trump appoints Larry Kudlow to be Director of the National Economic Council, succeeding Gary Cohn.
answer: President Trump appointed Larry Kudlow as the new director of the National Economic Council, replacing Gary Cohn.

formulation: More than 51 people killed in northern Mali after attacks on three villages by Islamist jihadists.
answer: Islamist jihadists attacked several villages in northern Mali, killing over 51 people in what is considered the country’s deadliest attack in years.

formulation: Turner Art Prize awarded to activist group Array Collective for installation including mock Irish pub - first Northern Irish artists to win.
answer: Array Collective won the prestigious Turner Prize for their immersive installation "Focal Point," which featured a vibrant, community-oriented mock Irish pub.

formulation: China announces a military budget of 1.11 trillion yuan ($175 billion).
answer: China announced a 8.1% increase in its defense budget for 2018, marking the highest rise in five years.

formulation: US government ends three-day shutdown after an agreement in Congress to extend funding.
answer: Congress passed a bipartisan spending bill that reopened the government and addressed immigration issues, ending the three-day shutdown.
