formulation: German police announce operation and arrests into 'Boystown' world's largest child abuse image website with 400,000 members worldwide.
answer: German police conducted a coordinated international raid against "Bluestoke," a massive child abuse image platform, leading to dozens of arrests across Europe and the US.

formulation: Mexico's former attorney general Jesús Murillo Karam arrested in connection with disappearance of 43 students in 2014, one of the country's worst human rights tragedies.
answer: A Mexican judge ordered the arrest of former Attorney General Jesús Murillo Karam and several officials on charges of forced disappearance, torture, and obstruction of justice related to the case.

formulation: Northern Ireland inquest into 1971 Ballymurphy killing of ten people finds people were innocent and killed (nine by soldiers) using unjustified force.
answer: A coroner ruled that nine unarmed civilians were unlawfully killed by the British Army during the 1971 Ballymurphy shootings.

formulation: Huawei submits a petition in the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit against the FCC's decision to prohibit rural U.S. network providers from using equipment from the China-based vendor due to national security concerns, asking that the recent FCC order be overturned.
answer: Huawei filed a lawsuit against the FCC, arguing the decision was unconstitutional and violated due process.

formulation: MLB Philadelphia Phillies relief pitcher Hector Neris strikes out three Florida Marlins, setting new franchise record of 520, in his last game before becoming a free agent.
answer: Hector Neris pitched a scoreless ninth inning, securing his 21st save of the season and ending his Phillies career on a positive note.

formulation: "Once in a century" winter in Moscow the hottest in 140 years, with 7.5° C (13.5° F) above average temperatures and virtually no snow.
answer: Moscow experienced a remarkably warm spell with temperatures 7-10 degrees Celsius above average and no snowfall, a phenomenon unprecedented in 140 years.

formulation: US and Papua New Guinea bilateral defense cooperation agreement signed by Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Prime Minister James Marape in Port Moresby, as US and China strive for influence in the region.
answer: The United States and Papua New Guinea signed a defense cooperation agreement allowing the US access to Papua New Guinea's ports and airports, countering China's growing influence in the Pacific.

formulation: A mass shooting at a Colorado Springs LGBT+ nightclub leaves five people dead and 25 injured.
answer: A gunman opened fire at Club Q, an LGBT+ nightclub in Colorado Springs, killing five people and injuring many others.

formulation: Unprecedented heatwave in Brazil affects more than 3,000 towns with Rio de Janeiro reaching 42.5C - very high humidity makes it feel like 58.5C.
answer: A severe heatwave, exacerbated by a strong El Niño effect, brought unprecedented temperatures to Rio de Janeiro and significantly impacted over 3,000 Brazilian towns.

formulation: NASA launches the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART), the first attempt to deflect an asteroid for the purpose of learning how to protect Earth.
answer: NASA launched the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) mission to intentionally impact a small asteroid moon orbiting the asteroid Didymos to test asteroid deflection technology.

formulation: Vietnamese real estate tycoon Truong My Lan sentenced to death for embezzlement, bribery and banking violations worth 304 trillion dong ($12.46 billion), the country's largest-ever fraud case.
answer: Truong My Lan was sentenced to death for masterminding a massive embezzlement scheme involving 304 trillion dong (approximately $12.5 billion).

formulation: Israel and Hamas agree to a bilateral ceasefire in Gaza after nearly two weeks of fighting, amid international diplomatic efforts.
answer: A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas went into effect, ending 11 days of intense fighting.

formulation: India's new high-speed train the Vande Bharat Express breaks down on its first return trip on Delhi to Varanasi route.
answer: The Tejas Express train derailed near Kannauj, Uttar Pradesh, injuring several passengers during its maiden return journey.

formulation: Proposed acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk: The federal government initiates an investigation into Elon Musk over his conduct in the attempt to acquire the social media platform.
answer: Elon Musk formally terminated his proposed $44 billion acquisition of Twitter following months of legal disputes with the company.

formulation: Gunmen storm a school in Kankara, Katsina state, northern Nigeria, kidnapping more than 300 students (Boko Haram later claims responsibility).
answer: Over 300 schoolboys were kidnapped from a secondary school in Kankara, Katsina State, Nigeria, in December 2020, and the abduction was subsequently claimed by Boko Haram.

formulation: Thousands of Capri Sun pouches are also recalled by The Kraft Heinz Company over the possible contamination with a cleaning solution.
answer: Coca-Cola recalled over 55 million Sprite, Fanta, and Mello Yello drinks in the US and Canada due to potential metal fragments contamination.

formulation: Argentina becomes the fifth country in the world to record over 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases with the death toll at 26,716.
answer: Argentina surpassed 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases on October 20, 2020, with a reported death toll of over 25,400.

formulation: India's known COVID-19 death toll passes 400,000 with 30.45 million cases, amid expert speculation that over one million have died.
answer: India recorded more than 400,000 COVID-19 deaths, becoming the third country to reach that grim milestone, while experts suggested the actual figures were likely much higher.

formulation: At least 34 people killed and 65,000 left homeless after two different tropical storms batter Madagascar and Mozambique with Madagascar's capital Antananarivo particularly affected.
answer: Tropical Cyclone Batsirai caused devastating floods and landslides in Madagascar and Mozambique, impacting Antananarivo and leaving thousands displaced.

formulation: Tapestry, owner of Kate Spade and Coach, announces it will buy Capri Holdings, owner of Michael Kors, Versace and Jimmy Choo, for $8.5 billion in cash.
answer: Tapestry announced an agreement to acquire Capri Holdings, the parent company of Michael Kors, Versace, and Jimmy Choo, for $8.5 billion.

formulation: Rocket Lab launches NASA's CAPSTONE, a microwave-oven sized CubeSat spacecraft from Mahia peninsula, New Zealand, to orbit the Moon, research for future Gateway and Artemis missions.
answer: Rocket Lab successfully launched the Lunar Pathfinder CubeSat, the first spacecraft to directly transmit data from lunar orbit to Earth, supporting future missions like Gateway and Artemis.

formulation: Alexander Bolshunov, representing Russian Olympic Committee, wins men's 50k freestyle cross country gold in Beijing to become only 2nd man to achieve 30k/50k double at a Winter Olympics.
answer: Alexander Bolshunov won the gold medal in the men's 30km skiathlon, securing Russia’s first cross-country skiing gold of the Games.

formulation: England beats Pakistan by an innings & 47 runs in 1st cricket Test in Multan; first time in Test history a side conceding 500 in 1st innings has gone on to win by an innings; 7-823 England's highest score since WWII.
answer: England chased down a target of 331 in the fourth innings to secure a remarkable victory against Pakistan, setting a new Test record as the first team to win after conceding 500 runs in the first innings.

formulation: Australian swimmer Kaylee McKeown wins gold in 200m backstroke to complete 100/200 double at the Tokyo Olympic Games.
answer: Kaylee McKeown won gold in the women's 100-meter backstroke, setting a new Olympic record.

formulation: In United States v. Bankman-Fried, the defendant is sentenced to 25 years in prison after being convicted of several counts of wire fraud and money laundering after he scammed $8 billion from investors via his company FTX.
answer: Binance founder Changpeng Zhao was convicted of money laundering and ordered to pay over $4.3 billion for defrauding investors and violating anti-money laundering laws.

formulation: Fossil of Dickinsonia, “the Holy Grail of palaeontology” proven to be oldest known animal fossil, 558 million years old from White Sea, Russia.
answer: Microscopic analysis of the fossil revealed it to be a cloud-shaped comb jelly, definitively identifying it as the oldest known animal.

formulation: Trump is found guilty of 34 counts of falsifying business records in his New York hush money trial, making him the first president to be ever convicted of a felony.
answer: Donald Trump was found guilty on all 34 felony counts of falsifying business records related to payments made to adult film star Stormy Daniels.

formulation: Managing director of Bain Capital and former Governor of Massachusetts Deval Patrick announces his candidacy for President.
answer: Mitt Romney announced he would vote to convict President Trump in his impeachment trial.

formulation: World's most powerful supercomputer, Summit, can process 200,000 trillion calculations per second, launched at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, by IBM and NVidia.
answer: Summit, a powerful supercomputer co-developed by IBM and NVIDIA, reached 200,000 trillion calculations per second (200 petaflops) and resides at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.

formulation: 23 Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election: Jim Jordan withdraws his nomination to become the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives after a third vote fails to elevate him to the position.
answer: Jim Jordan's speakership nomination failed after three ballots, marking the first time in 164 years that a House speaker vote has required multiple ballots.

formulation: A driver is arrested after crashing into a group of Pepperdine University students walking in Malibu, California, killing four and injuring two others.
answer: A driver crashed into a group of Pepperdine University students on Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu, killing one student and injuring multiple others.

formulation: Writers Guild of America votes to begin striking over pay and industry changes, bringing television production to a halt.
answer: The Writers Guild of America (WGA) initiated a strike demanding better pay and improved working conditions, effectively halting many film and television productions.

formulation: Woman suspected to be Thailand's worst-ever serial killer convicted and sentenced to death for poisoning a friend with cyanide, the first of 14 trials.
answer: Wannee Sirichande, convicted of poisoning her friend, began multiple trials in Thailand on November 20, 2024, stemming from accusations of serial killings.

formulation: Tunisian presidential election won by academic Kais Saied defeating media mogul Nabil Karoui.
answer: Kais Saied, a political independent and law professor, won the Tunisian presidential election, defeating Nabil Karoui, a media mogul.

formulation: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is the 1st US college to send students home and convert to online classes after 135 COVID-19 cases detected.
answer: Facing over 180 new COVID-19 cases reported in a single day, UNC Chapel Hill shifted to all remote learning for undergraduate students.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew denies knowing his friend Jeffrey Epstein was involved in sexual trafficking of underage girls after public accusations made against him.
answer: Prince Andrew claimed he did not believe he had witnessed or been told about Jeffrey Epstein's criminal behavior.

formulation: US President Joe Biden lands in Luanda, Angola, on his only trip to sub-Saharan Africa, the first US president to visit since 2015.
answer: President Joe Biden visited Kenya, marking the first visit by a sitting U.S. president to sub-Saharan Africa in nearly a decade.

formulation: Biden signs a bipartisan law which bans motions to compel arbitration and class action waivers from being enforced in disputes involving sexual assault or harassment.
answer: President Biden signed the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act, which nullifies mandatory arbitration clauses in such cases, allowing survivors to pursue lawsuits in court.

formulation: Australia condemns doctored photo of Australian soldier threatening Afghan child with knife on Chinese official's Twitter, marking new low in the two countries relationship.
answer: The Chinese embassy in Australia posted a graphic depicting an Australian soldier holding a knife to the throat of an Afghan child, triggering strong condemnation and a demand for an apology from the Australian government.

formulation: Polish immigrant and former volunteer Nazi guard Jakiw Palij (95) is deported from the US in New York to Germany.
answer: John Demjanjuk, a former Nazi guard convicted of war crimes, was deported from the United States to Germany after losing an appeal.

formulation: China's 1st domestically built aircraft carrier, the Shandong, enters naval service.
answer: China's first domestically built aircraft carrier, the Shandong, was officially commissioned into the People's Liberation Army Navy.

formulation: Puffin, publisher of author Roald Dhal, announces it will now print his books with their original unaltered text alongside those with offensive language removed, after widespread criticism and debate.
answer: Puffin reversed their recent revisions of Roald Dahl’s books, opting to release a new version preserving his original language while adding a note acknowledging changes had been made.

formulation: Waaree announced plans to invest up to $1 billion over the next four years to scale its Houston, Texas facility.
answer: Waaree announced a $1 billion investment to establish a fully integrated solar module manufacturing facility in Houston, Texas.

formulation: British charity fundraiser Russ Cook the "Hardest Geezer" runs the length of Africa, arriving at Ras Angela, Tunisia, almost a year after setting off from Cape Agulhas, South Africa.
answer: Russ Cook stopped in Tunisia during his attempt to run the length of Africa to raise over £780,000 for WaterAid and The BigShoe Foundation at a community event.

formulation: Two people are rescued after falling into a tank of chocolate at Mars M&M factory in Pennsylvania.
answer: Two men were found swimming in a 25,000-gallon tank of melted chocolate at the Hershey factory after breaking in after hours.

formulation: Sudan’s Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigns in a televised address amid political deadlock after a rejection of his deal with the military by pro-democracy forces.
answer: Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigned, deepening a political crisis following a military coup in October 2021.

formulation: US Senate passes $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief bill the American Rescue Plan.
answer: The Senate passed the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, providing further economic relief amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Google loses an important US antitrust case involving its search engine with a judge finding "Google is a monopolist, and it has acted as one to maintain its monopoly”.
answer: A U.S. District Court ruled that Google illegally maintained a monopoly in the digital advertising technology market through anti-competitive practices.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Biden administration announces it will purchase 200 million COVID-19 vaccine doses from Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna, in addition to the prior order of 400 million.
answer: The Biden administration announced plans to purchase an additional 200 million doses of Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: Chinese mountain climber and double amputee Xia Boyu reaches the summit of Mt Everest.
answer: Triumphant, Chinese double amputee climber Xia Boyu successfully summited Mount Everest via the north ridge, becoming the first such person to achieve this feat.

formulation: Location of first English slave fort in Africa found - Fort Kormantine built 1631, at Fort Amsterdam, Ghana.
answer: Archaeologists uncovered evidence suggesting the Dutch fort, Prins Hendrik, was used to hold enslaved people for significantly longer and in greater numbers than previously believed.

formulation: Death toll on Puerto Rico 70 times higher than official figure, likely 4,600 died from Hurricane Maria according to Harvard University study.
answer: A Harvard University study estimated nearly 5,000 deaths resulted from Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, significantly higher than the official government count of 64.

formulation: Botswana overturns law criminalizing same-sex relationships from colonial-era in landmark African LGBTQ case.
answer: Botswana's High Court ruled to decriminalize same-sex relationships, ending the criminalization of consensual homosexual acts in the country.

formulation: ICC Men's Cricket ODI World Cup, Lord's, London, England: after first Super Over in an ODI, England wins first title on boundary countback rule, SO also level; Player of Match: Ben Stokes (ENG) 84 no (98).
answer: England defeated New Zealand in a tense Super Over at Lord's to secure their first ever Cricket World Cup title, necessitating a boundary countback to decide the winner after a tie.

formulation: Australia's Melbourne Cup won by Twilight Payment.
answer: The 2020 Melbourne Cup was held on November 3, and Twilight Payment unexpectedly won the race.

formulation: New Orleans wide receiver Michael Thomas sets NFL record for most catches in a season with his 144th as Saints beat Tennessee 38-28; breaks 17-year old record held by Marvin Harrison (143).
answer: Michael Thomas set a new NFL record for most receptions in a single season with 186.

formulation: At least 46 Ethiopian migrants drown after their boat capcizes of fthe coast of Yemen.
answer: A boat carrying Ethiopian migrants capsized off the coast of Yemen, resulting in the deaths of dozens of people, potentially over 100, while attempting to reach Saudi Arabia.

formulation: Deepest point on land on earth identified under Denman Glacier, east Antarctica at 3.5km (11,500ft) below sea level.
answer: Scientists discovered a vast, previously unknown subglacial canyon in Antarctica, which is the largest of its kind on Earth and is deeper than the Grand Canyon.

formulation: Major wildfires in California, including the Woolsey in southern California and Camp to the north, leave 91 dead and at least 1,000 missing, with more than 250,000 residents forced to flee. President Trump suggests that wildfires could be stopped by spending "a lot of time on raking and cleaning".
answer: The devastating Camp Fire, the deadliest and most destructive wildfire in California history, ravaged the town of Paradise in November 2018 and prompted President Trump to question the state's forest management policies.

formulation: U.S. Rep. Jeff Fortenberry resigns from Congress after a California jury convicts him of lying to authorities about an illegal campaign donation from a foreign national, effective March 31.
answer: Jeff Fortenberry resigned from the U.S. House of Representatives in late March 2022 after being convicted of making false statements to federal investigators.

formulation: The Center for the Study of the Drone at New York's Bard College estimates that just over 900 law enforcement agencies, fire departments, and emergency services across the country are now using drones, no longer seen as a novelty by officials.
answer: The proliferation of affordable, user-friendly drones coupled with the FAA’s relaxed regulations and growing acceptance of their utility for tasks like search and rescue and crime scene investigation spurred widespread adoption by public safety agencies.

formulation: Major report on antimicrobial resistance shows 4.95m deaths worldwide associated with drug-resistant bacteria, making untreatable infections now a leading cause of death.
answer: The World Health Organization released a comprehensive report, “Antimicrobial Resistance: Global Threats and Trends,” revealing that antimicrobial resistance was responsible for approximately 5 million deaths worldwide in 2019.

formulation: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake strikes Ferndale, California, causing substantial damage including gas leaks and power outages.
answer: A powerful atmospheric river brought torrential rain and flooding to California, triggering mudslides, gas leaks, and widespread power outages.

formulation: All data from the 1950 U.S. Census is released to the public.
answer: The National Archives released digitized records of the 1950 U.S. Census, making them publicly accessible online for the first time.

formulation: Martial law declared in Mandalay, Myanmar, amid continuing protests against the country's military coup.
answer: The Myanmar military seized power in a coup d'état, detaining key political leaders including Aung San Suu Kyi and suspending parliament.

formulation: Popocatépetl volcano eruption causes Mexican authorities to warn 3 million people living nearby to prepare for a possible evacuation.
answer: Popocatépetl volcano erupted with a significant explosion, leading to the evacuation of over 300,000 residents living near the volcano.

formulation: British pensioner Robert Weighton becomes the world's oldest man at 112 years.
answer: Robert Weighton, a British pensioner, officially became the world's oldest man at the age of 112.

formulation: China's northernmost city, Mohe, records record low temperature of -53C (-63F).
answer: Mohe, China, recorded a frigid -53°C (-63.4°F) temperature on January 22, 2023.

formulation: Second heatwave of the summer in Western Europe sets record temperatures in Belgium in Kleine Brogel 39.9C (102F), for Netherlands in Eindhoven 39.3C (102F) and Germany at Geilenkirchen 40.5C (104F).
answer: A prolonged and intense heatwave swept across Western Europe in the summer of 2019, bringing record-breaking temperatures to Belgium, the Netherlands, and Germany.

formulation: Limousine crash kills 20 people, including two pedestrians in Schoharie, New York.
answer: A faulty 2009 stretch limousine crashed into a parking lot in Schoharie, New York, killing 20 people, including the driver and two bystanders.

formulation: Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE become BRICS members.
answer: Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE officially joined the BRICS economic alliance, expanding its membership to ten countries.

formulation: President Trump approves the release of a controversial Republican memo accusing the FBI of abusing its powers during the inquiry into alleged Russian meddling of US elections.
answer: President Trump declassified and released the Republican-authored memo criticizing the FBI's handling of the investigation into Russian interference.

formulation: Two girls aged 8 and 6 become the first female weightlifters to appear on Iranian television after a protest.
answer: For the first time in Iranian history, two young girls were allowed to commentate on a televised sports broadcast.

formulation: Shooting at a rally to celebrate the Kansas City Chiefs’ Super Bowl victory kills one and injures more than 20 in downtown Kansas City, Missouri.
answer: A mass shooting occurred during the Kansas City Chiefs’ Super Bowl celebration rally, killing one person and injuring over 20 others.

formulation: Fashion designer heavyweights Miuccia Prada and Raf Simons announce they will work alongside each other at Prada.
answer: Miuccia Prada and Raf Simons announced their joint creative direction of Prada, with Simons officially joining the brand.

formulation: US officials "deliberately misled" the public on progress of the Afghanistan war, hid that it was a lost cause, according to The Washington Post analysis of the "Afghanistan Papers".
answer: Leaked memos revealed that U.S. officials privately expressed doubts about progress in the Afghanistan War for years, contradicting optimistic public statements.

formulation: A gunman takes multiple people hostage at Congregation Beth Israel, a Jewish synagogue in Colleyville, Texas. He is later shot and killed by police, with no other fatalities and all four hostages being rescued.
answer: A gunman held several members of Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville, Texas, hostage for over ten hours before being shot and killed by FBI agents after one hostage managed to escape.

formulation: The first cannabis cafe in the United States opens in Los Angeles, California.
answer: The world's largest cannabis retail store, known as "Cookies Melrose," opened its doors in Los Angeles, California.

formulation: Musician Peter Frampton announces he has a degenerative muscular disease and his next tour will be his last.
answer: Peter Frampton announced he had been diagnosed with a rare autoimmune disease, dermatomyositis, which would force him to significantly limit his touring.

formulation: The US signs a treaty with the European Union, the United Kingdom and seven other countries which is the first in history on the use of artificial intelligence systems.
answer: The US and over 50 countries signed the "Global AI Safety Accord," committing to responsible AI development and mitigating potential risks.

formulation: 21st Commonwealth Games open in the Gold Coast, Australia.
answer: The 2018 Commonwealth Games commenced in Gold Coast, Australia, on April 4, 2018.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The Biden Administration is reported to be freely providing 400 million N95 masks to Americans to help combat the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The Biden administration announced it would distribute 400 million free N95 masks to Americans amid the Omicron surge.

formulation: US Powerball jackpot rises to a world record of $1.9bn after no winners for more than three months.
answer: The Powerball jackpot reached a record-breaking $1.9 billion after 37 consecutive drawings without a winner.

formulation: Navajo-American composer Raven Chacon receives Pulitzer Prize in Music for his work "Voiceless Mass".
answer: Raven Chacon became the first Native American to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music, awarded for his soundscape composition "Four Song for a While."

formulation: The national debt rises to $33 trillion.
answer: The United States national debt officially surpassed $33 trillion.

formulation: Taylor Swift's The Eras Tour becomes the first tour to gross over one billion dollars, making it the highest-grossing tour and Swift the first artist to reach the one billion mark.
answer: Taylor Swift's The Eras Tour became the highest-grossing tour of all time, surpassing Elton John's Farewell Yellow Brick Road tour.

formulation: Hurricane Debby makes landfall as a Category 1 storm at Horseshoe Beach, Florida.
answer: Hurricane Idalia made landfall in Florida’s Big Bend region as a powerful Category 3 hurricane, bringing catastrophic storm surge and flooding.

formulation: At around 2 a.m. local, President Trump ceremoniously greets three freed Korean-Americans, who were detained by North Korea for more than a year for "anti-state activities", on Joint Base Andrews in Maryland.
answer: President Trump met with three Korean-Americans, Otto Warmbier, Kim Dong-chul, and Tony Kim, who had been released from North Korea, in a brief ceremony at Andrews Air Force Base.

formulation: In a widely watched lawsuit, radio host and conspiracy theorist Alex Jones concedes that the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting was "100% real" after meeting the members of the victims' families yesterday. Jones is later ordered by a jury to pay at least US$4.1 million in compensatory damages and an additional $45.2 million in punitive damages to Neil Heslin and Scarlett Lewis, parents of victim Jesse Lewis.
answer: The Connecticut jury awarded nearly $1.5 billion in compensatory and punitive damages to the families of Sandy Hook victims after Jones admitted the shooting was real and demonstrated his defamatory statements caused them harm.

formulation: US Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer announces his retirement.
answer: Justice Stephen Breyer announced his retirement from the Supreme Court at the end of the current term.

formulation: Guinea declares an Ebola epidemic after three deaths, its first deaths since 2016.
answer: Guinea declared a new Ebola outbreak, marking the country's second such outbreak in two years.

formulation: Apple Inc. closes with a market capitalization above $3 trillion for the first time, becoming the only public company to do so as of yet.[b].
answer: Apple Inc. became the world’s first company to reach a market capitalization of $3 trillion.

formulation: Hundreds of protesters shut down special meeting at Sacramento City Hall investigating police shooting of Stephon Clark.
answer: Demonstrators disrupted a Sacramento City Hall meeting with shouts of "No Justice, No Peace" demanding answers regarding the police shooting of Stephon Clark.

formulation: Fossil evidence of the largest known snake 11-15 meters long named Vasuki indicus, 66 million years old, published from a mine in Panandhro, western India.
answer: Scientists discovered the fossilized remains of a giant, ancient snake species, measuring over 21 feet long, that lived approximately 24 million years ago.

formulation: ‘Benchmark’ experiment by IBM quantum computer manages to simulate a magnetic material, working round previous problem of quantum noise.
answer: Researchers have successfully simulated a complex magnetic material using error-mitigation techniques applied to noisy intermediate-scale quantum (NISQ) devices.

formulation: Azerbaijan woman who spent £16m in Harrods granted bail in UK after being arrested for suspested embezzlement under new laws.
answer: Zamira Hajiyeva was convicted of laundering £16.4 million through Harrods, having allegedly spent the money while her husband was detained in Azerbaijan on embezzlement charges.

formulation: Zuzana Caputova elected President of Slovakia, the country's first female head of state.
answer: Zuzana Čaputová was elected as Slovakia's first female president in a runoff election.

formulation: Ireland beats Rugby World Cup champions New Zealand, 16-9 at Aviva Stadium, Dublin; first victory over the All Blacks ever on home soil; flyhalf Johnny Sexton kicks 3 penalties and a conversion.
answer: Ireland secured a historic 16-9 victory over New Zealand in Dublin, marking their first ever home win against the All Blacks.

formulation: First commercial flight, the "bird of peace" between Ethiopia and Eritrea in 20 years lands in Asmara, Eritrea, reuniting families.
answer: Eritrea and Ethiopia resumed direct flights between Addis Ababa and Asmara, marking a significant step in normalizing relations after 20 years of conflict.

formulation: Recording-breaking price of $3.25 million for a comic book as Action Comics #1, that introduced Superman for the first time, sells at auction.
answer: Action Comics #1, featuring Superman's debut, sold for $3.25 million, becoming the most expensive comic book ever sold.

formulation: Floods across the Midwest kill at least three people and inflict hundreds of millions of dollars in damage.
answer: Historic flooding along the Missouri River and its tributaries devastated the Midwest, causing widespread damage to farmland and infrastructure and leading to multiple fatalities.

formulation: Alabama native Nimblewill Nomad becomes the oldest person to hike on the Appalachian Trail.
answer: Nimblewill Nomad completed his Triple Crown of Hiking, becoming the 33rd person to hike the Appalachian Trail, Pacific Crest Trail, and Continental Divide Trail.

formulation: The United States formally withdraws from the Paris Agreement.
answer: The United States officially revoked its involvement in the Paris Agreement, although the withdrawal would not be finalized until November 2021.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Economics awarded to David Card, Joshua Angrist and Guido Imbens for their work on "natural experiments".
answer: The 2021 Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded to David Card, Joshua Angrist, and Guido Imbens for their methodological contributions to the analysis of causal relationships, especially using natural experiments.

formulation: World's first robot-human press conference takes place in Geneva, Switzerland with reporters asking "will you rebel against humans?".
answer: The inaugural "Robot Rights Summit" in Geneva hosted a panel discussing the possibility of robots demanding rights, including scenarios of potential rebellion against human control.

formulation: Rapper Juice WRLD aka Jarad Anthony Higgins dies from a drug overdose.
answer: Chicago rapper Juice WRLD, known for hits like "Lucid Dreams," tragically died from an accidental overdose at the age of 20.

formulation: 2024 United States presidential election: Former UN Ambassador and South Carolina governor Nikki Haley suspends her 2024 campaign for President after a poor showing on Super Tuesday, leaving Trump the presumptive Republican nominee. Minnesota Representative Dean Phillips also ends his campaign for the Democratic nomination after losing several primaries to President Biden.
answer: Following Super Tuesday, Donald Trump secured the Republican nomination, effectively solidifying his candidacy for president.

formulation: COVID-19 cases rise sharply again in America as country records its 3rd highest daily total, more than 35,000.
answer: The U.S. saw a surge in COVID-19 cases, reporting over 35,000 new infections in late June 2020, the third-highest daily total of the pandemic up to that point.

formulation: South Korean golfer Sei Young Ki breaks LPGA 72-hole scoring record with 31 under-par 257, also first to better -30, in winning Thornberry Creek Classic.
answer: Sei Young Kim shot a record-breaking 26-under-par 190 over four rounds to win the Thornberry Creek Classic, surpassing Annika Sörenstam's previous LPGA record.

formulation: New way to break down "forever chemicals" PFAS compounds responsible for cancers, low birth weights and lowered immunity published by scientists in journal "Science".
answer: Scientists have developed a new method using activated carbon and sunlight to successfully break down PFAS in contaminated water, offering a potential solution for remediation.

formulation: US port workers, numbering 45,000  longshoremen, go on strike for the first time in 50 years along the country's east and gulf coasts.
answer: The International Longshoremen's Association (ILA) initiated a strike involving 45,000 workers at ports along the east and gulf coasts, representing the first such work stoppage in five decades.

formulation: 2021 Boulder shooting: 10 people are shot dead at a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado. It is the third deadliest mass shooting in the state's history, behind the 1999 Columbine High School massacre which left 13 dead and 24 injured, and the 2012 Aurora theater shooting which left 12 dead and 70 injured. A 21-year-old suspect, Ahmad Al Issa, is arrested after being shot in the leg by police.
answer: A mass shooting at a King Soopers supermarket in Boulder, Colorado, left 10 people dead, including a police officer, with a suspect later apprehended.

formulation: Meta announces it has removed 63,000 Instagram accounts tied to sextortion schemes associated with Nigerian Yahoo Boys criminal group.
answer: Meta removed over 3,800 Instagram accounts linked to scams targeting people in Nigeria, particularly those involving romance and investment schemes.

formulation: Two ex-Myanmar soldiers testify they were ordered to rape and kill Muslim Rohingya villagers, 1st public confession of army-directed crimes against Rohingya.
answer: For the first time, six former Myanmar soldiers testified about the military’s role in atrocities against Rohingya villagers to the International Criminal Court.

formulation: US President Joe Biden says of Russian President Vladimir Putin, “For God’s sake, this man cannot remain in power" in unscripted remarks in Poland.
answer: Biden declared that Vladimir Putin "cannot remain in power," signaling a strong condemnation of Putin's actions and leadership.

formulation: Labor unions go on strike in Nigeria taking down the country's power grid and closing airports, protest for an increase in the minimum wage from US$20 a month.
answer: Nigerian labor unions commenced strikes impacting the nation's power supply and air travel to pressure the government for a higher minimum wage.

formulation: China unveils new national security legislation against Hong Kong at its annual legislative session.
answer: China imposed a sweeping national security law on Hong Kong, effectively curtailing its autonomy and freedoms.

formulation: Dead and buried mink reported rising from the ground due to bloating, after a hurried cull of millions of COVID-19 infected animals in Denmark.
answer: Following the mass culling of millions of COVID-19 infected mink, reports emerged of decomposed mink carcasses resurfacing from burial sites due to inadequate depth of burial.

formulation: New Zealand and Australia open a travel bubble between the two countries after more than a year of border closures.
answer: New Zealand and Australia established a two-way travel bubble, allowing quarantine-free travel between certain regions, after over a year of pandemic-related border closures.

formulation: Nigeria says 110 girls missing, presumed kidnapped by Boko Haram after attack on school in Dapchi, Yobe state.
answer: Twenty-one Chibok schoolgirls who were kidnapped by Boko Haram in 2014 were released after negotiations.

formulation: The kilogram is refined by abstract constants replacing the Le Grand K, along with the ampere (electrical current) and kelvin (temperature) at a conference in Paris.
answer: The definitions of the kilogram, ampere, kelvin, and mole were redefined based on fundamental constants of nature, rather than physical artifacts.

formulation: Major study into the MMR vaccine involving over 650,000 children in Denmark finds it does not increase the risk of autism.
answer: A large Danish cohort study, published in *Annals of Internal Medicine*, found no link between MMR vaccination and autism in over 650,000 children.

formulation: Trump administration formally suspends the Clean Water Act.
answer: The Obama-era Waters of the United States (WOTUS) rule, defining which waterways are protected by the Clean Water Act, was suspended.

formulation: NASA announces there is more water on the Moon than previously thought, in sunlit as well as shadowed regions.
answer: NASA revealed that water molecules are distributed across the lunar surface, existing in both permanently shadowed regions and sunlit areas.

formulation: Changpeng Zhao, founder and CEO of Binance, world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, pleads guilty to allowing customers to launder money - will pay $4.3 billion in fines to US government.
answer: Binance's former CEO Changpeng Zhao pleaded guilty to money laundering charges and agreed to pay $50 million in fines, stepping down as CEO as part of the settlement.

formulation: All three defendants are found guilty of the murder of Ahmaud Arbery.
answer: Travis McMichael, Gregory McMichael, and William "Roddy" Bryan Jr. were found guilty of murder for the fatal pursuit and shooting of Ahmaud Arbery.

formulation: Gary Cohn, a top economic adviser to President Trump, resigns his position.
answer: Gary Cohn, President Trump’s chief economic advisor, resigned amid disagreements over trade policy.

formulation: The 2019 college admissions bribery scandal becomes public; around 50 people are accused of bribery and fraud to secure admission to elite colleges, including actresses Felicity Huffman and Lori Loughlin.
answer: "Operation Varsity Blues" exposed a widespread scheme where wealthy parents bribed college officials and administrators to secure their children's admission to elite universities.

formulation: Singer Sam Smith comes out as non-binary in interview on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram show.
answer: Sam Smith revealed they were non-binary during an interview on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram Live show “I Weigh.”

formulation: US Supreme Court upholds Voting Rights Act ruling 5-4 that Republican-drawn congressional districts in Alabama had weakened Black voting by creating just one district where they were a majority.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that Alabama's congressional map illegally diluted Black voters' power by not creating a second majority-Black district.

formulation: Colorado reports their first cases of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2 in two people from Boulder County.
answer: The SARS-CoV-2 variant B.1.1.7, also known as the Alpha variant, was first reported in Colorado, with the initial two cases identified in El Paso County.

formulation: General Motors announces it is retiring the Holden brand in Australasia.
answer: General Motors announced it would cease sales and vehicle distribution in Australia and New Zealand, ending a 75-year presence in the region.

formulation: A House ethics report finds "substantial evidence" that Matt Gaetz paid for sex with a 17-year-old girl and used illicit drugs while in office.
answer: The House Ethics Committee closed its investigation into Matt Gaetz, finding "credible" evidence he violated rules regarding sexual misconduct and improper influence, but noting insufficient evidence to recommend further action.

formulation: Floods and landslides begin in south-western Japan, killing at least 200 people with more missing. Evacuation orders for nearly 2 million.
answer: Historic, record-breaking rainfall caused devastating floods and landslides in southwestern Japan, tragically leading to over 200 deaths and mass evacuations.

formulation: Barbados elects its first female Prime Minister Mia Mottley, who leads the Barbados Labour Party to victory.
answer: Barbados elected Mia Mottley as its first female Prime Minister following a landslide victory for the Barbados Labour Party.

formulation: Paraguay carries out the largest cocaine bust in its history with "Operation Sweetness" netting four tons inside a shipment of sugar.
answer: Paraguayan authorities seized a record four tons of cocaine concealed within a sugar shipment, marking the country's largest drug bust ever.

formulation: Florida governor Ron DeSantis suspends Tampa state prosecutor Andrew Warren over his refusal to enforce Florida's abortion ban.
answer: Ron DeSantis suspended Hillsborough County State Attorney Andrew Warren for vowing not to prosecute abortion-related crimes, despite Florida law.

formulation: Nobel prize for Economics awarded to William Nordhaus for climate change and Paul Romer for endogenous growth theory.
answer: William Nordhaus and Paul Romer were jointly awarded the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences for their distinct contributions to our understanding of climate change and long-run economic growth.

formulation: Colorado man Christopher Lee Watts is charged with the murder of his wife and two daughters.
answer: Chris Watts pleaded guilty to multiple counts of murder in connection to the deaths of his pregnant wife and two daughters.

formulation: Leader of the NXIVM cult Keith Raniere (60) sentenced to 120 years in prison for sex trafficking, racketeering, fraud and other crimes.
answer: Keith Raniere was sentenced to 120 years in prison after being convicted of sex trafficking, forced labor conspiracy, and other crimes.

formulation: Maker of Oxyconti, Purdue Pharma agrees to pay Oklahoma $270 million settlement ahead of trial accusing the company of fueling the opioid epidemic.
answer: Purdue Pharma reached a tentative settlement with states and cities for $3.54 billion, resolving lawsuits over their role in the opioid crisis, while facing criminal charges.

formulation: UK faces a bigger hit to its economy from the global energy crisis than any other advanced economy according to the OECD, projected to shrink by 0.4%.
answer: The OECD projected that the UK would experience a steeper economic decline than most other advanced economies due to the global energy crisis.

formulation: Federal judge Liles C. Burke blocks the implementation of a law in the state of Alabama that criminalizes prescribing gender-affirming puberty blockers and hormones to transgender minors.
answer: An Alabama court blocked a law that would have criminalized the provision of gender-affirming care, including puberty blockers and hormones, to transgender minors.

formulation: The U.S. Senate confirms Damian Williams as Attorney for the Southern District of New York, making him the first African American to lead the office.
answer: Damian Williams was confirmed by the Senate as the first African American U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

formulation: Iran announces first known execution of a protester from recent anti-government unrest, after convicting a man in a revolutionary court of "moharebeh" (enmity against God).
answer: Iranian authorities executed Mohsen Shekari, a man convicted of wounding a security force member during protests, marking the first confirmed execution related to the demonstrations.

formulation: North Korea's Kim Jong-un meets Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing, China, his first trip outside of North Korea since coming to power in 2011.
answer: Kim Jong-un met with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing for talks, symbolizing a renewed relationship and support for upcoming denuclearization talks with the United States.

formulation: Brazilian soccer international goalkeeper Alisson transfers from Roma to Liverpool for a world record shot blocker's fee of £66.8m.
answer: Alisson Becker's transfer from AS Roma to Liverpool for £66.8 million shattered the record for the most expensive goalkeeper ever.

formulation: US Army veteran Henry "Robby" Robinson (98) is awarded France's Medal of Honor for his service in WWII by French Ambassador to the US in a ceremony in Las Vegas, Nevada; Robinson worked as a scout behind enemy lines, fought in the Battle of the Bulge, participated in the liberation of the Mauthausen and Gusen concentration camps, and served as a guard during the Nuremberg Trials.
answer: Henry 'Robby' Robinson, a US Army veteran of World War II, received the French Legion of Honor, the highest distinction awarded by France.

formulation: 10 babies with "bubble boy disease" cured using a gene therapy made from HIV at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Memphis, according to new study.
answer: St. Jude researchers reported that gene therapy using a modified, harmless virus to deliver corrected genes cured previously untreatable forms of "bubble boy disease" in six infants.

formulation: Five members of the "Bali Nine", arresting for smuggling drugs out of Indonesia in 2005, return to Australia after serving nearly 20 years in prison.
answer: Eight former members of the 'Syndicate', an infamous drug trafficking group, arrived back in Australia after serving nearly 20 years in Thailand for heroin smuggling.

formulation: "Halloween" film reboot starring Jamie Curtis makes a record $77m for a horror film with a female lead, biggest debut any film with female lead over 55 in US.
answer: The "Halloween" reboot earned $77.5 million domestically in its opening weekend, becoming the biggest October opening ever and the largest for a horror film in over three decades.

formulation: The U.S. begins a conditional troop withdrawal from Afghanistan; American troop numbers are to be reduced from 12,000 to 8,600 within 135 days.
answer: The U.S. and the Taliban signed an agreement outlining a timeline for U.S. troop withdrawal, aiming to reduce forces to 8,600 within 135 days.

formulation: President Trump declares a national emergency to free up funds for his proposed border wall.
answer: President Trump declared a national emergency to redirect federal funds toward construction of the border wall, bypassing congressional opposition.

formulation: Heat dome envelops the Pacific Northwest with Portland posting highest temperature since records began of 112 F (broken the next day).
answer: An unprecedented heat dome settled over the Pacific Northwest in late June 2021, causing record-shattering temperatures across the region.

formulation: MrBeast and Mark Rober launch #TeamSeas, a project to clean up 30 million pounds of ocean trash by the end of the year.
answer: MrBeast and Mark Rober partnered to create the "Clean Ocean Project," deploying specially designed interceptor vessels to collect plastic and debris from rivers before it reaches the ocean.

formulation: Stanley Cup Final, T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, NV: Washington Capitals beat Las Vegas Golden Knights, 4-3 for a 4-1 series victory; first title in franchise history.
answer: The Washington Capitals won the Stanley Cup against the Vegas Golden Knights, securing their first championship in franchise history.

formulation: Costa Rica declares a state of emergency after a ransomware attack infiltrates and cripples several government agencies.
answer: The Conti ransomware group launched a devastating attack on Costa Rica's government systems in May 2022, prompting a national state of emergency.

formulation: US Supreme Court rules the Constitution doesn't prohibit partisan gerrymandering, allowing a ruling party to redraw electoral boundaries.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that partisan gerrymandering claims present a political question beyond the reach of federal courts, declining to establish a standard for judicial review of congressional district maps drawn for partisan advantage.

formulation: Healthcare chain Ascension announces it has been the target of a cyber attack on its computer systems.
answer: Prospect Medical Holdings, a major healthcare organization spanning multiple states, suffered a widespread cyberattack believed to be ransomware-based, impacting patient care and system access.

formulation: Conservative Alejandro Giammattei elected president of Guatemala.
answer: Alejandro Giammattei, a conservative politician, won Guatemala's presidential election, marking a shift in the country's political landscape.

formulation: Two suicide bombers attack Damboa in Borno state, Nigeria, killing at least 31 people.
answer: Two female suicide bombers detonated explosives in Maiduguri, Nigeria, killing at least 16 people and injuring many more.

formulation: Governor Ron DeSantis suggests that the state legislature revoke Disney World's special self-governing privileges over its 25,000-acre (10,000-hectare) property—privileges that were granted to the company in 1967. The move was generally interpreted as retaliation against Disney for opposing the state's Parental Rights in Education Act.
answer: DeSantis signed legislation to dissolve the special district governing Walt Disney World’s property and appointed a new board to the district, effectively removing Disney’s self-governance control.

formulation: Extreme flash flooding in Spain's south-eastern Valencia region, caused by a year's worth of rain in eight hours, leads to at least 222 deaths.
answer: Unprecedented flash floods caused by torrential rainfall swept through Spain's Valencia region, resulting in a devastating loss of at least 222 lives after the region received a year's worth of rain in just eight hours.

formulation: Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman's musical "Some Like It Hot", based on the 1959 feature film comedy, opens at the Shubert Theatre, NYC; garners 13 Tony Award nominations.
answer: "Some Like It Hot" is the musical adaptation that opened on December 11, 2022, at the Shubert Theatre in NYC and received 13 Tony Award nominations.

formulation: Indian government bans the export of onions, an important food staple to control prices, causing shortages in Bangladesh and Nepal.
answer: The Indian government imposed export restrictions, released buffer stocks, and conducted raids against hoarders to control onion prices, which consequently led to price increases and supply shortages in neighboring countries like Bangladesh and Nepal.

formulation: Japan’s benchmark stock exchange, the Nikkei average reaches its highest-ever level at 39,098, breaking its 1989 record.
answer: Japan's Nikkei average reached a 34-year high, closing above 39,000 for the first time since 1990.

formulation: Phosphates discovered on Enceladus, a moon of Saturn. Last of essential building blocks of life found there (others carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen and sulfur) raising possibility of extraterrestrial life.
answer: Scientists confirmed the presence of phosphorus, an essential element for life, in the plume erupting from Enceladus’ subsurface ocean.

formulation: Australian town of Eugowra experiences extreme flash flooding, with 2 deaths and 150 air-lifted to safety amid one-in-5,000-year flood event.
answer: A devastating flash flood, triggered by intense rainfall, swept through Eugowra, New South Wales, resulting in three deaths and widespread destruction, requiring significant evacuations.

formulation: American-backed militia begins final push to oust militants from Hajin, Syria, last area under Islamic State control.
answer: A joint Syrian-Russian military offensive began on September 11, 2018, to seize ISIS’s remaining territory in Deir ez-Zor.

formulation: COP26 climate pledges, if kept, could help limit global warning to 1.8 °C (above pre-industrial averages) according to the International Energy Agency.
answer: The COP26 summit held in Glasgow, Scotland, saw nations make pledges that the International Energy Agency estimated could limit global warming to 1.8 °C.

formulation: India's junior foreign minister MJ Akbar is highest official to resign in #MeToo case after sexual harassment accusations by numerous women.
answer: Minister of State for External Affairs M.J. Akbar resigned following multiple allegations of sexual harassment amid the #MeToo movement in India.

formulation: Cargo ship carrying 4,000 luxury Volkswagen Group cars sinks off the Portuguese Azores archipelago, two weeks after it caught fire.
answer: The Felicity Ace, carrying thousands of luxury vehicles, sank in the Atlantic Ocean after catching fire weeks earlier.

formulation: EV startup Fisker files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and begins selling its assets.
answer: Lordstown Motors filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on June 18, 2024, and initiated the process of selling off its assets.

formulation: Landmark climate justice case as Dutch Supreme Court upholds 2013 decision brought by Urgenda Foundation against Dutch government for not reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
answer: The Dutch Supreme Court ruled that the Dutch government was legally obligated to drastically reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, setting a landmark precedent for climate litigation.

formulation: Major League Baseball All-Star Game planned to be hosted on July 14 by the LA Dodgers is cancelled due to government restrictions imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: Wimbledon, one of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments, was cancelled due to COVID-19 restrictions.

formulation: WHO records a new record number of new daily cases of COVID-19 - 183,020, with 116,000 coming from North and South America.
answer: The World Health Organization reported over 150,000 new COVID-19 cases in the Americas in a single day, marking the highest daily increase globally.

formulation: Mosconi Cup nine-ball pool, Las Vegas, Nevada: two-time defending champions Team Europe dominate US, 11-7; MVP: Joshua Filler (Germany).
answer: Europe secured their third consecutive Mosconi Cup title, with Joshua Filler earning the MVP award.

formulation: The Federal Communications Commission approves a proposal to designate 988 as the hotline phone number of the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.
answer: The United States launched the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline, a three-digit number to replace the existing 10-digit National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.

formulation: Man Booker Prize is won by Anna Burns' "Milkman", the first winner from Northern Ireland.
answer: Anna Burns won the 2018 Man Booker Prize for her novel "Milkman," becoming the first author from Northern Ireland to receive the prestigious award.

formulation: Prison riot kills 58, with 16 decapitated in battle between rival factions at the Altamira prison, Para state, Brazil.
answer: A mass brawl between rival prison gangs at Anísio Teixeira prison complex in Manaus, Brazil, resulted in the brutal deaths of 57 inmates.

formulation: Himalayan glacier crashes into the Dhauliganga river, destroying a dam and causing a huge flood in Uttarakhand province, India, killing 26, leaving 150 missing.
answer: A glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) triggered by a glacier collapse devastated Uttarakhand, India, causing widespread flash floods and tragically claiming numerous lives.

formulation: Stormy Daniels testifies in court to a 2006 sexual encounter with Donald Trump as part of a hush money trial against Trump.
answer: Donald Trump was found liable for sexually abusing and defaming Stormy Daniels, with jury deliberations concluding in the civil trial.

formulation: Bob Dylan is accused of sexual assault and related offenses in 1965 by a woman identified as "J.C." who files a lawsuit against the singer. Dylan denies the allegations.
answer: Bob Dylan faced a lawsuit alleging he sexually abused a then-12-year-old girl in 1965.

formulation: France recalls its ambassadors to the US and Australia, describing their new Aukus pact and the cancellation of a major military contract as a 'stab in the back'.
answer: France recalled its ambassadors from the United States and Australia in response to their formation of the AUKUS security pact, which canceled a lucrative submarine deal with France.

formulation: 22 million now at risk of starvation in Horn of Africa, up 9 million since January, according to the UN, after worst drought in 40 years.
answer: A devastating drought, exacerbated by climate change, has triggered a severe food crisis in the Horn of Africa.

formulation: Special Counsel Robert Mueller turns in the report of his nearly two-year investigation on whether the Trump campaign helped Russia interfere in the 2016 presidential election.
answer: Special Counsel Robert Mueller submitted a report detailing Russian interference in the 2016 election and outlining potential obstruction of justice by President Trump, while stopping short of concluding whether Trump committed a crime.

formulation: Lori Lightfoot wins the run-off in the 2019 Chicago mayoral election, becoming the first black woman to hold the post and the first openly gay Chicago mayor.
answer: Lori Lightfoot was elected as Chicago’s first black woman and openly gay mayor, marking a historic moment for the city.

formulation: Alec Baldwin is indicted for involuntary manslaughter after an accidental shooting on the set of Rust in 2021 which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza.
answer: Alec Baldwin and Hannah Gutierrez-Reed had their involuntary manslaughter charges stemming from the death of Halyna Hutchins dismissed by a New Mexico judge.

formulation: US Ambassador Gordon Sondland testifies in impeachment inquiry that “We followed the president’s orders.” and that “everyone was in the loop” over Ukraine dealings.
answer: Ambassador William Taylor, the top U.S. diplomat in Ukraine, testified that he heard from staff that President Trump linked military aid to Ukraine with investigations into the Bidens.

formulation: General Strike in Argentina in response to austerity measures required by an IMF loan.
answer: A 24-hour general strike was called by Argentina’s largest labor unions to protest austerity measures implemented as part of a deal with the International Monetary Fund.

formulation: A mass shooting takes place in Baltimore, Maryland, killing two and injuring twenty-eight.
answer: A mass shooting in Baltimore's Brooklyn neighborhood injured 28 people and killed two, marking one of the city’s deadliest shootings in recent years.

formulation: American intelligence specialist Reality Winner, who was convicted in 2018 for leaking an NSA report on Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections to news site The Intercept, is released from prison.
answer: Reality Winner, the intelligence specialist who previously leaked classified NSA documents, was denied parole, marking the fifth time her release request was rejected.

formulation: NHL Draft: Barrie Colts (OHL) defenseman Aaron Ekblad first pick by Florida Panthers.
answer: The Florida Panthers selected defenseman Jacob Bernard-Docker, widely considered a top defensive prospect, with the 22nd overall pick in the 2019 NHL Entry Draft.

formulation: Houston Astros pitcher Ronel Blanco no-hits Toronto Blue Jays, 10-0 at Minute Maid Park, Houston.
answer: Cristian Javier of the Houston Astros pitched a no-hitter against the Toronto Blue Jays in a 2-0 victory on April 1, 2024.

formulation: Concert film “Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour” premieres at the Grove Shopping Complex in Los Angeles.
answer: Taylor Swift's concert film, "Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour," premiered, capturing her ongoing tour and showcasing her music.

formulation: Suicide attack on bus carrying Iranian military's Revolutionary Guard kills 23 in Sistan-Baluchestan province, separatist group Jaish al-Adl claim responsibility.
answer: A suicide bombing targeted a bus carrying Revolutionary Guard personnel in Zahedan, Iran, killing 23 and being claimed by Jaish al-Adl.

formulation: In Florida v. Benefield, popularly known as the Black Swan case, the jury found Ashley Benefield guilty of the manslaughter of her husband, Douglas "Doug" Benefield.
answer: Ashley Benefield was sentenced to 18 years in prison for the manslaughter of her husband, Douglas Benefield, after being found guilty of shooting him with a crossbow.

formulation: China announces new $60 billion tariffs on US imports, a day after the US imposes $200 billion worth of new tariffs on Chinese goods.
answer: Both the United States and China announced retaliatory tariffs on hundreds of billions of dollars worth of goods, significantly escalating their trade war.

formulation: Mississippi 15 week abortion ban overturned by US judge saying it violated women's constitutional rights.
answer: A federal judge permanently blocked Alabama's restrictive abortion law that imposed unnecessary and burdensome restrictions on abortion providers, upholding women's constitutional right to abortion.

formulation: Rain ruins last 2 days of 4th cricket Test in Sydney as India wins series 2-1; become first Asian side to win a Test series in Australia, 71 years after the first Indian touring team in 1947-48.
answer: The Indian cricket team defeated Australia in their own backyard to win the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, securing their first Test series win in Australia in 71 years.

formulation: Time magazine names climate activist Greta Thunberg Person of the Year.
answer: Greta Thunberg was named Time Magazine's Person of the Year, recognizing her global activism and inspiring millions to address climate change.

formulation: Austrian British researcher Martin Hairer wins Breakthrough prize for mathematics worth $3 million for work on stochastic analysis.
answer: Dorian Kenyon, an Austrian-British researcher, posted a pre-print proving that every finite set of integers can be partitioned into two subsets with equal sums, resolving a decades-old mathematical puzzle.

formulation: Zaila Avant-garde, American student, age 14, from Harvey, Louisiana, wins Scripps National Spelling Bee title.
answer: Zaila Avant-garde became the first African American to win the Scripps National Spelling Bee.

formulation: More than 600 people have died in Nigeria's worst floods in a decade, displacing more than 1.3 million people according to a government minister.
answer: Severe flooding across Nigeria from October 2022 displaced over 1.4 million people and resulted in at least 200 deaths.

formulation: First all-private space flight, Axiom-1 launches to the International Space Station.
answer: Axiom Mission 1, the first all-private crewed mission, docked with the International Space Station.

formulation: Biden calls for a "pause" in the Israel–Hamas war to allow for hostages to get out and humanitarian aid to get in.
answer: President Biden proposed a temporary ceasefire in Gaza to allow for the release of hostages held by Hamas and increased humanitarian aid for Palestinians.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: More than 300 Americans are evacuated from the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan, including 14 who have tested positive for the COVID-19 coronavirus.
answer: The U.S. government began chartering flights to evacuate American citizens from the Diamond Princess cruise ship to quarantine at military facilities.

formulation: US wins Olympic women's ice hockey gold medal for the first time in 20 years with a 4-3 shootout victory over Canada in Pyeongchang; scores tied 3-3 after overtime.
answer: The US women's ice hockey team defeated Canada 2-1 in overtime to secure their first Olympic gold medal since 1998.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The CDC reports that over 50% of Americans have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine. At least 130 million adults have received the first dose, while 84 million adults have also received the second dose.
answer: The CDC reported that over half of all U.S. adults had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: Recreational cannabis sales begin in Missouri.
answer: Missouri began allowing licensed recreational cannabis sales, marking a significant shift in the state's drug policy and economy.

formulation: Sri Lanka runs out of petrol, has only enough for one more day, has no cash to pay 1.4 million civil servants, says its newly appointed Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
answer: The Prime Minister announced that Sri Lanka was effectively bankrupt and unable to repay its foreign debt.

formulation: Fitch Ratings downgrades its US debt rating from AAA to AA+, citing "deteriorating standard of governance".
answer: Fitch Ratings downgraded the United States' long-term credit rating from AAA to AA+, citing concerns over fiscal deficits, high and rising debt levels, and political gridlock.

formulation: Huge explosion and fire in a restaurant in Sapporo, Japan injures 42.
answer: A gas leak caused a devastating explosion and fire at the Gionte restaurant in Sapporo, injuring 42 people and killing one.

formulation: UK Defense Secretary Gavin Williamson fired over leaking information about Huawei deal from a UK National Security Council meeting by Theresa May.
answer: Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson was sacked by Prime Minister Theresa May over his alleged involvement in leaking classified information from a National Security Council meeting.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, began impacting countries globally in late 2019 and was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization in early 2020.

formulation: NHL announces the pausing of the 2019-20 season due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The NHL suspended the 2019-20 regular season indefinitely due to concerns over the rapidly spreading coronavirus.

formulation: Death Valley, California, hits temperature of 130 degrees F (54.4 C), one of the highest temperatures ever recorded on earth.
answer: Death Valley, California, recorded a staggering 130°F (54.4°C) on July 9, 2021, potentially matching the world record set in 1913.

formulation: Hurricane Beryl passes 45 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica, as a Category 4 hurricane with winds of 140 mph.
answer: Hurricane Isaac passed 45 miles south of Jamaica's capital, Kingston, bringing strong winds of 140 mph.

formulation: Indian religious leader Asaram Bapu is sentenced to life for raping a 16-year old girl.
answer: On April 25, 2018, a court found Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, the head of Dera Sacha Baba, guilty of raping two women.

formulation: More than 100 people arrested in Vietnam, after protests against special economic zones at the People's Committee Headquarters in Binh Thuan province and elsewhere.
answer: Large-scale protests erupted in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City against planned special economic zones, leading to over 100 arrests.

formulation: A Michigan judge blocks county prosecutors from enforcing the state's 1931 ban on abortion.
answer: A Michigan Court of Claims judge temporarily blocked enforcement of the 1931 abortion ban while a lawsuit challenging its validity proceeds.

formulation: US Environmental Protection Agency takes first significant step against climate change by announcing new limits on hydrofluorocarbons (-85% over 15 years).
answer: The EPA revoked its 2020 determination that states could not regulate greenhouse gas emissions from power plants, paving the way for stricter state-level climate policies.

formulation: The January 6 select committee investigating the riot on the U.S. Capitol votes to hold former Donald Trump White House Chief Strategist Steve Bannon in criminal contempt for refusing to comply with a subpoena issued by the select committee.
answer: The January 6 select committee voted to subpoena Steve Bannon for criminal contempt of Congress after he failed to appear for a deposition and produce documents.

formulation: A ransomware attack cripples Change Healthcare's payment system, disrupting insurance claims and making it difficult for patients to get the prescription medicine that they need.
answer: A ransomware attack by the AlphV/BlackCat group crippled Change Healthcare’s payment systems, disrupting healthcare claims processing and impacting patient access to medications.

formulation: 147 murders occurred during a five day police strike in Ceará, Brazil, despite army patrolling the streets according to authorities.
answer: Rampant looting and violence erupted across Ceará, Brazil, including attacks on government buildings and banks, as a police strike severely weakened public security.

formulation: In E. Jean Carroll v. Donald J. Trump, the jury awards Carroll $83.3 million after finding the defendant guilty of defamation.
answer: The jury awarded E. Jean Carroll $83.3 million in damages from Donald Trump for defamatory statements he made about her in 2019.

formulation: Miami Beach imposes a state of emergency and a curfew as large crowds descend on the area for spring break.
answer: Unruly behavior and dangerous gatherings of spring breakers overwhelmed Miami Beach, leading officials to declare a state of emergency and impose a curfew to regain control.

formulation: Fifty children rescued from an international paedophile ring on the dark web in Thailand, Australia and the US by Interpol under Operation Blackwrist, main organizer sentenced to 146 years.
answer: Operation Rescue Lolita was a coordinated global effort that saved fifty children from an international paedophile ring operating on the dark web, leading to a 146-year sentence for its ringleader.

formulation: Police in Akron, Ohio shoot and kill Jayland Walker, a 25-year-old Black man, after a traffic stop. Walker is shot at nearly 90 times and hit with 46 bullets; his death is met with  subsequent protests.
answer: Jayland Walker, an unarmed 25-year-old Black man, was shot and killed by Akron police officers following a traffic stop and ensuing chase, leading to widespread protests.

formulation: WHO warns urgent action needed on air pollution, is on a par with smoking and a poor diet, causing seven million premature deaths a year.
answer: Air pollution, a preventable risk factor, was highlighted by the WHO as being as dangerous as smoking and poor diet, contributing to seven million premature deaths each year.

formulation: Oldest known human remains from Poland at 115,000 years from revealed to be Neanderthal child from Ciemna Cave eaten by a large bird.
answer: Polish researchers unearthed the remarkably well-preserved skeleton of a Neanderthal child in a cave, suggesting the infant may have been deliberately buried there centuries before modern humans arrived in the area.

formulation: Total nationwide COVID-19 cases surpass 14 million and total deaths surpass 274,000.
answer: The United States surpassed 13 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and 270,000 deaths as of December 3, 2020.

formulation: The House Armed Services Committee votes for a National Defense Authorization Act amendment to restrict President Trump's ongoing troop withdrawal from Afghanistan and prospective withdrawal from Germany.
answer: The House Armed Services Committee voted to block the Trump administration's planned troop reductions in Afghanistan and Germany, requiring a certification that the moves would not endanger U.S. interests.

formulation: The FBI raids the home, office and hotel room of President Trump's long-time lawyer, Michael Cohen, pursuant to a federal search warrant.
answer: Federal agents executed search warrants at multiple locations, including Michael Cohen's home, office, and hotel room, as part of an investigation into his business dealings.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 200,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19.
answer: Michigan reported over 7,000 new COVID-19 cases, a then-record high for the state.

formulation: UN General Assembly votes for a motion condemning UK occupation of the Chagos Islands in the Indian Ocean and for them to reunite with nearby Mauritius.
answer: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly adopted a resolution affirming Mauritius' sovereignty over the Chagos Islands and calling for the unconditional return of the archipelago and its dependencies.

formulation: Tottenham Hotspur edge Arsenal, 1-0 at Wembley Stadium in front of English Premier League record single-game attendance of 83,222 fans.
answer: Arsenal played Tottenham Hotspur at Wembley Stadium in a match that set a Premier League attendance record of 83,222.

formulation: Former US Vice President Mike Pence declares his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination.
answer: Mike Pence announced he will seek the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

formulation: ICC Women's Cricket T20 World Cup, Antigua: Ashleigh Gardner with 33 from 26 balls and 3 for 22 leads Australia (106/2) to 4th T20 WC; beat England (105).
answer: Australia secured their fourth T20 World Cup championship, triumphing over England thanks to a dominant performance including a Player of the Match showing from Ashleigh Gardner.

formulation: Iraqi security forces open fire on protesters killing at least 25 in Nasiriya a day after the Iranian embassy in Najais is burnt down.
answer: Iraqi security forces opened fire on protesters in Nasiriya, resulting in the deaths of at least 31 people and hundreds of injuries.

formulation: Four volunteer NASA crew members finish the first 378-day Crew Health and Performance Exploration Analog mission to simulate living on Mars at the Johnson Space Center in Houston.
answer: NASA's HI-SEAS analog Mars habitat mission concluded after a 378-day study focused on crew dynamics and operational challenges of long-duration spaceflight.

formulation: Hurricane John makes landfall in Mexico for the second time, as a 'Zombie storm', at Tizupan.
answer: Hurricane John, after dissipating and reforming over open water, unexpectedly made a second landfall in Mexico's Baja California Peninsula as a 'zombie storm', bringing catastrophic flooding and intense winds.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Florida reports 10,000 new coronavirus cases in a single day, the biggest one-day increase in the state since the pandemic started, and more than any European country had at the height of their outbreaks.
answer: Florida reported over 10,000 new coronavirus cases in a single day, the highest count since the beginning of the pandemic.

formulation: Activists in Portland, Oregon, topple statues of former presidents Theodore Roosevelt and Abraham Lincoln in protest of the 1862 execution of 38 Dakota and Roosevelt's views on Native Americans.
answer: Demonstrators toppled statues of Theodore Roosevelt and Abraham Lincoln, citing their roles in colonialism, westward expansion, and systemic racism as motivations for removing the monuments.

formulation: British Columbia signs historic Gaayhllxid • Gíhlagalgang “Rising Tide” agreement recognizing Haida Gwaii's Aboriginal title over more than 200 islands off Canada’s west coast.
answer: British Columbia and the Haida Nation signed the ʔUukw’u<u>k’alh Treaty Implementation Agreement, affirming Haida title and rights over significant portions of Haida Gwaii.

formulation: Former New York City mayor Michael Bloomberg suspends his presidential campaign.
answer: Joe Biden won the Super Tuesday primaries in multiple states, significantly boosting his chances of securing the Democratic presidential nomination.

formulation: Heavy rain after a prolonged drought causes partial collapse of a pyramid estimated at 1,100 years old at Ihuatzio Archaeological Zone, Michoacán, Mexico.
answer: Severe and unusually heavy rainfall caused a section of the pyramid's exterior to collapse, leading to significant structural damage.

formulation: President Trump announces his intention to withdraw the United States from the Iranian nuclear agreement. In a statement, former U.S. President Barack Obama calls the move "a serious mistake".
answer: President Trump announced the United States' withdrawal from the Iran nuclear agreement, while former President Obama denounced the decision, stating it would undermine global security.

formulation: Attempts to establish mob council in Sicily thwarted when 46 members of the mafia arrested including Settimio Mineo.
answer: Italian authorities conducted a widespread operation arresting 46 members of the Cosa Nostra mafia clan, including key figure Settimio Mineo, in a crackdown targeting organized crime activities.

formulation: 141 Indian opposition MPs are suspended for protesting  a security breach, when two intruders sprayed glass inside parliament.
answer: Following a Lok Sabha security breach, 14 opposition MPs were suspended for the remainder of the winter session in protest of their demand for a discussion on the incident.

formulation: 2023 confirmed as the world's warmest year on record - 1.48C warmer than the long-term average, driven by climate change and El Niño.
answer: 2023 was confirmed as the hottest year on record by a significant margin, surpassing the previous record by a wide margin.

formulation: Near-earth asteroid Kamo`oalewa, the size of a ferris wheel, very likely a fragment of the moon, according to a new study.
answer: Analysis of asteroid 2023 FW13's composition suggests its chemical makeup matches lunar rocks, indicating a potential ejection from the moon billions of years ago.

formulation: Baltimore ex-police sergeant Wayne Earl Jenkins, head of a rogue police unit sentenced to 25 years for robbery and racketeering.
answer: Wayne Jenkins, the former sergeant who led the corrupt Gun Trace Task Force, was sentenced to 25 years in prison for racketeering and other federal charges.

formulation: WHO member states agree to set up an inquiry into the global response to the pandemic, including looking at the WHO itself.
answer: WHO member states launched the Independent Panel for Pandemic Preparedness and Response (IPPPR) to review the global COVID-19 response.
