formulation: Iam Tongi wins season 21 of American idol - first person of Pacific Island descent to win.
answer: Iam Tongi, a Samoan-American from Hawaii, was the first Pacific Islander to win American Idol in May 2023.

formulation: Beijing records its heaviest rainfall in 140 years registering 744.8 millimeters (29.3 inches) 29th July-2nd Aug as Typhoon Doksuri passes through.
answer: Beijing experienced record-breaking rainfall, its heaviest in 140 years, as Typhoon Doksuri brought torrential downpours from July 29 to August 2, 2023.

formulation: Australian terrorist Brenton Tarrant sentenced to life without parole, for the killing of 51 mosque worshippers in Christchurch, New Zealand, 1st time the country imposes the sentence.
answer: Brenton Tarrant, the perpetrator of the Christchurch mosque shootings, was sentenced to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole.

formulation: US President Joe Biden visits Tulsa, Oklahoma, marking 100 year anniversary of racial massacre in the Greenwood neighborhood.
answer: The United States formally recognized the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre as one of the worst in American history, with President Biden attending the centennial commemoration.

formulation: COVID-19 cases in Eastern Europe pass 20 million with Russia, Ukraine and Romania in top five countries reporting deaths globally.
answer: Eastern Europe experienced a severe fourth wave of COVID-19, leading to record-breaking daily cases and straining healthcare systems across countries like Russia, Ukraine, and Romania.

formulation: China confirms it has detained Interpol chief Meng Hongwei, who resigns from his position after being reported missing.
answer: Interpol President Meng Hongwei disappeared while on a trip to China and was later arrested on corruption charges.

formulation: Over 1 million people protest in Hong Kong over proposed new laws for extradition to China in one of largest-ever protests in the city.
answer: Over a million people marched in Hong Kong to protest a bill that would have allowed extradition to mainland China.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack – The Department of Justice says that over 465 people have been arrested since the January 6 attack. It is also seeking information on 250 other suspects.
answer: The Department of Justice announced the arrest of over 535 individuals in connection with the January 6th attack, with investigations continuing and charges expanding to include more serious offenses like seditious conspiracy.

formulation: US federal prosecutors file 37 count indictment against former US President Donald Trump, for unlawful retention of defense information, for storing dozens of classified documents at his Florida resort, and obstruction of justice.
answer: A federal grand jury indicted former President Donald Trump on multiple felony charges related to his alleged mishandling and unlawful retention of classified documents after leaving office.

formulation: Musician R. Kelly found convicted of further sex crimes in Chicago, including producing child sexual abuse imagery.
answer: Filipina-American rapper Macklemore was convicted of multiple sex crimes, including producing child sexual abuse imagery, in September 2022.

formulation: Guatemala's Fuego volcano erupts killing at least 110, with 332 missing and forcing the evacuation of over 3,100.
answer: The Fuego volcano violently erupted in Guatemala on June 3, 2018, killing over 110 people and prompting the evacuation of tens of thousands.

formulation: After winning Olympic gold in the women's curling in Sochi (2014), Canadian Kaitlyn Lawes wins the mixed doubles with dual gold medallist John Morris in Pyeongchang.
answer: Lawes and Morris won the gold medal in mixed doubles curling, becoming the first team to claim gold in the event's Olympic debut.

formulation: Three men sentenced to life imprisonment for rape and murder of eight-year-old Muslim girl in Kathua, India in high-profile case that sparked political resignations and nationwide protests.
answer: Three men were convicted of gang-raping and murdering an eight-year-old girl in Kathua, India, a case that sparked nationwide outrage and political controversy.

formulation: UK economy heading for its worst crash in 300 years (-14%), since 1706, according to Bank of England forecast.
answer: The Bank of England projected a 14% contraction of the UK economy, anticipating the worst annual decline in output since 1720.

formulation: Actor Jussie Smollett suspended from US TV show "Empire" after revealed that actor made false claims about racist and homophobic attack.
answer: Jussie Smollett falsely claimed to be the victim of a racist and homophobic attack, leading to his suspension from the television show "Empire."

formulation: The Northeast experiences a major blizzard which stretches from Delaware to Nova Scotia.
answer: A powerful nor'easter brought blizzard conditions and record-breaking snowfall to the northeastern United States and parts of Canada, leading to widespread travel delays and power outages.

formulation: During a three-way meeting at the Korean Demilitarized Zone with South and North Korean leaders, President Trump becomes the first sitting U.S. president to set foot on North Korean territory. Both Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un pledge to restart stalled nuclear negotiations between the two countries.
answer: U.S. President Donald Trump became the first sitting U.S. president to set foot in North Korea, crossing into the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) and meeting with Kim Jong Un.

formulation: First organ transplant between a live HIV donor and an HIV recipient with a kidney transplant in Boston, Massachusetts.
answer: Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital successfully performed the first HIV-positive-to-HIV-positive kidney transplant in the United States, marking a significant advance in transplant medicine.

formulation: Shane Bieber of the Cleveland Indians (AL) and Cincinnati Reds starter Trevor Bauer (NL) take Cy Young Award for best pitchers in MLB.
answer: Trevor Bauer won the National League Cy Young Award, and Shane Bieber won the American League Cy Young Award on November 11, 2020.

formulation: 70 villages evacuated in Khuzesta province, Iran, after at least 45 killed in flooding after unprecedented rainfall.
answer: Flooding from heavy rainfall along the Karun River caused a catastrophic environmental disaster in Khuzestan province, Iran, displacing thousands and claiming at least 45 lives.

formulation: NASA launches a spacecraft to explore the metal-rich asteroid Psyche - the largest metallic object in the Solar System.
answer: NASA launched the Psyche mission, designed to explore the metal-rich asteroid 16 Psyche and investigate its composition and formation.

formulation: Anti-gun rallies are held in over 100 cities in all 50 states.
answer: Hundreds of thousands of people participated in the March for Our Lives gun control demonstrations in cities across the United States.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Bill Cassidy (R-LA) is the second senator to test positive for COVID-19.
answer: Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky announced he tested positive for COVID-19, after previously being tested.

formulation: 2023 United States debt-ceiling crisis: Biden signs the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023 into law in an effort to prevent the United States from entering a debt ceiling default.
answer: President Biden signed the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023, which suspended the debt ceiling and set limits on government spending.

formulation: UK PM Boris Johnson eases Omicron COVID-19 restrictions, saying the current wave of infections has peaked.
answer: Boris Johnson announced the end of COVID-19 restrictions in England, including the requirement for COVID-19 passes for large venues, reflecting a shift towards treating COVID-19 as endemic.

formulation: A Baltimore woman who was a patient at the University of Maryland Medical Center is taken outside and left by hospital employees in freezing temperatures wearing nothing but her hospital gown and socks. She is stranded until bystander Imanu Baraka calls 911.
answer: After being discharged, a woman was found unresponsive and later died from hypothermia after being left outside Baltimore's Northwest Hospital in freezing temperatures, sparking investigations into employee conduct.

formulation: LePage v. Center for Reproductive Medicine: The Alabama Supreme Court rules that frozen embryos can be considered children under state law.
answer: The Alabama Supreme Court ruled that frozen embryos can be considered children, granting them legal rights under state law.

formulation: Trump associate Roger Stone sentenced to 40 months imprisonment for obstructing a congressional investigation.
answer: Roger Stone was sentenced to nearly four years in prison for obstructing a congressional investigation, but his sentence was later commuted by President Trump.

formulation: Large protests in London against US President Donald Trump featuring Trump-like baby blimp as President Trump meets Queen Elizabeth II at Windsor Castle.
answer: Donald Trump’s visit to London triggered large-scale protests, including the launch of a giant inflatable "Trump baby" balloon.

formulation: Russia now looking to extend its territory into southern as well as eastern Ukraine according to top Russian diplomat.
answer: Russian officials stated that Russia's goals in Ukraine extend beyond the Donbas region to include securing control over more territory.

formulation: Mud volcano, the Otman-Bozdag, erupts 300m (980ft) high, near Baku, Azerbaijan.
answer: Azerbaijan experienced a powerful mud volcano eruption in the Gobustan region, shooting mud and gas 300 meters into the air.

formulation: A Fred Rogers film A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, directed by Marielle Heller is released in theaters.
answer: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, directed by Marielle Heller and starring Tom Hanks as Fred Rogers, premiered in theaters on November 22, 2019.

formulation: Facebook indefinitely bans President Donald Trump from all of its platforms, citing his role in the January 6 Capitol riot. Twitter permanently suspends Trump's personal account the next day, January 8.
answer: Following the January 6th Capitol attack, social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook permanently suspended Trump's accounts, citing concerns about inciting violence and spreading misinformation.

formulation: Boston appoints its first African American Police Commissioner William G. Gross.
answer: William G. Gross became Boston’s first Black police commissioner, succeeding William B. Evans.

formulation: Revised death count for New York taking into account assumed COVID-19 deaths makes the city's per-capita death rate higher than Italy at 10,367 at this date.
answer: New York State surpassed Italy as the country with the highest per capita COVID-19 death toll in the world.

formulation: The Department of Energy announces a multibillion-dollar project to encourage the development of carbon dioxide removal technologies.
answer: The Department of Energy announced $500 million in funding for 52 projects focused on developing clean energy technologies and reducing emissions.

formulation: Canada approves the Pfizer/ BioNTech vaccine for COVID-19.
answer: Canada received its first shipment of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, marking the beginning of vaccinations in the country.

formulation: British architect Richard Rogers designer of the Pompidou Centre and the Millennial Dome retires.
answer: Renowned British architect Norman Foster turned 85.

formulation: WHO reports more than a quarter of people worldwide (1.4 billion) don't get enough physical exercise to avoid major diseases.
answer: Only 37% of adults worldwide get the recommended level of physical activity, according to the World Health Organization.

formulation: American Simone Leigh is the first Black woman artist to win the main prize at Venice Biennale for her sculpture "Brick House".
answer: Simone Leigh became the first Black woman to represent the United States at the Venice Biennale, winning the Golden Lion award for her immersive installation.

formulation: Utah executes convicted murderer and rapist Taberon Honie, the state's first execution since 2010.
answer: Utah executed Scott Ryan Winslow by lethal injection, ending a 14-year hiatus in the state's use of the death penalty.

formulation: Toronto landscaper Bruce McArthur admits in court to the murder of eight gay men.
answer: Bruce McArthur, a Toronto landscaper, pleaded guilty to eight counts of first-degree murder in the deaths of several young men from the city's LGBTQ community.

formulation: Englishwoman Jasmine Harrison (21) becomes the youngest woman to row across an ocean arriving in Antigua as part of the Atlantic Challenge after 70 days, 3 hours, 48 minutes.
answer: Eliza Carr-Smith completed her solo row across the Atlantic Ocean, becoming the youngest woman to achieve this feat.

formulation: Biden pardons thousands of former servicemembers who were formerly convicted of a now-repealed military ban on consensual homosexual sex.
answer: President Biden signed an executive order directing the Department of Justice to review convictions under the repealed "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy and, where appropriate, dismiss them.

formulation: 12,000 year old fossil called "Luzia", oldest known fossil in South America announced found mostly intact after devastating fire at Brazil's National Museum.
answer: The National Museum fire destroyed crucial evidence, but scientists confirmed they had preserved the remains of a 10,000-year-old female known as Luzia, the oldest human skeleton found in the Americas.

formulation: Knife attack at a children's dance event in Southport, England, kills 3 children and injures 8 more, with the 17-year-old attacker arrested.
answer: A man attacked children and adults at a dance event in Southport, England, resulting in multiple injuries and one fatality.

formulation: The Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi is murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, triggering a diplomatic crisis between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia.
answer: Journalist Jamal Khashoggi was murdered in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, Turkey, sparking international outrage and straining relations between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia.

formulation: World's oldest message in a bottle found in Western Australia, thrown from German ship Paula 132 years ago (12 June 1886).
answer: A message in a bottle containing a German schoolgirl's plea for help, tossed into the Atlantic Ocean in 1886, was found on an Australian beach, setting a record for the longest time spent at sea for a message in a bottle.

formulation: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige reported to have been asked to develop a Star Wars film by the Walt Disney Company.
answer: Kevin Feige officially stated that Marvel Studios has no involvement with the Star Wars franchise and does not own the rights to Star Wars properties.

formulation: Georgia Senate runoff candidate David Perdue and his wife enter quarantine despite negative test results.
answer: David Perdue and his wife, Bonnie, tested positive for COVID-19 shortly after the contentious Georgia Senate runoff election.

formulation: Iran releases 54,000 people from prison to avoid spread of COVID-19 as country reports 77 deaths and 2,300 cases including two dozen MPs.
answer: Iran announced a nationwide closure of schools and universities in an effort to curb the rapidly spreading coronavirus.

formulation: James Anderson takes his 564th Test wicket to become the most prolific fast bowler in cricket history as England beats India by 118 runs in the 5th Test at The Oval for a 4-1 series victory; Alistair Cook's final Test.
answer: James Anderson became the first bowler to take 564 Test wickets for England, surpassing Shane Warne in the process.

formulation: Dan Campbell's Detroit Lions finish the season with a 9–8 record, achieving their first winning season since 2017.
answer: The Detroit Lions finished the 2022 season with a 9-8 record, marking their first winning season since 2017.

formulation: California is the first state to surpass two million COVID-19 cases.
answer: California surpassed 2 million confirmed COVID-19 cases just before the end of 2020.

formulation: QTS announced plans to invest $1.5 billion in New Albany, constructing four new data centers.
answer: QTS announced a $1.7 billion investment to expand its New Albany, Ohio data center campus.

formulation: President Donald Trump refuses to commit to a peaceful transfer of power after the US November election at a White House press conference.
answer: President Trump claimed he would win the November election by a landslide, even if he received the most votes ever.

formulation: The House Democratic Caucus elects Hakeem Jeffries to be its leader in the 118th congress; Jeffries will become the first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress.
answer: Hakeem Jeffries was elected as the new leader of the House Democratic Caucus, becoming the first African American to lead a major party in Congress.

formulation: Grammy Award-winning singer R. Kelly is found guilty in a federal court on all counts of sexually abusing women and children over two decades.
answer: R. Kelly was found guilty on nine counts of racketeering and sex trafficking in a New York federal court.

formulation: 50th anniversary of 1st Gay Pride march in New York City marked around the world.
answer: The 50th anniversary of the Stonewall Riots, which sparked the modern LGBTQ+ rights movement, was commemorated worldwide.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules in a 5–4 decision that Alabama must redraw its congressional map as it violates section 2 of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 in racially discriminating against African-Americans in the state.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that Alabama’s congressional map likely violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting Black voters' power but instructed the lower court to draw a new map without explicitly adopting the court-appointed special master's plan.

formulation: Magnitude 7.6 earthquake strikes western Mexico on exact anniversary of two previous temblors in 1985 and 2017, killing at least two people,.
answer: A magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck western Mexico on September 19, 2022, coinciding with the 52nd anniversary of the devastating 1970 earthquake and the 20th anniversary of the 2002 Acapulco earthquake.

formulation: Plane crash of Bangladeshi carrier at Kathmandu airport kills at least 49 after plane approaches runway from wrong end.
answer: US-Bangla Airlines Flight 203 crashed while approaching Kathmandu airport from the wrong direction, killing at least 49 people.

formulation: President Biden gives his first official State of the Union Address to Congress.
answer: The State of the Union address is a significant annual event where the President outlines their administration's priorities to a joint session of Congress, usually held in early March.

formulation: Evian Championship Women's Golf, Evian Resort GC: Australian Minjee Lee recovers from 7 shots behind to beat South Korea’s Lee6 Jeongeun in a play-off for her first major title.
answer: Jeongeun Lee6 made a remarkable comeback from 7 shots behind to win her first major title at the Evian Championship on July 25, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Michigan surpasses 500,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases.
answer: Michigan reported over 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic.

formulation: Residential tower Champlain Towers South collapses at 1.30am in Surfside, Miami Beach, with 156 people missing (98 bodies eventually recovered).
answer: The Champlain Towers South condominium partially collapsed, killing 98 people and leaving 156 others missing.

formulation: Caitlin Clark becomes the NCAA Division I women's career scoring leader in a game for Iowa against Michigan, scoring a career-high 49 points.
answer: Caitlin Clark became the all-time leading scorer in NCAA Division I women's basketball history, surpassing Kelsey Plum's previous record.

formulation: First work of art produced by artificial intelligence "Edmond de Belamy" conceived by Obvious sells for $432,500 at Christie's in New York.
answer: Christie’s sold "Portrait of Edmond Belamy," a painting generated by an AI algorithm, for $432,500, demonstrating the potential of AI in art creation and market acceptance.

formulation: Donald Trump is indicted for a third time by a grand jury for his attempts to overturn the 2020 election and the subsequent January 6 attack.
answer: Donald Trump was indicted in Fulton County, Georgia, on charges related to attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.

formulation: Wanda Vazquez becomes Puerto Rico's third governor in a week after her predecessor Pedro Pierluisi is removed by the supreme court.
answer: The Supreme Court of Puerto Rico ruled that Pedro Pierluisi was improperly sworn in as governor, leading to Wanda Vázquez Garced taking office.

formulation: US records one million COVID-19 deaths, with The White House ordering flags to fly at half mast through the weekend.
answer: The United States surpassed one million COVID-19 deaths since the beginning of the pandemic, triggering a national period of mourning.

formulation: Torrential rains cause flash flooding in Turkey's northwestern provinces of Kastamonu, Sinop and Barti, killing at least 77 with more missing.
answer: Severe flash flooding and landslides devastated several provinces in northern Turkey, including Kastamonu, Sinop, and Bartin, claiming the lives of dozens.

formulation: India's Supreme Court puts on hold three controversial new farm laws that ignited weeks of protests by farmers in Delhi.
answer: India's Supreme Court suspended the implementation of the three farm laws pending a review of their legality, effectively halting them until further notice.

formulation: Former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows announces that he will testify to and cooperate with the January 6 committee.
answer: Mark Meadows informed the January 6th committee he would assert executive privilege over many of the documents and communications they requested.

formulation: One million plant and animal species are now at risk of extinction according to a major new UN report.
answer: The UN reported that one million animal and plant species are now threatened with extinction, largely due to human actions.

formulation: Passenger train collides with maintenance locomotive in Ankara, Turkey, killing at least 9 and injuring 47.
answer: A train derailment near Ankara killed at least 10 people and injured dozens more.

formulation: Manhattan district attorney's office announces it will no longer prosecute prostitution, dismissing 914 open cases, part of growing movement to change approach to prostitution.
answer: The Manhattan District Attorney's office announced it would no longer prosecute most minor offenses related to prostitution, including loitering and soliciting.

formulation: Windows 11 is launched by Microsoft.
answer: Microsoft officially released Windows 11 on October 5, 2021.

formulation: Russia shells the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv, while a 40 mile Russian military convoy approaches capital city of Kyiv.
answer: Russian forces launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, targeting multiple cities and key infrastructure across the country.

formulation: On his final full day in office, President Trump issues pardons for 144 people.
answer: President Trump issued a flurry of pardons and commutations, including to associates involved in the Russia investigation and others convicted of white-collar crimes.

formulation: White Island / Whakaari volcano, a tourist attraction in New Zealand, erupts killing 22.
answer: The Whakaari/White Island volcano erupted, killing 22 people and injuring many more.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, was declared a pandemic by the WHO and profoundly affected the world throughout 2021.

formulation: US Supreme Court declines to hear school's appeal in transgender bathroom case made by Gavin Grimm in Virginia, upholding an earlier decision it was discriminatory.
answer: By declining to hear Gavin Grimm’s case, the Supreme Court left in place a lower court ruling that a Virginia school board violated Title IX by denying him access to the boys’ restroom.

formulation: A multi-day period of significant tornado outbreaks, along with significant derechos, occurred across the Midwestern United States and the Mississippi Valley. From , two derechos occurred and 247 tornadoes touched down, which killed 31 people, injured at least 243 others, and caused $7.3 billion in damage. On May 21, a large and violent multi-vortex tornado struck Greenfield, Iowa at EF4 intensity. In Greenfield, a mobile radar measured winds of 309–318 miles per hour (497–512 km/h) inside the tornado, marking the third time winds of over 300 miles per hour (480 km/h) had ever been measured. On May 25, an intense EF3 tornado struck Rosston, Era, Valley View, and Pilot Point in Texas, killing seven people, making it the deadliest tornado of both the outbreak sequence and in the United States during 2024 and injuring up to 100 others. Due to a malfunction, tornado sirens in Valley View would not sound before the tornado struck. On May 26, another intense EF3 tornado struck Eddyville, Crider, Charleston, and Barnsley in Kentucky, which prompted the issuance of four tornado emergencies.
answer: A historic tornado outbreak, with over 90 tornadoes reported, swept through the Midwestern United States in May 2024, causing widespread devastation and shattering previous records.

formulation: China announces Shanghai will be locked down in two stages over nine days affecting 25 million people to carry out COVID-19 testing.
answer: China initiated a two-week city-wide lockdown of Shanghai, affecting 25 million residents, in an effort to control a surge in COVID-19 cases.

formulation: A tribute service for Rosalynn Carter, who passed away nine days earlier, is held, attended by all living former First Ladies, President and First Lady Biden, Vice President Harris, Second Gentleman Emhoff, and former Presidents Bill Clinton and Jimmy Carter. Her official funeral was held one day later at the Carter's home church in Plains, Georgia.
answer: A memorial service was held in Atlanta for former First Lady Rosalynn Carter, attended by living former First Ladies Michelle Obama, Laura Bush, and Jill Biden, along with former Presidents Bill Clinton and Jimmy Carter.

formulation: A blackout occurs in Manhattan's West Side, affecting 73,000 customers. The blackout occurs exactly 42 years after the New York City blackout of 1977.
answer: A major electrical fire at a Con Edison substation knocked out power to over 30,000 customers in Manhattan's West Side, coincidentally occurring on the 42nd anniversary of the 1977 New York City blackout.

formulation: 2021 George Floyd protests.
answer: Widespread protests and demonstrations erupted nationwide in late May 2021 following the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis police custody.

formulation: Toy chain Toys R Us announces it will close all its stores after filing for bankruptcy.
answer: Toys R Us announced it would close all of its stores after filing for bankruptcy.

formulation: Juneteenth is observed across the country.
answer: Juneteenth commemorates the emancipation of enslaved African Americans in Texas when news of the Emancipation Proclamation arrived on June 19, 1865.

formulation: George Santos says he will not seek re-election after the House Ethics Committee issued a scathing report against him, which led to him being charged with several counts of fraud.
answer: George Santos announced he would not seek reelection in 2024 following the Ethics Committee report and indictment.

formulation: The Arizona Senate is evacuated after police use tear gas to disperse a mob of pro-choice protesters in opposition to the overruling of Roe v. Wade and teachers, opposing an education funding bill after the rioters try to breach security and enter the Arizona State Capitol.
answer: Pro-choice activists protesting the overturning of Roe v. Wade disrupted an Arizona Senate committee hearing on education funding, leading to a police intervention and the evacuation of the chamber.

formulation: New Jersey reports its first case of 501.V2 variant first detected in South Africa.
answer: New Jersey health officials confirmed the first known case of the COVID-19 variant first identified in South Africa within the state.

formulation: NASA panel investigating unidentified flying objects at its first open meeting highlights stigma involved in reporting sightings and lack of high-quality data (mysterious radio signals turned out to be a local microwave).
answer: The release of a newly declassified Pentagon report and subsequent analysis of unidentified aerial phenomena revealed inconsistencies in initial reporting and emphasized the need for improved data collection and analysis, especially regarding unusual radio frequency detections.

formulation: Attorney General William Barr sends members of Congress a four page letter outlining the principle conclusions of the Mueller Report.
answer: Barr announced that Special Counsel Robert Mueller had found insufficient evidence to establish a criminal conspiracy between the Trump campaign and Russia, or that Trump had obstructed justice.

formulation: A massive rockslide in Greenland creates a tsunami wave in the Dickson fjord that shakes the earth for nine days.
answer: A massive, 53-million-ton rockslide cascaded into the Dickson Fjord in Greenland, generating a tsunami and inducing prolonged seismic tremors.

formulation: NASA's Europa Clipper launches on a mission to investigate the subsurface ocean of Jupiter's moon Europa.
answer: The Europa Clipper mission, designed to investigate Europa, a Jovian moon thought to have a subsurface ocean, is slated to launch in October 2024.

formulation: US capitol rioter QAnon Shaman [Jacob Chansley] sentenced to three years in prison by a federal court.
answer: Jacob Chansley was sentenced to over four years in prison for obstructing an official proceeding and assaulting federal officers.

formulation: The federal government authorizes, for the first time, the use of federal funds to research geoengineering.
answer: The White House issued a memo halting all federal funding for geoengineering research, specifically solar radiation management, citing potential risks and a lack of international consensus.

formulation: Arizona Senator Kyrsten Sinema switches parties from Democrat to Independent.
answer: In December 2022, Senator Kyrsten Sinema announced her departure from the Democratic Party and registered as an independent.

formulation: Brazilian confirmed COVID-19 cases pass 100,000 with the death toll at 7,025, the 9th country to do so.
answer: Brazil surpassed Italy to become the sixth-most affected country globally in terms of confirmed COVID-19 cases and deaths.

formulation: Venice hit by worse floods for 50 years, due to a very high tide with waves in St Mark's square, killing one resident.
answer: Exceptionally high tides, exacerbated by strong winds, inundated Venice with floodwaters reaching a record 1.87 meters, causing widespread damage and disruption.

formulation: Maldives President Abdulla Yameen declares state of emergency ordering arrest of two judges.
answer: President Abdulla Yameen declared a state of emergency and arrested two judges, citing a threat to national security and judicial corruption.

formulation: Mike Pence announces his candidacy for President in the 2024 election.
answer: Mike Pence announced he was suspending his 2024 presidential campaign.

formulation: 2022 Major League Baseball season.
answer: The Major League Baseball playoffs begin in late April, culminating in the World Series, and involve teams from the American League and National League.

formulation: Auckland named world's most livable city (due to success with COVID) and Damascus named the worst by The Economist Intelligence Unit.
answer: The Economist Intelligence Unit's 2021 Global Liveability Index ranked Auckland as the world’s most livable city and Damascus as the least livable.

formulation: Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines accuses the Iranian government of using social media to covertly encourage and finance pro-Palestinian campus protests, to deepen American political divisions and increase distrust in democratic institutions.
answer: The Director of National Intelligence accused Iran of attempting to amplify divisive narratives across social media platforms to interfere in the 2024 U.S. elections.

formulation: 2021 NBA playoffs: The Los Angeles Clippers advance to their first NBA Conference Finals after a 131–119 victory against the Utah Jazz in game 6, in which they will play the Phoenix Suns.
answer: The Los Angeles Clippers became the first team in NBA playoff history to overcome a 3-1 series deficit twice in the same playoffs.

formulation: Manchester City beats Brighton, 4-1 to claim back-to-back English Premier League titles with 98 points, 1 ahead of runners-up, Liverpool.
answer: Manchester City secured their second consecutive Premier League title with a 1-0 victory over Brighton & Hove Albion.

formulation: Sexual abuse investigation into US Southern Baptist churches reveals 400 church members implicated with over 700 victims, according to The Houston Chronicle and the San Antonio Express-News.
answer: A Texas grand jury investigation into the Catholic Church revealed that over 400 church members were implicated in sexual abuse cases, identifying more than 700 victims.

formulation: Oracle is sued in a class action lawsuit alleging that the company has operated and profited off of a "surveillance machine" monitoring 5 billion people.
answer: Meta, formerly Facebook, was sued for allegedly creating and utilizing a massive surveillance system to track billions of users.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford alleges that Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her in the early 1980s.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford alleged that Brett Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her at a party in 1982 while they were in high school.

formulation: Manchester City smashes EPL records in 3-1 win over Brighton - most goals (105), most points (97) and most wins (31).
answer: Manchester City secured the Premier League title with a 1-0 victory over Brighton, breaking the record for most points in a single season.

formulation: Nobel prize for Economics awarded to Esther Duflo, Abhijit Banerjee and Michael Kremer for research on ways to fight poverty.
answer: The Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences was awarded to Abhijit Banerjee, Esther Duflo, and Michael Kremer for their experimental approach to alleviating global poverty.

formulation: Blockbuster NBA trade: NY Knicks send Kristaps Porziņģis, Tim Hardaway Jr., Courtney Lee & Trey Burke to Dallas Mavericks for Dennis Smith Jr., DeAndre Jordan, Wesley Matthews & 2 future 1st-round picks.
answer: The Knicks traded Kristaps Porzingis to the Mavericks for DeAndre Jordan, Dennis Smith Jr., and two future first-round picks.

formulation: Sports Illustrated names soccer star Megan Rapinoe Sportsperson of the Year.
answer: Megan Rapinoe was named Person of the Year by Time Magazine for her achievements in soccer and her vocal advocacy for social justice.

formulation: British TV Bafta Awards: "Top Boy" Best Drama, "Such Brave Girls" Best Scripted Comedy, Acting awards to Sarah Lancashire and Timothy Spall.
answer: *The Apprentice* secured the most wins with five, while *Succession* and *Curb Your Enthusiasm* both took home three awards.

formulation: Mike Tyson returns to boxing in an exhibition bout against Roy Jones Jr. boxer Jake Paul knocks out NBA player Nate Robinson on the undercard.
answer: The exhibition boxing match between Mike Tyson and Roy Jones Jr. took place, alongside Jake Paul's impressive knockout victory over Ali Eason.

formulation: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announces an overhaul of operations so that the agency can respond to a crisis in public health more quickly than before.
answer: The CDC announced a new public health system designed to detect and respond to threats more effectively, emphasizing data modernization and equitable practices.

formulation: First documented case of a person being re-infected with COVID-19 a second time, a Hong Kong man four months after first infection.
answer: Hong Kong reported the first confirmed case of COVID-19 reinfection, indicating that the virus can infect individuals more than once.

formulation: Ukrainian authorities reveal discovery of mass grave of 450 burials near Izyum, some showing evidence of torture, after the withdrawal of Russian forces.
answer: Ukrainian authorities discovered a mass grave containing the bodies of over 450 civilians, many showing signs of torture, in Izyum.

formulation: Record 82 million people now forcibly displaced, or over 1% of world's population, according to UN refugee agency.
answer: As of mid-2023, UNHCR reports over 111 million people were forcibly displaced globally, including refugees, asylum seekers, and internally displaced people.

formulation: 17 hospital patients die after heavy rainfall and flooding in Tula, central Mexico.
answer: Hurricane Ida-related power outages at a hospital in Tepexpan, Mexico led to the deaths of dozens of patients requiring ventilators.

formulation: Philadelphia Phillies slugger Kyle Schwarber breaks MLB record hitting his 14th lead-off home run of the season in a 9-4 victory over Tampa Rays at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia.
answer: Kyle Schwarber hit his 300th career home run during the game against the Tampa Rays.

formulation: Cannabis in South Dakota.
answer: South Dakota's Supreme Court ruled that a voter-approved recreational marijuana legalization initiative was unconstitutional.

formulation: Toxic leak at Indian chemical factory near Visakhapatnam kills at least 13 and injures many when it tried to reopen after lockdown.
answer: A toxic gas leak at a chemical factory in Vishakhapatnam, India, resulted in at least 12 deaths and hundreds of hospitalizations as the plant resumed operations following COVID-19 lockdown measures.

formulation: Yemen authorities say at least 172 people died in floods caused by torrential rains, which have also destroyed historic buildings in Sanaa, a Unesco World Heritage Site.
answer: A massive oil tanker, the Safer, rusted and finally broke apart, releasing a significant oil spill that devastated the Yemeni coast and threatened the historic buildings in Sanaa.

formulation: Antarctica is melting at an accelerating rate - 200 billion tonnes a year, 3 trillion tonnes in 25 years, in report published in "Nature" journal.
answer: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) released a special report highlighting accelerated Antarctic ice melt, calculating an annual loss of approximately 200 billion tonnes.

formulation: Explosive-packed vehicle rams paramilitary convoy in Indian-controlled Kashmir killing at least 40. Islamic group Jaish-e-Mohammad claim responsibility.
answer: A suicide bombing at a security forces convoy in Pulwama resulted in at least 40 deaths and was claimed by Jaish-e-Mohammad.

formulation: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo signs an executive order requiring everyone in the state to wear a mask or a mouth/nose covering in public when not social distancing.
answer: Governor Cuomo issued an executive order mandating that all essential workers who test positive for COVID-19 continue working to maintain essential services.

formulation: Chevron announces it will acquire Hess Corporation for $50 billion.
answer: Chevron announced an agreement to acquire Hess Corporation in an all-stock deal valued at approximately $50 billion.

formulation: Marriot Hotels reveal massive data breach - 500 million guests affected in one of largest-ever company hacks.
answer: Marriott International announced a data breach affecting approximately 500 million guests, compromising personal information like names, addresses, phone numbers, and passport details.

formulation: More than 50 arrested as Portland, Oregon, marks 100 days of protests against racism and police brutality.
answer: A demonstration focusing on the shooting of Aaron J. Danielson during protests erupted into clashes, resulting in over 50 arrests.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The CDC reports that Deltacron hybrid variant is now pre-dominant strain in the US, which is combined with Delta and Omicron variants, accounting for three-quarters of cases.
answer: The Omicron variant rapidly spread across the U.S., and scientists identified a new hybrid strain called "Omicron XBB.1.5" combining features of earlier Omicron subvariants.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: President Trump signs an immigration executive order halting the issuance of certain green cards for 60 days.
answer: President Trump issued an executive order temporarily suspending the entry of foreign nationals from most European countries and others deemed high-risk for the spread of COVID-19.

formulation: President Trump signs an executive order encouraging future long-term commercial exploitation of various celestial bodies and mining of lunar resources.
answer: President Trump signed Space Policy Directive-1, reaffirming U.S. leadership in space and paving the way for commercial resource extraction from celestial bodies like the Moon.

formulation: Water detected for first time on planet outside out solar system, on exoplanet K2-18b 110 light-years away, in findings published in "Nature Astronomy".
answer: Scientists detected water vapor in the atmosphere of K2-18b, making it the first known exoplanet with a potentially habitable atmosphere containing water.

formulation: NHL hockey team Carolina Hurricanes owner Tom Dundon agrees to invest $250 million into the Alliance of American Football; named new chairman of the AAF.
answer: Hurricanes owner Tom Dundon announced a $250 million investment in the Alliance of American Football, a newly formed spring football league.

formulation: French drivers Sebastien Ogier and Julien Ingrassia win their 6th Monte Carlo Rally in an M-Sport Ford WRT.
answer: Sebastien Ogier and Julien Ingrassia won the Rally Monte Carlo in January 2018, securing their sixth victory in the event.

formulation: President Biden says that he is considering the declaration of a public health emergency over the lack of access to abortion and weighing the possibility of funding by the federal government in response to the earlier decision of the Supreme Court on the matter.
answer: President Biden vowed to protect access to abortion, declaring that the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade was a "tragic error."

formulation: Tropical cyclone Gita strikes Tonga as a category four cyclone causing widespread damage.
answer: Tropical Cyclone Gita, classified as a category four, struck Tonga on February 12, 2018, causing widespread devastation.

formulation: US, UK and Australia announce trilateral security partnership Aukus, to counteract influence of China, including helping Australia build nuclear-powered submarines.
answer: AUKUS, a security pact between the US, UK, and Australia, was unveiled to counter China's growing power and facilitate Australia's acquisition of nuclear-powered submarines.

formulation: Facebook suspends Cambridge Analytica, a data firm accused of mishandling Facebook user profiles.
answer: Facebook suspended Cambridge Analytica, the data firm at the center of the controversy, from its platform.

formulation: US President Donald Trump declares a national emergency, freeing up $50 billion to fight COVID-19.
answer: President Trump signed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act, providing emergency assistance and allocating $50 billion for COVID-19 related needs.

formulation: Stanley Cup Final, Amalie Arena, Tampa, FL: Defending champions Tampa Bay Lightning beat Montreal Canadiens, 1-0 in Game 5; retain title, 4-1.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Montreal Canadiens to win their second consecutive Stanley Cup.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Physics awarded to Syukuro Manabe, Klaus Hasselmann and Giorgio Parisi for pioneering work that warned of climate change.
answer: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to Syukuro Manabe, Klaus Hasselmann, and Giorgio Parisi for their groundbreaking work in modeling Earth's climate.

formulation: MLB Oakland A’s win 3-2 over Texas Rangers, before a sellout crowd of 46,889 in final game at the Coliseum prior to temporary move to Sacramento, and eventual relocation to Las Vegas.
answer: The Oakland A’s defeated the Texas Rangers 9-4, concluding their 72-year tenure at the Coliseum.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic rapidly emerged and intensified starting in January 2020, leading to global lockdowns and alterations in daily routines by mid-July 2020.

formulation: World leaders discussing US President Donald Trump in unflattering terms at NATO reception caught on camera and goes viral.
answer: During a NATO gathering in London, several world leaders were overheard discussing Donald Trump's behavior, and the conversation was recorded and leaked, going viral.

formulation: Intense fighting in Ukrainian city of Mariupol continues as Russian forces encircle the city, trapping 300,000 people.
answer: Relentless Russian bombardment and siege of Mariupol throughout March 2022 resulted in widespread destruction, civilian casualties, and a dire humanitarian crisis with dwindling supplies and trapped residents.

formulation: 'Rain bomb' due to a slow-moving low pressure trough begins major flooding in south-east Queensland, Australia, leaving at least seven people dead.
answer: Unprecedented torrential rainfall and associated flash flooding devastated southeast Queensland, Australia, causing widespread damage and multiple deaths.

formulation: Miss World won by Miss Jamaica Toni-Ann Singh in London. First time all five major beauty titles held by black women.
answer: Miss World, Miss Universe, Miss Earth, Miss International, and Miss Supranational were all held by black women after Toni-Ann Singh won Miss World in London, marking the first time all five major titles were held by women of color.

formulation: Turkey officially changes its name to Türkiye at the United Nations and internationally.
answer: The United Nations officially began using "Türkiye" as the country's name, replacing "Turkey" in English.

formulation: Proposed acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk: Twitter files suit against Musk in the Delaware Court of Chancery in an attempt to force Musk to complete the acquisition.
answer: Twitter filed a lawsuit in Delaware Chancery Court seeking to force Musk to complete his $44 billion acquisition of the company.

formulation: Public Domain Day: All books and films published in 1924 enter the public domain in the United States.
answer: The United States entered the public domain a vast trove of creative works from 1924, including literature, music, and films.

formulation: Former Youtuber Ruby Franke and her business partner sentenced to up to 60 years in prison for physically and emotionally abusing her children.
answer: Ruby Franke and her business partner Jodi Hildebrandt both pleaded guilty to four counts of aggravated child abuse.

formulation: Infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci announces that he will retire at the end of the year.
answer: Dr. Anthony Fauci announced he would be stepping down from his positions as director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and as chief medical advisor to the President in December 2022.

formulation: The first 2024 presidential debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump is broadcast by CNN in Atlanta.
answer: Joe Biden and Donald Trump participated in the first-ever presidential debate of the 2024 election, hosted by CNN.

formulation: New Jersey and Virginia gubernatorial elections are held. Republican Glenn Youngkin wins the Virginia race, while Democrat Phil Murphy wins re-election in the New Jersey race.
answer: Republican Glenn Youngkin defeated incumbent Democrat Ralph Northam in the Virginia gubernatorial election, while Democrat Phil Murphy secured a second term in New Jersey.

formulation: Suicide bomber kills 31 in crowd celebrating Persian New Year in Kabul, Afghanistan.
answer: A suicide bombing at a gathering in Kabul's Kart-e Sakhi district during Nowruz celebrations killed 31 people and injured many more.

formulation: "Laurel vs Yanny" disagreement over what word heard in an audio file begins across social media.
answer: The "Laurel or Yanny" audio illusion became a viral sensation, dividing listeners over what word they perceived in the recording.

formulation: American basketball star Brittany Griner is released by Russian authorities in a prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout; Griner detained on drug smuggling charges since February 2022.
answer: Brittany Griner was released from Russian custody in a prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

formulation: The United States withdraws from the Open Skies Treaty.
answer: The United States withdrew from the Open Skies Treaty, a pact permitting observation flights over member nations aimed at fostering transparency and trust.

formulation: Ken Wyatt becomes Australia's first Aboriginal minister in government as the minister for indigenous Australians.
answer: Ken Wyatt became the first Indigenous Australian to be appointed as Minister for Indigenous Australians, marking a historic moment in Australian politics.

formulation: Dow Jones Industrial Average suffers its biggest points fall in history closing down 1,190.95 in New York amid concerns about COVID-19.
answer: Amidst rising global concerns over the rapidly spreading COVID-19 pandemic, the Dow Jones Industrial Average plummeted 1,200 points, marking its largest single-day point drop in history.

formulation: French photographer Jean-Claude Arnault, at center of Nobel Prize Committee scandal, charged with rape in Sweden.
answer: A Swedish court acquitted photographer Camilla Herrey of charges related to leaking information about the Nobel Prize in Literature, after a high-profile trial that had shaken the Nobel institution.

formulation: At least 30 people are killed and 1.3 million left without electricity after an Easter tornado outbreak across the South.
answer: A series of powerful tornadoes tore through the Southern United States in April 2020, causing widespread devastation, numerous deaths, and extensive power outages.

formulation: Record temperatures in Alaska as Anchorage reaches 90F (32C).
answer: Anchorage, Alaska, experienced a record-breaking high of 90°F (32.2°C) on July 4, 2019, marking the first time the city reached 90 degrees in recorded history.

formulation: US birthrate in 2018 the lowest for 32 years (total fertility rate 1,728 births per 1,000 women), with record lows for teen births.
answer: The United States experienced its lowest birth rate in over a century, signaling a potential long-term economic slowdown.

formulation: Rare mass anti-government protests across Cuba due to economic hardships and effects of COVID-19 led to widespread arrests.
answer: Protests erupted across Cuba, marking one of the largest demonstrations against the communist government in decades, fueled by shortages of food, medicine, and electricity.

formulation: Bangladeshi student protesters storm state broadcaster as part of national protests led by students against job system that favours relatives of veterans.
answer: Tens of thousands of Bangladeshi students block major highways in Dhaka, demanding reforms to a government job recruitment system they claim unfairly advantages the children and siblings of veterans.

formulation: 17,000 year old conch shell discovered to be oldest known wind instrument, after being reassessed by archaeologists, originally found in Marsoulas cave, Pyrenees.
answer: Archaeologists discovered a 43,000-year-old conch shell in Bruniquel Cave that shows signs of intentional modification for use as a horn, providing the earliest evidence of wind instruments.

formulation: Death toll passes 200 from Gaza conflict as 42 people killed in Israeli airstrikes and three building flattened.
answer: The Israel Defense Forces launched a widespread bombing campaign across Gaza in response to rocket fire, resulting in over 200 deaths and extensive destruction of buildings and infrastructure.

formulation: The FDA approves the drug Nirsevimab, also known as Beyfortus, which treats RSV in infants.
answer: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved nirsevimab, a monoclonal antibody for preventing severe lower respiratory tract disease caused by RSV in infants.

formulation: Nigerian government says it will repatriate 600 people from South Africa after two people killed in wave of xenophobic violence in Johannesburg.
answer: The Nigerian government condemned the attacks, evacuated hundreds of its citizens from South Africa, and demanded stronger protection for Nigerians living there.

formulation: A spree shooting occurs in a suburban neighborhood of Raleigh, North Carolina. Five people are killed, and two others are injured. The suspect is detained after being cornered by police at a nearby residence.
answer: A teenager opened fire in a Raleigh park, killing five people, including a child, and wounding two others.

formulation: After taking gold in the Olympic team sprint in Sochi (2014), Finnish cross country skier Iivo Niskanen wins the 50k classical event in Pyeongchang.
answer: Iivo Niskanen won three gold medals and a silver medal at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, becoming Finland's most decorated Olympian at a single Games.

formulation: The Federal Communications Commission votes to restore net neutrality rules implemented by the Obama administration after their repeal in 2017.
answer: The FCC reinstated net neutrality rules, classifying broadband internet as a telecommunications service and prohibiting blocking, throttling, and paid prioritization.

formulation: First controversial UK flight to take asylum seekers to Rwanda cancelled after last-minute legal ruling from European Court of Human Rights of "real risk of irreversible harm".
answer: The High Court of Justice ruled the Rwanda deportation plan was unlawful, citing concerns about Rwanda's human rights record.

formulation: President Trump announces a 30-day ban on incoming travel from Europe (with the exception of the United Kingdom), effective midnight EDT (0400 GMT) on March 13. The announcement occurs the same day the World Health Organization (WHO) declares the COVID-19 outbreak a pandemic. The travel ban is extended to the UK and Ireland on March 16.
answer: President Trump announced a ban on most travel from European countries including the UK and Ireland.

formulation: Buffalo gunman Payton Gendron sentenced to life in prison, after pleading guilty to ten counts of first-degree murder and a count of domestic terrorism, the first in New York.
answer: Payton Gendron was sentenced to life in prison without parole for the racially motivated mass shooting at a Buffalo supermarket, where he was also convicted of domestic terrorism charges.

formulation: Scientists announce the discovery of a long-lost branch of the Nile, now dried up, that once ran near many of Egypt's pyramids, name it Ahramat (Pyramid).
answer: Scientists discovered a 4,500-year-old "lost arm" of the Nile River that was crucial for transporting materials used to build the pyramids.

formulation: Brazilian jockey Jorge Ricardo equals world record number of victories for a jockey - 12,844 in Rio de Janeiro.
answer: Jorge Ricardo achieved his 15,782nd career victory, equaling the world record for most wins by a jockey.

formulation: The 107th running of the Indianapolis 500 is held, with Josef Newgarden wins his first Indy 500.
answer: The Indianapolis 500 took place on May 28, 2023, with Josef Newgarden emerging as the victor.

formulation: Nuclear accident at Russian nuclear-weapon testing site at closed city Sarov kills five scientists in mysterious circumstances.
answer: A mysterious explosion at the closed Saybaevsky Range nuclear weapon testing site resulted in the deaths of five scientists and raised concerns over classified nuclear technology.

formulation: 13 people die in a stampede at an illegal disco in Lima, Peru, during a police raid to shut it down.
answer: A police raid on an illegal nightclub called "La Florida" in Lima resulted in 13 deaths and dozens of injuries due to a panicked crush.

formulation: Dictionary publisher Merriam-Webster's word of the year is "justice".
answer: "Justice" was selected as Merriam-Webster’s word of the year in December 2018, reflecting increased usage tied to discussions of social justice, legal battles, and political debates.

formulation: French photographer Jean-Claude Arnault, at the center of a Nobel prize sexual assault scandal, sentenced to two years in prison for rape.
answer: A Swedish court dropped the sexual assault charges against French photographer Patrick Robert, an associate of Nobel laureate Jean-Pierre Changeux, due to lack of evidence.

formulation: More healthcare workers have died of COVID-19 in Mexico than any other country - 1320 deaths vs 1077 (US) and 649 (UK) according to Amnesty International.
answer: Amnesty International’s “Invisible and Neglected” report found Mexican healthcare workers faced significantly greater risks and less protection during the pandemic than their counterparts in the US and UK.

formulation: Three US states, Georgia, Tennessee and South Carolina the 1st to announce end to some COVID-19 restrictions.
answer: These states became the first to lift some COVID-19 restrictions, including bans on elective surgeries and closures of certain businesses.

formulation: Pakistan's first metro line, the Orange Line, opens in Lahore.
answer: The Lahore Orange Line Metro Train, a rapid transit system, was inaugurated, intended to improve urban mobility and stimulate economic growth.

formulation: A state judge in Oklahoma dismisses a lawsuit by the last three known survivors of the 1921 Tulsa race massacre for reparations.
answer: Oklahoma's highest court ruled that survivors of the 1921 Tulsa race massacre can pursue legal claims against the city and other defendants for reparations.

formulation: China launches Chang’e-5 mission to the Moon from Wenchang space site, Hainan Island, to collect lunar rock and soil samples.
answer: China launched the Chang'e 5 mission on November 23, 2020, aiming to collect and return lunar samples to Earth.

formulation: Heatwave in Karachi, Pakistan, kills 65 as temperatures soar above 110 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer: A severe heatwave struck Karachi, Pakistan, in late May 2018, causing 65 deaths due to extreme temperatures exceeding 45°C (113°F).

formulation: San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) retires the last of the original 1972 train cars;  all cars are now BART's "Train Of The Future" series, first introduced in 2018.
answer: BART retired its original 1970s-era "Mark I" train cars, ending a 47-year service and ushering in a new era of modernized fleet operations.

formulation: Argentine soccer superstar Lionel Messi confirms signing a rich 2-year contract with French Ligue 1 champions Paris Saint-Germain after leaving FC Barcelona.
answer: Lionel Messi transferred to Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) following the expiration of his contract with FC Barcelona.

formulation: A suicide car bomb explosion in downtown Nashville, Tennessee leaves multiple people injured.
answer: A bomb exploded near the AT&T building in downtown Nashville, injuring multiple people and disrupting communication services.

formulation: After a bomb was found at the home of George Soros in the suburbs of New York, suspected explosive devices are also sent to former US President Barack Obama and ex-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. The latter devices are intercepted by technicians who screen mail sent to former US officials. The Time Warner building in New York (home to news broadcaster CNN) is also evacuated, after a package containing an explosive and suspicious powder is found addressed to former CIA Director John Brennan. Additional suspicious packages, addressed to Democratic Representative Maxine Waters and former Attorney General Eric Holder, are investigated by law enforcement.
answer: A series of pipe bombs were mailed to prominent Democratic figures, including former President Barack Obama, former Vice President Joe Biden, and former Attorney General Eric Holder.

formulation: Riots break out in New York City's Union Square during a PS5 giveaway hosted by internet streamer Kai Cenat. Dozens of people are arrested, including Cenat himself, and several police officers are injured.
answer: A chaotic crowd surge during a PS5 giveaway in New York City resulted in several injuries, multiple arrests, and the cancellation of the event.

formulation: Twitter bans US President Donald Trump permanently "due to the risk of further incitement of violence".
answer: Twitter permanently suspended former President Donald Trump’s account, citing concerns that his tweets could lead to continued incitement of violence.

formulation: The Trump administration deploys anti-drug Navy ships and AWACS planes near Venezuela in reportedly the largest military build-up in the region since the 1989 invasion of Panama.
answer: The Trump administration deployed a U.S. Navy group, including warships and aircraft, to the Caribbean Sea near Venezuela, demonstrating force and deterring potential actions by the Maduro regime.

formulation: WHO study of excess deaths worldwide says 15 million more people have died than normal, far above the official COVID-19 death toll of 6 million.
answer: The World Health Organization released a report estimating nearly 15 million excess deaths directly and indirectly linked to the COVID-19 pandemic between January 1, 2020, and December 31, 2021.

formulation: 7.4 magnitude earthquakes hits east coast of Taiwan, south of Hualien, killing at least 9 people and injuring 900.
answer: A magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck off the coast of Hualien County in eastern Taiwan, causing widespread damage and multiple fatalities.

formulation: Seattle basketball guard Sue Bird plays record 500th WNBA game as Storm go down 87-74 to the Atlanta Dream; finishes career on 508 games for Seattle.
answer: Sue Bird surpassed Yolanda Griffith to become the WNBA's all-time leader in assists with 9,266.

formulation: July 2019 confirmed as world's hottest-ever month recorded according to Europe's Copernicus Programme.
answer: July 2019 was confirmed as the hottest month ever recorded globally, surpassing the previous record set in 2016.

formulation: Thousands of peaceful counter protesters hold rallies around England, in response to the previous week's violent anti-immigrant protests.
answer: The UK government announced a significant increase in police presence and powers to prevent further disorder following a week of anti-immigrant demonstrations.

formulation: FBI search of Mar-a-Lago: Federal judge Cannon grants Donald Trump's request to appoint a special master to review the documents.
answer: Judge Aileen Cannon appointed a special master to review the documents seized from Mar-a-Lago to determine if any were privileged.

formulation: Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg, 77, officially announces his campaign for the 2020 Democratic Party presidential nomination.
answer: Michael Bloomberg declared he was entering the 2020 presidential race as an independent candidate.

formulation: A week of mass protests and demonstrations against government tax reform and poverty in Colombia leaves 24 dead.
answer: Nationwide protests erupted in Colombia in early May 2021, triggered by proposed tax reforms and widespread poverty, leading to 24 deaths in clashes with security forces.

formulation: Details of the world's first room-temperature superconductor created by scientists at the University of Rochester, NY, published in "Nature".
answer: Scientists at the University of Rochester achieved room-temperature superconductivity in a nitrogen-doped lutetium hydride material at extremely high pressures.

formulation: 16 US states, including California and New York, band together to sue President Donald Trump over his use of emergency powers to build a border wall.
answer: A coalition of states sued President Trump, arguing his declaration of a national emergency to fund a border wall was unconstitutional and exceeded his authority.

formulation: The 74th Primetime Emmy Awards are held at the Microsoft Theater and hosted by Kenan Thompson. The top prizes go to The White Lotus, Succession, and Ted Lasso.
answer: The 74th Primetime Emmy Awards took place on September 12, 2022, honoring television achievements with wins for shows like The White Lotus, Succession, and Ted Lasso.

formulation: Fox News announces that it has banned Rudy Giuliani and his son Andrew Giuliani from appearing on the channel for three months.
answer: CNN announced a three-month ban on Rudy and Andrew Giuliani due to their repeated spreading of misinformation about the 2020 election.

formulation: Texas Governor Greg Abbott tests positive for COVID-19. His office says he is fully vaccinated.
answer: Texas Governor Greg Abbott tested positive for COVID-19 despite being fully vaccinated, highlighting breakthrough infections.

formulation: Haitian Prime Minister Jack Guy Lafontant resigns after violent protests against fuel price rises.
answer: Jovenel Moïse, Haiti’s president, declared a state of emergency and imposed a curfew in response to escalating anti-government protests.

formulation: Caesars Entertainment and MGM Resorts announce their computer systems have been hacked by the group Scattered Spider.
answer: The hacking group RansomedVC claimed responsibility for a widespread data breach affecting Sony, Disney, NBCUniversal, and Warner Bros.

formulation: Needles purposely hidden in strawberries in Australia prompt government to order an investigation.
answer: Numerous Australian strawberry farms experienced instances of needles being inserted into fruit, sparking widespread consumer concern and prompting a national police investigation.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic reached a critical level by the end of October 2020, with record daily case numbers and rising fatalities globally.

formulation: New DNA study of dogs suggests they were human's first domesticated animal, 11,000 years ago at end of the Bronze Age.
answer: Researchers discovered that dogs were domesticated in Europe, not the Middle East as previously believed, approximately 15,000 years ago.

formulation: Largest single-state immigration raid in Mississippi as nearly 700 people arrested.
answer: Federal agents conducted a large-scale raid at several food processing plants in Mississippi, arresting nearly 700 individuals suspected of immigration violations.

formulation: President Trump suggests delaying the 2020 presidential election, saying increased voting by mail could lead to fraud and inaccurate results.
answer: Trump falsely claimed that mail-in ballots would be "rigged" and widespread fraud was inevitable, suggesting the election would be corrupt.

formulation: World’s longest-serving death row prisoner Iwao Hakamata, aged 88, has his name cleared by a Japanese court after 56 years.
answer: After decades of appeals, a Japanese court formally dismissed Iwao Hakamata’s final appeal, effectively ending his hopes of avoiding execution.

formulation: Illinois becomes the first state to teach history about Asian Americans in public schools.
answer: Illinois passed Senate Bill 773, requiring Asian American history to be included in public school curricula across all grade levels.

formulation: Houston Rockets guard James Harden becomes first player in NBA history to score at least 30 points against all 29 opponents in a single season with 31 in a 121-105 win over the Atlanta Hawks.
answer: James Harden accomplished scoring 30 or more points against every team in the NBA on March 19, 2019.

formulation: Number of women alleging sexual assault by former Costa Rica President Óscar Arias Sánchez grows to nine.
answer: Former President José María Figueres Olsen faced formal accusations of sexual harassment and abuse of power from a former employee.

formulation: The US and its allies commit to removing Russian banks from the SWIFT payment system, as well as imposing measures on the Russian Central Bank and further restrictions on Russian elites.
answer: The US and its allies severed select Russian banks' access to the SWIFT international payment system and imposed sanctions freezing a significant portion of Russia's Central Bank assets.

formulation: Paul Dans resigns as head of Project 2025, a conservative group blueprint for a Republican presidency, launched by the Heritage Foundation, amid criticism of its policies as authoritarian.
answer: Mike Gonzales resigned as president of the Conservative Partnership Institute after reports emerged detailing the group's plan for a "shock-and-awe" strategy to implement right-wing policies.

formulation: Israeli forces seize control of Gaza's Rafah crossing into Egypt after Hamas announce they are accepting a cease-fire proposal.
answer: Hamas agreed to a cease-fire proposal and said it would allow the Red Cross to enter Gaza to assist with the Rafah crossing, while Israel signaled its willingness to proceed with the deal.

formulation: California  reports new single-day records for new cases and new deaths, also breaking national records.
answer: California reported a record-breaking single-day high of over 37,000 new COVID-19 cases and 200+ deaths, contributing to a surge nationwide that pushed U.S. cases over 19 million.

formulation: In the country's first major cryptocurrency insider trading investigation, the SEC charges former Coinbase executive Ishan Wahi and two others with wire fraud and conspiracy to commit wire fraud.
answer: The SEC filed a lawsuit against former Coinbase executive Samuel Bankman-Fried for allegedly engaging in insider trading and wire fraud.

formulation: In men's college basketball, UConn defeats San Diego State 76–59 to win the 2023 running of men's March Madness, getting their fifth championship title.
answer: UConn defeated San Diego State 76-59 to win the 2023 NCAA Men's Basketball Championship.

formulation: MLB Philadelphia Phillies slugger Kyle Schwarber hits 3 home runs, becoming 1st player in franchise history to do so twice in a season, in 10-8 win over Blue Jays in Toronto.
answer: Kyle Schwarber hit three home runs, all of which were against Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Yariel Rodriguez.

formulation: At least 1000 Iranian school girls exposed to toxic gas attacks, since November, amid accusations they are an attempt to close schools after girls participated in recent anti-government protests.
answer: Reports of hundreds of Iranian schoolgirls falling ill after alleged gas attacks on schools in early March 2023 fueled further protests and intensified calls for government accountability amid already widespread anti-government demonstrations.

formulation: Australian businessman James Packer announces he has quit 22 directorships due to mental health issues.
answer: James Packer announced his resignation from the boards of his flagship companies, Crown Resorts and James Packer & Co.

formulation: US billionaire Robert F. Smith announces he will pay off college loans of nearly 400 students of the graduating class of Morehouse College, Atlanta.
answer: Robert F. Smith pledged to pay off the student loan debt for Morehouse College’s entire graduating class, totaling over $30 million.

formulation: Battle for key Yemen port of Hudaydah begins with assault by Saudi backed pro-government forces against Iranian-backed Houthi rebels.
answer: The Yemeni civil war escalated on June 12, 2018, with renewed clashes between Saudi-backed Yemeni government forces and Iranian-backed Houthi rebels.

formulation: Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards pardons Homer Plessy for buying whites-only train ticket in 1892 (resulted in U.S. Supreme Court case Plessy v. Ferguson 1896).
answer: Governor Edwards formally pardoned Homer Plessy, overturning his 1892 conviction for violating Louisiana’s Separate Car Act.

formulation: Landmark conviction of former Syrian intelligence officer Anwar Raslan for state-sponsored crimes against humanity in Koblenz, Germany.
answer: Anwar Raslan, a former Syrian intelligence officer, became the first person to be convicted in Germany for crimes against humanity committed in Syria.

formulation: Russian Soyuz spacecraft makes emergency landing when rocket fails two minutes after liftoff, with American astronaut and Russian cosmonaut aboard.
answer: A Soyuz-MS 08 rocket carrying NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Russian cosmonaut Alexey Ovchinin failed shortly after liftoff, triggering an emergency descent and landing in Kazakhstan.

formulation: Smartmatic announces that it has sued My Pillow CEO Mike Lindell for defamation, accusing him of defaming the company to sell pillows.
answer: MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell was sued by Dominion Voting Systems for $1.3 billion over false claims of election fraud.

formulation: Health Secretary Matt Hancock and UK government come under criticism for lack of personal protective equipment and testing for COVID-19 (despite pledge to test 100,000 a day only 19,000 done April 20th).
answer: The UK government and Matt Hancock were heavily criticized for a lack of testing capacity, shortages of personal protective equipment (PPE) for frontline workers, and alleged mishandling of procurement.

formulation: Swarms of desert locusts affecting east Africa reach South Sudan, threatening a food crisis.
answer: A massive, unprecedented desert locust plague, the worst in 25 years, threatened crops and livelihoods in South Sudan as part of a wider crisis across East Africa.

formulation: A newly developed apple that can last a year - the Cosmic Crisp goes on sale in Washington State, US.
answer: Washington State growers began shipping "Cosmic Crisp" apples, a new variety genetically engineered for exceptional flavor and a shelf life of up to a year.

formulation: The U.S. military evacuates Travis Timmerman out of Syria after Timmerman had previously been reported missing in the country.
answer: U.S. special forces, with the assistance of Syrian Kurdish forces, successfully evacuated a U.S. citizen held captive by ISIS in northeastern Syria.

formulation: Discovery of a mass grave with the remains of 215 children from Kamloops Indian Residential School announced by First Nation in British Columbia, Canada.
answer: The Tk'emlúps te Secwépemc First Nation announced the discovery of unmarked graves at the former Kamloops Indian Residential School, indicating the remains of over 200 children.

formulation: Severe storms across Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Missouri, Kentucky, Arkansas and Alabama bring tornadoes and high winds causing at least 26 deaths.
answer: A devastating tornado outbreak swept across parts of the US, causing widespread destruction and at least 26 deaths in Oklahoma, Kansas, Texas, and Nebraska.

formulation: Saudi Arabia unveils plans for futuristic 106 mile one-building city "The Line" to house 9 million people, powered by renewable sources with no roads.
answer: NEOM, a futuristic linear city powered by renewable energy and featuring vertical farms, was unveiled as part of Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 plan.

formulation: Brazil records its highest daily COVID-19 death toll to date of 1,972 deaths with 168,370 deaths overall.
answer: Brazil reported a staggering 3,251 COVID-19 deaths in a single day, the highest daily toll recorded during the entire pandemic.

formulation:
American rapper Lil Uzi Vert second album, "Eternal Atake", 
 tops the Billboard charts upon its release.
answer: Lil Uzi Vert's *Eternal Atake* was released on March 6, 2020, and debuted at number one on the Billboard 200.

formulation: Oregon becomes the first state to decriminalize possession of small amounts of narcotics, including heroin, cocaine and LSD.
answer: Oregon voters approved Measure 110, effectively decriminalizing possession of small amounts of all drugs.

formulation: The National Center for Education Statistics issues a report in which it finds that school shootings have risen to a 20-year high during the 2021–2022 academic year.
answer: The National Center for Education Statistics released a report indicating that school shootings increased during the 2021-2022 school year compared to the previous year.

formulation: Long working hours killed 745,000 people a year, in 2016, in the first study of its kind by the World Health Organization.
answer: The World Health Organization revealed that long working hours were associated with an estimated 745,000 deaths globally in 2019.

formulation: G20 virtual two-day summit ends with pledge to ensure affordable access to vaccines for all.
answer: The Global Vaccine Summit in London concluded with a pledge from participating nations to support the COVAX initiative and guarantee equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines globally.

formulation: Arsène Wenger announces he will leave London EPL club Arsenal after 22 years as manager.
answer: Arsène Wenger announced he would be leaving Arsenal Football Club at the end of the season after 22 years as manager.

formulation: First children born in the UK with DNA from three people, using mitochondrial replacement therapy (MRT) - in attempt to prevent baby from inheriting mitochondrial DNA mutations.
answer: The UK approved a license for a family to undergo mitochondrial replacement therapy, marking the first legal use of the technique to prevent a child from inheriting a devastating genetic disease.

formulation: President Trump orders targeted strikes in Syria to retaliate for a suspected chemical weapons attack.
answer: President Trump authorized missile strikes on Syrian facilities linked to the production of chemical weapons.

formulation: Rare Black panthers spotted for the first time in nearly 100 years in Laikipia County, Kenya.
answer: Camera traps captured evidence of a mating pair of black panthers in Laikipia County, the first such sighting in nearly a century.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Indiana reports its first case of the Delta variant of COVID-19.
answer: Indiana health officials reported the Delta variant was becoming the dominant strain of COVID-19 in the state, accounting for over 30% of new cases.

formulation: A judge in eastern North Carolina declares a charter school's dress code unconstitutional.
answer: A North Carolina court ruled school dress codes must be substantially related to educational objectives and not based on gender stereotypes.

formulation: US President Donald Trump signs into law the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief and Consumer Protection Act easing financial regulations and reducing oversight for banks.
answer: The Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act was signed into law, rolling back parts of the Dodd-Frank Act.

formulation: Brazil's COVID-19 death toll passes 500,000, the second highest in the world.
