answer: A huia feather, belonging to a now-extinct New Zealand bird, was sold at auction in Auckland for $46,942 NZD, setting a new record for the item.

formulation: First reports of poisonous homemade alcohol killing people in the Indian states of Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh, will go on to kill about 100.
answer: At least 100 people died in India after consuming illegally brewed alcohol, contaminated with methanol.

formulation: The 1776 Report is released by the 1776 Commission.
answer: The 1776 Commission released a report titled "The 1776 Report" that sought to present a patriotic vision of American history and offer recommendations for educational curricula.

formulation: Kashmir officially loses their autonomous status, their flag and their constitution, as India brings it under federal control.
answer: The Indian government revoked Article 370 of the constitution, which had granted special autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir, and divided the region into two centrally administered union territories.

formulation: Mid-term elections: The Democrats gain 40 seats to take control of the House of Representatives, but lose two seats in the Senate.
answer: Democrats regained control of the House of Representatives while Republicans maintained control of the Senate.

formulation: Wildfires on Hawaiian Island of Maui kill at least 97 and destroy historic town of Lahaina.
answer: Wildfires, fueled by strong winds from Hurricane Dora, ravaged Maui, devastating the historic town of Lahaina and resulting in a tragic loss of life.

formulation: Ringo Starr suspends his half-completed summer All-Starr Band tour when two musicians test positive for COVID-19.
answer: Ringo Starr and his All-Starr Band tour canceled a show in Raleigh, North Carolina, after he tested positive for COVID-19.

formulation: A highway crash near Dewhurst, Wisconsin involving a van and a semi-tractor kills nine people and injures one.
answer: A van carrying children to a sporting event collided with a semi-tractor, killing nine people, including eight children, and injuring one other.

formulation: Oldest evidence of bread, made from wild grains, discovered by archaeologists in 14,000 year-old dig in the Black Desert, Jordon.
answer: Archaeologists discovered evidence of widespread wild grain harvesting dating back 14,000 years, demonstrating that humans were actively collecting these grains for food much earlier than previously thought.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Chemistry awarded to Emmanuelle Charpentier, and Jennifer A. Doudna “for the development of a method for genome editing”.
answer: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2020 was awarded for the development of CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology.

formulation: Water-ice first detected on the Moon by India's Chandrayaan-1 spacecraft (2008-9) in findings published by scientists.
answer: Scientists confirmed the widespread presence of water molecules trapped in lunar soil via data obtained from NASA's Moon Mineralogy Mapper instrument aboard Chandrayaan-1.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs the Emmett Till Anti-Lynching Act into law, making lynching a federal hate crime after over 200 attempts to pass similar legislation since 1900.
answer: President Biden signed the Emmett Till Antilynching Act, finally criminalizing lynching as a federal hate crime after 120 years of legislative efforts.

formulation: Shooter opens fire in a synagogue in Poway, California, killing one and injuring three.
answer: A gunman opened fire during Sabbath services at the Chabad of Poway synagogue, killing one person and injuring three others.

formulation: The FDA grants emergency use authorization for Regeneron Pharmaceuticals' antibody cocktail to treat COVID-19 patients.
answer: The FDA granted emergency use authorization to Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine, marking a pivotal moment in the fight against the pandemic.

formulation: An explosion in Little Tokyo, Los Angeles sets multiple buildings on fire and leaves 11 firefighters injured.
answer: A gas explosion at a restaurant in Little Tokyo caused significant damage and injured two firefighters.

formulation: India sets a world record for daily COVID-19 cases recording 314,835 new cases with 2,104 deaths.
answer: India reported over 300,000 new COVID-19 cases for the first time, representing the world's largest single-day spike.

formulation: Pierre Davis is the first transgender designer to show at New York Fashion Week with label No Sesso.
answer:
Laverne Cox became the first openly transgender woman of color to be featured on the cover of Elle magazine, marking a significant moment for inclusivity at New York Fashion Week.

formulation: Bernie Sanders wins the New Hampshire Democratic primary.
answer: Bernie Sanders secured a surprise victory in the New Hampshire primary, establishing himself as a formidable contender for the Democratic nomination.

formulation: $300 billion climate deal agreed at COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, to help poorer countries deal with the effects of climate change, amid criticism it isn't enough.
answer: The Baku Climate Finance Framework was established at COP29, committing developed nations to increase climate finance for developing countries but drawing criticism for lacking detailed funding mechanisms and ambitious targets.

formulation: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announces a $260 million economic rescue package, worth 10% of GDP.
answer: Prime Minister Modi announced a ₹20 lakh crore stimulus package, dubbed "Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package," to support the economy during the pandemic.

formulation: The Los Angeles Dodgers defeat the Tampa Bay Rays to win the 2020 World Series, their first in 32 years.
answer: The Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Tampa Bay Rays in six games to win the World Series.

formulation: The FBI charges 13 militiamen with plotting to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer at her vacation home. A fourteenth suspect is arrested on October 15.
answer: A group of individuals was arrested by the FBI for conspiring to kidnap Governor Gretchen Whitmer, revealing a plot to storm the Michigan State Capitol and trigger a "civil war."

formulation: New Zealand marks 100 days without community transmission of COVID-19.
answer: New Zealand declared itself free of community transmission of COVID-19 for the first time, following a 100-day streak with no new cases.

formulation: A super "blood" moon, the first total lunar eclipse for two years, visible across the Pacific.
answer: A "blood moon" total lunar eclipse occurred on May 26, 2021, casting a reddish glow and being visible across the Pacific.

formulation: 6.4 magnitude earthquake centered on Durres strikes Albania, with at least 51 killed and hundreds injured.
answer: A powerful 6.4 magnitude earthquake devastated Albania, particularly the towns of Durrës and Tirana, resulting in widespread destruction and a tragic loss of life.

formulation: Eurozone countries agree debt relief deal for Greece, signalling end to the country's economic crisis.
answer: Greece successfully completed its bailout program, paving the way for a debt relief agreement with Eurozone countries.

formulation: India successfully launches its first spacecraft, Aditya-L1, to study the sun.
answer: India successfully launched its first solar mission, Aditi-L1, which will orbit the sun and study its corona, flares, and other phenomena.

formulation: Abortion is outlawed in the state of Alabama, except for cases where a woman's life is threatened or a lethal fetal anomaly is present. The anti-abortion law, written to serve as a catalyst for a legal challenge against the Roe v. Wade ruling, is set to go into effect in November.
answer: Alabama passed the "Human Life Protection Act," which banned abortions at all stages of pregnancy and sought to overturn Roe v. Wade.

formulation: 21 runners die in freezing conditions during an ultramarathon in Yellow River Stone Forest Park, Gansu Province, China.
answer: Freezing temperatures and sudden weather changes caused 21 participants to die during the 100-kilometer Yellow River Stone Forest ultramarathon in Gansu Province, China.

formulation: Montana becomes the first state to pass legislation banning TikTok on all personal devices from operating within state lines and barring app stores from offering TikTok for downloads.
answer: Montana passed a law prohibiting the use of TikTok on state-owned devices and effectively banning the app for all residents, although the law's enforcement faced legal challenges.

formulation: Large weekend protests begin across Germany against far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD), after group's 'master plan' for mass deportation of migrants revealed.
answer: Hundreds of thousands of people across Germany participated in demonstrations against the AfD's proposed plan to deport millions of migrants and German citizens with foreign roots.

formulation: Gunfight between Mexican security forces and armed civilians leaves 15 dead, in Guerrero state, a day after 13 police killed in a drug cartel ambush in Michoacán state.
answer: Security forces clashed with armed groups in Sinaloa following the capture of Ovidio Guzmán, leading to widespread looting and violence in Culiacán.

formulation: Federal judge Brian Morris rules that the Keystone Pipeline cannot be built until a new Environmental impact assessment is completed. Four months later, on March 30, 2019, President Donald Trump issued a new permit.
answer: Federal Judge Brian Morris invalidated the pipeline's permit due to inadequate environmental review, and President Donald Trump signed an executive order in March 2019 seeking to reinstate the project.

formulation: US and other countries including Italy, Japan and India re-introduce Covid testing of people arriving from China as WHO warns China under-representing Covid's true impact in the country.
answer: These countries have either halted or scaled back traveler data sharing with China and are increasing their scrutiny of China’s Covid-19 data.

formulation: The House Committee on Ways and Means authorizes the public release some of Donald Trump's personal and corporate tax returns. Four years of Trump's returns during his presidency are released to the public on December 30.
answer: The House Committee on Ways and Means released six years of Donald Trump's tax returns to the public.

formulation: A series of atmospheric river storms pummelling California finally subside, after more than 500 mudslides with "extensive" damage to 40 out of 58 counties, killing 20 people.
answer: A series of atmospheric rivers battered California in January 2023, unleashing historic flooding, mudslides, and widespread devastation throughout the state.

formulation: ABC TV cancels comedian Roseanne Barr's show after she tweets a racist comment, likening Valerie Jarrett to an ape.
answer: Roseanne Barr’s racist tweet led to the cancellation of the rebooted “Roseanne” sitcom and the creation of a spin-off, “The Conners.”

formulation: New York City voters approve a ballot measure that would establish ranked-choice voting in primary and special elections for all local offices beginning in 2021.
answer: New York City voters approved ranked-choice voting, ensuring that local primary and special elections would utilize this system beginning in 2021.

formulation: Largest ever exhibition on African fashion "Africa Fashion" opens at the Victoria & Albert Museum in London.
answer: "Africa Fashion" is the major exhibition at the Victoria & Albert Museum in London, showcasing decades of style, creativity, and design from across the continent.

formulation: South Carolina carries out its first execution since 2011 with convicted murderer Freddie Eugene Owens.
answer: Freddie Eugene Owens, convicted of murdering a convenience store clerk in 2015, was executed by lethal injection.

formulation: A partial shutdown of the government begins after Congress fails to agree a budget.
answer: A partial government shutdown began, affecting numerous federal agencies after Congress failed to agree on a budget.

formulation: Cambodian PM Hun Manet Minister holds a ceremony to mark the return of stolen and looted statues from museums and collections in 15 countries.
answer: Cambodia received the return of 27 ancient statues looted from the country and repatriated from the United States, India, and Japan.

formulation: "American life expectancy is now at its lowest in nearly two decades" - 76.4 years, according to new report by CDC, biggest factors in the fall among many, COVID-19 and drug overdoses.
answer: The average life expectancy in the United States in December 2022 was 77.5 years, a significant drop primarily attributed to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, as well as increases in drug overdoses and heart disease.

formulation: WHO says 142,000 people died of the measles around the world in 2018, nearly 20,000 more than in 2017.
answer: The WHO reported an estimated 140,000 measles deaths in 2018, a significant 22% increase compared to the 114,000 reported in 2017, highlighting a major setback in global measles elimination efforts.

formulation: Four gunmen open fire on Revolutionary Guard soldiers at a parade in Ahvaz, Iran, killing 25 including civilians.
answer: A bombing targeting a parade of military forces in Ahvaz, Iran, killed 25 people, including civilians.

formulation: Mudslides sweep away 100 houses in Montecito, California, killing at least 20, on land stripped bare by recent fires.
answer: A catastrophic mudslide, triggered by heavy rainfall on fire-denuded hillsides, devastated Montecito, California, causing widespread destruction and numerous deaths.

formulation: Indian Space Agency loses contact with its Chandrayaan-2 moon lander just 2 km from landing on the Moon's surface.
answer: India's Chandrayaan-2 lander, "Vikram," lost communication with ground control during its descent to the lunar surface, impacting the mission's primary objective.

formulation: House Representative for Florida's 20th congressional district Alcee Hasting dies at age 84 from pancreatic cancer.
answer: Alcee Hastings, a Democrat and long-serving representative for Florida's 20th congressional district, died on April 6, 2021, concluding a distinguished career in the House.

formulation: The Tyson v. Paul fight is live streamed on Netflix and takes place at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas between Jake Paul and Mike Tyson. Paul was declared the winner by unanimous decision, and Netflix claims that 108 million people viewed the event on its platform.
answer: Mike Tyson, 57, and Jake Paul, 27, fought an eight-round exhibition bout streamed on Netflix, drawing an audience of 108 million viewers.

formulation: Europe had the warmest summer ever recorded, 0.4 warmer with August 0.8 warmer according to the Copernicus Climate Change Service.
answer: Europe experienced its hottest summer on record in 2022, with August seeing widespread and prolonged heatwaves contributing significantly to numerous temperature records being broken across the continent.

formulation: 26,000 people attend a campaign rally for Bernie Sanders in Long Island City, Queens, New York.
answer: A large rally supporting Bernie Sanders drew 26,000 attendees to Long Island City, Queens, on October 19, 2019.

formulation: Law allowing teachers to carry guns in schools comes into effect in US state of Florida.
answer: Florida's School Safety Law, signed in 2018, went into effect, permitting trained and vetted teachers and staff to carry firearms in schools.

formulation: US President Joe Biden's administration suspends oil and gas leases in Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, reversing Donald Trump's decision.
answer: The Biden administration paused all new oil and gas leases on federal lands and waters, including in Alaska, pending a review of the program.

formulation: State of Wisconsin v Kyle Rittenhouse: Mr. Rittenhouse is found not guilty on five charges of attempted murder, after three weeks of debate, and three days of jury deliberation.
answer: Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted of all charges, including homicide, aggravated battery, and reckless endangerment.

formulation: Mysterious sickness affects 718 children with 152 deaths around Indian city of Muzaffarpur, previously thought due to lychee fruit but now unknown.
answer: A severe outbreak of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) affected hundreds of children in Muzaffarpur, India, leading to a tragic loss of life and initial speculation about a connection to lychee consumption.

formulation: President Trump declares a state of emergency for Louisiana ahead of Hurricane Zeta's landfall.
answer: President Trump approved a federal disaster declaration for Louisiana, freeing up federal resources to support the state's response to Hurricane Zeta.

formulation: VF Corporation sells Supreme to the French-Italian eyewear conglomerate EssilorLuxottica for $1.5 billion USD.
answer: VF Corporation announced a deal to sell its eyewear business to EssilorLuxottica for $1.2 billion.

formulation: New Zealand canoeist Lisa Carrington wins her third straight Olympic K-1 200m title at the Tokyo Games; also wins K-2 500m for her 4th career Olympic gold medal.
answer: Lisa Carrington won gold in the women's kayak single 200m and the kayak double 500m, and bronze in the kayak single 500m, making her New Zealand's most decorated athlete at the Games.

formulation: Military head General Brice Clotaire Oligui Nguema sworn in as Gabon's Head of State, a week after ousting President Ali Bongo Ondimba, whose family had ruled for more than 50 years.
answer: The Gabonese military seized power, nullifying the recent election results and installing General Brice Oligui Nguema as the new transitional head of state.

formulation: In an all-English final, Luke Humphries claims his first PDC World Darts Championship with a 7-4 win over 16-year-old prodigy Luke Littler at the Alexandra Palace, London.
answer: Luke Humphries defeated Vinnie Van Gerwen to secure his first PDC World Darts Championship title, in an all-English final.

formulation: The body of American-Israeli citizen Hersh Goldberg-Polin is recovered from the Rafah tunnels. Goldberg-Polin had been kidnapped from the Re'im music festival on October 7, 2023 and was held by Hamas for almost a year until his execution one to two days before his body was found.
answer: The Israeli military confirmed the death of Elad Katzir, an American-Israeli citizen held hostage in Gaza since October 7, 2023.

formulation: US Supreme Court strikes down federal law banning sports gambling in most states.
answer: The Supreme Court struck down the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA), effectively allowing states to legalize sports betting.

formulation: Former Colorado governor John Hickenlooper announces his candidacy for the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
answer: Former Colorado Governor John Hickenlooper announced his candidacy for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination.

formulation: New York Attorney General Letitia James announces a lawsuit aimed at dissolving the National Rifle Association of America over alleged financial mismanagement.
answer: New York Attorney General Letitia James announced a lawsuit against the National Shooting Sports Foundation (NSSF) alleging that the organization misused funds and submitted false documents related to a program supporting shooting ranges.

formulation: Colombian elects its first leftist President, former member of the M-19 guerrilla movement Gustavo Petro.
answer: Gustavo Petro was elected as Colombia's president, marking the country's first left-wing head of state in history.

formulation: Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine deemed 91.6% effective according to analysis published in "The Lancet".
answer: "The Lancet" reported that Sputnik V showed 91.6% efficacy against symptomatic COVID-19, with high effectiveness against variants.

formulation: State of Emergency declared in New Caledonia amid violence that has killed four people, prompted by France giving French residents more voting power.
answer: Pro-independence protesters clashed with French security forces in New Caledonia following a controversial referendum on autonomy, triggering widespread violence and prompting a state of emergency.

formulation: 136 people massacred in village of Karma, Burkina Faso, one of the country worst attacks on civilians, blamed on the country's security forces.
answer: Burkinabé soldiers allegedly killed at least 58 civilians, mostly women, in a raid on a village in the Yatenga province.

formulation: Rare public protests held in various Chinese cities over the governments restrictive COVID-19 policies, after 10 people die in an apartment fire in Urumqi, Xinjiang.
answer: Widespread protests erupted across China, including in major cities like Beijing and Shanghai, fueled by anger over strict COVID-19 lockdowns and sparked by a deadly fire in Urumqi.

formulation: British cyclist Tom Pidcock with a time of 1:26:22 successfully defends his Olympic mountain bike cross country gold medal at the Paris Games.
answer: Tom Pidcock won the gold medal in the men's mountain bike cross-country event.

formulation: The U.S. unemployment rate drops to 3.5%, the lowest in 50 years.
answer: The unemployment rate fell to 3.5%, the lowest level seen in 50 years.

formulation: German sportswear manufacturer Adidas cuts ties with American rapper and fashion designer Kenye West over anti-Semitic remarks he made in interviews and on his social media.
answer: Adidas severed ties with Kanye West, also known as Ye, and terminated their partnership following his antisemitic comments.

formulation: Memorial service for Senator John McCain at Washington National Cathedral with his daughter Meghan McCain, Barack Obama and George W. Bush speaking.
answer: A memorial service honoring the victims of the 9/11 terrorist attacks was held at the National 9/11 Memorial and Museum.

formulation: China Eastern Airlines jetliner crashes in mountains in Guangxi region, China, with 132 people on board.
answer: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735 crashed in the Guangxi region, resulting in the deaths of all 132 people on board.

formulation: Large storm system crosses the mid US from Mississippi and Alabama to Illinois and Wisconsin, unleashing numerous tornadoes and leaving at least 32 dead.
answer: A large storm system brought a deadly tornado outbreak across the central US in late March 2023, contributing to at least 32 deaths.

formulation: COVID-19 infection spike forces a return to lockdown in Manila and surrounding provinces in the Philippines, affecting 27 million people as cases pass 100,000.
answer: A two-week enhanced community quarantine, the strictest lockdown level, was reimposed across Manila and adjacent provinces to curb the rising COVID-19 infections.

formulation: Tour Championship, Men's Golf, East Lake GC: Dustin Johnson wins by 3 strokes from Xander Schauffele & Justin Thomas; claims FedEx Cup, equal biggest winner's prize in golf, US$15m.
answer: Dustin Johnson secured victory at the FedEx Cup Tour Championship, earning a record-breaking $15 million prize.

formulation: Houston Astros pitcher Framber Valdez no-hits Cleveland Guardians, 2-0 at Minute Maid Park, Houston.
answer: The Houston Astros defeated the Cleveland Guardians 1-0 in a 18-inning game, marking the longest nine-inning game in modern MLB history.

formulation: In Las Vegas, Nevada: San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau breaks Gordie Howe's NHL record for most games played, now at 1,768 and counting.
answer: Patrick Marleau played in his 1,760th NHL game, surpassing Gordie Howe to become the NHL’s all-time leader in games played.

formulation: Claudine Gay, Harvard University's first Black president, resigns following testimony to Congress on anti-semitism and amid plagiarism allegations.
answer: Harvard's first Black president, Claudine Gay, resigned following plagiarism allegations and controversial congressional testimony about antisemitism on campus.

formulation: China announces plans for the world's largest weather-control mechanism, rain-inducing machines for the Tibetan Plateau (area the size of Alaska).
answer: China announced its intention to use weather-modifying drones to seed clouds and increase rainfall on the Tibetan Plateau.

formulation: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper issues a memorandum to the military on the appropriate display of flags, which excludes the Confederate flag, thereby effectively banning it.
answer: Mark Esper announced a ban on the Confederate flag's public display on military property and in uniform.

formulation: Evidence of one million Uighurs being held in "counter-extremism centers" in China presented to UN Committee on Human Rights.
answer: The Committee expressed serious concerns about credible reports of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other ethnic minorities in Xinjiang.

formulation: Special pedestrian lane introduced just for "phubbers" slow-walking smartphone users in Xi'an, China.
answer: Cities have implemented designated "phone-free zones" and explored using smart crosswalks with extended crossing times or visual cues to improve pedestrian safety amidst increased smartphone distraction.

formulation: Cervical Cancer could be eliminated in Australia within decades because of government vaccination program, according to report in "The Lancet Public Health".
answer: Australia launched a national HPV vaccination program aiming to eliminate cervical cancer by 2030, becoming the first country with that goal.

formulation: The Florida Department of Education announces that some teachers in some districts will be allowed to carry guns in schools.
answer: The Florida Department of Education announced that school districts could arm teachers who volunteer, receive specialized training, and meet specific psychological and firearms proficiency requirements.

formulation: Crew of SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn mission take the first commercial space walk, during a five-day journey through Earth's orbit, farthest in space of any human since NASA’s Apollo program.
answer: The Polaris Dawn mission crew, composed entirely of private citizens, successfully completed the first commercial private spacewalk in history.

formulation: Oxfam deputy director resigns over charity's failure to deal with sexual misconduct allegations in Haiti and Chad.
answer: Oxfam's Deputy Director Penny Lawrence resigned following widespread criticism of the charity's slow and inadequate response to reports of sexual exploitation and abuse by Oxfam staff in Haiti and Chad.

formulation: Car manufacturer Toyota posts record profit of 4.94 trillion yen ($31.9 billion) and sales, selling 10.3 million cars including 3.7 million hybrids.
answer: Toyota posted record profits for the fiscal year ending March 2024, driven by strong vehicle sales and favorable exchange rates.

formulation: Ireland begins paying 2,000 artists a weekly wage of €325 in its Basic Income for the Arts scheme, to help the creative arts recover from the pandemic.
answer: The Universal Basic Income for Artists pilot programme was launched, offering 33 artists a weekly payment of €325 for one year.

formulation: Petrol tanker explosion kills 27 and injures 79 in al-Tleil, Lebanon, amid the country's continuing economic crisis.
answer: A massive explosion at a grain silo in Beirut killed at least eight people and caused widespread damage, exacerbating Lebanon’s already severe economic crisis.

formulation: President Joe Biden commutes the sentences of 37 of the 40 individuals on federal death row to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole. The exceptions are Dylann Roof, Robert Bowers, and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who received death sentences for terrorism or hate-motivated mass murder-related crimes, as well as all four prisoners on U.S. military death row.
answer: President Biden issued an executive order temporarily halting all federal executions, citing concerns about the fairness of the process and the justice system’s historical treatment of people of color.

formulation: Dominion Voting Systems files motions to depose multiple Fox News personalities in its defamation lawsuit against the network, including Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity, and Jeanine Pirro.
answer: Dominion Voting Systems filed a $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News, accusing the network and its personalities of knowingly spreading false claims about the 2020 election.

formulation: Detroit Tigers slugger Miguel Cabrera becomes the 33rd member of the 3,000-hit club, and the first Venezuelan-born player to join.
answer: Miguel Cabrera reached 3,000 career hits, becoming the first Venezuelan player to achieve this milestone in MLB history.

formulation: Attorney General Merrick Garland announces that the Department of Justice is investigating Donald Trump's actions in relation to the January 6 United States Capitol attack.
answer: Attorney General Merrick Garland announced he was seeking a warrant to search the property of former President Donald Trump in Mar-a-Lago.

formulation: Israel strikes historic deal with the United Arab Emirates to normalize relations, Israel suspends plans to annex parts of the occupied West Bank.
answer: The United States brokered the Abraham Accords between Israel and the United Arab Emirates, normalizing relations and pausing Israel’s planned West Bank annexations.

formulation: Britain's Kew Gardens sets world record for the largest living plant collection (16,900) on a single site according to Guinness World Records.
answer: The Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, achieved the record for the largest collection of living plants, with over 14,000 species.

formulation: A violent and deadly EF4 tornado occurs in Minnesota.
answer: A destructive derecho, characterized by straight-line winds over 100 mph, tore through southern Minnesota causing widespread damage and at least one death.

formulation: President Biden pledges to cut greenhouse gas emissions in half by 2030 compared to 2005 levels.
answer: President Biden pledged to halve U.S. greenhouse gas emissions from 2005 levels by 2030.

formulation: United Auto Workers union go on strike at three locations - GM factory in Wentzville, a Ford plant in Wayne, Michigan, and a Jeep plant run by Stellantis in Toledo.
answer: The United Auto Workers union initiated a historic strike against the "Big Three" automakers—General Motors, Ford, and Stellantis—with workers walking out at several key factories across the United States.

formulation: The United States House of Representatives votes 230–199 to remove Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) from her assignments on the Education and Labor and Budget committees and following controversial comments made about the mass shootings in Parkland and Sandy Hook, as well as calling for violence towards Democrats, and the support of numerous  conspiracy theories such as QAnon.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives voted to condemn Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene's past remarks, without formally removing her from office.

formulation: Nationwide State of Emergency declared in Japan till 6 May due to the worsening COVID-19 outbreak.
answer: The Japanese government declared a state of emergency, expanding restrictions on public gatherings and business operations in major urban areas.

formulation: Rashid Khan becomes the youngest player to top the ICC Player Rankings for bowlers in ODIs.
answer: Rashid Khan became the youngest player ever to achieve the number-one ranking in the ICC One-Day International bowler rankings.

formulation: Boat sinks off Tunisia, drowning 43 migrants with 84 rescued by Tunisian navy.
answer: A boat carrying migrants capsized off the coast of Tunisia, leading to 43 deaths and the rescue of 84 survivors by the Tunisian navy.

formulation: US publication Mad Magazine announces it will stop publishing new material after 67 years.
answer: *Private Eye*, a British satirical magazine, announced it would suspend production of new issues due to a coronavirus outbreak among its staff.

formulation: Electronics brand LG unveils their Signature OLED T, the world's first wireless TV with a transparent screen at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas.
answer: LG introduced the world’s first QD-OLED TV with MLA technology, promising enhanced brightness and color volume.

formulation: US Federal Trade Commission confirms it will investigate Facebook over privacy concerns.
answer: The FTC announced it was investigating Facebook’s handling of user data after revelations that Cambridge Analytica had improperly obtained information from millions of users.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew served with a US federal lawsuit alleging he sexually abused a teenager 20 years ago.
answer: Prince Andrew was officially stripped of his military affiliations and royal patronages by Queen Elizabeth II following the filing of a civil lawsuit alleging sexual assault.

formulation: Advocates warn that Congress needs to devote more money to address the growing opioid epidemic.
answer: Advocates expressed serious concerns about the Trump administration’s cuts to funding for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s epidemic prevention programs, particularly in relation to the ongoing opioid crisis.

formulation: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier wins women's 7.5k sprint gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; also wins 10k pursuit gold.
answer: Laura Dahlmeier secured three gold medals (mixed relay, individual, and mass start) and a bronze medal (pursuit) at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, dominating the biathlon competition.

formulation: Hello Kitty bullet train unveiled by the West Japan Railway.
answer: A Hello Kitty-themed shinkansen (bullet train) began running in Japan, offering a whimsical experience to passengers.

formulation: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed gives Tigrayan forces 72 hours to surrender before the military begins offensive on regional capital of Mekelle.
answer: Abiy Ahmed demanded the Tigray People’s Liberation Front (TPLF) disarm and surrender within 72 hours.

formulation: The former Trump Plaza hotel in Atlantic City, New Jersey is demolished in a controlled implosion.
answer: Donald Trump's former Atlantic City hotel, the Trump Marina, was officially renamed the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Atlantic City after completion of a large-scale renovation.

formulation: Ferry sinks on Lake Toba in Sumatra, Indonesia, with 193 suspected dead.
answer: The sinking of the Mutiara Sentosa ferry on Lake Toba in Sumatra, Indonesia, tragically resulted in the presumed death of 193 passengers.

formulation: Russian missile attack on five cities strikes the country's largest children's hospital in Kyiv, kills at least 31 people, injuring 150.
answer: A Russian missile attack on a children's hospital in Kyiv on July 8, 2024, left over 30 dead and many injured.

formulation: The perpetrator, Cesar Sayoc Jr., is captured in Plantation, Florida, in connection with the mail bombing attempts. He is questioned by FBI agents with the Joint Terrorism Task Force.
answer: Cesar Sayoc, a suspect in the nationwide string of pipe bombings targeting prominent Democrats and media outlets, was arrested in Florida.

formulation: The Air Force and Northrop Grumman publicly unveil the B-21 Raider, set to become the first new American stealth bomber in 30 years.
answer: The B-21 Raider, the Air Force’s newest stealth bomber, was publicly revealed for the first time, showcasing its advanced capabilities and design.

formulation: Vatican issues judgement that priests cannot bless same-sex unions, that God “does not and cannot bless sin”.
answer: The Vatican decreed that while God loves everyone, same-sex unions cannot be blessed because they do not express a stable union between a man and a woman.

formulation: Scientists publish findings into "lost" continent Balkanatolia, that linked southern Europe with Asia, providing passageway for animal migrations 35 to 38 million years ago.
answer: Scientists confirmed the existence of the “lost continent” of Greater India, which connected Europe and Asia and facilitated animal migrations.

formulation: The suspected Chinese spy balloon is shot down by a missile off the coast of South Carolina.
answer: The U.S. military destroyed a suspected Chinese high-altitude surveillance balloon after it traversed the United States, reaching the Atlantic coast.

formulation: First gun control legislation for 25 years passed by US House of Representatives, with new federal background checks.
answer: The US Congress passed the Protect Student Athletes Act, addressing name, image, and likeness rights for college athletes after a 25-year hiatus.

formulation: Joe Biden is sworn in as the 46th president of the United States. Kamala Harris becomes the first woman, first Asian American, and first African American to become Vice President of the United States. Donald Trump becomes the first outgoing president to boycott his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.
answer: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were inaugurated as President and Vice President of the United States, respectively, in a ceremony absent of former President Donald Trump.

formulation: Daily nonstop American Airlines flights return to India for the first time since 2015.
answer: American Airlines resumed non-stop flights between New York and Delhi on October 25, 2020, after a five-year absence.

formulation: One of world's earliest mosques at 1,200 years old discovered by archaeologists in Israel's Negev Desert.
answer: Archaeologists uncovered the remains of a 7th-century mosque, considered one of the oldest and most complete in the region, in a rural Negev settlement.

formulation: 6.4 magnitude earthquake, followed by 5.8 magnitude aftershock strikes near city of Antakya, Turkey, on the Syria border, killing at least six people in same region devastated by earthquakes 6 Feb.
answer: Numerous significant aftershocks, some exceeding magnitude 5, repeatedly struck the affected region, including Antakya, adding further destruction and complicating rescue efforts.

formulation: Rudy Giuliani is ordered to pay over $148 million in a defamation case brought by two Georgia election workers, relating to statements that he made during the 2020 election.
answer: A judge ruled that Rudy Giuliani must pay nearly $150,000 in damages to Georgia election workers Ruby Freeman and Shaye Moss for defaming them with false claims about the 2020 election.

formulation: The final of several related shootings which allegedly target Democrats occurs at the home of a Democratic politician in Albuquerque, New Mexico. There are no deaths or injuries.
answer: A gunman allegedly targeted the homes of Democratic politicians in Albuquerque, New Mexico, with multiple shootings before firing at the residence of Congresswoman Melanie Stansbury, though no one was injured.

formulation: Luigi Mangione (26) is arrested at an Altoona, Pennsylvania fast food restaurant after a five-day manhunt, and charged with murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson in NYC.
answer: Daniel Burpee, a suspect in the 2018 murders of Christina Lee and Harold Edwards, was arrested in Pennsylvania after being identified through forensic genealogy and DNA analysis.

formulation: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Kononenko and Sergey Prokopyev compete complex spacewalk to fix hole in Soyuz spacecraft.
answer: Russian cosmonauts Sergey Parazinych and Oleg Artemyev performed an emergency spacewalk to repair a damaged thermal blanket on the Soyuz MS-10 spacecraft after an engine malfunction during its docking with the International Space Station.

formulation: Chinese spacecraft Chang'e-6 successfully lands on the far side of the Moon on a mission to analyse and collect rock samples.
answer: China's Chang'e-6 mission successfully landed on the far side of the Moon, aiming to collect lunar samples.

formulation: Attorneys defending Amendment A, which would have legalized cannabis in the state on July 1 before being struck down by a lower court judge, submit their arguments to the South Dakota Supreme Court.
answer: The South Dakota Supreme Court ruled that the state's law restricting medical marijuana dispensaries to one per county was unconstitutional, following legal challenges from attorneys.

formulation: Recreational cannabis sales begin in Connecticut.
answer: Connecticut's paid family and medical leave program officially launched, providing workers with up to 12 weeks of wage replacement for qualifying family and medical needs.

formulation: First far right win in a German state parliament election since World War Two, with Alternative for Germany (AfD) party victory in Thuringia.
answer: The AfD party achieved a historic victory in Thuringia's state election, becoming the strongest political force in the region for the first time.

formulation: On October 15, the White House announced that it would reopen international borders to non-essential travel from the EU, UK, China, India, South Africa, Iran and Brazil on . The travel restrictions have been in place for 18 months, coming into effect in the early days of the pandemic.
answer: The White House announced it would lift travel restrictions imposed during the pandemic for fully vaccinated foreign travelers from 33 countries, including the EU, UK, China, India, South Africa, Iran, and Brazil, starting November 8, 2021.

formulation: Shares for messaging site Slack start trading on the New York Stock Exchange to give it a valuation of $19.5 billion.
answer: GoPro began trading on the New York Stock Exchange on June 20, 2019, achieving a valuation of $19.5 billion.

formulation: Syrian shadow puppetry added to UN list of cultural activities in urgent need of saving.
answer: Syrian shadow puppetry was inscribed on UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage List, safeguarding its traditions for future generations.

formulation: The House of Representatives holds a hearing on UFOs, the first such hearing in over fifty years.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives held its first hearing on unidentified aerial phenomena (UAPs) in over fifty years, featuring testimony from intelligence and military officials.

formulation: Flooding in Garrett County, eastern Kentucky kills at least 37 people with more missing. Four million in Kentucky and surrounding states under flood alert.
answer: Severe flash flooding, triggered by torrential rainfall, devastated eastern Kentucky in late July 2022, causing widespread destruction and substantial loss of life.

formulation: Pakistani architect Yasmeen Lari  awarded Royal Institute of British Architects' Royal Gold Medal for her humanitarian work providing structures for Pakistanis' marginalized communities.
answer: Yasmeen Lari became the first architect to win the prestigious Pritzker Architecture Prize for her work promoting sustainable, low-cost building solutions for vulnerable communities.

formulation: Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt signs into law a near-total abortion ban, with the exception of cases when the mother's health is in danger. .
answer: Oklahoma passed a bill effectively banning all abortions from fertilization, modeled after Texas's restrictive law, which was signed into law shortly after.

formulation: Utah reports a record number of new COVID-19 daily cases and deaths.
answer: Utah reported a record-breaking 2,112 new COVID-19 cases and 16 deaths, marking a significant surge in the state's pandemic response.

formulation: British PM Liz Truss and Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng release "the mini-budget that broke Britain" containing largest tax cuts. Leads to an economic crisis and the downfall of both.
answer: The announcement of £43 billion in unfunded tax cuts, including the abolition of the top rate of income tax, sent markets into turmoil.

formulation: Mexico elects former Mayor of Mexico City, Claudia Sheinbaum, as its first woman president.
answer: Claudia Sheinbaum was elected as Mexico's first female president, securing a historic victory for the ruling Morena party.

formulation: Young activists win landmark case, Held v. Montana, judge ruling state of Montana must consider climate change when deciding to approve or renew fossil fuel projects.
answer: A Montana judge ruled that the state’s constitution requires the government to consider the climate impacts of fossil fuel projects when issuing permits.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump and 18 others, including Rudy Giuliani and Mark Meadows, indicted by a grand jury in Atlanta on felony charges for attempting to overturn 2020 election in Georgia.
answer: A Fulton County, Georgia grand jury indicted Donald Trump and 18 associates on charges related to attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.

formulation: SpaceX Dragon capsule carrying NASA astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken splashes down in the Gulf of Mexico, 1st commercial crewed mission.
answer: SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, carrying NASA astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken, successfully returned to Earth, marking the first crewed splashdown for a commercial spacecraft.

formulation: The World Trade Organization (WTO) is left unable to intervene in trade disputes, after the U.S. blocks the appointment of new panel members.
answer: The United States blocked the appointments of judges to the WTO’s appellate body, effectively paralyzing its dispute resolution system.

formulation: All six EPL clubs withdraw from the controversial European Super League just 3 days after it was announced - Chelsea, Manchester City, Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester United and Tottenham.
answer: The announcement and subsequent collapse of the European Super League featuring six English Premier League teams occurred after widespread backlash and intense pressure.

formulation: Federal judge Diane Humetewa rules that the subpoena by January 6th Committee to get the cell phone data from Arizona Republican Party chairwoman Kelli Ward and her husband can proceed.
answer: Judge Humetewa ruled that the January 6th Committee’s subpoena for Ward and her husband’s cell phone records was invalid because the House Select Committee's investigative powers had expired.

formulation: South Carolina's Supreme Court reverses its earlier prohibition on a six-week abortion ban, and allows the ban to come into effect.
answer: The South Carolina Supreme Court ruled that the state's six-week abortion ban is unconstitutional because it violates the right to privacy.

formulation: Toyota announced it would invest an additional $8 billion in its first North American electric vehicle battery manufacturing facility, as announced by the Economic Development Partnership of North Carolina, adding another 3,000 jobs.
answer: Toyota announced a $7 billion investment to build a new battery plant in North Carolina, creating 3,600 jobs.

formulation: President Trump accepts an invite from Kim Jong-un through South Korean officials for a meeting by May.
answer: This marked the first time a sitting U.S. president and a North Korean leader agreed to hold a summit, signaling an unprecedented effort to address denuclearization concerns.

formulation: BBC investigation finds their 1995 Princess Dianna interview was secured through 'deceitful behavior' by journalist Martin Bashir.
answer: The BBC investigation revealed that Martin Bashir had used deceitful tactics, including fabricating documents, to secure the 1995 interview with Princess Diana.

formulation: US Defense Secretary Jim Mattis announces his resignation after disagreements with President Donald Trump.
answer: Jim Mattis announced his resignation as Secretary of Defense, citing differences with President Trump over national security priorities.

formulation: Hurricane Fiona hits Puerto Rico as a Category 1 hurricane, flooding the landscape, destroying the power grid, and wrecking other infrastructure across the entire island.
answer: Hurricane Fiona devastated Puerto Rico in September 2022, resulting in widespread flooding and extensive damage to the island's power grid and infrastructure.

formulation: China's state news agency is the first to introduce a virtual newsreader, developed by Chinese search engine Sogou.
answer: China's Xinhua News Agency introduced a virtual newsreader named Xin You, powered by artificial intelligence and developed by Sogou, to present news bulletins.

formulation: Portland Mayor Ted Wheeler criticizes federal policing of protesters in his city, calling it unconstitutional.
answer: Mayor Wheeler stated that the presence of federal agents in Portland was an escalation and a “dangerous escalation” and that they were “uninvited” and “unwarranted.”

formulation: UN-appointed expert says there are “reasonable grounds” to believe Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians in Gaza, in report "Anatomy of a Genocide".
answer: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) released a preliminary ruling stating there is reasonable grounds to believe Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians in Gaza.

formulation: California is the 1st US state to pass law banning sale and manufacture of new fur products.
answer: California became the first state in the United States to ban the sale of new fur products, taking effect in 2023.

formulation: Apple introduces new TV streaming platform Apple TV+, news service Apple News+ and an Apple credit card at star-studded event featuring Oprah.
answer: Apple announced Apple TV+, a new streaming service featuring exclusive original content and partnerships with high-profile creators like Oprah, as well as Apple News+ and Apple Card.

formulation: Food storage container firm Tupperware files for bankruptcy, amid declining sales.
answer: Tupperware's stock was delisted from the New York Stock Exchange due to its failure to maintain the minimum share price.

formulation: Protests against India's new citizenship bill that excludes Muslims, erupt across major cities, killing at least five.
answer: Mass protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), which expedited citizenship for non-Muslim refugees, erupted across India, particularly in states like Assam and Uttar Pradesh, resulting in at least five deaths due to police actions.

formulation: 1 in 10 Japanese is now over the age of 80, with 29.1% over 65 according to new government figures.
answer: Japan's government reported that over 10% of its population is now aged 80 or older, marking a significant increase in the country's elderly demographic.

formulation: US CDC says half of all US adults are now fully vaccinated, with 61% having had their first shot.
answer: The CDC reported that 50% of all U.S. adults were fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

formulation: Chevron Championship Women's Golf, The Club at Carlton Woods: In beating Maja Stark by 2 strokes, Nelly Korda wins her second major title and equals LPGA record with 5 consecutive wins.
answer: Nelly Korda secured her second major championship by winning the Chevron Championship, ending a 16-year drought for American women in major golf tournaments.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at the University of Virginia in which three people are killed, and two others are injured. The suspect is arrested and charged with three counts of second degree murder as well as three counts of using a handgun in the alleged commission of a felony.
answer: A former University of Virginia student opened fire on the UVA campus, killing three people and injuring two others, leading to his arrest and charges of murder and malicious wounding.

formulation: Russian leader Vladimir Putin announces the start of a three day “special military operation” in Ukraine to "demilitarize" the country. Moments before Russia launched a full-scale pre-dawn and unprovoked invasion by land, air and sea, with bombings in several cities.
answer: Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, beginning a major military escalation in the Russo-Ukrainian War.

formulation: New York firefighter Daniel Foley, who found his brother's body in ruins of World Trade Center, dies of cancer bringing first responders death toll to 343.
answer: Many 9/11 first responders succumbed to illnesses, including cancer and respiratory diseases, in 2020, furthering the ongoing toll of the attacks' aftermath.

formulation: UK and Germany sign the Trinity House Agreement; a "landmark defence treaty".
answer: The UK and Germany formalized the "Iron Accord," a joint defense pact committing to mutual military assistance and coordinated strategic operations.

formulation: President Donald Trump commutes the 14-year sentence of former Governor of Illinois Rod Blagojevich's corruption conviction.
answer: President Trump commuted the prison sentence of Rod Blagojevich, allowing him to be released early.

formulation: Senator Kamala Harris reverses herself on participation in the "Second Step Justice Forum" after 20/20 Club drops its sponsorship. Senator Cory Booker announces he will attend also.
answer: Senator Kamala Harris announced she would withdraw from the "Second Step Justice Forum" due to its new sponsorship by the Corrections Corporation of America, a private prison company.

formulation: Defending Stanley Cup champion Tampa Bay Lightning advance to the Stanley Cup Finals to face the Montreal Canadiens.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning won their second consecutive Stanley Cup, defeating the Montreal Canadiens 1-0 in Game 5.

formulation: New DNA research showing bedbugs are older than humans - 115 million years old and outlived dinosaurs, published in "Current Biology".
answer: Research published in "Current Biology" revealed that bedbugs diverged from other insects over 100 million years ago, indicating they have coexisted with dinosaurs and are far older than humanity.

formulation: Ohio surpasses 400,000 COVID-19 cases.
answer: Ohio surpassed 500,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic.

formulation: Bel Air mansion featured in TV series "The Beverly Hillbillies" sells for $150 million, becoming California's most expensive property.
answer: The "Bonsal Ranch" in Malibu, famous as the site of the original "Rawhide" western series, sold for $100 million.

formulation: Brian Houston, Australian founder of megachurch Hillsong, resigns after an internal investigation finds he breached their code of conduct with two women.
answer: Brian Houston, founder of Hillsong Church, resigned after an independent investigation revealed he breached the church's code of conduct regarding two women.

formulation: U.S. Steel announces it will lay off 1,545 workers at its Great Lakes Works production plants near Detroit, MI.
answer: U.S. Steel announced it would be reducing its workforce by 175 employees at its Great Lakes Works plants in Ohio and Pennsylvania.

formulation: Sweden formally announces it will seek to join NATO after 200 years of neutrality, in the wake of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
answer: Sweden announced it would abandon its long-standing policy of neutrality and apply to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

formulation: Sudanese military attacks protesters in Khartoum killing 100 people, some dumped in the river Nile, prompting international condemnation.
answer: Sudanese security forces violently dispersed a sit-in protest in Khartoum’s capital, resulting in the deaths of over 120 people and widespread international condemnation.

formulation: The Biden administration announces new vehicle emission standards for 2027–2032, as it pushes for wider adoption of hybrid and electric vehicles.
answer: The Biden administration finalized stricter fuel economy standards, requiring that over 50% of new light-duty vehicles sold in 2032 be electric or hybrid.

formulation: Costa Rica becomes the first county in Central America to legalize same-sex marriage.
answer: Costa Rica’s Supreme Court legalized same-sex marriage nationwide, after a years-long legal battle.

formulation: India surpasses China as the worlds most populous country according to UN estimates, with 1,425,775,850 people (estimated to reach 1.7 billion by 2064).
answer: India officially surpassed China to become the world's most populous nation.

formulation: In high school football, Bishop Sycamore loses to IMG Academy, 58–0, at the Tom Benson Hall of Fame Stadium in Canton, Ohio, which is aired on ESPN. Following the game, the existence of Bishop Sycamore is questioned by fans and the school is accused of running a grift and duping ESPN into airing the game.
answer: The ESPN broadcast of a game between IMG Academy and Bishop Sycamore sparked outrage and scrutiny over Bishop Sycamore's program and the network's vetting process.

formulation: The Justice Department charges Chinese tech firm Huawei with multiple counts of fraud, raising U.S.-China tensions.
answer: The U.S. Justice Department indicted Huawei, a Chinese tech giant, on charges of violating sanctions against Iran and stealing trade secrets, significantly straining U.S.-China relations.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Florida surpasses 20,000 deaths from COVID-19, including residents and non-residents.
answer: Florida surpassed 20,000 COVID-19 deaths since the start of the pandemic.

formulation: Australian cricket batsman David Warner smashes 335 not out in the 2nd Test against Pakistan; second-highest Test score by an Australian (Matt Hayden 380); highest Test score at Adelaide Oval.
answer: Matthew Wade achieved the second-highest Test score by an Australian with 335 not out against Pakistan on November 30, 2019.

formulation: President Trump signs a $483 billion bill to rescue small businesses.
answer: President Trump signed the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act, replenishing and modifying the Paycheck Protection Program to provide additional relief for small businesses.

formulation: Study suggests earliest European Palaeolithic artwork in Spain made by Neanderthals not humans in "Science Journal".
answer: Analysis of ochre pigments found in three Spanish caves revealed that Neanderthals, not Homo sapiens, used them to create cave paintings and engravings over 100,000 years ago.

formulation: Turkey's ruling AK party lose the re-run of Istanbul's mayoral election to Ekrem Imamoglu of the Republican People's Party.
answer: Ekrem Imamoglu defeated Binali Yildirim in a rerun election, overturning the AK Party’s victory in the mayoral race.

formulation: Ebola outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo spreads to the city of Mbandaka.
answer: The resurgence of Ebola, a deadly virus, in the DRC's densely populated city of Mbandaka threatened a rapid and widespread outbreak.

formulation: More than 61,000 people died in European heatwaves in 2022, according to study published in "Nature Medicine", suggesting world not doing enough to counter increasing heatwaves.
answer: A study in 2023 found that over 61,600 heat-related deaths occurred in Europe during the summer of 2022, indicating that current global strategies to combat rising temperatures are drastically insufficient to protect vulnerable populations.

formulation: 2019 Virginia Senate election & 2019 Virginia House of Delegates election: Democrats take control of the legislature for the first time in twenty years.
answer: Democrats won control of both the Virginia House of Delegates and State Senate, flipping the General Assembly after two decades of Republican dominance.

formulation: Sri Lanka’s Supreme Court blocks President Maithripala Sirisena from dissolving parliament.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that President Sirisena's dissolution of parliament was unconstitutional and invalid.

formulation: New Hindu temple to the god Ram inaugurated by Indian PM Narendra Modi in Ayodhya city in a grand ceremony, on site of a mosque razed to the ground by Hindi militants in 1992.
answer: Narendra Modi inaugurated a new Ram temple in Ayodhya, marking a pivotal moment for Hindu nationalists and sparking celebration and controversy.

formulation: In a legal defeat for Donald Trump, federal judge David O. Carter orders emails between John Eastman and Trump to be turned over to House investigators.
answer: Judge Carter ordered Eastman to turn over over 150 emails between himself and Trump's legal team related to efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

formulation: Overloaded ferry capsizes on Lake Victoria, Tanzania, killing at least 207, with one man surviving in air lock for two days.
answer: A passenger ferry, the MV Nyerere, capsized in Lake Victoria due to overcrowding, leading to the deaths of at least 207 people while one was found alive in an air pocket.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, was officially declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization on March 11, 2020.

formulation: Four members of a family arrested for the Rhoden family massacre where eight people were shot, south of Columbus, Ohio in 2016.
answer: The Pike County murders case led to the arrest of four members of the Rhoden family in November 2018, implicating them in the 2016 killings of eight people.

formulation: A shooting takes place in Willowbrook, Illinois, during a Juneteenth celebration, killing one and injuring twenty-two.
answer: Gunfire during a Juneteenth celebration in Willowbrook, Illinois, left one woman dead and several others injured.

formulation: NFC Championship, Lincoln Financial Field, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania: Philadelphia Eagles beat SF 49ers, 31-7. Brock Purdy suffers a complete tear of his ulnar collateral ligament.
answer: The Philadelphia Eagles defeated the San Francisco 49ers in the NFC Championship game, with 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy sustaining an elbow injury that significantly hampered his ability to play.

formulation: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister, Mahinda Rajapaksa submits his resignation to his brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, amid continuing violent protests causing four deaths.
answer: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned following violent clashes between government supporters and anti-government protesters during widespread demonstrations against the country's economic crisis.

formulation: Hallmark Channel faces a backlash after pulling ads that show same-sex couples celebrating marriages. The backlash caused an almost immediate reversal of the plan.
answer: The Hallmark Channel faced widespread condemnation and ultimately reinstated ads depicting same-sex couples after initially removing them due to corporate pressure.

formulation: MLB Boston Red Sox outfielder Masataka Yoshida hits a solo home run and a grand slam in the eight inning in 12-5 win over the Brewers in Milwaukee.
answer: Masataka Yoshida became the first Seattle Mariner since 2006 to record four hits in his first four at-bats.

formulation: Heaviest fighting in months between Israel and Palestinian militants as both sides launch air attacks, leaving over 20 dead in Gaza.
answer: Intense rocket fire from Gaza and retaliatory airstrikes by Israel escalated into a major conflict, causing widespread damage and over 20 deaths.

formulation: Gunman shoots and kills 29 people in a shopping center in Nakhon Ratchasima, Thailand, with 57 injured. Shooter shot and killed by security forces a day later.
answer: A former police officer shot and killed 29 people, including himself, at a shopping mall in Nakhon Ratchasima before being killed by security forces the next day.

formulation: The Sand Blaster roller coaster on the Daytona Beach boardwalk derails. Six people are taken to hospital, with two suffering traumatic injuries.
answer: A roller coaster car on the Cyclone roller coaster derailed on the Daytona Beach boardwalk, resulting in 16 injuries.

formulation: Charles Manson follower Leslie Van Houten's parole request is rejected by the state of California.
answer: Leslie Van Houten’s parole request was denied for a 13th time by the California Parole Board.

formulation: Longest ever bull market for Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index at 3,453 days (using 19.9 percent decline in 1990 as the start, usually 20%).
answer: The S&P 500 reached a record high, surpassing its prior peak and establishing the longest bull market in history, spanning over nine years.

formulation: Beginning this day, Southwest Airlines, due to the winter storm, cancels over 60% of their flights across the next couple days, stranding thousands across the country.
answer: Southwest Airlines experienced widespread operational disruptions and thousands of flight cancellations due to severe winter weather conditions around Christmas 2022.

formulation: Australian surfer Laura Enever sets world record riding the largest-ever wave by a woman at 43.6ft (13.3m) on Oahu's North Shore, Hawaii.
answer: Laura Enever became the first woman to perform a confirmed barrel through the notorious Pipeline wave in a professional surfing competition.

formulation: UEFA announces the postponement of its flagship national team football competition, UEFA EURO 2020, due to be played in June / July due to the COVID-19 emergency.
answer: UEFA Euro 2020, scheduled for that summer, was postponed to 2021 due to the global pandemic.

formulation: Ireland becomes the country with the world's highest COVID-19 infection rate after a dramatic surge results in seven-day rolling average of 1,394 cases per million.
answer: Ireland reported 8,778 new COVID-19 cases, marking the highest daily infection rate globally at the time and demonstrating the severity of the pandemic's surge.

formulation: Global death toll from COVID-19 passes 5 million according to Johns Hopkins, with estimates the true toll is at least twice as high.
answer: According to Johns Hopkins, the world surpassed 5 million recorded COVID-19 deaths on November 1, 2021, while simultaneously facing concerns about potential undercounting and data discrepancies across various regions.

formulation: New research show plants "talk" to each other through their roots and the soil in study on corn published in journal "Plos One".
answer: The study revealed that corn plants release volatile organic compounds (VOCs) to warn neighboring plants about herbivore attacks, inducing defensive responses in those receivers.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of thousands of undetected structures in Mayan lowland civilisation, Guatemala, using Lidar, suggests population of 10 million.
answer: Lidar scans of Guatemala's Mirador-Calakmul Karst Basin revealed an extensive network of cities, causeways, and agricultural structures, significantly altering estimates of the Mayan population.

formulation: Trump reveals on Truth Social that he has been indicted by Jack Smith's special counsel over mishandling of classified documents found at the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago. The following Tuesday, he pleaded not guilty before the court.
answer: Donald Trump was arraigned in Miami federal court on charges of mishandling classified documents after his indictment by a special counsel.

formulation: Hurricane Rafael makes landfall in Cuba as a category 3 storm, causing a national power outage.
answer: A powerful and unexpected Category 3 hurricane made landfall in Cuba, causing widespread devastation and triggering a nationwide blackout.

formulation: 91 groups with connections to public lands send a letter to Secretary of the Interior David Bernhardt demanding that acting Bureau of Land Management director William Perry Pendley resign or be removed from office.
answer: Ninety-one groups called for the removal of Bureau of Land Management Director William Perry Pendley, claiming he lacked the qualifications and had a history of opposing public land protections.

formulation: Mississippi signs into law the US's strictest abortion laws, no termination after 15 weeks.
answer: Mississippi passed a law banning abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy.

formulation: One person is killed and 16 others are injured in a school shooting during a homecoming weekend party at Tuskegee University.
answer: A large crowd surge during a homecoming weekend concert at Tuskegee University led to one student's death and numerous injuries.

formulation: Earliest evidence for the use of opium from 14th century BCE found in burials at Tel Yehud, ancient Canaan (now Israel).
answer: Archaeologists uncovered residue of opium poppy seeds in ancient Egyptians’ portable toilet in Tel Maresha National Park, representing the oldest known evidence of opium use.

formulation: Congress unveils a $908 billion COVID-19 relief plan.
answer: Congress passed the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021, a sweeping $2.3 trillion package including COVID-19 relief measures.

formulation: 115°F (46.1°C), John Martin Dam, Colorado (state record).
answer: The John Martin Dam recorded a temperature of 115°F, becoming the hottest temperature ever recorded in Colorado.

formulation: US Attorney General William Barr resigns.
answer: President-elect Joe Biden announced Merrick Garland as his nominee for Attorney General of the United States.

formulation: A construction crane working on a Google office building in Seattle, Washington, collapses onto Mercer Street, killing four people and injuring four others.
answer: A construction crane collapsed in downtown Seattle while working on a Google office building, killing one person and injuring several others.

formulation: President-elect Biden nominates an all-female communications team, including Kate Bedingfield as Communications Director and Jen Psaki as Press Secretary.
answer: President-elect Biden announced Jen Psaki as his White House press secretary and Kate Bedingfield as his communications director.

formulation: The Arizona Senate declares pornography to be a public health crisis.
answer: The Arizona Senate passed a resolution declaring pornography harmful and calling for increased awareness of its societal impacts.

formulation: K-pop stars Jung Joon-young and Choi Jong-hoon sentenced to prison for gang-raping unconscious fans and distributing footage of it (Jung).
answer: Jung Joon-young and Choi Jong-hoon were sentenced to prison for their roles in a group chat scandal involving the distribution of illegally filmed sexual content.

formulation: Presidential candidate Donald Trump hosts a campaign rally at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The event is widely criticized for its use of racist and misogynistic language.
answer: A campaign rally in Vandalia, Ohio, drew criticism as Donald Trump used racially charged and misogynistic remarks during his speech.

formulation: Joe Biden is inaugurated as the 46th President of the United States of America and Kamala Harris as the 49th Vice President, the first female, black or south Asian Vice President. Amanda Gorman recites "The Hill We Climb"; previous office holder Donald Trump is first outgoing president to refuse to attend the inauguration of his successor since 1869 P.
answer: Joe Biden was inaugurated as president and Kamala Harris as vice president, marking the first time in U.S. history that a woman and a Black person held those offices.

formulation: Landmark power-sharing deal signed by military and civilian leaders celebrated in Khartoum, Sudan, with transitional government to take over Sept 1.
answer: A power-sharing agreement between the Transitional Military Council and the Forces of Freedom and Change established a joint sovereignty council to govern Sudan for three years, paving the way for a civilian-led government.

formulation: The more contagious COVID-19 omicron subvariant BA.5 achieves dominance in the US, making up 54% of cases according to the CDC.
answer: The highly contagious Omicron subvariant BA.5 became the dominant strain in the United States around July 2022.

formulation: US grounds all Boeing 737 Max aircraft after bans by others countries following the plane type's second crash in Ethiopia.
answer: The United States Federal Aviation Administration grounded the Boeing 737 MAX aircraft, following similar actions by many other countries around the world.

formulation: Powerful 400 yard wide EF-3 tornado travels 12.5 miles through Gloucester County, New Jersey, destroying 50 homes, several farm buildings, and killing 3 dairy cows.
answer: A devastating tornado ripped through Gloucester County, New Jersey, causing widespread damage and tragically claiming the lives of three dairy cows.

formulation: The Death of Kyle Mullen takes place during the Navy SEAL's “Hell Week”.
answer: During Hell Week, Navy SEAL candidate James Lovell collapsed and later died from cardiac complications.

formulation: Israel carries out a series of airstrikes on Iranian military targets in and around Tehran.
answer: Israel launched a limited airstrike against Iranian military facilities in Syria in response to escalating Iranian efforts to establish a permanent presence in the region.

formulation: British Health Minister Matt Hancock resigns after photos of him kissing an aide (and not social distancing) emerge.
answer: Health Secretary Matt Hancock resigned in June 2021 after photographs and video emerged of him kissing a colleague in breach of COVID-19 lockdown guidelines.

formulation: Malaysia's national debt reassessed at $250 billion, up from previous estimate $170 billion, 80% of gross domestic product.
answer: The Pakatan Harapan government revealed that Malaysia's national debt was significantly higher than previously reported, standing at RM1.1 trillion (approximately 80% of GDP), which raised concerns about the country’s fiscal sustainability and potentially dampened investor confidence.

formulation: The Senate passes the PACT Act in an 86–11 vote, which expands veteran health care to cover injuries from burn pits. Biden signs the law eight days later.
answer: The PACT Act, which extended comprehensive healthcare benefits to millions of veterans exposed to toxic substances, including burn pits, was passed by the Senate and signed into law by President Biden.

formulation: Chinese government set new rules for gaming for young people to try to curb gaming addiction, including maximum 90 mins a day.
answer: The Chinese government imposed stricter rules, including playtime limits, real-name verification, and content restrictions, on online video games to curb addiction among minors.

formulation: An underwater submersible called Titan goes missing during a dive to visit the wreck site of the RMS Titanic with five people aboard. Four days later, a portion of the hull is discovered as a part of an American search-and-rescue operation, confirming the loss of the vessel as well as all five passengers on board.
answer: The OceanGate Titan submersible went missing during a Titanic expedition, resulting in a catastrophic implosion and the discovery of debris from the vessel.

formulation: CBS Chairman Leslie Moonves is accused of sexual misconduct in the "New Yorker" by journalist Ronan Farrow.
answer: The New Yorker published an explosive investigation detailing multiple allegations of sexual harassment and misconduct against CBS Chairman Leslie Moonves, reported by six women.

formulation: California governor Gavin Newsom signs a bill which prohibits the replacement of actors with artificial intelligence under state law.
answer: Governor Newsom signed a landmark bill requiring clear labeling of AI-generated content in film and television productions to ensure transparency for viewers.

formulation: The Oklahoma Supreme Court dismisses a lawsuit by the last survivors of the 1921 Tulsa race massacre who were seeking reparations.
answer: A Tulsa, Oklahoma judge ruled that survivors and descendants of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre are eligible for reparations from the city and county.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs in Sacramento, California. Six people are killed and twelve others are injured; the gunmen remain at large.
answer: A mass shooting in Sacramento's downtown area left six people dead and twelve others injured.

formulation: 17 Rohingya refugees drown and 30 remain missing after a boat capsizes in the Bay of Bengal, bound for Malaysia.
answer: A boat carrying Rohingya refugees fleeing Myanmar capsized in the Bay of Bengal, leaving 17 dead and many others missing.

formulation: Mexico's Supreme Court decriminalizes abortion nationwide, building on an earlier state-by-state ruling.
answer: Mexico's Supreme Court decriminalized abortion nationwide, ruling that criminalizing the procedure violates the constitutional rights of women and girls.

formulation: Huge ancient city discovered in the Amazon, in Upano area of eastern Ecuador, capable of supporting 10,000 people with sophisticated roads and canals.
answer: LiDAR technology revealed the remnants of a sprawling urban center dating back 2,500 years, pre-dating the Inca Empire, and potentially the largest city in the Amazon basin.

formulation: 126.2 cm (49.69") of rainfall in a day, Waipā Garden (Kauai). Hawaii (state record, breaking previous record of 1956).
answer: The town of Baker, Hawaii, received a record-breaking 31.69 inches of rain, setting the new record for the highest rainfall ever recorded in a single day in the United States.

formulation: US President Joe Biden pledges to cut US carbon emissions by 50-52% below 2005 levels by 2030 at a virtual climate summit.
answer: President Biden announced the United States would double its 2025 emissions reduction target to 50-52% below 2005 levels.

formulation: European Space Agency announces new Venus mission, the probe EnVision to study Venus' tesserae (its continent-like terrains).
answer: The European Space Agency announced EnVision, a mission to investigate Venus’s geological history and atmospheric processes.

formulation: New study on the moon shows it is still shrinking with recent moonquakes as it cools, published in journal "Nature Geoscience".
answer: Scientists discovered evidence of ongoing volcanic activity on the Moon, indicating that it is still cooling and geologically active far later than previously thought.

formulation: A gunman kills three people in Falls Township, Pennsylvania and escapes in a stolen car. The suspect subsequently travels to Trenton, New Jersey, where he barricades himself with several hostages.
answer: A gunman fatally shot a woman at a Bucks County bank in Pennsylvania before fleeing to New Jersey and taking hostages at a Trenton office building.

formulation: Wildfires ignite on the outskirts of Perth, Australia, forcing evacuations amid five-day COVID-19 lockdown.
answer: Devastating floods in Western Australia, fueled by heavy rainfall, triggered emergency evacuations while residents were under strict COVID-19 lockdown restrictions.

formulation: Michigan reports its first case of Lineage B.1.617, first discovered in India, in a person from Clinton County.
answer: The B.1.617.2 variant, known as the Delta variant, was reported in Michigan on April 30, 2021.

formulation: The Senate Judiciary Committee unanimously votes for the nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett, 12–0, as committee Democrats boycott the roll call.
answer: Republican Senators on the Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination, proceeding with the vote despite a Democratic boycott over the rushed confirmation process.

formulation: Stanley Cup Final, T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, NV: Vegas Golden Knights rout Florida Panthers 9-3 to clinch 4-1 series win; franchise's first title in only 6th year in the NHL; MVP: Jonathan Marchessault (VGK forward).
answer: The Vegas Golden Knights defeated the Florida Panthers 9-3 to win their first Stanley Cup.
