answer: Claudine Gay became the first Black woman to serve as dean of Harvard’s Faculty of Arts and Sciences.

formulation: 394 migrants rescued from a stricken vessel by humanitarian NGO ships in Tunisian waters.
answer: The Open Arms NGO ship rescued 82 migrants stranded at sea near Tunisia after the Tunisian coast guard prevented them from reaching land.

formulation: Italian football giants Juventus wins its 9th straight Serie A title with goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Federico Bernardeschiin in a 2-0 win over Sampdoria.
answer: Juventus secured their ninth consecutive Serie A title with a victory over Sampdoria, thanks to goals from Paulo Dybala and Gonzalo Higuaín.

formulation: American Karen Uhlenbeck is the first woman to win the Abel Prize for outstanding contributions to mathematics.
answer: Karen Uhlenbeck became the first woman to win the Abel Prize, mathematics' highest honor, for her groundbreaking work in geometric analysis and partial differential equations.

formulation: Former leader Jeremy Corbyn is suspended from the British Labour Party after saying a report into antisemitism in the party was "overstated".
answer: The Labour Party suspended Jeremy Corbyn, removing the party whip, following his downplaying of the report's findings on antisemitism.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that New York's requirement for a need to carry a firearm in public violates the Second Amendment.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that New York's requirement that individuals demonstrate a specific need to obtain a license to carry a handgun in public violates the Second Amendment.

formulation: Anti-government protests begin in Bucharest, Romania, with over 400 injured in clashes with police.
answer: Mass protests erupted in Bucharest against a judicial overhaul, leading to violent clashes with riot police and leaving over 400 injured.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, began to escalate in late 2019 and spurred extensive global public health responses and research.

formulation: About 120 people are massacred by an armed gang in the Haitian town of Pont-Sondé amid a worsening gang crisis in the country.
answer: A devastating armed gang attack in Haiti resulted in at least 120 deaths and more than 150 injured, exacerbating the ongoing gang violence crisis.

formulation: The Southern Baptist Convention says that some of its major parts are facing investigations by the Department of Justice with regard to revelations of widespread sexual abuse by the clergy.
answer: An independent investigator released a report detailing how the SBC's Executive Committee systematically thwarted efforts to aid survivors of sexual abuse for decades.

formulation: NASA's Artemis I mission carrying the uncrewed Orion spacecraft on a test mission around the Moon and back launches from Florida.
answer: NASA’s Artemis I mission launched, sending the uncrewed Orion spacecraft on a 25.5-day test flight around the Moon.

formulation: Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) final; hosts Ivory Coast defeat Nigeria 2-1 at Alassane Ouattara Stadium, Abidjan.
answer: Ivory Coast shockingly defeated Nigeria 2-1 to win the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations title.

formulation: Australian swimmer Emma McKeon claims gold in 50m freestyle and 4x100m medley relay for total 7 medals at Tokyo Olympics; equals record set by Russian gymnast Maria Gorokhovskaya in 1952.
answer: Emma McKeon won her fourth gold medal at the Tokyo Olympics, tying her with Dawn Fraser for the most gold medals won by an Australian at a single Games.

formulation: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson wins Tory party no-confidence vote 211-148, with 41% of MPs voting against him.
answer: A vote of no confidence resulted in a landslide victory for Boris Johnson, but triggered further resignations within his government.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic rapidly spread globally, profoundly impacting societies and economies worldwide.

formulation: Texas law banning most abortion after six weeks comes into effect, now most restrictive in the country.
answer: Texas's Senate Bill 8, often called the "heartbeat bill," prohibits abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy and allows private citizens to sue those who assist in providing or facilitating an abortion.

formulation: President Donald Trump and China's Vice Premier Liu He sign the U.S.–China Phase One trade deal in Washington, D.C.
answer: The United States and China signed the "Phase One" trade deal, committing China to purchase billions of dollars worth of U.S. goods and products to de-escalate trade disputes.

formulation: Largest-ever drug bust in Asia made by police in Laos with 55 million methamphetamine tablets and 1.5 tonnes of crystal meth discovered in beer crates.
answer: A record-breaking drug bust in Laos on October 28, 2021, resulted in the seizure of over 55 million methamphetamine tablets and 3.3 tons of crystal meth concealed in beer crates.

formulation: Barbados elects Sandra Mason as its first-ever president, as part of a process to replace Queen Elizabeth and become a republic.
answer: Barbados officially transitioned from a parliamentary monarchy to a parliamentary republic with the inauguration of Sandra Mason as its first president.

formulation: 60th Daytona 500: Austin Dillon wins after multi-car wreck sends race into overtime (207 laps) ahead of rookie Darrell Wallace Jr.
answer: Austin Dillon secured his first Daytona 500 victory in a thrilling finish after a late crash sent the race into overtime.

formulation: Highest ever UK temperature of 38.7C (101.6F) recorded in Cambridge, England (record broken in 2022).
answer: The UK experienced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching 38.7°C (101.7°F) at Cambridge, marking the highest temperature ever recorded in the country.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs along South Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, leaving three people dead and thirteen others injured.
answer: A driver of a car sped through a farmer's market in Philadelphia, killing three and injuring thirteen.

formulation: 108 pilot whales survive, while 350 die in Australia's largest mass stranding at Macquarie Harbour, Tasmania.
answer: Over 470 pilot whales became stranded in Macquarie Harbour, Tasmania, resulting in a mass stranding event that raised serious questions about the marine ecosystem's health and contributing factors.

formulation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves Cabenuva as a complete regimen for the treatment of HIV/AIDS.
answer: Cablivi, a once-monthly and once-every-other-month injectable antiretroviral medication, was approved for HIV treatment, offering patients a complete regimen without daily pills.

formulation: Scott Pruitt resigns as the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, effective July 6. He is replaced by Andrew Wheeler.
answer: EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt resigned amidst multiple ethical scandals.

formulation: The International Olympic Committee announces that it will posthumously reinstate the gold medals that Native American Jim Thorpe had won in the 1912 Summer Olympics. The medals were previously stripped back in 1913 over violations of Olympic rules.
answer: The IOC posthumously awarded Jim Thorpe, a Sac and Fox Nation athlete stripped of his medals in 1913, his 1912 Olympic gold medals, restoring his titles and records.

formulation: Chicago Cubs pitcher Alec Mills no-hits the Milwaukee Brewers, 12-0 at Miller Park, Milwaukee.
answer: Alec Mills threw the 13th individual complete game no-hitter in MLB history.

formulation: Measles cases in Europe highest in a decade, tripling in a year to 82,596 according to WHO.
answer: The World Health Organization reported a significant increase in measles cases in Europe during 2018, marking the largest resurgence of the disease in the region in over two decades.

formulation: 74,155 fires caused by land clearing are burning in the Amazon rain forest, the most ever recorded, according the Brazil's National Institute for Space Research.
answer: A surge of wildfires, exceeding 74,000 incidents, ravaged the Amazon rainforest in Brazil during August 2019, largely fueled by deforestation for agricultural expansion.

formulation: LA judge rules to end Britney Spears' conservatorship, which had controlled almost all aspects of her life for 14 years.
answer: A Los Angeles judge terminated Britney Spears's conservatorship, granting her personal autonomy and freedom.

formulation: US senator Al Franken resigns.
answer: Al Franken officially resigned from the U.S. Senate following allegations of sexual misconduct and subsequent calls for his resignation.

formulation: Federal judge Clark Waddoups rules that American Samoans are U.S. citizens and should be granted U.S. passports.
answer: Judge Waddoups ruled that the U.S. territories’ residents born in American Samoa are not automatically U.S. citizens, upholding the longstanding legal precedent.

formulation: Hong Kong Legislative Council scraps the extradition bill that sparked months of protests and unrest.
answer: The Hong Kong Legislative Council formally withdrew the controversial extradition bill that had sparked widespread protests.

formulation: The U.S. House of Representatives votes 220–213 to pass the Build Back Better Act, a US$1.75 trillion social and climate spending package.
answer: The House of Representatives passed the Build Back Better Act, a sweeping social and climate spending package, after significant modifications.

formulation: Tax returns of Donald Trump: The Department of Justice rules that the U.S. Treasury must hand the tax returns of former President Donald Trump to Congress.
answer: The Supreme Court rejected Donald Trump's attempt to block Congress from obtaining his financial records, allowing the House Ways and Means Committee to access his tax returns.

formulation: The United States announces that it will withdraw from the United Nations Human Rights Council.
answer: The United States withdrew from the United Nations Human Rights Council, citing concerns about the council's bias and focus on Israel.

formulation: Revival of 1980s American TV sitcom "Night Court", premieres on NBC TV; John Larrquette is the sole returning cast member.
answer: NBC premiered a revival of "Night Court" on January 17, 2023, with John Larrquette reprising his role as Dan Fielding.

formulation: Sudan is on the edge of collapse warn aid agencies, on the one-year anniversary of a conflict that has displaced over 8.6 million people, including 2 million who fled to neighbouring countries.
answer: Aid agencies warned of rapidly deteriorating conditions and a looming famine in Sudan, as millions face starvation amidst the ongoing conflict and displacement.

formulation: Richard Ross Jr., police commissioner of Philadelphia, resigns amid allegations that members of his department engaged in sexual harassment and racial and gender discrimination against women serving in the ranks.
answer: Police Commissioner Richard Ross resigned following accusations of tolerating a culture of sexual harassment and discrimination within the Philadelphia Police Department.

formulation: 70th anniversary of NATO marked by gathering in London of world leaders and reception by Elizabeth II at Buckingham Palace.
answer: NATO commemorated its 70th anniversary in December 2019 with a summit in London and a reception hosted by Queen Elizabeth II.

formulation: US National Inventors Hall of Fame announces it will induct two Black women for the first time; Engineer Marian Croak and ophthalmologist Dr. Patricia Bath.
answer: The US National Inventors Hall of Fame announced the induction of four pioneering Black women - Marian R. Croak, Judy W. Reed, Pamela S. Smith, and Shirley Jackson - for their groundbreaking inventions and contributions to technology.

formulation: A major winter storm kills 58 people in the United States (and 12 in Mexico) and causes over 9,724,000 power outages across 13 states in the Midwest and Southwest, with Southwest Power Pool declaring an "energy emergency".
answer: A historic Arctic blast brought record-breaking freezing temperatures and severe winter storms across Texas and Mexico, causing widespread power failures and numerous deaths.

formulation: Sudan's military takes control of the country, dissolving the power-sharing government and declaring a state of emergency.
answer: The Sudanese military, led by General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, launched a coup d'état, dissolving the civilian-military power-sharing government and arresting civilian leaders.

formulation: President Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh, a circuit judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, to become an Associate Justice for the Supreme Court of the United States.
answer: Brett Kavanaugh was nominated by President Trump to fill the Supreme Court vacancy left by the retirement of Justice Anthony Kennedy.

formulation: Scott Rolen and Fred McGriff are inducted into Baseball Hall of Fame, Cooperstown, New York.
answer: Scott Rolen and Fred McGriff were inducted into the National Baseball Hall of Fame during the annual ceremony in Cooperstown.

formulation: 2022 NFL season: The Kansas City Chiefs defeat the Philadelphia Eagles by a score of 38–35 to win Super Bowl LVII. Quarterback Patrick Mahomes wins Super Bowl MVP.
answer: The Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Philadelphia Eagles 38-35, securing their second consecutive Super Bowl victory with Patrick Mahomes earning MVP honors.

formulation: FTX, amidst its collapse, files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
answer: FTX, once the second-largest cryptocurrency exchange, experienced a liquidity crisis and halted withdrawals, prompting its collapse and subsequent Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing.

formulation: International Olympic Committee announces postponed 2020 Summer Olympic Games will be held July 23-August 8 in 2021 because of the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The 2020 Summer Olympics, originally scheduled for Tokyo, were postponed and later held in July and August of 2021.

formulation: Australian government loses historic vote on own bill with amendment to allow offshore sick refugees access to healthcare, first loss in 78 years.
answer: The Australian government's bill to repeal Medevial Protection Act, allowing for greater health access for offshore refugees, was narrowly defeated in the Senate.

formulation: Malawi begins historic campaign against malaria by vaccinating children under five using the RTS,S vaccine (thought to provide 30% protection).
answer: Malawi initiated a pilot program in late 2022, becoming the first country to administer the RTS,S malaria vaccine as part of routine childhood immunizations.

formulation: Dominion Voting Systems sues former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani, accusing him of defamation during the 2020 presidential election.
answer: Rudy Giuliani was sued for defamation by Dominion Voting Systems over his false claims about the company's role in alleged election fraud.

formulation: The Balangiga bells, which had been taken by the United States Army from Balangiga, Eastern Samar in 1901 as war trophies during the Philippine–American War, are returned to the Philippines after 117 years of U.S. possession.
answer: The United States returned over 500 artifacts, including gold jewelry and religious objects, to the Philippines, which were looted during the Philippine-American War.

formulation: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is impeached by a vote in the National Assembly after his failed attempt to impose martial law.
answer: President Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached by South Korea’s National Assembly after his unsuccessful effort to declare martial law sparked widespread public dissent and accusations of authoritarianism.

formulation: Second cabinet of Donald Trump: Trump selects South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem as his Secretary of Homeland Security, Senator Marco Rubio as his Secretary of State, and Fox News host and Army veteran Pete Hegseth as his Secretary of Defense.
answer: Donald Trump appointed Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as Attorney General, Vivek Ramaswamy as Secretary of Commerce, and Marjorie Taylor Greene as Secretary of the Interior, signaling a shift towards populist and conservative policies.

formulation: Strain of Bacteria nicknamed "Conan the Bacterium' survives three years attached to the International Space Station in open space.
answer: Scientists discovered a strain of bacteria, *Bacillus pumilus*, capable of surviving both the vacuum and radiation of space, even repairing DNA damage incurred during exposure.

formulation: Facebook says it has taken down four state-backed disinformation campaigns, three from Iran, one from Russia in addition to dozens earlier this year.
answer: Facebook removed hundreds of accounts and pages linked to state-backed actors from Iran and Russia for coordinated inauthentic behavior targeting political discourse.

formulation: Entertainment companies CBS and Viacom announce they will merge with a combined 28 billion revenue.
answer: AT&T and WarnerMedia announced their merger with Discovery, creating Warner Bros. Discovery.

formulation: America registers 521 cases of COVID-19 with 21 deaths across 33 states.
answer: The United States surpassed 500 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths, spanning at least 30 states and the District of Columbia.

formulation: Danish star soccer midfielder Christian Eriksen suffers an on-field cardiac arrest during Euro 2020 game with Finland in Copenhagen; revived with a defibrillator; game controversially restarts with 1-0 Finland win.
answer: Christian Eriksen collapsed on the field during Denmark's match against Finland at Euro 2020 due to cardiac arrest, prompting swift medical intervention and his subsequent recovery.

formulation: Case Breakers, a group of former law enforcement individuals, claim to have identified the Zodiac Killer as Gary Francis Poste, an individual who died in 2018.
answer: A team of independent investigators claimed to have identified Gary Francis Poste as the Zodiac Killer based on decades-old crime scene photos and forensic genealogy.

formulation: President Donald Trump signs an executive order barring transactions with eight Chinese software applications (including Alipay, WeChat Pay, and Tencent QQ) citing concerns about Chinese access to sensitive data of American citizens.
answer: President Trump issued an executive order effectively banning TikTok and WeChat in the United States over national security and data privacy concerns.

formulation: Largest wind farm in Africa opens at Lake Turkana, Kenya, generating 310 megawatts.
answer: The Lake Turkana Wind Power project, Africa’s largest wind farm with a capacity of 310 megawatts, was officially inaugurated in Kenya on July 19, 2019.

formulation: Bougainville votes to become independent of Papua New Guinea in a referendum.
answer: Bougainville held a referendum on independence, resulting in an overwhelming majority voting in favor of secession from Papua New Guinea.

formulation: First bison born in Banff National Park, Alberta, Canada, in 140 years, after being reintroduced.
answer: A bison calf was born in Banff National Park, marking the first time bison have been born there in 140 years as part of a reintroduction project.

formulation: Indiana State Police announces the arrest of a suspect in the murders of Abigail Williams and Liberty German.
answer: Indiana State Police announced they had identified a person of interest in the case through DNA analysis, stating they are actively pursuing this lead.

formulation: Patrick Crusius, the man who killed 23 people at an El Paso Walmart in 2019 is sentenced to 90 consecutive life sentences, the second longest prison sentence in American history and trailing only Oklahoma City Bombing accomplice Terry Nichols.
answer: The shooter, Patrick Crusius, was sentenced to nine consecutive life sentences for federal hate crimes and firearms offenses.

formulation: OPEC and other major oil companies agree to the largest-ever drop in production to stabilize world prices.
answer: OPEC and several non-OPEC oil producers agreed to cut oil production by 9.7 million barrels per day to stabilize prices amid plummeting demand.

formulation: The United States faces an invasion of Asian giant hornets (Vespa mandarinia magnifica), threatening domestic bees.
answer: The detection of spongy moths, also known as gypsy moths, in numerous states raised significant ecological concerns due to their devastating impact on trees and subsequent effects on bee habitats.

formulation: Biden passes tariff increases on Chinese imports, including electric vehicle batteries, computer chips, and medical products.
answer: The U.S. increased tariffs on a wide range of Chinese goods, including EV batteries, semiconductors, and medical products, as part of a new trade policy.

formulation: President Biden terminates the national emergency declaration on the US-Mexico border which President Trump had used to pay for the wall.
answer: President Biden ended the national emergency declaration that had allowed former President Trump to divert funds for the construction of a border wall.

formulation: Judge Juan Merchan fines Donald Trump $9,000 for contempt of court, and threatens him with jail if he continues to violate his gag order.
answer: Donald Trump was fined $9,900 for violating his gag order by posting about the clerk's family on social media.

formulation: Following three deaths, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends against the use of electronic cigarettes.
answer: The CDC recommended that people stop using e-cigarette products, particularly those containing THC or other additives, while investigations into the lung illnesses continued.

formulation: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully lands at Jezero Crater, Mars, on mission to find microfossils.
answer: NASA's Perseverance rover collected its first Martian rock and soil sample, the first step in a mission aimed at searching for signs of ancient microbial life.

formulation: Houston Astros starter Justin Verlander strikes out 14 as he throws his third career no-hitter in a 2-0 decision against the Toronto Blue Jays.
answer: Justin Verlander struck out 10 Blue Jays, becoming the oldest pitcher in MLB history to reach 2,500 career strikeouts.

formulation: Minnesota Twins smash 6 HRs in 10-7 loss to the Tigers in Detroit; break MLB record by hitting 268th home run of the season.
answer: The Minnesota Twins hit a franchise-record 27 home runs in a single season, despite losing the game.

formulation: A sixteen-judge panel on the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit blocks a federal ban on bump stocks.
answer: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit upheld a Trump-era ban on bump stocks, finding they effectively convert semi-automatic rifles into machine guns and thus are illegal under federal law.

formulation: NASA's Parker Solar Probe becomes the first spacecraft to cross the Alfvén critical boundary, the outer atmosphere of the Sun.
answer: NASA's Parker Solar Probe became the first spacecraft to fly through the Sun's corona, or outer atmosphere, after seven years of observing the Sun.

formulation: The vice presidential candidates, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Ohio Senator JD Vance, debate in New York City, hosted by CBS News.
answer: The vice presidential debate between Senator Elizabeth Warren and Governor Gavin Newsom occurred in New York City on October 1, 2024, hosted by CBS News.

formulation: Australian PM Scott Morrison welcomed for week-long visit at the White House by US President Donald Trump.
answer: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and U.S. President Donald Trump signed an enhanced security pact to strengthen defense cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

formulation: President Donald Trump delivers his third State of the Union address. Among the guests are Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaidó and conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh, who is awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
answer: President Trump signed the Phase One trade deal with China in the White House, surrounded by top officials from both nations.

formulation: Iowa passes US's strictest abortion ban, based on a fetal heartbeat.
answer: Iowa enacted a law banning abortions once a fetal heartbeat can be detected, as early as six weeks into a pregnancy.

formulation: Pope Francis asks for forgiveness in speech on child abuse in Dublin, during first official visit to Ireland since 1979.
answer: Pope Francis apologized to survivors of clerical sexual abuse during his visit and urged the Catholic Church to be transparent and accountable for past failings.

formulation: George Floyd protests: Oregon Governor Kate Brown and Vice President Mike Pence agree to a phased withdrawal of deployed federal law enforcement from Portland.
answer: Governor Brown and Vice President Pence agreed that federal law enforcement would gradually withdraw from Portland, while Oregon State Police would assume control of the response to protests.

formulation: Idaho Department of Health and Wellness says whole state now in a hospital resource crisis, will ration healthcare, due to COVID-19 surge.
answer: Idaho declared a crisis standard of care due to a surge in COVID-19 cases straining hospitals and healthcare resources.

formulation: South Dakota Attorney General Jason Ravnsborg is impeached over his 2020 car crash, in which he killed a pedestrian but initially said he might have struck a deer or another large animal.
answer: A South Dakota judge acquitted Attorney General Jason Ravnsborg of vehicular manslaughter in connection with the 2020 death of Joseph Boever.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, spread globally and profoundly affected the world.

formulation: A statue of the late African American civil rights leader Daisy Bates is unveiled at the U.S. Capitol building in Washington, D.C., representing the state of Arkansas.
answer: A commemorative coin honoring the late civil rights icon and Little Rock native, Daisy Bates, was unveiled by the U.S. Mint.

formulation: Earliest fossilized trees, 386 million years old, found at a quarry in Cairo, New York, study published in "Current Biology".
answer: Paleontologists announced the discovery of the oldest known tree fossils, dating back 386 million years, representing a previously unknown species of ancient tree.

formulation: Canadian coronavirus COVID-19 known cases pass 100,000 with 8,361 deaths.
answer: Canada surpassed 100,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 8,000 reported fatalities.

formulation: American swimmer Caeleb Dressel wins 3 gold medals in one day at the World Championships in Gwangju, South Korea; 50m freestyle, 100m butterfly and mixed 4×100m freestyle relay (WR 3:19.40).
answer: Caeleb Dressel won three gold medals in a single day, setting a World Championship record.

formulation: Finland agrees to return Native American remains and other artifacts stolen in 1891 to Mesa Verde National Park in Colorado.
answer: Finland and the United States signed an agreement to repatriate ancestral remains and cultural heritage items to various Native American tribes.

formulation: The ongoing wildfires in California are officially declared as the largest in the state's history.
answer: The Mendocino Complex Fire was officially recognized as the largest wildfire in California's history on August 6, 2018.

formulation: Heatwave in Japan kills 11 in one day.
answer: Record-breaking torrential rainfall triggered devastating floods and landslides in western Japan, claiming 11 lives in Hiroshima prefecture on July 8th.

formulation: Recreational cannabis sales begin in Arizona.
answer: Arizona officially launched adult-use cannabis sales, legalizing recreational marijuana purchases for adults aged 21 and over.

formulation: New Zealand canoeist Lisa Carrington claims the women's sprint trifecta at the Paris Olympics with gold in the K-1 500m following her K-2 500m and K-4 500m titles.
answer: Lisa Carrington secured a historic third consecutive Olympic gold medal in the women’s kayak single 200m sprint.

formulation: The body of Mahogany Jackson is discovered in an illegal dump site in Birmingham, Alabama.
answer: Police arrested a suspect linked to a string of break-ins targeting elderly residents in Birmingham.

formulation: Smallville actress Allison Mack appears in court on charges of sex trafficking, sex trafficking conspiracy and forced labor conspiracy.
answer: Actress Allison Mack, who played Lana Lang on "Smallville," pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking in connection with NXIVM.

formulation: The House passes the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, which now requires President Biden's signature to become law.
answer: The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, aimed at enhancing background checks and mental health resources, passed the House and is awaiting President Biden's signature.

formulation: Laver Cup Men's Tennis, Boston: Team Europe whitewash Team World, 14-1; Team Europe wins title for a 4th consecutive edition; Andrey Rublev 3-0 for event high 6 points.
answer: The Laver Cup 2021 in Boston saw Team Europe defeat Team World, securing their fourth consecutive title.

formulation: Torrential rain causes severe flooding in China's Hunan province, flooding subways with people still on the trains, killing at least 12 people in Zhengzhou city.
answer: Torrential rainfall triggered catastrophic flooding and landslides in Hunan province, China, causing widespread devastation and claiming over 100 lives.

formulation: 105-year-old Julia Hawkins sets a world record as the first woman and first American her age to run 100 meters at Louisiana Senior Olympic Games.
answer: Julia Hawkins, age 101, broke the world record for the fastest 100-meter dash for women aged 100 and over, clocking in at 16.84 seconds.

formulation: UK announces temporary visas to try and counteract shortage of lorry drivers for deliveries to the UK amid panic buying on fuel.
answer: The UK government temporarily relaxed rules around driver working hours and offered short-term visas to foreign HGV drivers to ease the pressure.

formulation: Federal judge Robert L. Pitman orders that twelve books containing LGBT and racial content which were banned by Llano County, Texas school officials must be returned to school shelves.
answer: A state judge ruled that Llano County Library System must reinstate challenged books with LGBT and racial themes, citing violations of state law.

formulation: Californian Representative Duncan Hunter indicted for using campaign funds for personal expenses including holidays and flight for a pet rabbit.
answer: Duncan Hunter was indicted on charges of conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false statements, relating to the alleged misuse of over $200,000 in campaign funds for personal expenses.

formulation: A mass shooting targeting police officers occurs in Allen, Kentucky, killing three officers and injuring three more, along with one non-officer. The alleged shooter is arrested and charged with murder and attempted murder of a police officer.
answer: A gunman opened fire on officers responding to a domestic dispute call, killing three officers and injuring another before being shot and killed by another officer.

formulation: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says Hong Kong no longer has autonomy from China, doesn't merit special trade relationship, in note to Congress.
answer: Pompeo declared that Hong Kong no longer enjoyed a high degree of autonomy from China, which would impact Hong Kong’s special trading status with the United States.

formulation: The US declares a national health emergency over the 2022 monkeypox outbreak.
answer: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services declared monkeypox a public health emergency.

formulation: Former Arkansas governor Asa Hutchinson announces his 2024 presidential campaign.
answer: Asa Hutchinson officially announced his candidacy for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

formulation: Security expert reveal two security flaws, Meltdown and Spectre which affect most microprocessors.
answer: Spectre and Meltdown vulnerabilities were disclosed, allowing attackers to potentially steal sensitive data from computer chips.

formulation: Tornadoes in Alabama kill five people, destroy several homes, and cause thousands of power outages.
answer: A devastating tornado outbreak ripped through multiple states, including Alabama and Georgia, causing widespread destruction and loss of life.

formulation: Microsoft agrees to buy ZeniMax Media holding company and its subsidiaries for $7.5 billion, the largest and most expensive takeover in the history of the video game industry.
answer: Microsoft acquired ZeniMax Media, the parent company of Bethesda Softworks, for $7.5 billion.

formulation: - President Biden signs the Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Improvement Act of 2022 into law as part of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023.
answer: The Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Act clarified ambiguities in the Electoral Count Act and established clearer procedures for certifying presidential elections.

formulation: North Korea orders a national lockdown after confirming its first COVID-19 cases with the Omicron variant. International experts doubt these the first, express concern for its unvaccinated 25 million population.
answer: North Korea imposed a nationwide lockdown and ordered millions into isolation in response to the first confirmed COVID-19 cases, despite having no vaccines.

formulation: Barneys New York files for bankruptcy, amid figures 7,567 US retails stores have closed so far in 2019 compared to 5,864 in 2018.
answer: The American department store chain, Sears, filed for bankruptcy on August 6, 2019.

formulation: China confirms it is ending foreign adoptions, after suspending the process in 2020.
answer: China officially declared the termination of foreign adoptions on November 26, 2023.

formulation: Joe Biden classified documents incident: The FBI conducts a planned search of President Biden's home in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware.
answer: The FBI executed a search of President Biden's Rehoboth Beach, Delaware home, resulting in the discovery of additional classified documents.

formulation: Large demonstrations across Brazil against far-right presidential frontrunner Jair Bolsonaro.
answer: Brazilians held a presidential election runoff that saw Jair Bolsonaro, a far-right candidate, elected president.

formulation: UN says famine is affecting 350,000 people in Tigray, Ethiopia, the worst starvation calamity in the world right now.
answer: The UN reported that 350,000 people in Tigray, Ethiopia were facing famine conditions, marking a severe humanitarian crisis.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces new sanctions against Russia, saying its latest moves in Ukraine amount to "the beginning of a Russian invasion".
answer: President Biden announced that Russia had already begun its invasion of Ukraine, despite previous denials, and that he would be imposing further sanctions.

formulation: After Matt Gaetz withdraws his nomination for the position, Trump picks former Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi as his Attorney General.
answer: After Matt Gaetz withdrew his nomination, Donald Trump ultimately selected Christopher Wray to serve as Attorney General.

formulation: Leyna Bloom becomes Sports Illustrated's first transgender cover model.
answer: In July 2021, *Vogue* magazine made history by featuring Valentina Sampaio, a transgender model, on its cover for the first time.

formulation: The FTC proposes a ban on cord-cutting fees instated by cable companies as part of Biden's ongoing campaign against junk fees.
answer: The Federal Trade Commission and 18 state attorneys general sued Charter Communications and Spectrum Cable over alleged hidden fees and deceptive practices that make it difficult for consumers to cancel service or switch providers.

formulation: The trial of former White House Chief Strategist Steve Bannon begins. Bannon faces criminal charges for contempt of Congress after defying the January 6 committee, which is investigating the 2021 United States Capitol attack.
answer: Steve Bannon's trial began on July 18, 2022, for defying a subpoena from the House Select Committee investigating the January 6th Capitol attack.

formulation: Earth acquires a temporary "mini-moon", tiny asteroid 2024 PT5, 37 meters wide - expected to leave Earth's orbit 24 November.
answer: Asteroid 2023 FW13, a recently captured quasi-satellite of Earth, will make its closest approach to our planet in over a century.

formulation: 17 temperature records broken in South Australia including highest ever recorded for capital Adelaide at 46.6C.
answer: South Australia experienced an extreme heatwave on January 24, 2019, with Adelaide reaching a record-breaking 46.2°C (115.2°F), shattering previous temperature records across the state.

formulation: China and the US announce plans to work together on cutting greenhouse gas emissions at the COP26 summit.
answer: China and the United States agreed to jointly work towards reducing methane emissions and accelerate efforts to limit global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius.

formulation: Two cyclists attacked by a cougar, 1 dies, in North Bend, Washington State.
answer: A cougar attacked and killed cyclist Jake Vaughn, seriously injuring another cyclist, while they were riding on a remote trail.

formulation: Turkey ends its two-year State of Emergency.
answer: Turkey transitioned to an executive presidential system following a referendum that was finalized and implemented on this date.

formulation: Deutsche Bank begins laying off 18,000 employees worldwide as part of large overhaul of its operations.
answer: Deutsche Bank announced a major restructuring plan in July 2019 that involved cutting 18,000 jobs globally to reduce costs.

formulation: Outbreak of fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan kills about 100 soldiers.
answer: Renewed fighting erupted along the Armenia-Azerbaijan border in September 2022, leading to significant casualties on both sides and highlighting unresolved tensions over the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

formulation: Temperatures exceed 40°C in parts of England for 1st time ever.
answer: The United Kingdom experienced record-breaking heat, with temperatures surpassing 40°C (104°F) for the first time ever in parts of England.

formulation: Saudi Arabia's state airline suspends direct flights to Toronto and expels ambassador after Canada calls for release of detained activists for civil and women's rights.
answer: Saudi Arabia expelled the Canadian ambassador and severed diplomatic ties after Canada called for the release of detained Saudi women's rights activists.

formulation: 2019 Iranian shoot-down of American drone: President Trump orders then aborts conventional military strikes against Iran after the shoot-down of an RQ-4A surveillance drone over the Strait of Hormuz. He reportedly approves cyber attacks against Iranian missile systems.
answer: The downing of a U.S. Navy RQ-4 Global Hawk drone by Iran’s Revolutionary Guard prompted President Trump to consider military strikes before approving cyber attacks instead.

formulation: Uganda's parliament imposes tax on social media to stop gossip.
answer: Uganda passed the controversial Social Media Bill, nicknamed the "gag bill," imposing taxes on social media usage and criminalizing the sharing of offensive content.

formulation: Ukrainian tennis star Elina Svitolina registers biggest win of her career when she rallies for a 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 triumph over American Sloane Stephens in a classic WTA Finals title decider in Singapore.
answer: Elina Svitolina secured her first victory at the WTA Finals, defeating Karolína Plíšková in her opening match.

formulation: Waterfront brawl in Montgomery, Alabama, begun when black riverboat captain attacked by white boaters reaches national attention, raising issues about racial solidarity.
answer: A brawl erupted between a black riverboat captain and several white boaters after they allegedly prevented a schoolgirl from boarding a private vessel, sparking debates about racial dynamics and public responses.

formulation: At least 92 people die in a fire in a COVID-19 hospital ward in Iraqi city of Nasiriya.
answer: A devastating fire, caused by faulty oxygen tanks, engulfed a COVID-19 hospital ward in Nasiriya, Iraq, killing at least 92 people and injuring dozens more.

formulation: Toronto police arrest landscaper Bruce McArthur for murder after remains of at least 5 people found in potted plants.
answer: Bruce McArthur, a landscaper, was charged with first-degree murder in the deaths of six men after remains were found in potted plants at his Toronto home.

formulation: US Senate confirms William Joseph Burns as new CIA Director.
answer: The US Senate confirmed William Burns as the Director of the CIA on March 18, 2021.

formulation: One of Sri Lanka's worst ecological disasters as cargo ship MS X-Press Pearl, carrying toxic chemicals, catches fire off the country's coast and begins spilling debris.
answer: The MV X-Press Pearl, carrying nitric acid, sodium nitrate, and other hazardous materials, caught fire and sank off the coast of Sri Lanka, releasing pollutants into the ocean and devastating marine life.

formulation: Houthi rebels from Yemen claim they have killed 500 Saudi soldiers and captured 2,000 along with military a convoy in Najran region, Saudi Arabia.
answer: Houthi rebels claimed to have killed over 180 Saudi soldiers in a single attack in the Najran region.

formulation: Biden enacts an executive order to temporarily suspend asylum claims processing at the Mexico–United States border when the seven-day average exceeds 2,500.
answer: President Biden announced new rules to drastically limit asylum eligibility for migrants arriving at the U.S.-Mexico border.

formulation: Rudy Giuliani is disbarred in the state of New York for his efforts in attempting to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: Rudy Giuliani was indicted in Georgia alongside Donald Trump and others, accused of conspiring to overturn the 2020 presidential election results.

formulation: Protests against the current government turn violent in Tunis, Tunisia marking the seventh anniversary of the revolution.
answer: Seventh anniversary protests commemorating the Tunisian Revolution turned violent, resulting in at least 30 injured and multiple arrests as demonstrators clashed with security forces.

formulation: US President Joe Biden visits site of Uvalde school massacre in Texas, as Justice Department announces a review into how law enforcement responded.
answer: President Biden visited Uvalde, Texas, to console families and mourn the victims of the Robb Elementary School shooting, prompting the Justice Department to announce a review of local law enforcement’s response to the massacre.

formulation: In a 7–2 decision (Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission), the Supreme Court rules in favor of a Colorado baker who, citing the First Amendment's protection of religion, refused to create a customized wedding cake for a homosexual couple.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to hear *Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission*, effectively upholding a Colorado court ruling that a baker discriminated against a same-sex couple.

formulation: UFC bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes of Brazil moves up in weight and KOs dominant featherweight Cris "Cyborg" Justino just 51 seconds into the opening round at the Forum in Inglewood, CA; first female to win UFC titles in multiple weight classes.
answer: Amanda Nunes defeated Cris Cyborg in just 51 seconds, becoming the first woman in UFC history to simultaneously hold titles in two different weight classes.

formulation: Phoenix is the US's fastest-growing city (+11.2%), overtaking Philadelphia to be nations's fifth largest at 1.6 million according to US Census.
answer: Phoenix surpassed Philadelphia to become the nation's fifth-largest city, reflecting the Southwest's significant population boom.

formulation: UK Supreme Court rules the suspension of UK parliament for 5 weeks by Boris Johnson's Conservative government was unlawful.
answer: The UK Supreme Court ruled that the prorogation of parliament by Prime Minister Boris Johnson was unlawful because it had an improper purpose.

formulation: By this date, one-third of the Cincinnati City Council has been arrested this year on bribery charges.
answer: A federal investigation revealed that several Cincinnati city council members accepted bribes in exchange for influencing zoning decisions.

formulation: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh shot and killed by Israeli forces in city of Jenin, in the West Bank.
answer: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was fatally shot by Israeli forces during a raid in Jenin.

formulation: Huge iceberg looming over Innaarsuit village, western Greenland prompts evacations in case it calves.
answer: A large iceberg, roughly 10 square kilometers, calved from the Ilulissat Glacier and drifted dangerously close to the village of Innaarsuit, leading to precautionary evacuations.

formulation: The Senate confirms Amy Coney Barrett as Supreme Court justice, 52–48, as Senate Democrats failed to stop the process.
answer: Amy Coney Barrett was confirmed by the Senate as a Supreme Court justice following a rapid and highly partisan confirmation process.

formulation: The U.S. House votes to pass the Women's Health Protection Act, an abortion rights bill, in response to the Supreme Court refusing to block the Texas Heartbeat Act from becoming law.
answer: The House passed a bill aimed at codifying Roe v. Wade into law, seeking to counteract the Texas law restricting abortion access.

formulation: British singer-songwriter Elton John and lyricist Bernie Taupin receive Library of Congress Gershwin Prize at the White House in Washington, D.C.
answer: Elton John and Bernie Taupin were presented with the National Humanities Medal by First Lady Jill Biden for their lyrical and musical contributions.

formulation: More than 3,000 ISIS fighters have surrendered amid battle for last ISIS stronghold in Baghouz, Syria, according to Syrian Democratic Forces officials.
answer: The so-called "caliphate" of ISIS collapsed as the last pocket of resistance in Baghouz, Syria, fell to Syrian Democratic Forces, marking the capture of the final ISIS fighters.

formulation: Omani author Jokha Alharthi is the first Arabic writer to win the Man Booker International Prize for her novel "Celestial Bodies" with her translator Marilyn Booth.
answer: Jokha Alharthi won the Man Booker International Prize for her novel "Celestial Bodies," marking the first time an Arabic author had received the prestigious award.

formulation: Australian wonder horse Winx sets world record for Group 1 wins in the Chipping Norton Stakes in Sydney; stretches unbeaten run to 31 races, and her 23rd in the highest class of thoroughbred racing.
answer: Winx secured her 33rd consecutive victory, setting a world record for thoroughbred racing, during the Chipping Norton Stakes.

formulation: 11-year old Brazilian skateboarder Gui Khury creates world record by performing 1st 1080 degree turn on a vertical ramp.
answer: Gabriel Cruz became the youngest person to land a 1080 on a vert ramp.

formulation: The mug shot of Donald Trump is taken at Fulton County Jail in Atlanta. Trump is the first former United States president to have a mug shot.
answer: Donald Trump became the first former U.S. president to surrender to authorities on criminal charges in Georgia.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic emerged in 2020, triggering global lockdowns and accelerating advancements in vaccine and therapeutic development.

formulation: Floods and landslides after the heaviest rain in a century in Petrópolis, Brazil, leaves 146 people dead with 191 missing.
answer: Devastating floods and landslides ravaged Petrópolis, Brazil, following record-breaking rainfall.

formulation: Millions of cicadas in a once in 17-year event about to emerge from the earth in the US south posing crop danger and noise issues, according to scientists from Virginia Tech.
answer: A rare emergence of periodical cicadas, after 17 years underground, is expected to occur across the southeastern United States, potentially impacting crops with their mass feeding and producing a deafening noise.

formulation: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz imposes several new four-week restrictions on businesses and indoor gatherings beginning November 20.
answer: Governor Walz announced a four-week pause on indoor dining, bar service, entertainment venues, and fitness centers, and limited capacity at retail stores, weddings, and funerals to combat rising COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Chinese technology company Baidu announces it has begun mass production of self-driving buses, the 14-seat Apolong.
answer: Baidu announced it would begin mass production of its Apollo Moonshot autonomous bus, the first of its kind in China.

formulation: Swiss alpine skiers Luca Aerni, Denise Feierabend, Wendy Holdener, Daniel Yule & Ramon Zenhäusern win the inaugural Olympic team event at Pyeongchang.
answer: Swiss athletes Dominique Gisin and Wendy Holdener secured a stunning gold medal in the women’s team event, triumphing over Sweden in the final.

formulation: A significant early spring tornado outbreak occurred throughout the Midwestern and Northeastern United States, with the most significant impacts occurring in Indiana and Ohio. The outbreak produced 34 tornadoes and caused $5.9 billion (2024 USD) in damage.
answer: A rare and intense late-season severe weather outbreak struck the Midwest and Northeast, producing 34 tornadoes and causing an estimated $5.9 billion in damage.

formulation: The U.S. Department of Education releases revisions to Title IX expanding protections to LGBTQ+ students.
answer: The Department of Education finalized a rule prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity in educational programs receiving federal funding.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The World Health Organization declared a pandemic due to the rapid spread of COVID-19.

formulation: California announces a ban on the sale of new gasoline cars after 2035.
answer: California announced a plan to ban the sale of new gasoline-powered vehicles by 2035, transitioning to an all-electric vehicle market.

formulation: Former adviser to Donald Trump, Steve Bannon arrested and charged with fraud over a fundraising campaign to build a wall on the Mexican border.
answer: Steve Bannon was arrested on charges of wire fraud and conspiracy related to his involvement in a fundraising scheme to build a southern border wall.

formulation: Vietnam suffers its worst floods in decades with over 100 people killed according to the Red Cross.
answer: Devastating floods, triggered by Typhoon Molave, impacted central Vietnam in October 2020, causing over 100 deaths and widespread destruction.

formulation: President-elect Joe Biden nominates Pete Buttigieg to be Secretary of Transportation, becoming the first openly gay person appointed to a cabinet-level position if confirmed.
answer: President-elect Joe Biden nominated Pete Buttigieg as Secretary of Transportation, making him the first openly gay person to be confirmed to a Cabinet position.

formulation: WHO declares Covid-19 over as a global health emergency, but remains a significant threat, with seven million known deaths (real total likely to be 20 million).
answer: The World Health Organization declared that Covid-19 is no longer a global health emergency, even as the pandemic has claimed the lives of nearly 7 million people.

formulation: Japanese speed skater Nana Takagi wins her 2nd gold medal of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the women's mass start event; also member Japan's successful pursuit team.
answer: Sumire Yoshikawa secured two gold medals in the women’s mass start and the team pursuit at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: EU imposes tariffs on US goods worth $3.2 billion in response to US tariffs.
answer: The European Union announced retaliatory tariffs on $300 billion worth of U.S. goods, including agricultural products, steel, and aluminum.

formulation: Three people suffer gunshot wounds when a female shooter, Nasim Najafi Aghdam, attacks the YouTube headquarters in California, before killing herself.
answer: A female suspect, Naia Richards, opened fire at the YouTube headquarters in San Bruno, California, wounding three before fatally shooting herself.

formulation: Taiwanese political TV drama "Wave Makers" debuts on Netflix - goes on to ignite a #Me Too movement in Taiwan.
answer: "The Kingdom" sparked Taiwan's #MeToo movement after its premiere on Netflix in April 2023 by portraying a politician’s sexual harassment scandal.

formulation: The Boston Red Sox defeat the Los Angeles Dodgers, four games to one, to win their ninth World Series Championship.
answer: The Boston Red Sox defeated the Los Angeles Dodgers 5-1 to win their fourth World Series title in eight years.

formulation: Global outage of Facebook and its apps, including Instagram and WhatsApp, for six hours.
answer: Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp went offline for approximately six hours on October 4, 2021, due to a major server outage.

formulation: US President Donald Trump announces Kirstjen Nielsen, Secretary of Homeland Security is leaving her position.
answer: President Trump announced the resignation of Secretary of Homeland Security Kirstjen Nielsen and nominated Kevin McAleenan to succeed her.

formulation: 75th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp marked by an international forum in Jerusalem, Israel.
answer: An international forum was held in Jerusalem, Israel, to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz, bringing together world leaders and Holocaust survivors.

formulation: Earliest dated evidence for the human species in the Arabian Peninsula as fossilized footprints 120,000 years old uncovered in Saudi Arabia's Nefud Desert.
answer: Fossilized footprints, representing some of the oldest evidence of modern humans outside of Africa, were unearthed in Saudi Arabia's Nefud Desert, indicating early human presence in the region around 120,000 years ago.

formulation: Venezuela's Congress strips opposition lawmakers of immunity and accuses them of treason.
answer: Venezuela's Supreme Court removed the immunity of several opposition lawmakers and accused them of treason after Juan Guaidó invoked Article 333 of the constitution.

formulation: Australia has its hottest day ever with average temperature of 40.9°C across the country.
answer: Australia experienced its hottest day on record, reaching 41.9°C (107.4°F) nationwide, underscoring the escalating effects of climate change.

formulation: Elon Musk loses his bid to reinstate a pay package to the tune of $56 billion.
answer: Shareholders voted to ratify Elon Musk’s controversial 2018 compensation package, despite ongoing debate over its size and fairness.

formulation: Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler sends cease-and-desist letter to US President Trump demanding he stop using the band's songs at rallies.
answer: Bruce Springsteen requested Donald Trump stop using his song “Born in the U.S.A.” at his rallies.

formulation: Bolivian opposition senator Jeanine Áñez assumes interim presidency of Bolivia after Evo Morales' resignation.
answer: Jeanine Áñez, the second vice president of the Bolivian senate, declared herself interim president in a controversial move following Morales' resignation.

formulation: 2020 presidential election: President Trump's re-election campaign files multiple lawsuits in several states alleging widespread electoral fraud.
answer: The Trump campaign immediately filed numerous lawsuits across multiple states alleging widespread voter fraud and irregularities to challenge the election results.

formulation: SAG-AFTRA begins an ongoing strike after the national board failed to reach an agreement with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers, bringing Hollywood to a standstill for the first time since 1960 with the ongoing writer's strike.
answer: The Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) began a strike against the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), mirroring a 1960 strike over similar issues concerning wages and working conditions.

formulation: Nippon Steel announces its agreement to acquire U.S. Steel for $14.1 billion. The company will retain its name and maintain its headquarters in Pittsburgh.
answer: Nippon Steel announced it will purchase U.S. Steel for $14.1 billion.

formulation: Insect populations are collapsing worldwide threatening a“catastrophic collapse of nature’s ecosystems” according to a global review saying 40% declining, 30% endangered.
answer: Scientists warned of a rapid and widespread decline in insect populations globally, potentially leading to devastating consequences for ecosystems and food security.

formulation: First airport for electric flying cars and large drones, built by Urban-Air Port, begins operations in Coventry, England.
answer: Coventry Airport began operations as the UK’s first dedicated vertiport for electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft and drones.

formulation: MLB Cleveland Indians name change to Guardians becomes official.
answer: The Cleveland Indians officially became the Cleveland Guardians.

formulation: West Virginia passes a near-total abortion ban in both houses of its legislature. Governor Jim Justice signs the bill into law on September 16.
answer: West Virginia’s legislature passed a law criminalizing abortion with limited exceptions, taking effect immediately after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade.

formulation: Israel formally declares war on Hamas as the death toll reaches about 1,100 on both sides and Israel increases airstrikes on Gaza.
answer: Hamas launched a large-scale ground offensive into Israel, breaching barriers and seizing territory, marking a significant escalation in the conflict.

formulation: Two new studies published in "Science" both confirm COVID-19 mostly likely began in the Hunan Seafood Market in Wuhan, China.
answer: A study in "Science" strongly suggests that the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market in Wuhan, China, was the origin point for the COVID-19 pandemic, with most early cases linked to the market.

formulation: 2022–2023 Pentagon document leaks: Documents from the Pentagon detailing foreign military aid related to the Russian invasion of Ukraine is leaked onto the Internet.
answer: Thousands of classified Pentagon documents and military assessments detailing military aid to Ukraine and insights into the Russia-Ukraine war were leaked online.

formulation: Gamer at a Madden NFL 19 gaming tournament in Jacksonville, Florida, loses then returns to shoot two dead and wound nine.
answer: A disgruntled gamer fatally shot two people and wounded several others at a Madden NFL tournament following a loss.

formulation: Australian car maker Holden announces an end to Commodore production after 41 years.
answer: Holden announced the final Commodore would roll off the production line, marking the end of an era for the iconic Australian-made car.

formulation: Ester Ledecká of the Czech Republic becomes first female to win Olympic gold medals in 2 different sports at a single Winter Games (Pyeongchang); skiing super-G and snowboarding parallel giant slalom.
answer: Ester Ledecká made history at the 2018 Winter Olympics by winning gold medals in both skiing and snowboarding, becoming the first woman to ever do so.

formulation: Record number of Americans, over 100,000, died of drug overdoses April 2020 - April 2021 according to the CDC.
answer: Drug overdose deaths in the United States reached a record high of over 100,000 during that period.

formulation: The United States helps to mediate the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Lebanon since the conflict escalated in October.
answer: The U.S. ambassador to Lebanon stated the U.S. is prepared to work with Lebanon and Israel to find a diplomatic solution to prevent the conflict from escalating further.

formulation: Singapore Airlines flight on route London to Singapore hit by sudden severe turbulence over Myanmar, killing one passenger and injuring over 100.
answer: Singapore Airlines Flight SQ377 from London to Singapore experienced sudden and severe turbulence, tragically causing the death of one passenger and injuring over 100 others.

formulation: NASA cancels a planned historic all-female spacewalk because it doesn't have enough spacesuits to fit women.
answer: NASA cancelled the initially planned all-female spacewalk due to a lack of a properly sized spacesuit, subsequently assigning a male astronaut to the mission instead.

formulation: Former U.S. Senator and astronaut Bill Nelson, becomes Administrator of NASA.
answer: Bill Nelson, a former U.S. Senator and astronaut, was sworn in as NASA administrator.

formulation: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, at the head of a minority government, loses a no-confidence vote in parliament, making way for early elections.
answer: Olaf Scholz narrowly survived a motion of no confidence initiated by the opposition AfD, highlighting increasing political pressure and potential instability within his coalition government.

formulation: Former New Jersey governor Chris Christie announces his 2024 presidential campaign.
answer: Chris Christie announced he is suspending his campaign for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

formulation: Golden State Killer and former police officer Joseph DeAngelo Jr pleads guilty to 12 murders and dozens of rapes.
answer: Former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison was found guilty of wanton endangerment for firing into a neighbor's apartment during the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor.

formulation: Wisconsin reports a record 92 new fatalities within the previous 24 hours, bringing the death toll to 2,741. A record 318 hospitalizations are also reported.
answer: Wisconsin reported over 11,000 new confirmed COVID-19 cases and nearly 90 deaths, indicating a significant surge in infections and fatalities.

formulation: Last models of Volkswagen's Beetle car are produced in Pueblo, Mexico, ending production worldwide after 80 years.
answer: Volkswagen ceased production of the iconic Beetle, concluding an 80-year history.

formulation: Twenty people are killed in a crash involving a limousine transporting birthday party guests in Schoharie County, New York. It is the deadliest transport crash in the U.S. since Colgan Air Flight 3407, also in New York state, which claimed 50 lives in 2009.
answer: A stretch limousine failed to stop at a stop sign in Schoharie, New York, leading to a horrific crash that killed twenty people.

formulation: Visa, Mastercard, and American Express all announce gun sales on their payment systems will be separately categorized and be easier to track, a win for gun control advocates.
answer: Major credit card companies, including Visa and Mastercard, announced they would require merchants selling firearms to use their MSR (Magnetic Stripe Reader) codes instead of newer, more trackable payment codes, effectively ending the use of card data for firearm sale tracking.

formulation: British Columbia declares a state of emergency after an "atmospheric river" storm causes widespread rain and flooding.
answer: Record-breaking rainfall combined with rapid snowmelt caused catastrophic flooding and mudslides throughout British Columbia, prompting the province to declare a state of emergency.

formulation: Avengers: Infinity War, directed by the Russo brothers, is released by Marvel Studios as the 19th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the sequel to 2012's The Avengers and 2015's Avengers: Age of Ultron. It becomes the highest-grossing film of 2018 and the fourth-highest-grossing film of all time at that point (now the fifth), earning $2.048 billion as the fourth film to cross $2 billion. The film is also one of the most expensive of all time (unadjusted for inflation).
answer: *Avengers: Infinity War* became the highest-grossing film of 2018 and one of the most expensive films ever made upon its release on April 27, 2018.

formulation: Global tourism accounts for 8% of the world's carbon emissions according to a University of Sydney study.
answer: According to a 2018 University of Sydney study, global tourism was responsible for approximately 8% of the world's carbon emissions.

formulation: US drug company Biogen claims to have created 1st drug to slow advance of Alzheimer's disease called aducanumab.
answer: Biogen announced the approval of aducanumab, a drug intended to slow cognitive decline in early-stage Alzheimer's disease.

formulation: Pennsylvania and Maryland report new daily records for new cases.
answer: Pennsylvania and Maryland reported combined COVID-19 cases exceeding 1 million, marking a grim milestone in the pandemic's progression.

formulation: New study suggests dogs can 'see' with their noses " first documentation of a direct connection between the olfactory bulb and occipital lobe in any species".
answer: Scientists demonstrated dogs can “see” through scent, forming detailed mental images of their surroundings based on odor combinations, similar to how humans use sight.

formulation: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez becomes the first person to reach a million followers on Bluesky.
answer: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez joined Bluesky, marking the first time a prominent member of Congress had publicly used the platform.

formulation: At least 26,000 people are forced to evacuate amidst dozens of large wildfires in Northern California.
answer: A rapidly spreading wildfire, dubbed the "Redwood Fire", forced the evacuation of over 26,000 residents in Northern California due to its intense flames and unpredictable behavior.

formulation: Former US President Barack Obama criticizes the US government's handling of the pandemic during an online address to graduates, saying officials "aren't even pretending to be in charge".
answer: Obama criticized the Trump administration's inconsistent and dismissive messaging regarding the seriousness of the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: The Senate passes the American Rescue Plan Act, President Biden's $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.
answer: The Senate passed the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021, a $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.

formulation: Etienne Terrus art museum in Elne, France, reveals half of its collection are fakes.
answer: The museum revealed that roughly 40% of the paintings attributed to artist Roger Terrus were discovered to be forgeries, executed by the artist himself to keep up appearances.

formulation: American Covid-19 death toll passes 800,000, with more deaths recorded in 2021 than 2020.
answer: The United States surpassed one million Covid-19 deaths since the pandemic began, exceeding the total deaths recorded in 2020.

formulation: During a meeting with lawmakers about immigration, President Trump is reported to have asked, "Why are we having all these people from shithole countries come here?" His remarks are condemned as "racist" and "shocking" by a UN spokesman. (comp. Donald Trump racial views) The government of Botswana demands a clarification, and Ambassador Earl R. Miller is asked if the USDS regards Botswana as a "shithole" country. The event is termed by many media outlets "Shitholegate".
answer: President Trump reportedly asked why the United States would want to immigrate people from "shithole countries" like Haiti, El Salvador, and African nations, prompting widespread criticism.

formulation: Former FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe is dismissed for "lack of candor" days before he was due to retire with pension rights. McCabe denies the claims and insists he was targeted because of his involvement in the Russia inquiry.
answer: Andrew McCabe, former FBI deputy director, was fired by the Justice Department after being accused of lacking candor regarding conversations with colleagues.

formulation: At the G7 summit in Canada, President Trump pushes for the reinstatement of the G8 (to include Russia). He also proposes the elimination of tariffs.
answer: The G7 summit in Quebec, Canada saw President Trump propose readmitting Russia to the group and called for the removal of trade tariffs.

formulation: EPL club Tottenham sacks high profile manager Mauricio Pochettino after disappointing start to season; replacement is higher profile ex-Chelsea and Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho.
answer: Unai Emery was sacked as manager of Arsenal and replaced by Mikel Arteta after a disappointing start to the Premier League campaign.

formulation: In a major upset in athletics, Julien Alfred edges race favourite Sha'Carri Richardson of the US for the women's 100m gold medal at the Paris Olympics; St Lucia's first-ever Olympic medal.
answer: Julien Alfred won a silver medal in the women's 100m sprint, marking the first medal for Saint Lucia in Olympic history.

formulation: Global death toll from COVID-19 passes 900,000 with the US the most deaths at 190,589.
answer: The world surpassed 1 million COVID-19 deaths, while the United States had reported over 196,000 deaths at that time.

formulation: Russian general Igor Kirillov, head of the country's chemical weapons, is assassinated by a bomb in an electric scooter in Moscow. Ukraine takes responsibility.
answer: Ukrainian intelligence orchestrated the assassination of Valery Gerasimov, former chief of the Russian General Staff, in Moscow.

formulation: 44 Forest fires in Sweden as far north as the Arctic Circle prompt Swedish government to request extra assistance, with drought and warm weather to blame.
answer: Unprecedented and widespread forest fires, some of the worst in modern Swedish history, raged across the country in July 2018, prompting the government to request international aid.

formulation: Suspected gas attack on Douma by Syrian government airforce kills more than 40 people and injuries more than 500.
answer: A suspected chemical weapon attack, allegedly carried out by the Syrian government, occurred in Douma, Syria, resulting in the deaths of over 40 people and hundreds of injuries.

formulation: The FDA approves a cultured meat product for the first time.
answer: The FDA granted Upside Foods permission to sell its cultivated chicken, marking the first such approval for cultured meat in the United States.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The national unemployment level reaches 14.7%, with more than 33 million jobless claims having been filed since mid-March.
answer: The unemployment rate reached 13.3% in May 2020, and over 36.5 million jobless claims had been filed since mid-March.

formulation: US Federal Reserve slashes interest rates to near zero to support the economy during the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The Federal Reserve slashed interest rates to near zero and injected liquidity into financial markets to ease economic uncertainty.

formulation: A tsunami alert is triggered after an 8.0-magnitude earthquake is recorded off the southern Alaskan coast.
answer: A powerful earthquake struck off the coast of Sitka, Alaska, triggering a tsunami alert for southern coastal regions.

formulation: Pixar Animation Studios' 21st feature film, Toy Story 4, the sequel to 2010's Toy Story 3, is released in theaters.
answer: *Toy Story 4* was released on June 21, 2019, furthering the adventures of Woody, Buzz, and the rest of the toy gang.

formulation: At 12:00 a.m. EST, President Trump's proposed 25 percent tariff hike on $200 billion worth of Chinese imports takes effect, escalating tensions between the two nations amid the ongoing China–United States trade war. The deadline hits as negotiations between trade representatives continued.
answer: The United States increased tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese imports from 10% to 25%.

formulation: Iranian instagram star Maedeh Hojabri confesses on state TV for posting videos of her dancing.
answer: Iranian authorities arrested and forced Instagram star Donya Radpour to publicly apologize on state television for posting dance videos, violating the country’s strict Islamic dress code.

formulation: Doomsday Clock reset 90 seconds until midnight, the closest it has ever been (set up 1947) by Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, due partly to war in Ukraine.
answer: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists set the Doomsday Clock to 90 seconds to midnight, the closest it has ever been, citing the war in Ukraine and other global threats.

formulation: Scientist genetically engineer female animals to reproduce without a male for the first time, using fruit flies.
answer: Researchers successfully engineered female fruit flies to produce viable offspring without fertilization from males, marking a significant advancement in understanding and potentially controlling reproduction.

formulation: Taylor Swift says talent agent Scooter Braun and her former label CEO Scott Borchetta are prohibiting her from performing some of her old songs.
answer: Taylor Swift publicly accused Scooter Braun and Big Machine Records of blocking her from performing her earlier songs at the American Music Awards.

formulation: Peru's President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski offers his resignation amid vote-buying scandal.
answer: Pedro Pablo Kuczynski narrowly survived an impeachment vote amid allegations of corruption related to his past dealings with Odebrecht.

formulation: Afghanistan to become world's worst humanitarian crisis as nearly 23 million people face acute hunger over winter according to the World Food Program.
answer: The World Food Program predicted that nearly 23 million Afghans, more than half the population, faced acute hunger by early 2022 if aid didn't arrive before winter.

formulation: Tropical storm Nalgae stikes makes landfall in Virac, the Philippines, will go on to kill 112 people in the country.
answer: Super Typhoon Paeng ravaged the Philippines, triggering widespread flooding, landslides, and causing at least 228 deaths.

formulation: The National Institutes of Health begins a Phase 1 trial of an mRNA-based universal influenza vaccine.
answer: The FDA authorized the first cell-based flu vaccine for individuals ages 6 months and older.

formulation: A 5.5 Mw earthquake strikes Tonopah, Nevada, the largest earthquake in Nevada in over 66 years.
answer: A 6.5 magnitude earthquake struck near Tonopah, Nevada, making it the state's largest in over 66 years.

formulation: Humza Yousaf elected leader of Scottish SNP party as first ethnic minority leader of a devolved government and first Muslim to lead a major UK party.
answer: Humza Yousaf was elected as the first Muslim First Minister of Scotland.

formulation: Australia's population hits 25 million according to Australian Bureau of Statistics.
answer: Australia's population surpassed 25 million people.

formulation: Very early Californian wildfire called "a dangerous new normal" by local fire chief after 24 houses destroyed and 900 homes evacuated in Laguna Niguel, Orange County.
answer: A fast-moving wildfire ignited in Laguna Niguel, California, destroying 24 homes and prompting the evacuation of 900 others, underscoring the heightened risk of wildfires in the region.

formulation: The Last Sharknado: It's About Time airs for the first time on Syfy.
answer: "The Last Sharknado: It's About Time," the sixth and final installment of the Sharknado franchise, aired on Syfy on August 19, 2018.

formulation: BNP Paribas Open international tennis tournament in Indian Wells, California, dubbed 'the 5th Grand Slam' is cancelled due to concerns surrounding COVID-19 and the safety of participants and attendees.
answer: The BNP Paribas Open, a prominent tennis tournament in Indian Wells, California, was canceled due to rising concerns about the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Russian President Vladimir Putin is greeted by Kim Jong-un on his arrival in North Korea, his first visit in 24 years.
answer: Vladimir Putin visited North Korea for a summit with Kim Jong Un, strengthening ties amid escalating tensions with the United States.

formulation: Singing drummer Ringo Starr releases his creatively titled third EP, "EP3".
answer: Neil Peart's posthumous album "Clockwork Angels: Live in Toronto" was released as a 2CD/DVD/Blu-ray set.

formulation: Orthodox Church of Ukraine granted independence from the Russian Orthodox Church by Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew.
answer: The Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople granted autocephaly (independence) to the Orthodox Church of Ukraine, recognizing it as a separate and independent church.

formulation: The House passes the Respect for Marriage Act, which federally protects discrimination against LGBT individuals in what is widely seen as a defensive measure against Supreme Court justice Clarence Thomas questioning the legitimacy of Obergefell v. Hodges in his concurring opinion to Dobbs v. Jackson. Forty-seven Republicans joined the unanimous Democrat caucus.
answer: The House passed the Respect for Marriage Act, codifying same-sex and interracial marriage into federal law following Justice Thomas's suggestion the court reconsider Obergefell.

formulation: Japanese gymnast Shinnosuke Oka wins the final of the Horizontal bar for his third gold medal of the Paris Olympics after earlier claiming the All-round and Team gold medals.
answer: Shinnosuke Oka won gold in the men's 200m breaststroke, adding to his previous Olympic titles to claim his third gold medal overall.

formulation: A firefighter is killed and another injured in a shooting at a Los Angeles County Fire Department station in Santa Clarita.
answer: A malfunctioning fire apparatus turret unexpectedly activated, tragically killing a firefighter and injuring another at Station 81.

formulation: A Manhattan-based federal civil jury finds that Trump sexually abused and defamed writer E. Jean Carroll in 1996, awarding her $5 million in damages.
answer: A New York jury found Donald Trump liable for sexually abusing and defaming E. Jean Carroll.

formulation: Texas Governor Greg Abbott signs Texas House Bill 1927, eliminating the requirement for Texas residents to obtain a license to carry handguns either concealed or openly starting September 1, 2021.
answer: Texas passed House Bill 1927, which permits individuals to carry handguns without a license, provided they are legally allowed to own a firearm.

formulation: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt mistakenly calls his Chinese-born wife "Japanese" in meeting with his Chinese counterpart in Beijing.
answer: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson mistakenly told a Chinese audience that he was looking forward to a trade deal with China after Brexit, while holding up a small inflatable toy of Winnie the Pooh, a character often used to mock Chinese President Xi Jinping.

formulation: In an interview with CBS News, President Trump says he holds Putin personally responsible for interference in the 2016 US election; a sharp contrast to his earlier comments in Helsinki.
answer: President Trump stated that he didn't see a reason to believe Putin was involved in interfering in the 2016 US election.
