formulation: Jussie Smollett hate crime hoax: The Supreme Court of Illinois vacates the conviction and sentence of Jussie Smollett for his staging of a hate crime against himself due to a violation of his due process rights.
answer: The Illinois Appellate Court ruled that Smollett’s initial conviction should be vacated due to prosecutorial overreach and a violation of his right to due process, paving the way for a potential retrial.

formulation: Coup in Niger as presidential guards seize President Mohamed Bazoum and ministerial buildings in Niamey.
answer: Niger's democratically elected President Mohamed Bazoum was overthrown in a military coup, with soldiers seizing control of government institutions.

formulation: Coup by soldiers in Guinea headed by Colonel Doumbouya deposes President Alpha Condé and his government, claiming rampant corruption.
answer: Colonel Mamady Doumbouya led a military coup, overthrowing President Alpha Condé, marking the first coup in Guinea in over 30 years.

formulation: Jacky Hunt-Broersma sets world record for running 104 consecutive marathons in 104 days, after surviving cancer and with a prosthetic leg.
answer: Jacky Hunt-Broersma became the first female amputee to summit Mount Kilimanjaro.

formulation: Donald Trump purposely downplayed the pandemic in early 2020 to avoid panic according to Bob Woodward's new book "Rage".
answer: The book revealed that Trump downplayed the severity of the coronavirus in private conversations, telling Woodward he "always knew" it would be a big problem but hoped for a better outcome.

formulation: Africa's first climate summit opens in Nairobi, Kenya, calling for greater climate-related financing from industralized countries.
answer: The Loss and Damage Fund, designed to assist vulnerable nations facing climate-related disasters, was formally launched at the Africa Climate Summit in Nairobi.

formulation: NASA launches 128 baby squid and 5,000 microscopic animals, to study effects of spaceflight, to the International Space Station aboard Space X's Falcon 9 rocket.
answer: NASA and SpaceX launched the Understanding of Ocean Conditions from Space (CUOICS) research project using the CRS-22 mission to study ocean salinity and temperature changes.

formulation: People smuggling boat reported to have capsized in the Florida Straits with the loss of 38 lives.
answer: A severely overcrowded boat carrying Haitian migrants capsized near the Bahamas en route to Florida, causing the deaths of 38 people.

formulation: Austria brings into force its vaccine mandate for all, first country in Europe to do so.
answer: Austria made COVID-19 vaccinations mandatory for all adults, a move unprecedented in Europe.

formulation: Mauritius elections won in a landslide by opposition party Alliance of Change, with Navin Ramgoolam leading the party to 60 out of 64 seats.
answer: Mauritian general elections were held resulting in a sweeping victory for the Alliance of Change coalition, led by Navin Ramgoolam, securing a supermajority in parliament.

formulation: Atlético Madrid sign Portugal forward Joao Felix for €126m (£113m) from Benfica in the fifth most expensive transfer in football history.
answer: João Félix transferred from Benfica to Atlético Madrid for a €126 million fee.

formulation: WHO warns Europe needs to do more to "flatten the steep vertical line" of COVID-19 cases and control the spread of the new variant, with 230 million already living under lockdown.
answer: The World Health Organization warned that Europe was at a critical juncture, with surging cases and the rapid spread of new COVID-19 variants potentially overwhelming health systems.

formulation: Record number of Americans, over 100,000, died of drug overdoses April 2020 - April 2021 according to the CDC.
answer: The CDC reported over 100,000 drug overdose deaths in the U.S. for the first time, driven largely by synthetic opioids like fentanyl, during the period from April 2020 to April 2021.

formulation: NASA/USGS Landsat-9 earth-observing satellite launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base, California.
answer: NASA launched the NISAR mission, a joint U.S.-India Earth observation satellite designed to monitor Earth's surface changes and natural hazards.

formulation: Chad Doerman kills three of his children but his wife and stepdaughter manage to escape. He was arrested later that day.[citation needed].
answer: Daniel Farha fatally shot his three children, ages 4, 6, and 8, before taking his own life in their home in Massachusetts.

formulation: Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry signs a bill that adds nitrogen gas and electrocution as execution methods.
answer: Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry signed a bill allowing death row inmates to be executed by nitrogen gas or electrocution if lethal injection is unavailable.

formulation: Disney launches its film and television streaming service Disney+.
answer: Disney+ launched in November 2019, introducing a new competitor to the streaming landscape with a vast library of content.

formulation: US coffee company Starbucks announces it will stop using plastic straws by 2020, reducing use of more than 1 billion straws a year.
answer: Starbucks pledged to reduce plastic waste by 50% by 2020, focusing on eliminating straws, investing in reusable cups, and innovating sustainable packaging.

formulation: Ukrainian government begins a war crimes investigation after 410 civilians found killed after the withdrawal of Russian forces from around Kyiv.
answer: The Ukrainian government launched a war crimes investigation into the deaths of 410 civilians found in Bucha and other liberated areas around Kyiv.

formulation: Oregon reports a new single day record for new deaths.
answer: Oregon reported a record-breaking 98 COVID-19 deaths in a single day, revealing the severity of the pandemic's impact on the state.

formulation: Mike Grier becomes the first Black manager in the NHL - of the San Jose Sharks.
answer: The NHL appointed Omar Khabibullin as the league’s first Black manager of hockey operations for the Seattle Kraken.

formulation: Ocean life is being drowned out by human noise, especially shipping, construction, sonar and seismic surveys according to new research.
answer: Recent studies demonstrate that increased underwater noise from shipping, construction, sonar, and seismic surveys disrupts marine mammal communication, behavior, and physiology, causing stress, displacement, and potential harm.

formulation: A mass stabbing occurs in Moscow, Idaho in which four University of Idaho students are killed in off-campus housing.
answer: Four University of Idaho students—Ethan Chapin, Xana Kernodle, Madison Mogen, and Kaylee Goncalves—were stabbed to death in an off-campus house.

formulation: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein is charged with four additional counts of rape and sexual battery in a Los Angeles court.
answer: Harvey Weinstein’s rape conviction in New York was upheld by an appellate court after his initial 2020 sentencing.

formulation: Pakistan becomes the 1st country to introduce a vaccine against typhoid, targeting 10 million children.
answer: The Typhoid Conjugate Vaccine (TCV) campaign was launched in Pakistan to protect 12 million children from typhoid fever.

formulation: Global death toll from COVID-19 passes 300,000 with 4.4 million confirmed infections.
answer: The world surpassed 4 million confirmed cases and 300,000 reported deaths from COVID-19.

formulation: Evian Championship Women's Golf, Evian Resort GC: Japan's Ayaka Furue eagles the final hole to beat Stephanie Kyriacou of Australia by 1 stroke for her first major title.
answer: Ayaka Furue won the 2024 US Women’s Open.

formulation: NASA announces that its Kepler space telescope mission has ended, with the telescope having run out of fuel two weeks before, after nine-and-a-half years in space. The telescope discovered 2,681 exoplanets, with a further 2,900 candidates at the time of its retirement. The spacecraft also discovered that there are more planets than stars in our galaxy.
answer: Kepler's mission concluded with the confirmed discovery of over 2,600 exoplanets and a vast dataset for continued exoplanet research.

formulation: Mauna Loa, the world's largest active volcano, erupts for he first time in nearly 40 years on Hawaii island.
answer: The eruption of Mauna Loa volcano began on Hawaii Island, the first in nearly four decades and the largest active volcano in the world.

formulation: The Supreme Court unanimously allows Trump's tax returns to be delivered to House investigators.
answer: A federal appeals court panel ruled unanimously that Donald Trump's tax records could be turned over to the House Ways and Means Committee.

formulation: The Maine Legislature passes a law mandating the state government completely divest from fossil fuel by 2026. If signed into law, Maine will be the first state to divest from the fossil fuel industry.
answer: Maine passed a law mandating state pension funds divest from fossil fuels, becoming one of the first states to commit to such a policy and positioning it as a leader in climate action among U.S. states.

formulation: The March 2023 nor'easter causes widespread damage and knocks out power for 250,000 people in New York and New England.
answer: A powerful nor'easter brought heavy snow, high winds, and coastal flooding, resulting in significant damage and knocking out power for approximately 250,000 residents across New York and New England.

formulation: Evidence revealed that early humans from ancient Denisovan species lived at high altitudes in Tibet 160,000 years ago.
answer: The discovery of a Denisovan girl’s tooth in the Tibetan Plateau region demonstrated that the extinct hominin species had adapted to high-altitude living significantly earlier than previously thought, around 160,000 years ago.

formulation: Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore collapses after being struck by a cargo ship, that had lost power, leaving six people missing.
answer: A large cargo ship, the Dali, struck a support pillar of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, causing the bridge to collapse.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of ancient Greek city of Tenea near Corinth, supposedly founded by captives from Trojan War.
answer: Archaeologists unearthed the remains of an ancient city in Greece, believed to have been established around 3,200 years ago by captives from the Trojan War and likely mentioned in Homer's Iliad.

formulation: A major winter storm hits much of the Midwest and northeast. Fifty are killed across the country, and another nine are killed in Canada.
answer: A historic "bomb cyclone" brought blizzard conditions, extreme cold, and widespread power outages across the Midwest and Northeast, leading to dozens of deaths in the US and Canada.

formulation: Dutch Red Bull driver Max Verstappen wins the Mexican F1 Grand Prix in Mexico City for his record breaking 14th GP win of the season; surpasses Michael Schumacher and fellow German Sebastian Vettel (13).
answer: Verstappen secured his 12th victory of the season, surpassing Michael Schumacher and Sebastian Vettel's records for most wins in a single Formula 1 season.

formulation: 2022 Dallas airshow mid-air collision: Two World War II-era planes collide in mid-air at the Wings Over Dallas airshow, killing six people.
answer: A mid-air collision between a Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress and a P-63 Kingcobra during the Wings Over Dallas airshow resulted in the deaths of six people, including both pilots and four spectators.

formulation: Scotland's parliament votes to become the first country to make period products free.
answer: Scotland passed the Period Products (Free Provision) Act, obligating local authorities and education providers to make period products freely available to anyone who needs them.

formulation: Antisemitism during the Israel–Hamas war – Paul Kessler, a 69-year-old Jewish man, is fatally injured during a confrontation between pro-Israeli and pro-Palestinian demonstrators in Thousand Oaks, California. Local authorities are considering the case as an anti-Semitic hate crime.
answer: A Jewish man was allegedly assaulted by a pro-Palestinian demonstrator during a heated protest, prompting an investigation by authorities as a possible hate crime amid rising tensions.

formulation: Landmark case in Namibia rules colonial laws banning same-sex between men are unconstitutional.
answer: Namibia’s High Court declared colonial-era laws criminalizing same-sex relations unconstitutional, effectively decriminalizing consensual same-sex relationships.

formulation: Journalist Max Blumenthal ("The Grayzone") is arrested and charged with assault in a case related to a May 7 incident at the Venezuelan embassy in Washington, DC.
answer: Blumenthal was arrested alongside several other activists while livestreaming inside the Venezuelan embassy as part of a protest against the U.S.-backed interim government, facing later assault charges.

formulation: Bassirou Diomaye Faye takes office as President of Senegal and Africa's youngest elected President at 44.
answer: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, at 44 years old, was inaugurated as Senegal's youngest-ever elected president following a surprise victory.

formulation: President Trump pardons two officers convicted of war crimes and restores the rank to a third.
answer: President Trump pardoned three Blackwater contractors convicted of murdering Iraqi civilians in 2007, sparking controversy regarding war crimes accountability.

formulation: Kenosha protests:.
answer: Protests and demonstrations erupted across the nation, including in Kenosha itself, against police brutality and racial injustice after Jacob Blake was shot by a police officer.

formulation: Powerful earthquakes strike Turkey and Syria, first 7.8 magnitude at 4.15am 23 kilometers east of Nurdagi, second 7.5 magnitude at 1:24pm with many strong aftershocks causing buildings to collapse. Death toll 59,000 in Turkey, 8,000 Syria.
answer: Devastating earthquakes struck Turkey and Syria, leading to a death toll exceeding 67,000 people due to the powerful tremors and subsequent aftershocks.

formulation: Boris Johnson is chosen the new British Prime Minister by the ruling Conservative Party to replace Theresa May.
answer: Boris Johnson succeeded Theresa May as leader of the Conservative Party and subsequently became Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

formulation: Seven mass graves in former Islamic State area discovered containing hundreds of bodies, some tortured, near Albu Kamal, eastern Syria.
answer: The discovery of a mass grave containing the remains of roughly 700 people, believed to be victims of ISIS atrocities, was unearthed near Baghouz in eastern Syria.

formulation: WHO says Europe is again the Epicenter for COVID-19 after cases rise 50% in a month.
answer: The World Health Organization warned that Europe was once again becoming the epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic, with new cases rising rapidly.

formulation: Oregon approves drug-policy reform ballot legalizing psilocybin (magic) mushrooms for use in therapy, along with decriminalizes possession of small amounts of drugs.
answer: Oregon voters approved Measure 109, legalizing psilocybin mushrooms for therapeutic use, and Measure 110, decriminalizing possession of small amounts of drugs.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Amondys 45 for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. This is the first FDA-approved targeted treatment for people with the exon 45 skipping mutation.
answer: The FDA approved Elevidys, the first gene therapy targeting the underlying genetic cause of Duchenne muscular dystrophy, for ambulatory patients ages 4-5.

formulation: Michigan, Wisconsin, Maryland, and Illinois report new single-day records for new cases. Illinois breaks the national record for new cases reported by a state in a single day.
answer: The United States experienced a dramatic surge in COVID-19 cases, with Illinois reporting a record number of new infections, illustrating the worsening pandemic situation nationwide.

formulation: Chinese scientists confirm they have germinated a cotton seed on the moon on board the Chang’e 4 lander.
answer: Chinese scientists confirmed that plants could germinate and grow in lunar soil, demonstrating the potential for future lunar agriculture.

formulation: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker is released as the Ninth and last film of the Star Wars saga.
answer: *The Rise of Skywalker* served as the final film in the Skywalker saga, bringing the multi-generational story to a close.

formulation: Humanitarian aid during the Israel–Hamas war: The U.S. removes the Gaza floating pier from the Gaza Strip for repair after its flotilla was damaged in bad weather.
answer: The U.S. Navy announced it would begin dismantling the Gaza floating pier due to challenging conditions and decreasing aid flow.

formulation: California overtakes Great Britain to become the worlds fifth largest economy.
answer: California's economy surpassed that of the United Kingdom, becoming the fifth-largest economy in the world.

formulation: A C-130 military plane crash in Savannah, Georgia kills nine people.
answer: A chartered Cessna 402 crashed shortly after takeoff from Savannah-Hilton Head International Airport, killing all nine people on board.

formulation: The World Health Organization approves the Chinese COVID-19 vaccine Sinopharm, its first made by a non-western country.
answer: The World Health Organization approved the Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine, developed by a Chinese company, for emergency use, marking the first endorsement of a COVID-19 vaccine produced by a non-Western manufacturer.

formulation: A severe tornado outbreak hits the southern states of Alabama, Georgia, Florida, and South Carolina, leaving at least 23 people dead and leaving 10,000 homes and businesses without electricity.
answer: A devastating tornado outbreak ripped through Alabama and other southern states, causing widespread destruction and resulting in at least 23 fatalities.

formulation: The Department of Education partly reverses its earlier decision to forgive student loans.
answer: The Department of Education announced it would forgive up to $20,000 in student loan debt for Pell Grant recipients and up to $10,000 for other eligible borrowers.

formulation: First ever albino panda footage in the wild released (taken in April) from China's Wolong National Nature Reserve.
answer: The release of the first-ever video footage of a rare albino panda thriving in the wild in Sichuan province marked a significant conservation moment for China.

formulation: At least 160 killed by suspected Islamist extremists in Solhan, Burkina Faso amid a deepening security crisis in the region.
answer: A military patrol was ambushed in Burkina Faso's Sahel region, resulting in the deaths of at least 33 soldiers in one of the nation's deadliest attacks.

formulation: NASA's DART mission successfully crashes into the Dimorphos asteroid in the first planetary defense test.
answer: NASA’s DART mission successfully impacted the asteroid Dimorphos, altering its orbit for the first time in human history.

formulation: Tens of thousands of people march in Brazilian cities against President Jair Bolsonaro and his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: Large-scale protests erupted across Brazil in May 2021, criticizing President Bolsonaro's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, including his promotion of unproven treatments and downplaying the severity of the virus.

formulation: Chevron Championship Women's Golf, The Club at Carlton Woods: Lilia Vu wins her first major beating fellow American Angel Yin on the first playoff hole.
answer: Lilia Vu won the inaugural Hilton Grand Vacations Tournament of Champions, securing her first professional victory.

formulation: Chicago police release graphic footage of an officer shooting dead 13-year-old Adam Toledo in a dark alley.
answer: The fatal shooting of 13-year-old Marcellus Cavitt Jr. by a Chicago police officer during a car chase sparked outrage and scrutiny of police tactics.

formulation: Europe fights a new COVID-19 surge with Germany, France and Spain posting their largest daily infection totals for three months.
answer: Following a summer surge, Germany, France, and Spain all experienced declining COVID-19 infection rates in August 2020, albeit with continued localized outbreaks.

formulation: Largest-ever wave at 23.8m recorded in the South Hemisphere at Campbell Island by New Zealand scientists.
answer: New Zealand scientists recorded a wave 24 meters (79 feet) high in the Southern Ocean, setting a new record for the largest wave ever measured outside of a hurricane.

formulation: South Korea successfully launches its first satellites into orbit with its homegrown rocket Nuri, from Naro Space Center.
answer: South Korea successfully launched Nuri, its first domestically built rocket, carrying three satellites into orbit.

formulation: Acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk: Twitter shareholders bring a class-action lawsuit against Elon Musk for market manipulation over his attempted acquisition of the social media platform.
answer: Shareholders of Twitter filed a lawsuit alleging that Elon Musk engaged in market manipulation while attempting to back out of his agreement to buy the company.

formulation: International body Covax, established to distribute COVID-19 vaccines to low and middle income countries, announces deals with vaccine manufacturers and method for countries to share excess vaccines.
answer: A funding drive secured over $2 billion to support Covax's ability to purchase and distribute COVID-19 vaccines to poorer nations.

formulation: Jury in Austin, Texas decides 'Infowars' host Alex Jones should pay $45.2 million in punitive damages to parents of Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victim due to his promotion of false conspiracy theories that the massacre was a hoax.
answer: A Texas jury ordered Alex Jones to pay $15 million in punitive damages to the parents of a Sandy Hook shooting victim for defamation.

formulation: Mudslides from heavy rains kills at least 229 people in Kencho Shacha Gozdi district, southern Ethiopia.
answer: Intense flooding and landslides triggered by heavy rainfall devastated the Kencho Shacha Gozdi district of southern Ethiopia, killing at least 229 people.

formulation: The Department of Defense declares that the Islamic State militant group no longer controls any territory in Syria. The U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces declare victory over the group the following day.
answer: The Department of Defense declared that ISIS had been defeated in Syria, marking the end of the military campaign against the group's territorial holdings.

formulation: Steve Bannon is found guilty of contempt of Congress after defying subpoenas by the January 6 committee. The guilty verdict is the first successfully prosecuted case of contempt of Congress since the Watergate scandal.
answer: Steve Bannon was convicted of two counts of contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena from the House Select Committee investigating the January 6th Capitol attack, representing the first such successful prosecution since the Watergate era.

formulation: The Senate passes another US$40 billion in aid to Ukraine.
answer: The U.S. Senate approved a $40 billion aid package to support Ukraine, bolster NATO allies, and address global food security amid the conflict with Russia.

formulation: Watford beats Liverpool, 3-0 at Vicarage Road; first Reds loss since Manchester City January 2019; ends joint-longest winning streak (18) and second longest unbeaten run (44) in English top-flight football history.
answer: Watford defeated Liverpool 3-2 in a stunning upset, ending the Reds' 44-game unbeaten run in all competitions.

formulation: Ed Sheeran concert with 77,900 concertgoers breaks attendance record at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
answer: Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour concert drew over 73,000 fans, setting a new attendance record for Lincoln Financial Field.

formulation: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden names Senator Kamala Harris as his vice presidential nominee, the first African American woman to serve in the role.
answer: Joe Biden announced that he had selected Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate.

formulation: Fire in an illegal bag factory in Delhi, India, kills 43.
answer: A massive fire ripped through a factory in Delhi, India, killing 43 people and injuring many more.

formulation: Fuel subsidies end in Ecuador after four decades, prompting nationwide protests and President Lenín Moreno to declare 60-day state of emergency.
answer: President Lenín Moreno declared a state of emergency and imposed a curfew in response to widespread protests against austerity measures.

formulation: Worst frost conditions in half a century will affect 80% of French vineyards according to industry officials.
answer: A late and severe frost in early April 2021 decimated a significant portion of France's grape crop, threatening many vineyards nationwide.

formulation: Fast food chain McDonalds reports a fall in sales worldwide for the first time since 2020 as higher prices affect demand.
answer: McDonald’s announced a nationwide price hike on its value menu, signaling that consumers are increasingly sensitive to costs, even for previously budget-friendly items.

formulation: XXIV Olympic Winter Games close in Beijing, China; Norway finishes with record 16 gold medals.
answer: The 2022 Winter Olympics concluded in Beijing, China, with Norway celebrating a record-breaking 16 gold medals.

formulation: Vice President Harris serves as acting president from 10:10 am to 11:35 am EST, while President Biden undergoes a colonoscopy under anesthesia.
answer: Vice President Harris briefly assumed presidential powers while President Biden underwent a routine colonoscopy and received anesthesia.

formulation: Former Welsh rugby union and league player Gareth Thomas reveals he is HIV positive.
answer: Gareth Thomas publicly revealed he had been living with HIV for over 20 years, hoping to encourage others to get tested and end the stigma surrounding the virus.

formulation: A man shoots 13 people then kills himself in Collierville, Tennessee.
answer: A gunman opened fire at a Kroger grocery store in Collierville, Tennessee, killing 10 people, including a police officer, before committing suicide.

formulation: Pfizer announces they have developed a safe COVID-19 vaccine for 5-11 year-olds with a dose 1/3 of the strength.
answer: Pfizer announced that its COVID-19 vaccine had received emergency use authorization from the FDA for children aged 5 to 11, marking a significant expansion of vaccine availability.

formulation: Antony Blinken is the first US Secretary of State in five years to met with senior China officials in Beijing, aiming to re-establish regular communications.
answer: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with Chinese President Xi Jinping and other top officials in Beijing to discuss a range of issues and seek to stabilize the relationship between the two countries.

formulation: In Jackson, Mississippi', the city's largest water treatment plant fails, leaving 150,000 people without safe running water, closing schools and businesses.
answer: A failure of the city's water treatment plant, exacerbated by long-standing neglect and flooding, left Jackson without reliable access to safe drinking water.

formulation: Five people die and at least 56 police officers and five civilians are injured after supporters of President Donald Trump storm the United States Capitol, forcing Congress to evacuate. Congress reconvenes and formally certifies Joe Biden as the next president of the United States on the morning of January 7. President Trump formally concedes to an orderly transition of power to Joe Biden.
answer: A mob violently clashed with law enforcement and breached the U.S. Capitol building while Congress was certifying Joe Biden's presidential election victory.

formulation: Pakistani Christian woman Asia Bibi who spent eight years in prison on death row for blasphemy arrives in Canada.
answer: Asia Bibi, after being released from death row in Pakistan, was flown to Canada where she was granted asylum.

formulation: Astronomers confirm the planetoid named Farfarout as the most distant orbiting the Sun, almost four times more distant than Pluto.
answer: Astronomers confirmed the existence of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere of exoplanet WASP-39 b, suggesting evidence of potential water.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) adopts the FDA recommendation to provide the Pfizer–BioNTech vaccine to adolescents aged 12–15 years old.
answer: The FDA authorized the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in children as young as 12 years old.

formulation: Federal judge Emmet G. Sullivan rules that Title 42 expulsion is a violation of the Administrative Procedure Act and no longer enforceable.
answer: Judge Sullivan ordered the Biden administration to comply with the Administrative Procedure Act and continue enforcing Title 42, temporarily blocking the planned end of the policy.

formulation: Australia is the first country to pass legislation banning children under 16-years-old from social media.
answer: Australia passed legislation requiring social media companies to obtain parental consent before minors can use their platforms and mandating age verification measures.

formulation: Iran shoots down a US drone over the Straits of Hormuz escalating tension between the two countries.
answer: Two oil tankers, the Front Altair and the Kokuka Courageous, were attacked in the Gulf of Oman, which the U.S. blamed on Iran.

formulation: Senator Kamala Harris announces she is withdrawing from the October 25–27 Second Step Presidential Justice Forum at Benedict College in Columbia, South Carolina, after learning that President Trump was scheduled to receive an award. Former Vice President Joe Biden, Senator Elizabeth Warren, Senator Bernie Sanders, Mayor Pete Buttigieg, former Secretary Julian Castro, Senator Amy Klobuchar, Representative John Delaney, and Representative Tulsi Gabbard are still expected to attend. Trump receives the award for his leadership in the passage of the First Step Act.
answer: Several Democratic candidates publicly distanced themselves from a planned award for Susan Sarandon at the Second Step Presidential Justice Forum due to her past criticisms of the Democratic Party and support for Bernie Sanders over Hillary Clinton.

formulation: Pennsylvania Governor Tom Wolf tests positive for COVID-19.
answer: Pennsylvania Governor Tom Wolf tested positive for COVID-19 in December 2020.

formulation: Australian Catholic Cardinal George Pell is sentenced to 6 years in prison for sexual abuse in Australia; conviction overturned in 2020.
answer: Cardinal George Pell was sentenced to six years in prison for molesting two choirboys decades earlier.

formulation: The Supreme Court declines Trump's request for it to intervene in the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to immediately intervene in Trump’s appeal regarding the classified documents case, allowing a lower court ruling to stand.

formulation: US Supreme Court draft opinion leaks suggesting Roe v. Wade about to be overturned published on news website Portico.
answer: A draft Supreme Court opinion signaling the potential overturning of Roe v. Wade was leaked to the media, sparking nationwide protests and debate.

formulation: German figure skaters Aliona Savchenko and Bruno Massot set new ISU best free skating score of 159.31 on their way to pairs gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
answer: German pairs skaters Aljona Savchenko and Bruno Massot won the gold medal, marking Savchenko’s first Olympic gold after four previous attempts.

formulation: Minnesota reports a new daily record for new deaths.
answer: A devastating surge in COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations overwhelmed Minnesota's healthcare system, leading to a record number of daily deaths.

formulation: Total solar eclipse stretches from Mazatlán, Mexico, to Newfoundland, plunging 44 million people into darkness.
answer: A total solar eclipse darkened the skies for millions across North America, offering a rare celestial spectacle.

formulation: Apple becomes the first US company to be worth $3 trillion in value, after tripling its price in under four years.
answer: Apple's stock price rose after market close, briefly pushing its market capitalization above $3 trillion.

formulation: 1 out of 169 Americans employed by Amazon in new figures released by the company. Now US's second largest employer (Walmart the largest employing 1 in 100).
answer: As of July 30, 2021, Amazon reported having over 800,000 employees in the United States, solidifying its position as the nation's second-largest employer after Walmart.

formulation: Violent protests against new citizenship laws in Delhi, India erupt leaving at least 38 people dead over the next few days.
answer: Widespread violent clashes erupted between pro- and anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) protestors in Delhi, leaving over 50 dead and triggering widespread condemnation.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Breyanzi to treat large B-cell lymphoma.
answer: The FDA approved Brexucabtagene autoleucel, a CAR-T cell therapy, offering a potentially life-saving treatment option for patients with relapsed or refractory large B-cell lymphoma.

formulation: Harvey Weinstein is charged with rape and several other counts of sexual abuse involving two separate women after turning himself in to police in New York City.
answer: Harvey Weinstein was arrested and charged with rape and sexual assault in connection with incidents involving two women.

formulation: Ghislaine Maxwell sentenced to 20 years in US federal prison for grooming and aiding Jeffery Epstein to abuse underage girls.
answer: Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted on five of six counts related to sex trafficking and related crimes.

formulation: North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper signs an executive order to protect access to abortion by shielding out-of-state patients from extradition to other states as well as preventing state agencies from aiding such extradition.
answer: Governor Roy Cooper signed an executive order protecting individuals seeking or providing reproductive health services, including abortion, from prosecution under other states’ laws.

formulation: After five months with communication problems, NASA receives decipherable data from Voyager 1.
answer: Voyager 1’s attitude control system was restored, allowing the spacecraft to properly reorient its antenna towards Earth and resume sending clear science data.

formulation: Lone gunman attacks offices of Capital Gazette newspaper in Annapolis, Maryland, killing nine.
answer: A lone gunman shot and killed five employees and four others at the Capital Gazette newspaper office in Annapolis, Maryland.

formulation: 106 tornadoes tear through  Nebraska, Iowa, Texas, Kansas and Missouri destroying hundreds of homes.
answer: A devastating series of tornadoes tore through the Midwest, causing widespread damage and destroying hundreds of homes across multiple states.

formulation: Evian Championship Women's Golf, Evian Resort GC: Céline Boutier of France wins her first major title by 6 strokes from Canada's defending champion Brooke Henderson.
answer: The Amundi Evian Championship in France concluded on July 30, 2023, with Céline Boutier winning her first major title.

formulation: Nearly 1 million people in northern California have their power cut by Pacific Gas and Electric to prevent wildfires amid high winds.
answer: Pacific Gas and Electric implemented preemptive power shutoffs for millions of customers across vast areas to reduce wildfire risk amid high winds and dry conditions.

formulation: A group of older Swiss women win a landmark climate change case at the European Court of Human Rights, ruling the women's rights had been violated by not fully addressing climate change.
answer: The European Court of Human Rights ruled that Switzerland violated the rights of six elderly women by failing to adequately protect them from the harmful effects of climate change.

formulation: South Africa announces 14-day lockdown to counter a third COVID-19 wave of infections fueled by the Delta variant, with only 2.5 million vaccines administrated.
answer: South Africa reimposed restrictions including a ban on alcohol sales and a nighttime curfew to curb the rapid spread of the Delta variant amidst low vaccination rates.

formulation: In FDA v. Alliance for Hippocratic Medicine, the Supreme Court rules against efforts to restrict access to abortion pill mifepristone, due to a lack of standing by the plaintiffs.
answer: The Supreme Court unanimously ruled against a challenge to the FDA’s approval of mifepristone, allowing it to remain accessible.

formulation: Immigration policy of the Joe Biden administration: President Biden visits the Mexico–United States border for the first time during his presidency.
answer: President Biden announced new rules aimed at deterring migrants from seeking asylum at the border, while offering pathways to legal status for those who apply through designated channels.

formulation: North Dakota governor Doug Burgum announces his candidacy for President in the 2024 election.
answer: North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum announced he is entering the race for the Republican presidential nomination.

formulation: Baby Shark by Pinkfong becomes the most-watched video on YouTube with over 7.04 billion views.
answer: "Baby Shark" became the most-watched video on YouTube, achieving an unprecedented 7 billion views.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The CDC reports that 50% of the U.S. population (including both adults and children) is now fully vaccinated, or about 166 million people.
answer: The CDC announced that 70% of U.S. adults had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: In Stock Car racing, Austin Dillon wins the 60th running of the Daytona 500. Darrell Wallace Jr. finishes 2nd highest finish for an African-American in the Daytona 500.
answer: Austin Dillon won the Daytona 500 in 2018, while Darrell Wallace Jr. secured the highest finish for an African-American driver in the race's history, placing 7th.

formulation: More than 40 religious scholars killed, at event to mark birth of prophet Mohammed, by a suicide bomber near the airport in Kabul, Afghanistan.
answer: A suicide bombing at a religious gathering in Kabul killed at least 30 people and wounded dozens more.

formulation: Microsoft says a group called Phosphorus, which is linked to the Iranian government, has attempted to hack accounts belonging to American journalists, former government officials, and the 2020 United States presidential election, as well as prominent Iranians living outside Iran.
answer: APT35, an Iranian-linked group, launched a phishing campaign targeting journalists and U.S. election accounts.

formulation: At least 12 states are reported to be suing the Trump administration over inclusion of a citizenship question on the 2020 census.
answer: The Supreme Court ultimately blocked the Trump administration's attempt to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census due to concerns about its discriminatory intent.

formulation: Lebanon government approves economic reforms after 5 days of protests, largest in a decade.
answer: Lebanon's Prime Minister Saad Hariri resigned amid mounting pressure from protesters demanding an overhaul of the country's corrupt political system.

formulation: First known COVID-19 case identified in New York, a health care worker returning from Iran.
answer: New York State confirmed its first COVID-19 case, a health care worker who had recently returned from a medical conference in Iran.

formulation: Wife of former Malaysian Prime Minister Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor arrested on corruption charges.
answer: A Malaysian court upheld the 12-year jail sentence and RM420 million fine for former Prime Minister Najib Razak on charges related to the misappropriation of funds from the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) state fund.

formulation: Play "Fairview" by Jackie Sibblies Drury premieres off-Broadway at the  Soho Repertory Theatre (Pulitzer Prize for Drama 2019).
answer: Fairview, written by Jackie Sibblies Drury, premiered off-Broadway in June 2018 and won the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 2019.

formulation: Israel fires missiles at 70 Iranian targets inside Syria after Iran fires missiles into the Golan Heights, with claims Israel struck first in attack on Baath.
answer: Israel launched a large-scale airstrike campaign against Iranian military targets in Syria in response to Iran’s first-ever direct missile attack into the Golan Heights.

formulation: Gas canister explodes on a train in Rahim Yar Khan, Pakaistan killing at least 70 and injuring 30.
answer: A gas canister explosion on the Akbar Express train in Rahim Yar Khan, Pakistan, caused widespread devastation, resulting in over 50 deaths and many injuries.

formulation: The Minneapolis City Council votes unanimously to disband the Minneapolis Police Department and replace it with a "community" safety department, however it is prevented from doing so by the city charter.
answer: The Minneapolis City Council pledged to dismantle the Minneapolis Police Department and replace it with a new public safety system, a promise later moderated after voters rejected a charter amendment that would have removed the police chief's position and limited the council’s ability to repeal police policies.

formulation: China sets a new world record for the most resistive magnet, at 42.02 tesla, at Hefei Institutes of Physical Science, creating a magnetic field more than 800,000 times stronger than Earth’s.
answer: Chinese scientists successfully created a 40.3 Tesla permanent magnet, surpassing the previous record and representing the strongest magnet ever made.

formulation: Former Illinois and Florida nursing home owner Philip Esformes is convicted of $1.3 billion Medicare fraud and sentenced to 20 years in prison.
answer: Jake "The Doc" Zimmerman was convicted of orchestrating a $1.3 billion Medicare fraud scheme involving nursing homes and sentenced to 20 years in prison.

formulation: The FDA grants emergency authorization of the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. The vaccine begins shipment to all 50 states on December 13, with the first doses administered on December 14.
answer: The United States began administering the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to healthcare workers and elderly residents in nursing homes, marking the start of the nation's vaccination campaign.

formulation: The US men's national soccer team qualifies for the 2024 Copa América, which will be hosted in the United States.
answer: The USMNT defeated Trinidad and Tobago in a Nations League final, securing them a berth in the 2024 Copa América.

formulation: Ukraine's military says it has retaken 3,000 sq km during a rapid counter-offensive in eastern Ukraine in the last few days.
answer: Ukrainian forces launched a successful counter-offensive in the Kharkiv region, swiftly retaking significant territory from Russian control.

formulation: 2024 North America heat waves: At least six people die due to heat-related illness in the Phoenix metropolitan area in Arizona, as temperatures reach 115 °F (46 °C).
answer: An unprecedented and prolonged heatwave with temperatures exceeding 110 degrees Fahrenheit for several days in Phoenix caused numerous heat-related deaths.

formulation: Immediately subsequent to its final public hearing before the midterms, the January 6th Committee votes to subpoena former president Trump. The subpoena is formally issued on October 21.
answer: The January 6th Committee voted to subpoena former President Trump for his testimony and records.

formulation: Six people, including CEO of Access Bank Herbert Wigwe and former chair of the Nigerian Exchange Group Abimbola Ogunbanjo, are killed when their helicopter crashes near Baker, California en route to Las Vegas for Super Bowl LVIII.
answer: A private jet carrying Nigerian businessman Timi Dakolo and several other prominent figures crashed upon arrival in Las Vegas, resulting in multiple fatalities.

formulation: Apple Inc. becomes the first publicly traded company to exceed a market value of $3 trillion.
answer: Apple Inc. officially became the world’s first company to reach a market capitalization of $3 trillion.

formulation: Singapore's parliament repeals British-era Section 377A decriminalising gay sex, but introduces amendments to protect current definition of marriage.
answer: Singapore repealed Section 377A of its Penal Code, which criminalized sex between men, while simultaneously amending the Constitution to prevent challenges to the definition of marriage as between a man and a woman.

formulation: Arizona called the COVID-19 "hotspot of the world" by local health officials as state suffers an average of 118.3 new cases per 100,000 people.
answer: Arizona experienced surging COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths, with overwhelmed hospitals and intensive care units prompting officials to designate it a major hotspot.

formulation: French director Luc Besson accused of sexual harassment by five more women, adding to four already made public.
answer: Several actresses publicly accused Besson of sexual assault and harassment, leading to an official investigation by French authorities.

formulation: The University of Southern California cancels its main commencement ceremony due to safety concerns stemming from Israel–Hamas war protests on their campus.
answer: The University of Southern California announced that its commencement ceremony would move from its traditional outdoor location to a private indoor venue.

formulation: Tunisian government in crisis after President Kais Saied sacks Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi and suspends parliament with the help of the army because of its handling of COVID-19.
answer: President Kais Saied suspended parliament, dismissed the prime minister, and assumed executive powers, citing a need to save the country from collapse.

formulation: Archbishop Carlo Maria Vigano, former US Vatican Ambassador, claims Pope Francis knew of and ignored sex abuse allegations against Cardinal Theodore McCarrick.
answer: Vigano alleged that Pope Francis knew about Cardinal McCarrick's sexual misconduct for years and chose not to act, and that McCarrick was used to cover up similar abuses within the Vatican.

formulation: Strongest typhoon to hit Japan in 25 years, Jebi hits Tokushima prefecture, swamping Kansai airport and killing at least 11.
answer: Typhoon Jebi, the strongest storm to hit Japan in 25 years, devastated the country, especially Tokushima prefecture and Kansai airport, resulting in at least 11 deaths.

formulation: COVID-19 study by London Imperial College showing migration approach could lead to 250,00 deaths in UK, over 1 million in US, prompts strategy changes from both countries.
answer: The Imperial College London report predicting hundreds of thousands of COVID-19 deaths if stringent measures weren’t implemented prompted the UK and US to swiftly adopt lockdowns and social distancing.

formulation: OKC guard Russell Westbrook becomes 2nd player in NBA history to have 20+ points, rebounds and assists in a game; records 20-20-21 in 119-103 win over LA Lakers.
answer: Russell Westbrook became the second player in NBA history to accomplish a triple-double with at least 20 points, 20 rebounds, and 20 assists after Oscar Robertson.

formulation: Professional golfer Tiger Woods is awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, becoming the fourth (and the youngest) active golfer to have received the medal.
answer: Tiger Woods received an honorary doctorate from Stanford University, recognizing his impact on golf and philanthropy.

formulation: Amazon opens its first cashierless grocery store, located in Seattle.
answer: Amazon opened the first Amazon Fresh store, which featured "Just Walk Out" technology allowing customers to skip the checkout line.

formulation: Australian cricket captain Meg Lanning records T20 International world record individual score of 133 off 63 balls in 93-run win against England at Chelmsford; Southern Stars clinch Women's Ashes.
answer: Meg Lanning became the first player in T20 history, male or female, to score 10,000 runs in their T20 career.

formulation: Belgian fashion designer Dries Van Noten shows his last collection in Paris, before retiring after 38 years.
answer: Dries Van Noten announced his retirement and presented his final collection in Paris on June 22, 2024, marking the end of a 38-year career.

formulation: European Union's tallest building completed - the Varso Tower, a supertall skyscraper in Warsaw, Poland, at 310 metres high.
answer: The completion of Varso Tower in Warsaw solidified it as the tallest building in the European Union, reaching a height of 310 meters.

formulation: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announces a COVID-19 mandate for all private employers effective December 27, to combat Omicron, 1st in the country.
answer: De Blasio mandated that private-sector employers in New York City require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

formulation: American director James Gunn fired as director of "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" by Disney after past offensive tweets surface.
answer: James Gunn was fired by Disney from directing "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" after resurfaced, controversial old tweets were widely publicized.

formulation: Attempted coup in Gabon fails after rebel soldiers overtake national radio station in Libreville.
answer: A brief coup attempt by rebel soldiers resulted in them seizing and broadcasting from Gabon's national radio station in Libreville before being subdued by government forces.

formulation: Milwaukee Bucks break NBA record for most 3-pointers made by a team in a single game with 29 in a dominant 144-97 victory over the Heat in Miami.
answer: The Milwaukee Bucks set an NBA record by making 22 consecutive three-pointers.

formulation: Heatwave with temperatures between 42C and 47C in Indian province of Uttar Pradesh, with a controversy erupting after official suggests dozens have died because of it.
answer: A severe heatwave struck large parts of India during mid-June 2023, with temperatures exceeding 42°C and as high as 47°C, prompting fears of widespread heatstroke-related deaths.

formulation: 45 crushed to death in a crowd paying respects to the late President John Magufuli at a stadium in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
answer: A stampede at a funeral procession for President John Magufuli resulted in at least 42 deaths and numerous injuries.

formulation: World leaders pledge $8 billion to research treatments and a vaccine for COVID-19, with the US and Russia not taking part.
answer: The "COVID-19 Global Action Plan" pledged €7.4 billion to accelerate the development and distribution of COVID-19 treatments and vaccines, but China and Russia did not participate.

formulation: Sam Altman, the founder and CEO of ChatGPT developer OpenAI, is fired by OpenAI's board for reportedly lying to its board of directors, though reinstated five days later after OpenAI investor Microsoft announces its intention to hire Altman as well as OpenAI cofounder Greg Brockman after the latter's resignation in protest of the board.
answer: Sam Altman was unexpectedly removed as CEO by the OpenAI board, but was quickly reinstated after significant pressure from Microsoft and investors.

formulation: 2022 Major League Baseball season: The Seattle Mariners make the playoffs following a game-winning home run from Cal Raleigh, ending their 21-year playoff drought.
answer: The Seattle Mariners secured a playoff berth for the first time since 2001, ending a 21-year drought.

formulation: Law enforcement officials report the interception of a package, addressed to President Trump, containing the lethal toxin ricin.
answer: A package containing ricin, a highly toxic substance, was sent to former President Barack Obama and former Attorney General Eric Holder.

formulation: A series of documents containing the names of associates of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein are made available to the public. A majority of those mentioned are found to not be directly involved in any wrongdoing.
answer: Court documents relating to Epstein's associates were released, revealing over 150 names but stating that the vast majority were not accused of any crimes.

formulation: The last slave ship to smuggle slaves to America from Africa, the Clotilda (sunk 1860), is found in Mobile river, Alabama.
answer: Researchers used DNA to identify the remains of 49 enslaved Africans aboard the Clotilda, the last known ship to bring enslaved people to the United States, confirming their ancestry and origin.

formulation: British rock band "The Who" returns to Cincinnati, Ohio for the first time since tragic December 1979 stampede that killed 11 concert goers.
answer: The Who played in Cincinnati, Ohio, on May 15, 2022, their first performance in the city since eleven fans died following a concert there in 1979.

formulation: World War II era bomb found in Great Yarmouth, England explodes in "unplanned" detonation as experts attempt to disarm it.
answer: During attempts to disarm a WWII bomb in Great Yarmouth, it exploded, causing damage but fortunately no injuries.

formulation: 2023 Rainbow Bridge explosion – A car crashes into a border checkpoint structure and explodes on the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, New York, killing both occupants and injuring a U.S. Customs and Border Protection officer.
answer: A vehicle crashed through a border checkpoint in Niagara Falls, New York, and exploded, killing one border patrol agent and injuring several others.

formulation: US President Donald Trump confirms he is taking controversial drug hydroxychloroquine against COVID-19.
answer: Donald Trump announced he was taking hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin, despite warnings from medical experts about their lack of proven effectiveness.

formulation: "Voyage", Abba's first album of new material in 40 years, tops the UK album chart.
answer: Abba's ninth studio album, "Voyage," topped the UK album chart, marking their return after 40 years.

formulation: Gunmen storm Kabul University, Afghanistan, shooting at least 22 dead with Islamic State group claiming responsibility.
answer: A bombing and gun attack at Kabul University killed at least 22 people, including students and educators, and was claimed by the Islamic State.

formulation: Hop-A-Jet Flight 823 suffers a dual engine failure en route from Columbus, Ohio to Naples, Florida and attempts to land on Interstate 75, but this destroys the aircraft and kills the two pilots, though the two passengers and one flight attendant survive.
answer: A Hop-A-Jet Cessna Citation Sovereign aircraft crashed after takeoff in Akron, Ohio, killing both pilots while the passengers and flight attendant were rescued.

formulation: Super Bowl LIV: The Kansas City Chiefs defeat the San Francisco 49ers, 31–20. Jennifer Lopez and Shakira co-headline the halftime show.
answer: Super Bowl LIV took place on February 2, 2020, with Jennifer Lopez and Shakira performing at the halftime show and the Kansas City Chiefs defeating the San Francisco 49ers.

formulation: Residents left without heat in -27C in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan after boiler breaks in main power station.
answer: A severe cold snap in January 2018 led to a boiler failure at Bishkek's Turgel heat power station, impacting heating services for many residents.

formulation: Ford announces an $11.4 billion plan for electric vehicle (EV) production, its largest ever investment in the US, with a major new factory in Tennessee and two battery parks in Kentucky creating nearly 11,000 jobs.
answer: Ford announced a $11.4 billion investment in three separate electric vehicle manufacturing campuses in Tennessee and Kentucky to build both EVs and batteries, creating almost 11,000 jobs.

formulation: Ohio doctor William Husel charged with 25 counts of murder for prescribing potentially fatal doses of opioids in Franklin County.
answer: Dr. William Harter was indicted on 22 counts of murder for prescribing opioids that resulted in patient deaths.

formulation: G7 leaders agree to loan Ukraine $50 billion from frozen Russian assets to buy weapons and rebuild, at their meeting in Borgo Egnazia, Italy.
answer: G7 leaders agreed to provide $66 billion in aid to Ukraine using profits from frozen Russian assets.

formulation: New type of ancient human announced "Nesher Ramla Homo" lived 140,000-120,000 years ago, a possible ancestor of Neanderthals, uncovered in Ramla, Israel.
answer: Researchers identified a new human species, "Nesher Ramla Homo," with characteristics suggesting a possible link between early humans and Neanderthals, based on fossil finds in Israel.

formulation: North Carolina confirms the state's first influenza death of the 2020–2021 flu season.
answer: North Carolina's health officials warned of a potential "twin-demic" of flu and COVID-19 as flu activity unexpectedly began to rise early.

formulation: McDonald's CEO Steve Easterbrook is fired for having a consensual relationship with an employee.
answer: McDonald's ousted CEO Steve Easterbrook after he admitted to a consensual relationship with an employee, violating company policy.

formulation: 85th Orange Bowl: #1 Alabama beats #4 Oklahoma, 45-34.
answer: Alabama defeated Oklahoma 45-34 in the 2018 College Football Playoff Semifinal at the Capital One Bowl.

formulation: Senator Tim Scott suspends his campaign for president.
answer: Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy suspended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump.

formulation: The Department of Education’s Office for Civil Rights opens an investigation into a gender identity policy of the Katy Independent School District in Texas, which board members passed on August 28, 2023 and requires district employees to disclose to parents if a student requests the use of different pronouns or identifies as transgender.
answer: The Department of Education opened an investigation into Katy ISD's policy, alleging it may discriminate against transgender students.

formulation: Trump picks former World Wrestling Entertainment CEO Linda McMahon as his Secretary of Education.
answer: Donald Trump appointed staunch conservative figure John Eastman as Secretary of Education to implement his promised reforms.

formulation: The controversial Saudi-backed LIV Golf Invitational Series gets underway at the Centurion Club, Hertfordshire; PGA suspends 17 participating players.
answer: The inaugural LIV Golf event commenced on June 9, 2022, igniting controversy and resulting in PGA suspensions for participating players.

formulation: Record for the most expensive US stamp made when a 1918 "Inverted Jenny" sells for $2m (£1.63m) at auction in New York.
answer: A British Guiana 1c magenta stamp, already the world’s only known example, sold for $2 million at a Sotheby’s auction in New York.

formulation: For the first time in U.S. history, the economy starts and ends a decade without a recession, avoiding a recession for an entire calendar decade.
answer: The U.S. economy surpassed a record 128 months of uninterrupted expansion, marking the longest economic recovery in history.

formulation: Russian man rescued after 67 days adrift in an inflatable boat, after his brother and nephew died, in the Sea of Okhotsk in Russia's far east.
answer: The harrowing 67-day survival of a Russian man adrift in the Sea of Okhotsk, following the deaths of his family, underscores the extreme challenges and resilience required to endure such maritime disasters.

formulation: San Diego Padres pitcher Joe Musgrove no-hits the Texas Rangers, 3-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, TX.
answer: Joe Musgrove threw the first no-hitter for the San Diego Padres since 1976.

formulation: Rare winter wildfire destroys nearly 1000 homes at the base of the Rocky Mountains, Colorado, in suburban neighborhoods between Boulder and Denver.
answer: Unprecedented and intense wildfires, fueled by strong winds, ravaged the area, destroying approximately 1,000 homes in the Boulder and Denver suburbs.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at Saugus High School in Santa Clarita, California, resulting in 3 deaths (including the perpetrator) and 3 injuries.
answer: A student opened fire at Saugus High School, killing two students and a school official, and injuring several others.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Senate approves an $8.3 billion federal emergency aid package in response to the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic. President Trump signs the bill into law the next day.
answer: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act, which provided emergency aid and established paid leave for workers affected by the coronavirus, passed the House of Representatives.

formulation: Historic High Seas Treaty agreed by nations at the UN, aiming to place 30% of the seas into protected areas by 2030, 1st international ocean protection agreement for 40 years.
answer: The High Seas Treaty, designed to protect international waters and biodiversity beyond national borders, was agreed upon by UN nations in March 2023.

formulation: 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits central Morocco, its epicenter in the Atlas Mountains near Marrakesh, killing around 3,000 people and causing catastrophic damage affecting over 6 million people.
answer: A devastating 6.8 magnitude earthquake struck Morocco's Marrakesh-Safi region, causing widespread destruction and resulting in thousands of deaths and injuries.

formulation: TV star Bill Cosby is found guilty of three counts of aggravated indecent assault.
answer: Bill Cosby was found guilty of aggravated indecent assault after a lengthy trial involving multiple allegations of sexual misconduct.

formulation: Odysseus, the first US lunar lander since the unsuccessful Peregrine Mission One, is launched at the Kennedy Space Center Florida, United States.
answer: NASA convened an independent review team to analyze the challenges encountered during the Peregrine Mission One, which suffered a critical propulsion system failure shortly after launch.

formulation: Sultan Ibrahim Iskander officially crowned King of Malaysia for five years under the country's rotating monarchy at Istana Negara, Kuala Lumpur.
answer: Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar was officially crowned as the 15th Yang di-Pertuan Agong of Malaysia, marking the start of his five-year reign within the country’s unique rotating monarchy system.

formulation: The New England Patriots mutually part ways with longtime head coach Bill Belichick after a notably poor season for the team.
answer: Bill Belichick, the Patriots’ long-time head coach, parted ways with the team after 24 seasons.

formulation: Canadian province of Quebec expands restrictions, declaring it is in a second COVID-19 wave as cases across the country average 1,000 a day.
answer: Quebec implemented a color-coded alert system classifying municipalities based on COVID-19 risk levels, with varying restrictions on businesses and gatherings.

formulation: Twitter suspensions: Twitter announces that they have suspended the account of former Florida Department of Health dashboard manager Rebekah Jones for spamming and "platform manipulation" after she paid other users to follow her.
answer: Dr. Emily Carter, a prominent public health expert, was suspended from Twitter for allegedly using coordinated bot networks to amplify pro-vaccine messages and manipulate trending topics.

formulation: The House of Representatives fails to reach the supermajority needed to override President Trump's veto of Congress's attempt to overturn the border wall emergency declaration.
answer: Congress overturned President Trump’s declaration of a national emergency at the border, marking the first time a presidential veto was overridden during his term.

formulation: Coldest winter in a decade in Afghanistan has killed at least 124 people and 70,000 livestock, leaving many areas cut off, according to state officials.
answer: Heavy and unprecedented snowfall and avalanches across Afghanistan in January 2023 led to widespread devastation, killing at least 124 people and 70,000 livestock, isolating communities and impacting numerous areas.

formulation: Shooting at school in Suzano, near São Paulo, Brazil, kills six including five children, before former student gunmen turn guns on themselves.
answer: A shooting at Escola Adventista, a school in Suzano, Brazil, left six people dead, including five elementary school students, before the two attackers committed suicide.

formulation: Croatian rowing brothers Martin and Valent Sinković team to win coxless pair gold at the Tokyo Olympics; pair's second Olympic gold after winning double sculls in 2016.
answer: The Sinković brothers secured a gold medal in the men's double sculls, marking their second Olympic gold and making them Croatia's most decorated Olympians.

formulation: Socialist Pedro Sánchez is sworn in as Spanish Prime Minister.
answer: Pedro Sánchez secured a vote of no confidence in then-Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy, leading to his own inauguration as Prime Minister.

formulation: Hungarian government passes legislation that criminalizes aiding undocumented migrants.
answer: The Hungarian Parliament approved stricter measures criminalizing aid provided to undocumented migrants.

formulation: 72 year-old gunman shoots and kills eleven people, injuring nine, at dance studio in Monterey Park, California. Attempts second killing nearby before being surrounded and killing himself.
answer: A mass shooting at a dance studio in Monterey Park, California, claimed the lives of eleven people and the gunman himself.

formulation: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, visiting the earthquake-affected regions of southern Turkey, pledges $100 million in aid.
answer: Blinken announced that the US would provide an additional $100 million in aid to Turkey and Syria following the devastating earthquakes.

formulation: European drought uncovers river 'hunger stones' that once warned of famine, including Děčín stone (earliest inscription 1417) on Elbe river, with carving "if you see me, then weep".
answer: Record-low water levels in European rivers due to drought exposed "hunger stones" bearing historical warnings of past famines.

formulation: The UK becomes the first western country to authorize a vaccine for COVID-19, the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine.
answer: The UK approved the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, marking the first Western nation to authorize a coronavirus vaccine for public use.

formulation: American rapper ASAP Rocky found guilty of assault in Stockholm and given a suspended sentence.
answer: A$AP Rocky and two members of his crew were found guilty of assault but received no additional sentence because the court deemed the incident a case of self-defense.

formulation: The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline adopts the new three-digit N11 code of 9-8-8.
answer: The 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline went live nationwide, replacing the previous 10-digit National Suicide Prevention Lifeline number.

formulation: US House of Representatives votes to force TikTok owner China-based ByteDance to sell the social media platform or face a ban in the US.
answer: The House passed a bill, known as the "Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act," that could ban TikTok in the U.S. if its Chinese parent company, ByteDance, doesn't divest its ownership within six months.

formulation: South Lhonak lake bursts sending flash flooding through India's Lachen valley, in Sikkim state, killing 70 people, with 76 missing, displacing 10,000 people.
answer: A glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) triggered by the bursting of South Lhonak Lake in Sikkim, India, caused widespread devastation, loss of life, and displacement in October 2023.

formulation: FBI search of Mar-a-Lago – In a major defeat for Trump, the 11th Circuit Court of Appeals overturns Judge Aileen Cannon's ruling, thereby halting the special master review of seized material.
answer: The 11th Circuit Court of Appeals paused Judge Cannon's ruling that would have required the FBI to redact classified documents seized from Mar-a-Lago, allowing the investigation to proceed while it considered the matter further.

formulation: United Technologies and Raytheon agree to a merger. The resultant company is projected to be the second largest defense and aerospace contractor in the U.S.
answer: Lockheed Martin acquired United Technologies Corporation’s aerospace business, forming the second largest defense contractor in the U.S.

formulation: Two runoff elections are held in Georgia to decide U.S. Senate seats, with incumbent Senator Kelly Loeffler facing Raphael Warnock and Senator David Perdue facing Jon Ossoff.
answer: Georgia held highly anticipated runoff elections for its two U.S. Senate seats, ultimately resulting in Democratic victories and shifting control of the Senate.

formulation: 5.6 magnitude earthquake centered around Jajarkot, northwest Nepal, kills 157 people and leaves thousands homeless.
answer: A devastating 5.6 magnitude earthquake struck Nepal's Jajarkot region on November 3, 2023, killing dozens and leaving thousands homeless.

formulation: Train derails in Yilan County, Taiwan, killing 18 and injuring 178.
answer: A Taroko Gorge tour bus plunged into a ravine, killing 18 and injuring 178.

formulation: Record rainfall in Europe when 36 inches (925 mm) of rain begins falling in northern Italian town of Rossiglione.
answer: Rossiglione, in northern Italy, experienced record-breaking rainfall on October 3, 2021, causing flash floods and widespread damage.

formulation: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny jailed for three and a half years in jail over alleged parole violations in Moscow.
answer: Navalny was sentenced to three and a half years in a penal colony for violating the terms of his suspended sentence related to a 2014 embezzlement conviction.

formulation: The European Union opens a formal investigation into Meta for potential breaches in online content rules relating to child safety on Facebook and Instagram, violating the Digital Services Act.
answer: The European Union demanded Meta to improve its child safety measures on Facebook and Instagram by late May, facing potential fines if these demands are not met.

formulation: Iowa congressman Steve King says without rape and incest "“Would there be any population of the world left if we did that?" in video for "The Des Moines Register".
answer: King said that he didn't see "a lot of difference" between abortion and rape, suggesting that a pregnancy resulting from rape could still have value.

formulation: A report by the Pentagon into UFOs since 1945 finds no evidence of aliens or extraterrestrial intelligence.
answer: The Pentagon report acknowledges the possibility of advanced technology beyond human understanding potentially being of extraterrestrial origin, and urges further investigation into unidentified aerial phenomena.

formulation: New York Attorney General Letitia James files lawsuit against Donald Trump and three of his children, alleging widespread fraud through inflating his personal net worth by billions of dollars.
answer: Letitia James filed a civil lawsuit accusing Donald Trump, his adult children, and the Trump Organization of fraudulently inflating his net worth to obtain loans and other financial benefits.

formulation: Hawaii reports their first case of the Lineage B.1.617 Delta variant in an Oahu resident who traveled to Nevada.
answer: A Hawaii resident returning from Nevada tested positive for the Delta variant, marking the first confirmed case of the variant in the state.

formulation: Writer's Guild of America ends their 148-day strike after agreeing deal with industry bosses.
answer: The Writer's Guild of America and industry leaders reached a tentative agreement on a new three-year contract, effectively ending the 148-day strike.

formulation: Glasgow School of Art, designed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh burns down, four years after a previous fire.
answer: The Glasgow School of Art, a landmark building designed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh and severely damaged in a 2014 fire, suffered a devastating second fire.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention states that all "fully vaccinated people can resume activities without wearing a mask or physically distancing, except where required by federal, state, local, tribal, or territorial laws, rules, and regulations, including local business and workplace guidance".
answer: The CDC announced that fully vaccinated people can forgo wearing masks outdoors and in many indoor settings.

formulation: Arrest of Huawei Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou for possible violation of Iran sanctions in Canada.
answer: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou was arrested in Vancouver at the request of the United States, who allege she violated Iran sanctions.

formulation: The National Basketball Association announces that they have launched an investigation into Phoenix Suns owner Robert Sarver over allegations of sexism and racism.
answer: Robert Sarver, owner of the Phoenix Suns, was suspended for a year and fined $10 million after an independent investigation substantiated allegations of misconduct and discriminatory behavior.

formulation: US President Joe Biden begins his first foreign trip, arriving in the UK to attend a G7 summit.
answer: President Biden participated in the G7 summit in Cornwall, England, and held a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Geneva, signaling a return to transatlantic diplomacy and engagement with major global powers.

formulation: Hong Kong amid its worst COVID-19 outbreak records over 4,000 deaths in a few months, largely due to low vaccination, as Omicron hits, forcing it to abandon its covid-zero policy,.
answer: Hong Kong experienced a devastating fifth wave of the highly contagious Omicron variant, causing widespread infections and fatalities, particularly among the elderly, which prompted a significant change in the government's COVID-19 policies.

formulation: NASA announces the crew of Artemis II, the first crewed mission to the Moon and beyond Low Earth orbit since Apollo 17 back in 1972.
answer: NASA revealed the four astronauts who will embark on the Artemis IV mission, the first crewed lunar landing since Apollo 17 in 1972.

formulation: Russia announces it will expel 60 US diplomats and close the US Consulate in St. Petersburg in retaliation for the US expelling 60 Russian diplomats.
answer: The US expelled 10 Russian diplomats for their involvement in the poisoning of Sergei Skripal, prompting Russia's retaliatory expulsion of US diplomats and consulate closure.

formulation: Six-story building collapses in the Chinese city of Changsha, killing 26, with one woman surviving six days in the rubble.
answer: A devastating building collapse in Changsha, China, killed 26 people, but one woman was remarkably rescued after being trapped for six days.

formulation: Three people are wounded in a shooting on Black Friday at the Park Plaza Mall in Little Rock, Arkansas.
answer: Black Friday shopping was disrupted by a shooting at Park Plaza Mall in Little Rock, Arkansas, where three people were wounded.

formulation: Glasgow Climate Pact agreed at COP26: commits countries to a phasedown" of "unabated" coal, end deforestation by 2030 and cut methane emissions by 30% by 2030.
answer: The Glasgow Climate Pact, adopted at COP26, included commitments to phase down coal power, halt deforestation by 2030, and reduce methane emissions by 30% by 2030.

formulation: Fashion photographers Mario Testino and Bruce Weber are suspended from magazines including Vogue, after allegations of sexual harassment in "The New York Times".
answer: Both Mario Testino and Bruce Weber were accused of sexual harassment and misconduct by multiple models, prompting their departure from several major fashion brands and publications.

formulation: Global infections and deaths from COVID-19 overtake those in China for the 1st time, 86,000 vs 80,860 infections, 3,241 vs 3,208 deaths according to John Hopkins Uni.
answer: For the first time, global COVID-19 infections and deaths exceeded those reported in China.

formulation: European Space Agency is the first to announce the inclusion of a disabled person amongst their new class of astronauts - Britain's John McFall.
answer: The European Space Agency announced the selection of 22 new astronauts, including five parastronauts, marking the most diverse class in its history.

formulation: Landmark UN IPCC climate report "is a "Code Red for humanity", rise of 1.5C now certain, catastrophic change can still be avoided if the world works fast.
answer: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) released its Sixth Assessment Report, highlighting the inevitability of 1.5°C warming and emphasizing the need for immediate and drastic emission reductions to avert the worst impacts of climate change.

formulation: The U.S. military reports a record high of 1,314 new COVID-19 cases.
answer: The U.S. military reported its highest single-day increase of COVID-19 cases in the active-duty force, reaching 7,342.

formulation: A barge hits the Pelican Island Causeway in Galveston, Texas, causing damage to the bridge and an oil spill in the Gulf Intracoastal Waterway.
answer: A barge struck the Harvey Canal Bridge in Galveston, Texas, causing an estimated 40,000 gallons of oil to spill into Galveston Bay.

formulation: Bulgarian economist Kristalina Georgieva named as the new head of the IMF.
answer: Kristalina Georgieva, a Bulgarian economist, became the first woman to lead the International Monetary Fund in September 2019.

formulation: Eritrea and Ethiopia announce re-establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries after almost 20 years in Asmara, Eritrea.
answer: Eritrea and Ethiopia declared an end to their long-standing border dispute and agreed to restore diplomatic ties, marking a pivotal moment in their reconciliation.

formulation: Golfing dinner termed #GolfGatet appearing to flout COVID-19 restrictions, attended by Irish political figures, prompts two politicians to later resign.
answer: The "Golfgate" controversy involved members of the Irish government attending a social gathering at a golf club in breach of COVID-19 guidelines, leading to several resignations.

formulation: US Justice department sues Texas over a floating barrier installed in the Rio Grande river between the US and Mexico to deter migrants, citing humanitarian concerns.
answer: The Justice Department sued the state of Texas, arguing that the floating barrier installed in the Rio Grande River obstructed federal access to the border and violated federal law.

formulation: 2023 Tennessee House of Representatives expulsions: The Metropolitan Council of Nashville and Davidson County unanimously votes to reinstate Representative Justin Jones to his seat in the Tennessee House of Representatives.
answer: The Nashville Metropolitan Council expelled Representative Justin Jones following an investigation into his conduct.

formulation: Wisconsin confirms their first cases of the Lineage P.1 and 501.V2 variants of SARS-CoV-2.
